MgNCvadF_VmbI7Eiv_UdQg.text: Delicious sushi, wide variety of rolls, fast service, fresh fish, little rice and cold mugs for your beer!!!

9-oWUVN2Ljybtk43ofACzA.text: I went for the first time on Sunday 12 June 2016 and had a really good time. Carlos was my waiter and he was really great. He took care of me while I waited at the sushi bar for my friend to arrive. The food was awesome and the manager was really friendly. One of my favorite things about this place are the names for the sushi rolls and the selection! I will be returning!

FFui43i_Ju4zHR5wNRLZjA.text: To keep it short and sweet this place is amazing. I've never had a bad experience and I've probably been here 50 times. Anytime someone makes me go elsewhere for sushi it doesn't even come close to comparing to the quality and experience you receive at I Love Sushi. Everything is good so go ahead and order something you wouldn't normally go for. The rolls have funny names like Stacey's Mom and I Love My Ass...it's funny to hear the servers repeat it back to you. Yummy!

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

OE3voC0RqcjBd6lh7DUS3A.text: My local friend took us here, swearing that it was the best sushi ever. I was skeptical but dang, he was right! The fresh wasabi was amazing. You'll never want to eat that green paste again.  And I don't remember the name of it, but there's a crab bowl with tuna and coveted in avocado which is freaking amazing. All the sushi was fresh and delicious.  I'll make the trek down here for sushi every trip to Vegas from now on, for sure.

cTPPccHsjuFyEdCXRLtLbw.text: We've never been disappointed at I Love Sushi. One of the best in town for quality. Well worth the extra dollars. I'll never stop eating there. Our family favorites are Tuna Tataki, Agedashi Tofu, baked lobster and butter garlic special.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic butter halibut.. Baked halibut for the people who don&#39;t like raw fish (not me)!
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Lobster special

dF2ZpIGcnGonSCJuinDDLg.text: One of my favorite non-AYCE sushi places.  It's so close to my house!  The sushi is super fresh--it glistens, like it came straight out of the water, sliced up, and jumped right onto your plate! haha! When it comes to sashimi and nigiri, they give you thick, fresh cuts of fish.  This is the only place in the city that I've been to that has THE freshest tasting uni (if you have any suggestions otherwise, please comment ;)).  I could eat a million orders of their uni.   Service is cool.  The ambiance is casual.  I suggest sitting up at the sushi bar cuz those dudes are awesome.  I'm not gonna leave a super long review, because people have already raved about this place.  The rolls are great, appetizers are great--THE FOOD IS GREAT. LOL. Just go, you won't be disappointed.  It's worth the $$, especially if you enjoy good quality sushi.

2Ox11IcRt9qDtx6swI_wYw.text: The absolute best Sushi hands down.   Excellent food and superior service.  I love the cucumber salad with fresh crab on top.   I  have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered.   You must try this place.  Always busy but minimal wait time.  Yummy

z1gshactSzfxb_vDovmsbw.text: If only I didn't live so far from this place I would go here all the time. Love their screaming O it's literally the best I've tried. Their selection is great, great fresh quality 100%. Atmosphere is good too. Overall a really good place to eat quality sushi. Never had a bad experience here.

bqRx9PCoqXB7Zv8N-4yj5w.text: This is my favorite sushi place that I have been coming to consistently since 2003, the best sushi town in my opinion, love that most of the people working here are still the same people since I starting coming in 2003, great atmosphere, great sushi bar, this place is always great and never disappoints

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiss of Fire Roll

yBk59QQq6h6xlJBb4ku31g.text: i always have a good time at i love sushi.. i walk in everyone is so friendly while you are getting seated at the same time. i usually ask for a table rather than the bar. fast service good sushi! well i get the crunch roll with soy paper, extra eel sauce or a chicken teriyaki roll with soy paper & of course a side of eel sauce!! i also get some mango mochi after. i leave satisfied every time so what's better than that!

WGXXfnfDJgu8J8q70VSqOw.text: Authentic sushi served in an energetic & noisy setting. We were seated at the bar right away & given complementary edamame, as well as cucumbers with kimchee sauce. This was given to us after we used warm towels for our hands.  Sushi was served to us right from the chefs. Hubby & I enjoyed the Monkey roll, the Spider roll & the Last Call roll. Definitely enough food for the two of us without feeling stuffed! Staff was friendly & attentive. Would recommend if you love sushi!

s6YHdYWjieb3PwLdiFB3dQ.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in town. Fish is fresh. Roll are delicious. Ambiance is nice. My personal favorite rolls are double d, rock and roll (no rice), salmon lover (no rice), screaming orgasm (no rice) but everything thing I've tried there has been good.

ZPkJL5JfpENL5RWeRLAb2A.text: This is one of the best sushi restaurants I have been to anywhere. They have a wild collection of specialty rolls with some of the filthiest names on earth. The Spicy Ponzu is liquid heroin. drink the leftovers, you will never be the same! Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

GiRMc914JZgg8cRjElsTkQ.text: Delicious rolls!  This place is a hustler.  They fill up quickly and the clear quickly.  The sushi chefs are sushi-making machines!  If you're on a time crunch to lunch, definitely come here.  You can have a 4 course meal in 30 minutes.  It's just a little on the pricy side...

ezaOs_je3rj4jPex3htd8w.text: I used to do the AYCE sushi, but since my first time at I Love Sushi, it's hard to go back. This place is my #1 sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. It is always busy, but it's because the food and service here is out of this world. Great and fresh quality of fish and the sushi chefs are friendly. Tip: ask the sushi chefs to create a roll of their own, you'll find that there are some great rolls not on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The absolute BEST sweet shrimp! The shrimp heads were crispy and large, while the sweet shrimp nigiri was sweet. Delish!

kas7DSfRs2pD1oXHSXWQeA.text: I give 5 + starts for the food, i always say i won't comeback because of the service, but then i go to other sushi place in town i  regret not going to i love sushi.The waitress were OK, everything was served on time and fast.  For the service i give 1 star just because of the owner /manager in the front. I felt like Seinfeld's episode when they go to this awesome soup place, but the chef is horrible and they can no tell him anything because he won't sell them food anymore!  He has no customer service sense, i hate seeing the sushi bar staff getting yell at! come on! they cook a great sushi! don't humiliate them in front of your costumers!. And what is worse! i just was telling him i was waiting for my friends and he got mad at me! aghh!!  i love the sushi but i don't agree with that manager's customer service.

mfr0MWz_pcRmfYjvVtke0w.text: Very good service and the food was delicious! Katsu chicken was the best we've ever had and the sauce was legit. I tried the happy ending which is amazing if you like baked rolls.   Would definitely come back again

tGvxbCM-D0zpwlYh90yuew.text: I have been here before and was expecting some quality food and service, but tonight they really brought their A game.   I Ordered salmon (sake) and mackerel (saba) nigiri. Delicious! Just some really fresh fish with subtle flavor to it. I don't know what it was, but it tasted just right. Wife ordered some sushi rolls (caterpillar, salmon skin, and philly) along with some udon noodles, also good, but I think I was still in a daze from the first course. I will say this though, sometimes we pop in just to have some udon and an order or two of sushi.  I liked that we were seated at a table as soon as we walked in the door, though that's probably due more to luck and good timing. I was really impressed by our waitress, fast and friendly, she really took care of us. When she noticed that the plates that came out first were dishes that my wife wasn't eating she immediately went back to the kitchen and brought another plate as soon as it was ready. I thought that was some damn fine service, worthy of 5 stars. So, thanks for dinner everyone at I Love Sushi.

SUoEHxxNM9s94yXZ9DlYJg.text: In a city where a sushi joint dots every single corner I love sushi is a True standout. The variety of rolls and sushi is unmatched by sushi joints in Las Vegas. Sitting at the sushi bar is always a good time. The sushi the chefs can do saki bombs with you and feel like part of your party.  Although they don't offer "all you can eat" like most places in town, I love sushi doesn't need to run promotions like that and the place is always packed. The service and food make people come back time and time again. Check it out be sure to try the MC roll, Japanese lasagna and the screaming orgasm.

-b_Me_QsNeR5Ez7HhzaENg.text: Best sushi in Town, freshest fish, best rolls. I come here for 2 ears, enjoy every time.

xGv7_LMIOyCSE-_YBqdcSw.text: I was not impressed with the staff. They seemed very busy and annoyed to be bothered. We ordered the show boat. It came with condiments  such as tarter sauce and the roll and sashimi selection it included was below average. There was no redeeming factor to this meal other then my husbands company and when we got home I fed the leftovers to the dogs. If you want an authentic experience with good service and good quality  steer clear of this place.

vJPU5tqK0YR3VtZIKZG8tg.text: When it comes to presentation this place executes that one thing completely. The food tastes as good as it looks, but if you're on a budget this place my be out of reach depending on what's in your pocket. Even their establishment looks amazing. I love this place and love their "screaming orgasm roll"!

dynZcaqdSY3Vs0wdUVWsnw.text: Good food and good service! Manager constantly walks around to make sure everyone is happy. Favorite sushi place in Vegas so far!

I06QTcmG0S759jgpZmET9A.text: Location, location, location.  Why the hell is this place so eff-ing far?!?!  JK, it's not THAT far.  Just far from me.  Truthfully I'm a sushi snob.  I feel that I have found the absolute best sushi place in Vegas, and I Love Sushi is not it.  The food wasn't bad though.  The tuna didn't look as fresh as I would have liked, so I chose to leave that part of my Hawaiian roll to my friend.  If he got sick, well it was his fault for dragging me there.   The Monkey Roll was pretty good.  That was really the only way I got out of feeling like I was cheating on my sushi place; by eating things on the menu that my joint didn't offer. Tried my first oyster shooter at I Love Sushi.  To quote myself the day that I tried it, "How is it possible that they took a lot of really really good things, put them together, and made them awful?"  Oyster on the half shell for me, please.  I did like how big it was and the kimonos that the hostess/waitress wore.  Very colorful.  Loved the sound of their flip-flops flippy-flopping.  One last thing....is there anyone else that felt like they were borderline dark-dining?  It's called a L-A-M-P.

uqYC8fVaUm6n32NtJjPjzw.text: Best sushi in Vegas. The Ryan's special and jackpot roll are the best! Super friendly staff as well.

fDNYBgXVUix3j2XvM_NSeQ.text: You gotta go here!  Always great food and a fun atmosphere.  If you want something spicy, go for the burn in your stomach roll or kiss of fire.

dOTpv48jMzcuak69gKm0ww.text: We were in Vegas for business.  I had heard about this place a few months back so we decided to make the 15 minute drive to Henderson.  All of the rolls we ordered were delicious.  The sauces were also amazing.  But most impressive of all was the gentleman who was seating the guests.  He appeared to be the owner. We arrived around 7:30 and the place was packed. We asked for a booth. Even though the available booth was for 6 people (and it was just the 2 of us), he gave us the booth  - after I told him we had travelled from LA and had heard great things about this restaurant :) All the servers were attentive and super friendly.   Definitely will visit again the next time we are in town.  YUMMMMMY sushi!!  Recommend 'rock and roll', 'gary's special', one night stand' and the seaweed salad was also delishhhhh.   Thank you "I Love Sushi"!

hU371tWs2rNz0uF1CnUuhg.text: Huge variety! Best sushi place in Henderson so far, and I've tried quite a few places.

iaqq5w0-32xGPyDEhRr9JQ.text: 5 stars isnt enough for this place...... literally the BEST sushi i have EVER had..... they have so many different types of rolls and well a great selection of hand rolls.  i eat here about twice a week (which is not enough, if u ask me!!!).  the fish is so fresh, the flavors are amazing, and the atmosphere is fun too!  The staff are all friendly.  As soon as you walk in, the entire staff greets you.    Some of my favorite rolls include the screaming orgasm, spring mountain roll, almost 90%, and the lisa hand roll.  Just writing this review makes me want to go have some now!!!!!

Q2o-eOpScSfpEnSe0C_3XA.text: I been to I love Sushi twice already in one month. A great place with a very busy but cosy environment. Sushi rolls are big portions and taste delicious!! The energy and the atmosphere is great at this place! Can't wait to go back again!!!

RufA1RRJH_OvdmWrjUQH_w.text: One of my favorite sushi places in Vegas.   They are always packed but they are very efficient.   To beat the crowd, try to come in before the rush hour usually lunch or dinner time.    The waitresses are always very friendly.   But most importantly, the food comes out very quick.

-ADamGLbJ45qAyxNUEVxtw.text: This was the first sushi place i went to after i moved out here.  It is pretty good, always crowded.  my fav. is the cherry blossom!  that is my every time visit must!  the service for the most part has always been pretty standard, only on once occasion was is a little poor...  i have not been here in a few months, but will be back soon!

W2FRViXW1XVhhtEAprZTKw.text: My family has been going here since 2005 since it's just around the corner.  Other than location, the sushi is always good.  In an area where all you can eat(AYCE) is just about everywhere, this restaurant does NOT offer that.  Just traditional order what you want and they'll serve it up fresh.  I gauge sushi establishments by my favorite fish, hamachi.  I order both nigiri and sashimi (when I want to spoil myself) I love sushi (ILS) has never disappointed me.  It's always so buttery smooth with that hint of fish.  The cuts are perfect, not to thin/thick.  There are other sushi places around but not "I-Love-Sushi" good as my boys will describe it.  Really good atmosphere.  On any given day, it's busy from 5:30pm to 7:30pm but it is worth the wait.

9k_yfQAk1aVdYx8bcDRh_g.text: Quite possibly the best sushi I've ever had and such a great environment. Everything is so fresh and unique on the menu and of all the times I've gone I've never had a poor experience. The waitresses are great and remember the customer faces and keep me going back! I would highly recommend it to all.  Not only does I love sushi have amazing sushi, but they have great appetizers and other options such as chicken and udon for those who are not fans of sushi. They're desserts are to die for as well!

7NCNnrunxX29Uz4Jn7UwSA.text: Very good sushi love the restaurant,friendly  Staff !the place is pretty clean ! I recomended this restaurant

85gTefp5A_YcxZB7XTfGmA.text: It's so sad that one of my favorite places has gone downhill.  2 years ago, it was the best.  The service and food aren't what they used to be.  I am not a fan of mediocre service, and lukewarm/cold food.  I will have to find somewhere else to enjoy Sushi.  It won't be at I Love Sushi.

abb7QQMFaPcOc7rL3Cn5Xw.text: Love this place. Come here for my sushi cravings. Not AYCE but delicious food and great service.

q6pbX0nGz66ona7AJQ-Qhg.text: "I Love Sushi" is easily my favorite sushi place in the Vegas Valley. Sure, it doesn't have the private garden, koi pond, and waterfall of "Mizumi" at Wynn Casino, but it doesn't have the same high prices, either. The fish may not also be as high quality as the product at "Bar Masa" in Aria (which only uses fish that have been out of Japan's waters for 24 hours or less), but I've never heard any complaints from anyone I've brought there.   The menu at "I Love Sushi" is extensive -- especially the amazing sushi roll options -- and the atmosphere is usually fun and lively. The creative sushi roll names always elicit laughs from first-time visitors and it's a great place for a casual date or group outing with friends. It's definitely a place that can get kind of loud, however, with a casual environment that's usually not conducive to a quiet romantic dinner (especially on a busy weekend night).   I always start off with the spicy edamame and some of my favorite menu items are the Kiss of Fire, Screaming Orgasm, and John Holmes.    If you're in the mood for great sushi and you don't want to deal with the hassle and high prices of a trip to the Strip, I definitely recommend this place.

tH7VOBiP4JTsVb_f16HItg.text: This place was awesome! Very nice service, fresh food and everything came out in a timely manner. I love this place. It's going to be my new regular spot

zEb0gOZzxa7uSPbHl1s2rQ.text: There are plenty of details about specific dishes/rolls in the previous reviews so I'll keep this succinct by saying this is probably one of the top 5 sushi places we've ever been too. It is not a traditional sushi house, per se, but the food is fun, the combination of flavors are delicious and it's a nice indulgence. If you're a sushi snob with an iron rod up your asshole this is not the place for you, but if you are chill enough to enjoy good food you'll love I Love Sushi.

4lf6msu5nvpCYFjBIZNSyw.text: Delicious food and wonderful service! This place is awesome, with a very fun environment.   Great food, thanks! :-D

_G8AWdpMv4J_-dVK903-Ew.text: What can I say?! Best sushi, best service, awesome atmosphere! This place is alive. When it comes to sushi, I would only recommend this place. We've created so many memories in here.  I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. My daughter also loves I Love Sushi
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Yes!! I can eat a lot, especially sushi.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. This was taken Mother&#39;s Day.

8f-z1S2-LtAc5k-Rqy3TdA.text: I Love Sushi is hands down my favorite sushi spot in Henderson (and I have been to them all).  The service is always incredible prompt and friendly and sushi is incredible.  The #22 flower roll and #28 jackpot roll are the best on the menu and mindblowingly good.    The only con is that they don't offer "all you can eat" and I am a huge eater but the quality and atmosphere make up for this.  I HIGHLY recommend giving I Love Sushi a try!

mKODWfSPbhGxKJ3AVyF0Vw.text: My cousin turned me on to this place with all the delicious pictures of her meal here that she posted on social media.  We decided to give it a try. There's ample parking, the restaurant is large and has a u shaped sushi counter with tables and booths on both sides. I like to begin my sushi meals with an order of salmon sashimi or sushi depending on my mood. I judge places by the quality of their salmon and the cut of the salmon here was thick and long. Very generous!   The menu was a little overwhelming so I recommend looking at the hundreds of pictures on Yelp to help you decide what to order. You definitely need to know what the right things to order are. I like everything we ordered but we were only there for a quick bite so we only tried 3 things. I can't wait to return to try more of their menu.

2USsItZkj_9_mn2DWa161Q.text: Friends in Las Vegas recommended I love sushi for a nice dinner out. We visited this past weekend and thoroughly enjoyed everything. Would highly recommend to everyone.

v5724-IcUbDuMiS3yjGVig.text: I just don't get how this place has this many reviews. The raw fish was not good. I tried several pieces of raw fish. I will stick with sushi Rocku or Nobu. The place was clean, service great, the raw fish just didn't melt in my mouth

svkCTwqvMIYaG-ZXAHrLIA.text: Convenient location from my home with decent prices. I had the jackpot roll, monkey roll, and the spicy tuna roll. My favorite bar far was the jackpot roll. Of course anything with tempura is amazing but this one really stuck out as the bell of the ball of flavor. Service was prompt and friendly as well, even on a bustling Saturday night! Think I will give a few of the other rolls a try on my next Vist and the plum sake was probably the best sake I have ever tasted for less then 100 bucks a bottle.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Jackpot roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Plumber sake the best

tIJf5A86eFRHdoyidt69RQ.text: I love sushi is hands down the best sushi! The I love sushi roll is my favorite, the tuna melts in your mouth. Good quality fish for a great price, don't waste your time or money on sushi on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

IKKEcIDBjkzP-nVGdH3fqA.text: Maybe we were there on an off night, because our experience was terrible. My husband and I arrived on a Wednesday night for dinner. We had a table for 2, and the restaurant was not overly busy. Our server was polite, and continually checked on us, which is great. We placed our order, my husband ordered from the hibachi, and I ordered 2-rolls, and we ordered saki. Nothing too crazy or out of the ordinary.  My husband received his meal within about 5-10 minutes after placing the order, but it came out without the rice. No big deal, we can live with that. The meal was hot, and looked fine. The taste was fine, but the meat was very tough. Again, we can kinda live with that, hey tough met happens. We waited and waited for my order to come through...and waited...and waited....  We were watching the sushi bar the entire time, and there were sushi chefs available to make our remaining order, so we thought, maybe our order got lost. Our waitress returned when my husband was almost done with his meal and brought the rice she forgot to bring out during the first arrival of his food. Rice was very bad.  My order finally came 45-minutes later. Let that sink in. 45-minutes later. 2-rolls. They were absolutely horrible. I love sushi. I love sashimi. The rolls tasted like really bad rotten fish, and even had the rotten smell. I gagged with the first bite, and thought maybe it's in my head. I tried bite number two and lost it. The waitress returned and she asked "Do you not like your meal?" I responded by saying what I thought, and she said "Thank you for being so nice to me, most people want the manager, thank you." At this point I just wanted taco bell. She didn't offer a refund or to even give a discount. We didn't ask. We had already spent almost 2-hours there and walked out paying $60 for a horrible experience.  By the way, this was our 3rd time there, and it was only my first experience that was great. The sushi chef was Joe, and we sat at the bar. He was not there the other two times, so maybe he's the key to the success? I don't know, but we will not return. :(

e_A3EhJpKlNI9wNtAtPBQQ.text: One of my favorite sushi spots in Vegas, always amazing, great sushi, the fish is fresh, I'm a fan! It's certainly in my rotation for Vegas sushi

kmORveGOQ3lVt9-YwlYnUQ.text: I love this place! Everything I order is delicious here. You can't go wrong. The service is excellent and they take reservations. I have been here numerous times and not once have I had any issues. The baked rolls are my favorite. Yummmmy!

bzt5iDiSnz2VuwOVKUBg5A.text: This is by far my favorite sushi place in all of Las Vegas and Henderson. If you want good sushi you come here. They will make you anything you want whether it is on the menu or not. The best and freshest Seafood I've ever had since living in San Francisco. You can't get any better than this!

S5ynALBDO5-4vRReC44Kig.text: very good sushi at a very reasonable price. service has always been more than friendly. food comes out fast and space is always clean. there is no shortage of sushi places on Eastern within three miles of this place and in my opinion this one stands out as the best!

X1Tz1JIFwuhyV_f-dZOwUg.text: I went here with my son for his birthday. The food was good but we were completely ignored. After trying to add on something for him for at least 40 minutes and get a drink refilled we finally just left with my son in tears because he was really excited to go. There were only three other tables there at the time. Good food but bad service. Won't be returning.

VfxHE_UkmTQ-VF_qk_C3kQ.text: I have been to many sushi places and some not ayce and this one is not an ayce.  It was good but not great.  The service and staff are extremely nice.  I tried the sushi boat called the love boat.  Little expensive for what you get. Think it's more for show.  I would love if they had a build your own boat option.  Not sure if I would go again unless that was an option to try. Other items I saw around looked good but not sure taste.

Nho_F0mV_jhJF0I4Pgn5mw.text: Came to this place on a friends recommendation.  The restaurant is nice. The decor was a bit dark but the waitresses all wore kimonos which were really pretty.  They are friendly and nice.   Between three people, we ordered the large screaming orgasm, Gyoza, Rick and roll and the fire(?) roll.  The Gyoza was fried and came with ponzu dipping sauce. The outside was crunchy but the inside a little mushy. I have had better but it's not bad. The rock and roll was by far our favorite. Salmon yellowtail tuna and crab meat wrapped in cucumber. It also came with a sauce but I just ate it plain with a slice of lemon. Very fresh and hits the spot. The fire roll not only looked like Mexican food, but tasted like it too. Too saucy and tart, couldn't really taste the fish. The screaming orgasm was drowning in sauce but it was quite tasty. 10 pieces of seared tuna for 16 bucks. We were so overwhelmed by sauce that we decided to order one more roll, the eel one with the spicy tuna. I really liked that roll. I got the fresh fish taste from the spicy tuna and the sweetness from the eel.   Overall I would come back again but I have had better for the price. Over all everything was 70 bucks all together.

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried Gyoza

4kl_Y-CUE4ovHHh45NHf4w.text: Under new ownership but just as good. Super fresh fish, Friday nights are like a club but still intimate. I miss seeing James though

fOnXFfMvcHizAPthazXihg.text: Always amazing! This place is packed and rightfully so! I love the cherry blossom and the screaming "o." One of my favorite sushi places!

3RXsijxo83L6sVVuzNMRZw.text: Went here based on a suggestion of a nearby business.  The service was very good, the wait staff is very attentive and our server suggested a delicious coconut sake that we loved.  Now the bad part:  the sushi tasted fresh enough, their menu is too big to parse out, and they wanted to start taking our orders immediately.  Everything is a la carte, no AYCE.  I did not love a single item of the 4-5 rolls we ordered.  We tried a sushi nacho thing that was too sweet, the sauces were either spicy and runny or poorly described on the menu.  Every item was just a little OFF.  The worst part comes today as my boyfriend and I have been sick all morning with GI distress after visiting.  I walked out last night disappointed and I woke up beyond angry that now I can't travel today because I'm locked in my bathroom.  Update: I called the restaurant the next day and a manager got back to me 4 days later.  They were very kind and apologetic, I chose a refund of my money instead of a credit at the restaurant.  I'm glad they offer this sort of service.

pR3F6TOL59x6pL70vWoNnA.text: I'll be honest, I haven't tried much of the sushi here but I am a huge fan of their tuna poke. The tuna actually tastes marinated and not just doused in a soy sauce dressing. It's also got a bit of a spicy kick which I love!   I Love Sushi also has awesome spicy garlic edamame. Definitely can't go wrong with some deliciously seasoned edamame to share as a starter.  I usually come here for sake and beers, so I haven't explored their menu too much yet. My friends get the rolls and I've tried a piece here and there - not bad at all. I'll have to write a more detailed review when I really feast on their sushi.   Service is quick; the servers are Korean as they yell out orders in Korean to one another across the restaurant. The few times I've been here the servers have always been attentive. They just happen to check up on us when I need another sake or beer...  The menu items here are a little pricier but I don't mind for the taste and service. I'm sure I'll be back next time I'm craving their tuna poke and some sake!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna Handroll! Yum
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Tuna Poke! So Delish!

FiLvzPbA_ta6ra0_qY0rxw.text: This place has always had the best sushi ever. Fish is fresh, food is great and the service is wonderful. If you love sushi, this is the place to go !!!

EzqrbMV9JV8U011Z6TbHWw.text: The food tasted good. My husband ordered an order of yellowtail sushi, tuna sushi, and salmon sushi. When he was chewing I could hear him crunching down on something very hard. He hurt his tooth. He spit it out and it was a small rock from in the rice. Luckily I only ordered sashimi! We will definitely not be going back.   Wash your rice!!!!

sdkcGEiFRDplkHi2xM2Mkw.text: Good quality sushi! The rolls looked dull though, I wish the presentation was better! Otherwise a decent sushi restaurant with an authentic vibe to it!

CU5Sp3Uf9oKPABRzlPjp2g.text: This is a solid NON AYCE sushi place in Henderson. The service was spot on throughout and our waitress was very sweet and personable. The fish was high quality and the rolls were reasonably priced. We were AYCE status stuffed and the bill was only $60 pre tip and that included a large Sapporo.  We started of with steamed Gyoza that were around $5 and edamame. For our rolls we opted for Rainbow roll, scallop roll, screaming orgasm roll, and an assortment of nigiri (salmon, yellowtail and scallop). The fish was very fresh and the rolls were not overloaded with yum sauce or cream cheese. The place does get packed in the evenings during dinner rush.   Keep in mind, there is no AYCE option here, but the quality of the food and the great service that accompanies it warrants paying the regular prices.

7j50KjA-muDef899YPzZ-Q.text: Excellent service & yummy Quality food every time. One of the very Best in Henderson hands down.

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sashimi Salad Masterpiece. @ilovesushi #sushi #sashimi #raw #tuna

k3DTa8fEh9jy6Sq4_3g1qA.text: I divide sushi into 2 different kinds: First, there are the restaurants devoted to serving fresh raw fish, prepared very simply, highlighting the flavors of the fish. Then, there are the restaurants that serve AYCE, or various fried rolls, or rolls with lots of different sauces, or rolls with weird sexual names.  I love sushi falls into this second category. It's not that it's bad - actually, I thought it was quite good - but don't go there expecting a great meal of nigiri and sashimi. Instead, order your 'screaming orgasm' and your 'sushi nachos' and enjoy them....and order some extra yum yum sauce on the side.

snSiLsnrAKJOZOgYOz0XBQ.text: My husband and I just had our first date here since our 7 month old baby was born. Service was awesome! Food really wonderful. We started with cucumber salads and miso soups. We also shared a spicy tuna roll that I'm craving seven days later!! I ordered the salmon skin salad that took a little longer than my husband's meals, but it was worth the wait!  It was larger than I had anticipated, so I ended up not ordering anything else after that. We plan to return as soon as our relatives return to babysit our baby girl!

TSNLjd_9DEVE4mvzouMm3Q.text: I Love Sushi does not do AYCE.. Which would not be a problem for me if the sushi quality was better/the prices weren't so high. I ordered 1 roll and a small beer and ended up paying $19. My money would have been better spent at an AYCE elsewhere.  We made a reservation for a table of 8. Easy, no problem, on time. 7PM Thursday night and the place was PACKED- Play it safe and make a reservation! The waitresses are all dressed in cheap kimonos and are HORRIBLE. One of the waitresses came over and asked who ordered the 'Screamo' (the roll was called the 'Screaming Orgasm') The restaurant was loud, we were a party of 8- none of us claimed the roll. The waitress ended up getting extremely angry insisting that it was our roll. We eventually figured out which roll she was talking about apologized for not understanding, but come on. Why work at a restaurant with a ton of dirty names if you don't want to say them out loud? It wasn't our fault we thought you had a different roll!  The sushi boat with terriyaki, katsu, sushi we ordered was larger than expected and worth the price if you're going to be sharing with a large group.  Candy Cane: Yellowtail and tuna covered rolls that looks like a candy cane. Not too saucy, perfect amount of raw.  Kiss of fire: A popular roll but I'm unsure why. It's spicier than anything I've previously experienced and tastes only of sricha.  Overall the sushi=4, service=1.

d8NMuREia-CxQr7weIWmng.text: Favorite sushi restaurant in town. Good service and fish always fresh.  Plan on a wait Friday and Saturday night.

grxnKvPGT7X2CSXse7khfQ.text: Been eating here for over 10 years & never had a bad meal!  Sushi is always extremely fresh and so tasty!!!  It gets busy every night so go early if possible.

Akm5h5YlqPDZzKnz7BVnlQ.text: I come here once a week, and I never had a bad experience, even when their super busy on Friday & Saturday nights! they deserve 5 stars because their sushi is the best and their service is amazing! #melsroll  is my favorite.

jrPRRXLjJcfpwbBq48sa4g.text: Hands down best sushi!!  The people who work there are efficient and very friendly. I was pleasantly surprised with the way the Last Call roll tasted, warm but cool, and is just incredible. My glass with green tea (cold) was never empty.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The rolls are amazing!!!!

jA_eF3wPqxZ7xNp8-6tMwA.text: The best sushi place I have been to in such a long time. Everything that I have tried has been very good whether it be one of the menu items or a special request with the sushi bar. My favorites are still the Screaming Orgasm and Lisa Hand Roll. If you like tuna, you cannot go wrong with these two items. They are absolutely fantastic! I visit or get carry out usually a couple times a month. I've tried several other sushi places in the area and have decided to stop wasting my time with the disappointment and just stick with what continually exceeds expectations... I will stick with I Love Sushi!

Idda8DnrS2UlAOBYjCDhKA.text: Omg this place has the best spicy sushi I have ever had. The "burning your stomach"  is a delicious blend of fresh fish with mouth burning sauces that aren't overpowering or take the flavor away from the fish. It's amazing and I can't even explain how quickly and efficiently they churn out their rolls. Very fast and very competent service. I have been to many sushi places and they are very fast paced and getting your roll order wrong has been fairly common for me. Not the case at all here.   You want good food and amazing, ORIGINAL SPICY rolls, this is the place for it.

0Y_PZDIaLhLre3q8c_E-Fw.text: By far the best. Sushi. I've. Ever. Eaten. I have nothing else to say but put this app down and go there now.

lqqh8mrnQSRl8nFBKJGaPQ.text: This place is the bomb. The food is always amazing and the service is friendly. Only four stars because sometimes I feel like I'm being rushed, but I guess that's normal for a locals place that's good and busy.

Rwqyp51ssm3nWbcyOJufnQ.text: We were seated immediately on a busy evening, nice environment, incredible sushi, and great service. The servers dress as geishas, the only thing that bummed me out was that it was not all you can eat, however, they compensated by having a tremendous menu. Highly recommend!

O3UHP3KCkuj2_kUTh8daZw.text: Ate there a few months ago with another couple. Food was veggie dish. The dish was almost 60 % onions. Told server and her only response was sorry. Told he manager on the way out. He said sorry. Nothing off the bill but told me  to let him know next time we came in and he would take care of an item.  NO thanks. Won't be back.  If you are looking for Japanese try the South Point casino.

tP9nOL0c-3hNtksJojBVNA.text: We went in with a party of 10, we had a great time. Service was excellent, food was fantastic! I recommend the Happy Ending sushi and chilled Raspberry Sake. We had a great giggle reading some of the names of the sushi on the menu.

BvZaXgkFC1BC-zrpf7sNyw.text: Like the vibe in this place, seems like your really in Japan grinding down on some good sushi. I always come back. Friendly staff always a plus.

1k-UeJ-cP8Kbq-pf-ATl2w.text: My best experience was sitting at the sushi bar and eating whatever the chef made for me. I told him I preferred cooked fish over raw, and he definitely made my taste buds and tummy happy. If I can remember the O'Ryan roll was fab!  Each time I've been here, I've had no problem with service. And, I love their huge selection of crazy-innovative sushi rolls. I have yet to find a place like this in SD!  It's also super spacious inside. I love eating here whenever I'm in town. If you end up eating here, be fun and adventurous and try something new!   Prices for the rolls are a little higher, but totally worth it!

GpEOoAa0wxZ6XVrP4DKvpA.text: Twas the night before Christmas, and all through the car, our tummies were grumbling. We couldn't go far. We jumped on to yelp to find some good eats.. long story short, this restaurant is sweet.

aCfh0YdpF8cdLD3NhjRggA.text: Love this place and I have been a regular since opening day.   I do go to other sushi bars to try out, but keep returning to I love sushi. Maybe its the way they immediately greet you when you walk in the door. Even if there is a wait, which there typical when we go on the weekends, its only 10 -15 minutes.   Our favorite - The screaming orgasm, seared ahi with a mayo and vinegar sauce on top of daikon radish! Yum.. the only difference I have seen over the years is the portion is getting smaller. The large order now looks like what the small did 4 years ago.   The bonzai roll is another favorite, shrimp tempura rolled into a california roll and drizzled with teryaki sauce. Spicy salmon another good choice along with the James Bond roll.   All this with a Sapporo beer makes for a great dinner out!   If you love sushi, this is a place to try. They have a huge selection, food tastes great and the service is fast!

S2aK5KiYkthlKSstBxHnWg.text: This I Love Sushi . . .this is good stuff. It's a bit of a trek, especially from the center of Las Vegas, but after two visits here I can say it is worth it. Who would have thought there would be so many sushi restaurants out this way, but many there are and thanks to a recommendation from a local in the know we found I Love Sushi.   I'm not a sushi expert but I can tell when the food is fresh and of excellent quality. Next time you're in a sushi restaurant order some Uni. It's a good way to gauge the quality of the food. I Love Sushi's Uni scores well.  Sitting at the bar, I thought the sushi chefs were professional, friendly, entertaining, funny and good at what they do which is to make great looking and tasty sushi.  The service was very attentive, almost too much so, but that could be attributed to the fact that this restaurant actually reads their Yelp reviews and realized that people have previously made comments about their iffy service.   Here are two dishes I've had and really liked, the Caterpillar Roll - tempura shrimp, cucumber, eel topped with avocado and eel sauce; and the Dragon Roll - California roll topped with eel and eel sauce. Both were fresh, fresh, fresh.

-ven-f0oMZz7rs_WlpTJuA.text: This place is amazing! It's not all you can eat but definitely worth the price. Their rolls are huge! I recommend the double d roll and Ryan's roll. The bacon wrapped shrimp is also a great starter.

v22pfl3l6gZzuD_wUNLwhA.text: The Seared Ahi Tuna is amazing!  And I love all of the different creative names for the sushi options.

dBe5_jWGhrOvtVAOvuH48A.text: I'm a sucker for sushi, but it has to be good and authentic for me to give a 5 star rating and I love Sushi passed for both!  We came here with some LV locals on our way back from Lake Powell and it was just what we needed.  We ordered so many different rolls that I couldn't just pick one that was better than the other.  The spicy garlic edemame  was great too.  Plenty of free parking also.

kYlFyVDkb29H3ianb-Uqyg.text: Seriously best sushi in town!  The only place I come :)  Amazing service and phenomenal sushi!

0joU_6R7oMgrD1IfrU3Lrw.text: Good food, always a line out the door. Alittle pricey per dish that is why only 4 stars.

umuJfFTMTssJLbs6-FNz1A.text: By far the best sushi off the strip!  Very friendly service too.

bpGxwR9U8xIimFtz2je_YQ.text: "I love Sushi" should be changed to "I love variety" instead.  While I love sushi does offer the traditional nigiri, this place offers way too much rolls that it's almost mind boggling. And the only reason why their rolls are so big is because pack in a lot of rice. The quality of their seafood/fish isn't bad, but I wouldn't say it's good either. It isn't the freshest I've ever had. For the times I've been here, it's always pretty packed and service is ok.  Suggestion: to simplify the menu, instead of naming each roll a different name, maybe it should be called one name and put alternative ingredients underneath each name as suggestions of how you can build your sushi...OR if you keep each name, put it by type of ingredients so I don't have to go on searching for specific rolls that have i.e. shrimp tempura, or one's with philly cheese because there is too many freakin' rolls to go through and read. Ai yi yi....  Bottom line: Don't think this place is really worth going to considering all that I've said + it's pretty pricey for a place that offers mediocre fish. I also suspect that this place isn't run by or is guided by someone of Japanese decent just by the way the rolls are prepared/served....

5Y68M2O0UK_A0ZpjgLOOVA.text: The different spicy sushi rolls they have will get you going!!! Lots of spice. Great presentation and service as well :) One of the better off the strip environments you will find in town. A happening place. One negative is one of my rolls. It was a white albacore one. FISHY!!! First sushi roll that I've ever had that was this way... Still I've been here enough to go back.

Located behind a Wendy's and a Black Bear Diner, we parked and went in and immediately noticed how packed it was. We we seated in one of the last free tables and edamame with soy sauce brought right over.  My husband ordered for us, putting in a few different choices. I am less adventurous than he when it comes to food, I keep my sushi pretty simple. California roll or tuna roll. My husband goes for the eel and octopus, with more intrepid ingredients.  All in all the sushi was good, and service too. Next time it's his pick for sushi I would be fine returning there.  The bill minus tip was $75.

hP5llKt9se17OsSVAnWqrg.text: I enjoyed my experience at I Love Sushi!  Nice servers and staff.  I really appreciate that all sushi rolls can be prepared without rice!! The Screaming O is also amazing and presented very well.  I will say the restaurant was rather busy so it took a bit of time to get seated but worth the wait.

RUDbGfOYBvVBd34iZ-2anw.text: I love sushi, so when I had some free time in this neighborhood, I popped in. Love the interior, it's so intense it's almost on par with a theme restaurant, in a good way. The service was also really good, everyone was friendly and enthusiastic.  The food was kind of hit or miss though. Got a few orders of nigiri and loved the cut: long, thick, generous slices and a great rice ratio. But the texture and flavor seemed to indicate that the fish was recently defrosted.   The rolls are the way to go here, and the popular Washington roll is awesome. I like that they have a variety of riceless rolls, but the Cherry Blossom just tasted off- maybe the oil was old, but the soft shell crab did not taste fresh and something in the roll was extremely peppery and offputting. Would give them another try, since they seem to usually be pretty great, but the actual food did not live up to expectations on my visit.

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ebi with heads
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Washington

ti5gzsmmA6mJ6InQcispiQ.text: Wow this place was a let down. Service was extremely slow. Everything from getting our order in, getting our food, and getting the bill took way too long. The server checked on our table only once.  They don't have AYCE as an option. The rolls were priced higher than most places, but the rolls were a little bigger.   I ordered the D.C. roll and the Happy Ending roll. They were ok, nothing that made me say "omg this is so good" more like "eh, I've had better" haha. The D.C. roll had soft shell crab in it, which is my favorite thing, but I did not like it in this roll. It left a burnt flavor in the roll like it was fried for too long. If you order this roll I also do not recommend pouring all of the special sauce on it at one time. I made that mistake and it was just too much for the roll. The Happy Ending also had a lot going on, they burnt the soft shell crab in this roll too. It was good, but I think next time I would stick to a regular Japanese lasagna roll.  I was in the area and wanted to give it a try because of the reviews... but im very picky about my sushi places so I don't see myself coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy Ending roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. D.C. roll

M5PpuYy__GY7JVZgAcR_SQ.text: Visited on Saturday September 3, 2016 at 8PM.  This restaurant is located on Eastern & Sundridge Heights (just South of St. Rose Pkwy).    For ambiance, I give this place 10 stars!!!  It's a massive restaurant with japanese paper booths lining the walls and a huge sushi counter in the middle with glass displays of the fresh fish.  All the waitresses are seriously foxy and dressed as geishas.  There is even an old asian man at the door greeting people and shouting orders at the servers.  I dig it!   $63.48 got us two sushi rolls, edamame, two soft drinks, and a dinner entree.  The dinner entree allows you to pick two proteins and then it comes with rice, miso soup, a salad, tempura rice, gyoza, and half an orange.  My husband chose chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu and liked both a lot.  I stole his miso soup and I gotta say it's about the best I've ever had.  It was hot and salty and earthy and had plenty of tofu and seaweed.    I got a sex on the beach roll which consisted of raw spicy scallop, crab, masago, scallion, cucumber, and salmon and then I asked them to add lemon since they don't offer a lemon roll like every other damn sushi place in Vegas. This roll made me gag a little bit but my husband ate it with no problems.   To be fair this was my first time trying raw scallop and I think I don't like it.    The other roll I got was much better and was called the double D roll.  It had tempura shrimp, cucumber, crab, salmon, masago, and avocado.   They brought me a delicious sauce called 69 and I dunked my pieces in there and they were edible.    I had hamachi kama here for the first time and now I see why so many people love it.  It's the "collar" of the fish (the area around the flippers but behind the gills).  The fish is so soft and squishy, and also fatty and salty.  It's like a tiny treasure hunt digging around the bones and fins and getting every little morsel out of every nook and cranny.  I used my hands because I'm obviously 3 years old on the inside and have no manners.  I could have eaten 5 of these seriously.   They have literally over a hundred different rolls so I'd say definitely take your time and read all the ingredients and you'll find a roll you like.  For the money I'd rather go to Sakana, Yama, or Goyemon, and enjoy the freedom of AYCE but this place has an amazing ambiance.
