There is never a time that they leave you waiting. Not only a great local sushi place, but a great sushi restaurant in general.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

Xf4X6gqkEDgx6RUcDrEcHQ.text: Went here for dinner on a Friday night. I've been eating a lot of sushi lately and couldn't resist trying out another place. I have to say that this place was interesting because the waitresses actually wear kimonos and have accents. My server was pretty sassy which made things even more enjoyable lol. I tried the Ryan's roll which was pretty good. It reminded me of a standard crunchy roll, but this one cost like $15, so I don't know if I would get it again. The Screaming Orgasm was really good too and the small portion was only $10. The seared tuna was good and I would probably get it again. I liked it because it was fresh (not like some places with the chewy or stale looking fish), had a slightly spicy aftertaste, and had a bunch of sprouts and stuff which made me feel healthy. It was pretty busy so you know that is a good sign.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ryan&#39;s roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Screaming orgasm

r_jQUrzAm4w9K-Hd6FWyjA.text: overpriced as hell. One thing that I quickly noticed from previous experience is that they keep the lights dim or practically no light at all. They gave me my plate and underneath it was so sticky and had some dried old food on top. I couldnt even eat, I left

7mo8rROLzElx7jK4r2YC1A.text: When in Vegas and you have time to get away from the strip - this is the sushi place to eat at!   They have a large variety of rolls, all the fish taste very fresh. Service is great, our server was prompt and checked in with us frequently. Can't wait to come back and try more of their rolls, I'm sure they are all delicious!

D1LzOVGm7G4tfxo6kLPEYw.text: If you've been patronizing this restaurant since 2010 like I have. You have probably noticed lately that the waitstaff are incredibly rude and the sushi is not as good. That's because ownership was sold 4-5 months ago. This place has gone completely downhill. Won't be going back.

iRQ-iLbIHp8dPfqcr3sWXA.text: Well damn!!!!! What in the hell was I waiting for??? I've passed by this place several times but never stopped in to try it. So glad I stopped in this particular day. What a nice surprise. Great customer service, atmosphere and excellent sushi. There were a large variety of sushi selections. I ordered the Jackpot roll with screaming orgasm sauce. OMG!!!!! So delicious. I also ordered a house salad and another roll (that I can't remember the name of). I will definitely return.

FQrrmua5lPhcsgfwJ6pqDg.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in all of Vegas. The menu is a never ending choice of creativity and flavor. Sake selection is one of the best off strip. A bit pricey but worth treating yourself. Note they don't have AYCE.

kairZlm6HlMOVLfUSZIOlg.text: My fiance and I have been going to I Love Sushi for 4 years now, ever since moving to the area. The service is always top notch and the sushi has always been fresh and amazing! Our favorites are the I Love My Ass, Burning Your Stomach, and Kiss of Fire! The Dynamite baked dish is amazing as well if you feel like something hot.  On occasions when we've ordered out the food has always been packed well and complete! I would definitely recommend I Love Sushi to anyone!

oTp5Nj_Lp60wb2RyzwLnFw.text: Best damn sushi in Henderson, if not Vegas.   I could eat the garlic tuna sushi by the bucket load. I guess I would if I were a seal. But I'm not. So I eat it here. One delicious, melt-in-your mouth, piece at a time.

UneVgqRHM0t2NprKWMSgRQ.text: Hands down my entire families favorite sushi restaurant! We are regulars here and every time we leave completely satisfied. Our favorite rolls are Kiss of Fire, Bam Bam, DD, and Jackpot Special. Other menu items we love is their Screaming O, Pepper Tuna, chicken salad (very flavorful), jalapeno yellowtail sashimi, and spicy edamame.

0J2kLWyEKlcsGqUd1gUyOg.text: I don't eat meat so I'm constantly looking for a good sushi place just in case I don't have time to cook at home and this place hit the spot perfectly! I always get the super white tuna and it's one of the best I've ever tasted. It was so good that I spent $75 worth of food all to myself. I got a few rolls, one hand roll, 4 nigiris and their crab fried rice. They were all so delicious! I would definitely come back again only this time with a few more people.

CfTwxq9HubiK2VbhzQwecA.text: I love this place!! Usually order the same dishes. Their Spicy Edamame is yum! The Springmountain Roll is a must try...it has just enough spice and has no rice. The Spicy Sashimi Salad I think it's called. The Large comes with choice of 3 different kinds of fish on top of Daikon (Winter Radish) with a spicy ponzu sauce. Amazing! The Grand Canyon Roll is a roll I order for my 5 year old niece. No raw fish in the roll. It's a California Roll topped with sauteed mushrooms, shrimp, and scallops in a creamy sauce. She also loves their Krab Hand Roll.   The service is usually great. Definitely not one of the All You Can Eat joints in Vegas, but totally worth it if you're not trying to dine on a budget.

bIxWVRb9jKCyDU_lu_i-9Q.text: The food and service has always been great here. Just started going again after being out of town and still love it.

eqLZzDUd4AkYEfJzxOgqmg.text: The sushi menu is plentiful, with lots of choices. Whether you want Sashimi, plain rice and fish, or really cool roll creations, this place has it. The fish is fresh and delicious. I know sushi, and this place is really good! There are rolls that I do not care for, yet only because I do not like the taste of some of the ingredients, while my friends think those are the bomb!  The service is very friendly, and the atmosphere is a happy one.  I have been here 7 times, and plan on continuing to go back. Easy to park and relaxed atmosphere.

z6AE2sw_L9qQc--aYHcpNw.text: First off, our server came with our drinks and when my friend said we were ready to order (which our server didn't even ask) she gave us a dirty look like "uh ok I guess." My friend ordered a California roll with crunch and eel sauce. Our server took her order and even asked her a second time what it was to be sure. My friends roll came out and it had no crunch or eel sauce on it... Also, our server was not friendly or very good. Never have had a super good experience here.

DUSjY9uSHn2mgMc4WeRU6A.text: So many choices of sushi rolls.  Fast and friendly service.  The restaurant was very busy, we were seated within 10 minutes.  All the food was very good.

LIqN6msTQN5PayhXY764OA.text: Wow great sushi place in Henderson. Been here twice in two days! I'm traveling from out of town but am glad I found a nice healthy high quality place to eat while I'm here. Love the peppered tuna avocado dish!

TcvgQ1KYycQrCqHKFWtqDw.text: This is where I broke my Las Vegas sushi cherry... TMI?  After a long day of driving a U-Haul across the CA/NV stateline, lifting and unpacking boxes I was ready to eat, but I was sick of fast-food and pizza options. I yelped Sushi and this place popped up with 4 1/2 stars? Let's do this!   I placed an order for pick-up and they said it would take about ten minutes. Hmmm, ten minutes for 2 orders of Udon Tempura and 2 Caterpillar Rolls? I decided to test this and arrived 8 minutes & 25 seconds later. "Hi, order for Tiffany?" (my GF) "Yup, right here...two orders of Udon Tempura and 2 Caterpillar Rolls"...whoa, this place is on it, but how does it taste?  I brought it home and feasted. The Udon Tempura was very good and full of flavor. The tempura was delightful, not to greasy just lite and flaky. Poi-fect! The Caterpillar rolls you could tell were super fresh and delicious. These were definitely made to order.   This place gets an easy 4 stars. I'm coming back to get the full restaurant experience soon. Maybe this will lead to an updated review and a added star?

B0MEy4OqDCtAOW1hOe4Rxg.text: Without a doubt the best sushi place in Las Vegas. The ingredients are premium quality, and the rolls are all unique. The service is always amazing and the atmosphere makes it a great experience.  Highly recommended!!

LQk-_KYyE681cdt6oyxyMg.text: Why I haven't written a review yet here is beyond me. Maybe it's because of the great conversation I have here that I forget, or the full happy belly that leaves me in such a euphoric state that I can't bear to type. Well whatever the case I am writing it now. This place has such a great atmosphere and amazing sushi rolls everything, every time I come I can't believe it. I'm never ever ever disappointed l. The staff is friendly and the sushi is delightful what more can you want!? Get here early on the weekends because it's usually slammed packed. Def a local spot. Oh and by the way SIMON IS AWESOME! Such a kind spirit and a pleasure to be around. Always makes my time at I Love Sushi even better!

ALD34Qt_PViOVyih-oHjog.text: The service at I Love Sushi is as good as the rolls, I drive past a dozen sushi spots on my way to I Love Sushi... Because I Love Sushi. Do yourself a favor and get a Sex on the Sushi, Rolley Rice Bowl, and the Screaming Orgasm.

sMDTkjd-z0-nHQ-ImGGvTQ.text: IMO the best rolls I have ever had. We had 4 for lunch and of course I ordered and as usual over ordered. Everything we tried was superb and very fresh. Large portions for the cut rolls and some very unique combos. They have a huge menu with well over a hundred different combos of rolls some fried but most just very healthy sushi.

gqFECLSQ-k34DZYQFsFNDg.text: Best Japanese food in Vegas by far.  Before I even get to saying how amazing the food was I will start with the atmosphere. We got sat at a table with walls around it so it was almost like having our own room. The waitresses wear traditional Japanese garments and speak very little English. It's considered casual but you would look a little under dressed if you showed up in board shorts and flip flops. It is a very cool setup and added to the experience.   Now about the amazing food. Sadly enough I didn't try the sushi but I did get the vegetable tempura which was absolutely amazing. Hands down the best I have ever had. My sister got the chicken Lo mein and it had such an amazing flavor to it I wanted to eat her whole meal! My boyfriend got the platter with shrimp tempura and teriyaki chicken. It was huge and he loved it. I think he picked the best thing on the menu!   Overall it was amazing and definetly will be a returning customer.

yYrsbKXe8qghtZiLKKxD2A.text: I Love Sushi is absolutely amazing!!  Favorite rolls:  -Washington roll -Gary's Special -Kiss of Fire  You have to order all 3 as they are amazinggg and the sushi chefs are fun too!

Paf-rT06hPoL-n9QbZ3DQw.text: Delish! Fun! Love the food, great sushi chefs. Been ere on dates, been her with fam and everyone leaves happy. A little pricy but great sushi is. Hear from a friend there's a kitchen sink roll that excellent. I haven't had it yet but will on my next visit. Bon Appetite!

qOzVBUt7gx725ZpB9wH9VQ.text: Lively, Gimmicky, Good Food.  This Anthem spot isn't for the sushi purist, but rather the sushi lover that takes quality more seriously than the dish's name.    Japanese Lasagna, Tastes like my ex-wife, and Screaming orgasm are all rolls featured on the menu at I Love Sushi.  I've never had a bad bite of anything here.  My only complaint about the food, is that many of the rolls are bathed in sauce.  For me, this is a no-no.  A little sauce is alright, but drowning something in spicy mayo only aims to hide poor quality ingredients, and the quality here is superb.  Even when this place gets jumping, and it does, the service is outstanding.  Food arrives in a timely manner, and is at the right temperature.    The Sushi Bomb here is out of this world, and definitely my favorite thing on the menu.  It is simple and satisfying.   It is tuna or salmon sashimi served with fresh wasabi.  This is HOT HOT HOT.  Stuffy sinuses seak shelter from this inferno of tasty heat.    A great date spot, I Love Sushi is a solid choice for good quality fish in the Anthem area.

OWadUOmfd1Q9c6kmR_Y33g.text: The reviews did not lie.. This place is awesome! Love that d tables by d sides are separated by walls for a lil privacy. Its my first time there tonight. I made reservations so we didnt have to wait long. They were busy but d servers were quick enough to bring our food. My step daughter never had rolls before and she said d spider roll was really yummy. Kiss of fire was actually spicy, unlike some other "spicy" rolls elsewhere. She also had chicken teriyaki n chicken katsu which were both good and great for d price. Will definitely come back! Im so glad this place is close to my house :)

FlJSrG9Ymgdql7XyPGgwtg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. I have been at least 10 times now. By far some of the best sushi I've had so far in Vegas. Their menu is epic with over 100 rolls. The sushi chefs have personality and you are treated well here. I highly recommend this restaurant. The Vegas special OS a great roll to try too.

Llkof70z3w-jKMxNQ2lwGg.text: 5 star service and atmosphere. Menu offers options for the most discerning sushi eaters and non-sushi eaters (ie many baked roll options). I recommend the oyster shooter with quail egg!

OMHhktwmPwGisSH85RCC9Q.text: This is the best sushi place I've found in Henderson so far. The quality is good and service are good. The rolls are fantastic but there are so many rolls on the sushi menu that I can't keep track of the ones i have/haven't had or the ones I like. They may want to skinny down the sushi menu just a little to cut down on confusion but I do enjoy the adventure! Perhaps a few daily special rolls would be cool.

DJbwTHkT6wNRDGSd0vR-nA.text: I picked this restaurant to eat because of the ratings.  I promise to never eat there again, nor will I recommend it to anyone.  I will agree that the service is fast. I was there on 3/03/2016.   It is almost as if they want their customers to get in and out again as quickly as possible so more people can come to eat.  The tuna poki was way too spicy.  Even my hubby who likes a little spicy did not like it.  It was too hot for him.  They took away my cucumbers before I had finished them.  They did not bring wasabi or ginger to the table...I had to flag someone down to get it.  My rainbow roll tasted fishy.  It was so bad I didn't finish it.  I would have liked to discuss this with someone, but nobody ever came back to our table.  The green tea was scalding hot, too hot to drink.  By the time my first cup had cooled enough to drink, I was done eating.  As we left the restaurant, I mentioned going out the door that I did not like the rainbow roll, which in turn was said to me I should have mentioned it earlier.  Well, I would have liked to mention it earlier, but nobody ever came back to our table.  I got tired of waiting.  The food isn't worth the price, the hot tea too hot to drink and the follow-up service non-existent.  I won't recommend this restaurant, nor will I ever eat there again.  At least I didn't throw up what little I ate of the rainbow roll.  For an $85 tab for 2 people, the food and service should have been much better.

PQU-gjE5T2CLEMkAmOt5Kw.text: You can tell a great sushi spot when they don't have an all you can eat option. Fresh rolls and great apps. Hands down my favorite sushi in town. A little far up Eastern Ave but it is worth the trip. Huge sushi roll menu. My two favorites are the Jackpot and Crispy Rice roll.

ZlRHEb36-K7iCdBZrnW0yQ.text: It was amazing!  One roll that is a sleeper is the Last Call.  This what I would a nontraditional roll, but really good.  You have to save room for desert, tempura cheesecake, I could have the whole cake.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Soooooo goooooood!!!

nrDpY_TbbAXQTMcD-s0LdQ.text: A local place with one of the best rolls I have had...the "burning your stomach roll" It's extremely spicy, but one of the best I have tasted. And the sushi is always fresh. Service has always been great...the only minor complaint would be sometimes the sushi doesn't come out all together..that could be annoying if you are in a larger group and some people don't have their food. But other than that a great place and prices are great as well.   The menu is huge, so it could take you a while too decide.

iSrn6DHC-Ot9PIdldbnP9w.text: I enjoyed the atmosphere, service, food and the servers. I especially enjoy the authentic japanese robes the ladies wear on their shifts.   Fish is not that fresh. Ex: cuts of fish was VERY VERY COLD/icy-like, as if it was recently thawed out from being frozen.   I enjoy authentic foods and was in the mood for ebi (live shrimp.) They said they have it, but it is frozen. Hands down, without hesitation I passed on this. (Just an FYI.)  Recommend: * "Bam bam" * Oyster shooters - yet the oysters are small. * Ginjo - cold sake. Very tasty and smooth.  Pass: *Cucumber wrapped rolls, items listed without rice. They skimp on the  quantity/portion of the fillers for the rolls if you order it this way. A great disappointment. * Sashimi - magaro. Only came with 4 very small pieces. Not worth it.  Overall, the food was good. I would go again.

1_IPMdAbg63VCLnemdCwLQ.text: They offer brown rice sushi! And the spicy tuna is so fresh, it melts in your mouth. I like this place :)

k3plKm3t1V8uyWcUz8Uoig.text: BEST sushi place in town, hands down!!! The sushi is always fresh and grade A quality. It's always busy during dinner, cause it's the bomb diggidy!

724Vp-Hg6Qx9Q1J0Rwr_9A.text: Busy place on a friday night. cool interior-- although I think their attempt to look authentic comes across as a bit campy. Still, good sushi place.  Sit right at the bar and you'll get instant service. We never had a problem getting our orders to us in timely fashion. The Screaming orgasm was probably the tastiest of the specialty rolls we had. The meat was arranged in a poke like fashion over tasty crispy noodles and tangy sauce. I agree with a previous critic that they rely on sauce a little too much here, but it is tasty nonetheless. The jerry roll went down smoothly, and the crunch roll can be addicting. Dynamite was very filling and a good value pick ( if you don't mind baked rolls). For those who don't know, it's a mixture of scallop and chopped shrimp baked over rice soaked in a creamy sauce. They offer a huge selection of specialty rolls here but they also do nigiri. The yellowtail was very thick-- some of the biggest pieces of nigiri i've ever seen. The squid was as well. You don't have to go AYCE to get a good value here, especially if you're willing to try a number of their nigiri offerings.  We left quite full, and I would gladly return.

kRy7HS_qMHhdeLsxRNVh-A.text: I usually love this place but sub par tonight ; I think they were too busy for their good. And the service was ok... But I thought it was weird when another waitress grabbed our check (at the end) and checked the tip. Get it together guys!

82ROJRU4BbJeoyWBlpwrlQ.text: Great sushi. Great service. For sure my favorite sushi place in town!  If you are looking for outstanding sushi you are at the right place. The waiters are super friendly and you never have a long wait once ordered.

tqfYBHE4AGsPD-gjd6mE3w.text: I love this place but last weekend me my wife and our 2 year old had a reservation for 6:30 we got there on time then after waiting for 45 min I ask how long and they said 15 to 30 min more. Just crazy they lie to you on how long you must wait. We decided to go somewhere else.  Go during the week much better!

fSyx4o3w-W8Z8iTit2fIFQ.text: been coming here for years.. always packed amazing amazing amazing! I drive 5 hours just to eat here get the lisa handroll its bomb! the only thing I don't like is they hav over 200 rolls so its anxiety sitting trying to read all of them figuring out what to get.. this is the best sushi in all of Nevada :)

MbfrGVXuPU35K7lwZQEqVA.text: I'll be honest, this is not the best Japanese restaurant in the area. But I come here more often than the other restaurant for  couple of reasons.  The place is lively and fun. It's busy, has a good buzz going, and the service is always good. The waiters are efficient, friendly and precise. Some of the women are career waiters and know how to work a table with humor. My favorite waiter is great with kids and engages in small talk without taking time away from her other tables.  Portions are big. This is white man's Japanese food. One "John Holmes" sushi roll for $12 is a meal. An order of tuna sashimi is bigger than anywhere I've ever been.  Food is consistent. You won't find toro, shima-aji, or kanpachi sushi here. That's not what their clientele wants. But the rolls are creative. I know what to expect and I've found items on the menu I'm comfortable ordering time and time again.    If you have friends that are rather middle-of-the-road, and not very adventurous, you can bring them here to introduce them to sushi. They'd also have plenty of meat and other cooked dishes to choose from.

owYX_KjjNs-r2dNVr9svcg.text: Once again, another awesome expierence at I Love Sushi on Eastern. Since I already wrote a review earlier that states how much I enjoy this restaurant, let me just add this little bit:  You know you ordered to much sushi for two people when the waitress says....   ::Server:: Are you sure you want to order all that? It's enough for 4-5 people.   ::ME:: Yes.... were fat. :)

wf1lTQ2jgf84ZfAelfqa7Q.text: Absolutely fabulous!!!  The service was excellent, food delicious and they even gave me a Deep Fried Ice Cream for my Birthday!!!

ZVzQBWVMFv33nFrl3MfbRw.text: I am a SUSHI ADDICT!! I need to have it at-least 3-4 times a week... and my choice is always I LOVE SUSHI... I moved from Los Angeles about 5 years ago and found out about I Love Sushi only 2 years ago. Lets just say I would visit family in LA atleast twice a month (so that i could eat sushi.) I think I Love Sushi has the freshest fish and the best selection of sushi, sashimi and rolls.   Screaming Orgasm, Spring Mountain Roll, ALmost 90%, I Love My Ass and Lisa Hand Roll are some of my all time favorites!!

bxwls8Ld830KYIzK7hC7DQ.text: Gooooood stuff. I am not from the area but read the reviews and said why not. I am glad my fellow yelp friends didn't steer me wrong. This place has some great names for their sushi but some really great sushi. Try the Mountain Roll or the I Love Sushi Roll. You wont regret  going here, even if you are away from strip drive here and enjoy. You'll thank me later.

CTPR-YRFgwB0LYr5roGpSg.text: The sushi is Yum, but if you have to eat gluten free I wouldn't recommend it. They aren't too knowledgeable about Gluten Free and I always leave with a tummy in pain no matter how plain I get my food. They do have a gluten free soy sauce which helps, but the staff isn't too knowledgeable on it so be very careful. They are pretty pricey as well.

IBaiiKP-pGrDeFMLBziRBA.text: The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because it's a good 15-20 minute drive from the strip and it's in a lousy strip mall (which shouldn't count against them, but for ambiance and setting, it does).  Other than that, the sushi is excellent and the prices are awesome. Talk to any local in Las Vegas and they all love this place.

6Eud84-qqbRtFiL4TtI-hQ.text: I have been coming here for years but used to frequent another as well. I came in one day to find one of my favorite sushi chefs now here. I brought my family down for sushi on Friday and sat at sushi bar in front of my longtime friend Joe. We had the best sushi experience in years as Joe was giving us his spin on some of our favorites. My kids love sushi but we're talking about how it was the best sushi we ever had. I love sushi is great but having Joe there puts it over the top for me. There are some great sushi places in Vegas and this is by no means the only great place but people make a difference in the over all experience and everyone here is great.

W33uFXNxP2deT6Fpic1qpg.text: Had the edamame and california rolls. Good food. Ok service.

rDzZT-JiR1Kg-iE5CWfp1A.text: Wish I could give 3.5, but will be generous.    We ordered entrees rather than sushi.  We first shared the butter yaki appetizer with scallops.  I don't associate scallops with Japanese food so I don't really know why we ordered this, but OMG they were the most tender scallops I have ever eaten!  And the portion size was very generous, so we took half home.  They were still surprisingly tender after being reheated in a microwave four days later.  Wow!    The rest of our food was ok to very good, not spectacular.  We both ordered entrees that came with 2 main items.  My vegetable tempura was very good and the salmon teriyaki good, but my husband didn't like his two selections very well (mackerel and spicy chicken, both only ok).  However, the miso soup, salad and side dishes that come with the entrees were all good and we had a lot of food left over.  Overall, we were satisfied.  It was busy and we had to wait about 15 minutes to get seated.   It seemed noisy in the main/bar area, but luckily we ended up just to the left of the front door where it was a little quieter.  If we go back, which we probably will, we'll try the sushi because I suspect that's what they do best.  (Maybe the butter yaki again, too.)  But if we're in the mood for non-sushi entrees, we will probably stick with En Sushi.

yhb-o7ALDQMJSJQgv3Cxgg.text: I love sushi and I love this place! Service is good most of the time, when it gets busy sometimes it's hard to get their attention, but that doesn't stop me from eating here as often as possible. I have never had a bad meal here, always on point. I've been going to this place for years, f*cking love this place...can you swear on yelp?..

V_Ev0lrdOVlZw_bYAhLoFw.text: Busy Busy but Fast service....I like how the waitress were kimonos !! Yummy sushi and bento box a lot of food for a good price...nice atmosphere

Mn9_6leezgENuwr9-D4M8A.text: Best sushi place in Vegas! I had the tiger roll, screaming o, a bunch of other rolls and the Lisa hand roll. The Lisa hand roll is my favorite but everything is delicious. The staff and owner are very friendly and efficient. Its more expensive compared to other sushi spots but def worth it!

b6gvpCdeJBCx-dyuib5H6g.text: My Huney and I visited this place during lunch while on vacation! It is amazing! The quality of fish is superior. We are back tonight because we have not had enough. The i love sushi special is amazing. It is spicy tuna roll wrapped in tuna-- leave the mayo at home, great Asian vinegar holds this spicy tuna together . The no-rice options are superb especially the salmon avocado pesto. This is 20 mins off the Strip and OMG its worth it.  Go there.

PtKhv7t5_7Z4kLPUTuj9FA.text: Good food, great service.  They always deliver.  This is the best sushi restaurant in Henderson, and there are a LOT of them!  I once counted 12 on the Eastern corridor from the 215 to Anthem alone!  They always come through for us.  It's usually my wife and me and 3 kids - 1, 2 and 11.  We've probably been 100 times, because they're always consistently good.

I-akFWSWIEvdjWqFFtBYHQ.text: Sadly after my husband I both got food poisoning I have to take off a couple stars. If you like rolls - this still is the best place in Vegas to go ! Their cooked food is decent as well. If you're a sashimi/nigiri fan I would take your business down the street to En.

y319OdqyZNHHZUnTJPPfOQ.text: The sushi here is so good and fresh that it literally melts in your mouth. The waitress was extremely friendly and the service was quick. This is a must go to sushi place.

ruNf0JsW9IvJE0t5rrpcDA.text: The sushi was delicious and the cooks were real friendly. My only negative comment on the place was they don't have the AYCE option. We all know sushi is expensive, especially when you go for dinner.  Usually an AYCE sushi place for dinner will run u 25-30 dollars. For 3 rolls including tip my bill just for me was around 50 dollars. If this place had AYCE, definitely would've been a 5 star rating from me.

OR8mEMYkmeTdhxwET4bx8w.text: Nondescript strip mall, go inside and love the Japanese themed decor. Waitresses wear the garb too. I don't know how they work in those dang shoes tho!  The burn your stomach roll was awesome, definately my fave. The salmon sashimi was really good as well.  The menu item names were entertaining.

A9uAxqSeZFypPBgAp4dwRQ.text: My son and I went and liked it. We normally go to Sushimon but since we were in the east side of town, thought to try it. It wasn't all you can eat, but the amount of food we ate came out to what it would have cost at all you can eat. We ordered 3 full rolls each $10-14, and we also ordered a lunch special for $9 with tempura and chicken teriyaki, that include soup, and gyoza. We had a custom salmon roll that my son likes  and Gary's special roll and something else that my son ordered. Gary's roll was really great. I liked the sauce - sesame vinegar that was slightly spicy. The fish was really fresh. You can tell the difference. It wasn't fishy at all and was velvety. The lunch cost $51 without tip. It's a little more expensive than Sushimon but it was good. I'd go back.

vEQyO1Ta98RQoNzEAq0mOA.text: My sister and I had a great lunch today. Miso soup, two big Japanese beers and two specialty rolls. Great service too.

f0VJN92So_MriNVgYjLFdg.text: Service is awful!  their sushi is wonderful but they're overwhelmed with work and not enough staff

m9aDi3Ihfo5e3l6d7Aahew.text: The food is amazing, costumer service is excellent. Every worker is very kind, and the atmosphere was so fun and cool.

8FqF4EevXhY-ihGuhbUtcQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH. Don't even read the reviews just go!!!!! Everything is so fresh and perfectly put together, just well balanced. My boyfriend and I come here once a week and it's our favorite sushi spot ever. Our favorites are: -flower roll -sun devil -one night stand -double D -alligator roll

zoFxDIdiIq52mii4-rPQIA.text: I Love Sushi! I really do and I love this place.  Got here late on a Sunday night around 10PM and was seated promptly with my family.  Ordered a few rolls:  - Salmon Lovers Roll. Probably the best roll we had. The salmon just melts in your mouth and it's wrapped around a thick piece of avocado.  The sauce was light enough to enjoy and not too overpowering. We liked it so much we got another one.  There's no rice in this one.  - Screaming Orgasm. Seared Ahi. What more can you ask. Fish was fresh. Sauce was good in this one as well. Available in small or large orders.  - Washington Roll.  I wasn't too much of a fan of this roll.  There was something about the consistency that didn't go right. It felt like too much was going on.  - Mountain Roll.  I for one really loved this roll. It's a california roll topped with salmon and baked.  Loved the sauce on this one.  - Honey Roll.  Deep Fried. This was tasty. Not the best roll we had but not the worse roll.  - Tempura Udon.  Someone in my party had this. I had a few bites and thought it was okay.  I love how they give free edamame.  Overall, I would come back here again if I was in town.

ToGZvEjOrbn7_ywXk-Ag0A.text: This place is amazing! I usually avoid coming here with friends because they do not offer AYCE. However, their grade of fish is a little better than most sushi places, their portions are a little bigger, and in my opinion you get fuller faster! I find myself having to eat so many rolls to get full at other places! Here, I get stuffed from one Japanese Lasagna roll and maybe an order of calamari (so 'all you can eat' is not necessary).   When I'm craving Japanese Lasagna I HAVE to get it from here! They have the best. Today, I decided to order a Cherry Blossom (no rice) and a Japanese Lasagna! The Cherry Blossom was incredible and HUGE!! I was full after eating half of it.  I don't think you can go wrong with anything from the menu :)

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Cherry Blossom- delicious and huge

Lco6cRlQxOwU0Ib0rVILbg.text: For some reason this place gets good reviews but every time I have gone to this location my Tuna was always "mushy", not firm, sweet nor fresh tasting in the least. Coming from the Bay Area where you can find "fresh", I can tell right away that the Tuna here isn't the freshest from the mushy consistency.   I will never go back and have found other Sushi Restaurants on Eastern that blows this place out of the water.

MDY-0wFcvMETaezM-C3APQ.text: I have taken my family several times. It was good the first two times. We usually go to Hiroba Sushi but its good to change things up once in a while. Anyhow, the last time we went with our son and daughter while they were home from college. We went during the peak time. They set us in a corner and literally forgot about us.  We were busy talking so it wasn't a big deal...at first. I flagged down a waitress and asked for menus and water after 15 minutes or so. She was so busy she ran off after completing my requests. 15 minutes later we decided to leave and go down to the street to Hiroba. We walked out and were never asked why we were leaving or thanked for coming in. It was a surprise and we haven't gone back since. We had a great time that night, but not at I love Sushi.

LIWSI3zBH7y8kxn8_qfXJw.text: Amazing service, good food! Some of the best Customer service I've had in a while! Friendly welcoming and had good recommendations!! Dragon roll was awesome!!

ZdqQ1hOF4vduc9txE-YQAQ.text: I got a dancing eel roll and a Mexican roll. The first one was pretty good, but the second one wasn't what I thought it would be - it was basically a California roll with spicy crab meat instead of normal crab meat. I thought it would be real crab meat, but I guess I was wrong. The dancing eel roll had very crispy tempura inside, and the top had some poke-like tuna mix, avocado, and eel. Not bad! I waited for about 10-15 minutes for my food; this place gets busy! Rolls are pretty small for the very high prices; not sure whether it's worth it. After two rolls and down about $25, I could definitely still eat more!

Npi2mGxnzmipc7hxO8KMNQ.text: Best Sushi in Vegas! Love this place. Every roll is excellent. The fish is fresh, the taste is amazing. Every time I fly in I eat here and don't plan on changing that routine. I'd love to pin point a roll but they are all so good that it's impossible. 10 out of 10 every time. Great service too.

gQ2bA19rz4kZFjUuu6hYug.text: The best sushi in town.  A vast number of different rolls and other choices.  We are regulars and can alway count on their reliable service and food quality.  Plus they have a great beer and sake selection to get a little loose at dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Johnny roll no rice!

_t7nnbphgS83L_mRLVXT-w.text: This place has way too much hype. Most of the rolls that I ordered were over kill with yum yum sauce or cream cheese. When I left I had an overwhelming mayo taste in my mouth that would not go away. Want better suggestions for Sushi, Sakana on Maryland and Flamingo, Sushi Wa Eastern and Coronado, Sushi Twister Boulder and Tropicana.

wREOrPUvKK1pAhYn3Y-xRg.text: So I guess I recently went on a sushi splurge. What can I say? I love sushi! Hah  This place was hustling and bustling the Friday night that I came. We had a group of 8 people and they accommodated all of us very nicely in one booth. It was my first time here so I didn't know what to expect. It's a sushi/Japanese restaurant run by Koreans with waitresses in kimonos. Interesting..   Let's start off by the saying that the specialty sushi roll menu is.. well.. extensive. Like really extensive. There are so many options.. maybe too many options for my indecisiveness haha.. The sushi was not bad though. I ordered the Ryan roll which was basically a crunchy shrimp tempura roll with maguro and special sauce. It was quite tasty.  Our service was great! Considering how busy the place was, our server was really attentive and fun.   So why just the 4 stars? I was a little thrown back by the price of the rolls. My roll was $15 already. I was a little disappointed to find out they didn't have a AYCE option but it is what it is. (I think people from Hawaii are just too spoiled with cheap food) They also have bento boxes/dinner specials that also looked yummy. I would give those a try if I come back next time!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie tempura with assorted specialty rolls in the background
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ryan Roll

DILhN2Cu124wjS6t-H6vWw.text: Amazing sushi. Variety of rolls and quality are  I recommend to any sushi lover in the Henderson area.

5JdnOnL8XDa1DACfDWTqww.text: I love sushi is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in all of the Henderson and Las Vegas area. Food is always fresh service is always wonderful. My favorite thing to eat there is the Screaming O. The sauce on it is mouthwatering yummy goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Screaming O

pM5RjPpjfkfrdtFpgQTOLg.text: The service as well as the food at I Love Sushi was great. Our server had made the overall experience even that much better due to her attention to detail. Will be back.

wsM8bL7jcGvyHV2kx5K_cg.text: I must have gone at the wrong time ;(  The first sign should have been the actual sign on front that said "help wanted".  Service was worse than any other sushi restaurant that I've ever tried. There were a total of four customers and two tables, us included and service was just horrible. As there were more employees than guest, kinda strange. Had to ask for help twice and took another ten minutes to get our order.  The garlic edamame was good but that was it.  I had the Baked Lobster and it was 95% mushroom and the little lobster they did give you wasn't even any good. Would not recommend.  Would definitely not recommend this place, clearly overhyped or I just caught them on a bad day.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Baked Lobster, would NOT recommend.

7E2PccjAVxWD5DxeBy-yVQ.text: It's my favorite spot for sushi . Eery dish I have tried there is fresh and so good! The staff is friendly and great service!

4s6Xv2gUw6xqajPnKTui8Q.text: Fantastic food and fantastic customer service!  Usually with sushi restaurants you don't usually have both of this be A+. Thank you! For your great management! A returning customer each time...

Vew1O_wPDkYqR-5PL7rIkg.text: We have enjoyed patronizing "I Love Sushi" since it first opened.  But never again!    Yesterday we discovered a serious breach of integrity on the part of at least one person employed at that establishment and whom the management chose to support despite direct proof their employee lied.    My spouse was supposed to give our daughter $60 (1 $50 and 2 $5 bills) to help her buy wedding shoes for her betrothed (who could not afford to buy them himself). Regrettably, my spouse forgot to hand our daughter the money before we left the table and, instead, mistakenly left the money neatly folded on the table. Within two minutes of leaving the restaurant, however, we discovered the oversight and immediately telephoned the restaurant while circling back to recover it.    After being placed on hold three times and being told that our waitress said we paid our bill with a credit card and a cash tip of $20, the person managing the call put the waitress on the phone.  The waitress began to recite in terribly poor English what we ordered, rather than listening to our concern.  A striking contrast to her in-person use of English while taking our order, I might add.    We returned to the restaurant within minutes of leaving and went inside to where we were sitting. The money was nowhere to be found (either on or under the table).  Despite explaining what that money was intended for, all denied seeing or taking it.  Sure, we made the mistake of forgetting the money neatly folded on the table. However, we responded almost immediately by contacting the restaurant.  And, it was very clear this could not reasonably be consTrued as a tip based upon the price of our meal.  Management nevertheless refused to even consider that the waitress LIED despite the fact our receipt showed our meal and tip were BOTH paid by bankcard and not with any cash whatsoever (as the waitress claimed).  So there it is:  A lying employee backed by management despite direct, contradictory proof exposing her lie.    Sayonara "I Love Sushi" to the couple of thousand dollars we have been spending at your restaurant each year, the recommendations and referrals we have been regularly making for your restaurant, and our good will.  This is the real price of dishonesty, not $60.

_afws8kz2AxIB5TqAmXWNA.text: But seriously. Five stars is what I have to give this place because well, it was friggin' tasty and the service was LEGIT as well!  We were seated at a table within 10 minutes of arriving without a reservation... And then we dove into the VERY CONFUSING MENU... While I totally would have taken a star off for the menu basically resembling hieroglyphics, the rolls we finally decided on were so good, I couldn't! What I would recommend is taking photos of ALL THE ROLLS so people can get a visual of what they're about to order- HIRE ME, and I'll do it! Ha!  Any who... Here's what I ordered (there was more ordered but I was so into making out with my own order, I didn't really pay attention!)  - Salmon Skin Handrolls (no rice, no sauce, no vegetables): This is a staple order for me, everywhere I go... If a sushi restaurant doesn't have Salmon skin, I don't go! I was VERY IMPRESSED with the portion they gave me-- typically restaurants aren't used to my type of order thus they're stingy with their salmon skin, but not this place! Oh and the skin was crunchy and pretty perfect!  - Hamachi Kama: this was a last minute decision and I'm really glad I did it because it was MOIST AND BOMB! I love the cabbage accompaniment (that doesn't have dressing) because I took bites of the meat and the cabbage together and YUM!!!   - Rock N Roll, Roll (no rice, no crab- wrapped in cucumber): this is legit what I wanted but I had to create the menu item-- as this one comes with sauce on top, rice, crab and it's wrapped in nori... But without blinking an eye, they made this roll possible and IM THRILLED cause yes please! The fish to cucumber ratio was PERFECT! And the fish was FRESH AS F!  - Seared Pepper Tuna with Avocado: I didn't order this but three plates were ordered for the table... And I'm glad I got to snag a piece, because it was SUPER TASTY! It would definitely be something I share with others though because I love Salmon 20x more than tuna!  Next time I come to Vegas, YEP- coming back here! It's not close to the strip and I'm 100% a-ok with that! When good food is on my radar, I don't care how far away it is from me!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Peppered Seared Tuna with Avocado
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Peppered Seared Tuna with Avocado

ZWSklfaIOS1nYAC64W5Mkw.text: So I came in here on a Friday night and I asked if the sushi bar was first come first serve and the hostess Tiffanny told me yes. A couple got up and I approached the two chairs that were open at the sushi bar. Another host came up to me and totally embarrassed myself in front of the whole restaurant saying their is a list you can't sit here. So I had to go back and wait and look ridiculous. I told the host Tiffany and she looked at me in shock like I didn't know what I was talking about. I also ordered the spicy edamame and it was cold. Not happy.

b2rgrHbIhHy0Zaz_tVF1Qg.text: Eh! Very good selection of sushi rolls. Sushi was good, but nothing special ; Mel's roll, Grand Canyon roll , Alaska roll. The weird thing is that the sushi rice was al dente. Never had al dente sushi rice and don't really like it. I love sushi, but so far,  not this sushi place. Maybe next time?

obc_ToFbVY3a7-tHWGC3HA.text: I love this place!  Great and fresh sushi  just darn good.   I ordered dynamite and a selection of other sushi rolls ... all were delicious   Even the restroom was cute ... so were the waitress staff ... up to par with Los Angeles for sure and cheaper !

FC6bNNWEXoosuoQrmffNYw.text: Definitely one of my favorite sushi spots in Las Vegas...the only downside (which really isn't, is the menu is HUGE, which makes it impossible to try everything even after 20 visits). Sitting at the sushi bar you truly feel as if you could be somewhere in Japan, and the waitresses in kimonos lends to the feel. We had the Dynamite, the seared peppered ahi with avocado and Double Ds, all of which were delicious.  We will absolutely be back...

kUMwYFO2ATw3HQdYFgImmQ.text: I have been to this sushi place multiple times throughout the years. Our server was great, very friendly and had a great sense of humor, she also helped us pick some of  the favorites on the menu. The sushi was tasty and we got it promptly. It was the afternoon so it was not overly crowded. They have a wide selection and also have a fair share of non-Rice rolls. Price is reasonable and some of the sushi names are very creative.

5lQmC8egDJyh4YZ5vqnlbQ.text: I Love Sushi is the greatest. If your looking for a place that offers good service and even better food, you've found the right spot!!! Been coming here for years and have NEVER had a bad experience. My recommendations:The Alligator Roll, The Philadelphia Roll,The Whose Your Babysitter, and The Whose Your Daddy!!! All AMAZING!!!( and tempura).

gqeBWzjgoxib1N6i8zexwg.text: The ambiance is great. Very private, great decor. The food is 3.5-4 star, the only problem..... if you are actually a person who likes nigiri or sashimi you will pay out the nose for it. If you like the traditional rolls they are standard sushi fare but marked up $2+ per roll. I liked the atmosphere but due to the exorbitant prices won't be back.

W5G03anABGGS8lrK5aeF9Q.text: My daughter who lives in Portland, Oregon came to visit and wanted some good sushi.  She knows good food. This restaurant did not disappoint. They answered all of her questions about the ingredients that they use and were utterly polite. Prices were fair for the quality that you get. Here in Las Vegas there are a lot of really good restaurants. The casinos all seem to have sushi in their buffet which is usually poor quality. If you are in Henderson by all means go to this restaurant.

XNmyR19knpZXIkCmEw3TrA.text: My favorite sushi spot in the Henderson area! Friendly, fast and most importantly delicious. I always get the salmon roll and the the blossom. I'd recommend this place to any sushi lover. The bar it self could improve in its set up. You're seated very low compared to the chefs. But that's about it. Good for families, date nights or just grabbing dinner with a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

H8srw88e-0qFbpVlSSScYQ.text: When you come here definitely try the Jackpot roll (crispy shrimp and salmon) as well as the Grand Canyon roll (this one has scallops and mushrooms). The Mochi ice cream dessert is a must! They offer you 4 different options of flavors. I selected Mango, Chocolate, Green tea and Red bean. I wasn't too impressed with the Green tea one so maybe get extra Chocolate or Mango, the Mango was awesome!! I love the vibe here and the customer service is great!!! Will definitely be back.

38CGp1JCSqL28O2J4q5_7g.text: The only thing this place is missing is all you can eat. The fish was fresh, and the rolls were good size. It's just tough to get "full" when sushi isn't all you can eat.

VlEPOC3V9Xm_qvyxVjFTnA.text: This picture says a thousands words! Great food! Awesome staff. They make eating out with children an amazing experience. Thank you!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

8gVzY2tNDMEqX3ZYEJqCXg.text: Fantastic as ALWAYS!! I've been coming to I Love Sushi since it's opening 16 years ago and it's still my favorite sushi restaurant in town.  A shout out to Milton and thank you for the hospitality and amazing customer service!

pg_2XeiwSDS_NDaie9zYVw.text: Shit hole  attitude from the start. Menu had so many stains that  was disgusting  don't take your kids, if u do don't read the dishes out loud  it's like a porno house  if there was negative stars I would give this joint a -3 star

gFwCAvp1H_VwD0RNMNIq_A.text: Fresh quality sushi. They do not offer all you can eat, which I normally gravitate towards but I'm glad I decided to stop in and try a few rolls!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy!!!

AqEY5Ix_FtU8E1nvXHg-8A.text: We always go here our favorite for sushi, rolls and sashimi. Pricey but the fish is fresh never had a bad meal or service here!

_42vi_zymT3nJvI9DtumbA.text: Favorite sushi spot in Vegas! The owner is awesome, the staff in so kind and efficient. I make it a point to swing by, even if it's just for a quick roll, when I'm on this side of town.  I've devoured almost everything on the menu and have yet to come across something that's not delicious!

IvzlLlAaG0jQsW40mA0iHg.text: I love this place. Every time they deliver the goods. 100% of the time we are in Vegas we come here. No ifs, ands, or buts

V4PeP50KSc_MvNQazCtg4Q.text: My favorite local sushi spot! Food is delicious and roll are unique. The service is really good and the sushi chefs treat you like a rockstar!

mwHu75Al2aD6Xs5pLpUDpg.text: This might be a biased review because I have only been here once during the hot lunch hour.  My friend and I were seated for about 15 minutes with our menus down and ready to order w/ out a peep from any of the waitresses.  I was already displeased with this considering, I had to go back to work within a certain timeframe.  I hate when lunch hours take longer than they should!  And the restaurant was not even full!  Boo!  Second, our orders took awhile to come out and we ONLY ordered 2 rolls, a salad, and an appetizer. Really?  That should not have taken very long to come out!  I was fairly disappointed.    Good thing the waitress was always apologetic.  We ordered the Garlic Chili Pepper Edamame, best edamame appetizer I've ever had.  Loved it!  We also ordered the rainbow roll; it was fresh and good tasting.  The crispy spicy tuna rice cake was amazing.  Has a nice jalapeno kick to it and definitely something I would come back for.  Their sashimi salad was ok; fish wasn't as fresh as I would have liked it, and I'm not too fond of their salty special sauce.  I might be back to try more rolls before I give up on this place.  There are just so many good sushi joints in the Southwest area to come back here.  We'll see!  Stay tuned!  Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (45/365).

N5d_ehUZfVy8nbxgsFkKnA.text: Had dinner here based off the reviews, gave it three stars for uniqueness and atmosphere. Overall sushi was ok, bit heavy and over sauced. Some ingredients didn't seem fresh or were overcooked. Lots of rolls to choose from, I'd probably got to SushiMon their rolls are a bit more well made, and service is better. We had to wait for drink refills a lot and they brought out all the rolls at once so the hot entrees chilled before we could eat them.

j3XPacMBGTWWSbt4_CX5JQ.text: This might be some of the best sushi I've had so far in the Valley.  I had the crunch and monkey roll.  Amazingly good as was the other items I sampled at our table.   The menu is extensive as our the portions.  No AYCE option but I didn't think the price was bad for what you get.  My only complaint is that they don't have a spot closer to me!

SuRSPccuzcoKXRLH1tRQlQ.text: I've dine here many times and have had some great meals.. Until tonight. Food poisoning is not fun!

zsHFCE75h9nHEgdkNfMnfg.text: Best. Sushi. Ever. This place is a MUST if you are in Vegas/Henderson. Always amazing food and friendly staff. My faves are the sunomono and sashimi salads. We take all of our friends and family from out of town here. Very busy on the weekends, so reservations are helpful. Worth the drive!

zuxORIhEOpi2-sJoOSZClQ.text: The food was great. When I go to a new sushi place I always order a spicy tuna roll to get a feeling for the quality of tuna that's being used and Friday nights are usually the best time to do that as many places get their last shipment of fish for the weekend on Friday ( local places in Nevada ) it's was fresh, delicious and well seasoned. The service was over the top even though the place was packed to the gills. We had I LOVE MY ASS ROLL as well which was awesome ! Will be back ASAP. Locals make the drive and try this place.

tx8TDWBvXPS9yvkcBIdiIw.text: This Place is on point.  Best Sushi and service in Las Vegas/Henderson.  You will not be disappointed!

3nK1VNjo9-5xnpqJMqQlCA.text: We have eaten at I Love Sushi several times over the last four years. They are amazing! The screaming orgasm is the best. Over the weekend it is better to make a reservation if you don't want to wait for a table. They are not cheap but the food is well worth the money! James, the owner, is fun and works hard to make this place the best to have sushi in town. Highly recommended.

XcYL2rXABe8a_A99zckqXQ.text: Always busy and always good, I Love Sushi is close to my house and an excellent late evening choice (they're open till 11PM, later than many places off the strip).  Not my favorite place for sashimi, but they have a great roll selection.  Many people love the Sushi Nachos, but they were gross to me.  Everything else I have tried on the menu is excellent.  An interesting baked roll is the volcano.

rqvbPX7dpOIQmLSjIqmdqw.text: Great food and great service! Our family loves this place. We have some non sushi eaters so it's great that this place offers so much more then just sushi and it's all been very good. My kids love the bento box dinners!

7eq52vw4EjBYzGEXsrlUFg.text: This is the best place ever for sushi! Service is excellent and timely. The food is delicious. The ambiance is absolutely the beat ever! Walking in there us like a trip to Japan.  I love all the Geisha Girls and their attire. By far my favorite restaurant ever!

GJTEoeUjFmD05qShyOELHQ.text: amazing reasonable sushi rolls!!! Love Gary's roll. generous with the ingredients & SO FRESH!  Super Fast service & attentive. All severs work here looked happy & with very up beat attitude. The owner is always present at the restaurant. Only people that seemed way serious were the sushi chiefs.

kMKMGCeZuiaoeusG7KmbsQ.text: AMAZING!!!!!! Ruined all other Sushi places for me. Bitter-sweet cause it is still sooooo good!

oS2OvdmsBGkMIYKh86k2Kg.text: Went here for a birthday dinner since the yelp reviews were 4-star.  Figured we would try a new place but should have stayed with Sushi Factory across the street. Only 1 vegetable roll to choose from, & only 1 piece of it had avocado & no cucumber. I also ordered veggie tepan yaki - except the onion & there was lots of them, the rest was all green, not too visually appealing- put some variety in there.  The rice was served with the soup so definitely cold by the time my dinner was served & her combo dinner still took another 5-10 minutes. So really need better planning.  Won't be back.

EX7rfgHXaGQFjd2r7Malug.text: Always packed, always fresh, and always good.  The best sushi place on Eastern in the Silverado Ranch/Anthem/Green Valley area.  Service is slow at the tables.  Eating at the bar is so much faster.  The garlic butter roll is crazy good!

spR4wjqPQpVPlHtudHwokA.text: I went here yesterday. I was seated quickly wait staff was excellent. But the sushi was over priced and not very good. I had the monkey roll and the salmon lover no rice they were 12.00 each not impressed I won't be going back

C4M12w_WJdv-nLEcTJzjPg.text: Great place!!!! Ate here on valentine's night and still was able to get great service.... and food was excellent. Anyone that is complaining doesn't know what there talking about. ...

75raznfSIwcNO6xcQK_mYw.text: This is the best sushi I've had in a long time. Definitely my go to sushi spot. The Ryan's roll and screaming orgasm was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ryan&#39;s roll

CeaRJ0zB0i_GjD07BDmdtg.text: What can I say? I pink puffy heart love I Love Sushi. We moved across town and it has been our favorite find. It's a real gem. The staff is great (bar and table service), the fish is fresh and the rolls are fun and mighty tasty. In the past few months we've been half a dozen times.   When it comes to rolls we prefer those that are spicy. Sexy Time Special, Kiss of Fire and Sun Devil are favorites. They are a must each and every time. We also enjoy the sashimi. The yellowtail is like butter. The screaming orgasm is a great alternative. We've enjoyed others, but their names escape me. Each and everyone is delicious, though. I have no doubt everything is well executed. So thankful, it's not AYCE. I much prefer quality to quantity.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

mYOSgAmx4Sfqw13xr9s4zA.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas. Very very very fresh sashimi!! Friendly staff!!! 5 stars!!

2EvrRz_Zp72XlklDlbXS-A.text: Best sushi in the state! We have ordered so many different dishes and they are all outstanding. I would eat here every day if possible. 10 stars.

1iSCJA5zqXuQOQL4Yj2Inw.text: Straight up great sushi place! One of my favorites for sure.  It is not all you can eat so the quality is a bit better and more carefully made. My usual bill for 2 people comes to about $58 seemingly every time.  Super White Tuna Nigiri is great, Miso soups, Jackpot roll is my favorite.  I've also had one of the boats as seen by my photo. The Lisa Handroll also pictured is my favorite.    I found out about this place because an asian friend who is a waitress at another sushi restaurant told me to check it out.  Then on second thought she said "dont go there, then you will not come back here anymore" as it was her favorite spot also. She was right. Luckily I live close by so I can go to this place whenever i want if in the mood for high quality sushi at a very reasonable price.   The place is always busy which is a good sign! I usually go mid day so I never have to wait to long to be seated but I imagine it is slammed around dinner time.

PV4jKEH8gJbc9p_wBQWvKQ.text: My sister referred us to I love Sushi and after finding out that they are open to 11pm, I was sold. The ambience is great and definitely welcoming. Everytime, I am in Henderson/Las vegas, I am going to come here.

z11JwbJNTeZbKMqEfwC_eA.text: Well where to start.  I've been enjoying I Love Sushi for quite a while.  Their "no rice" Sushi is a great idea and addition to the menu.  I decided to take my daughter there as she was home for the weekend from summer school.  We went on Friday July 28 at approx 1-1:30pm. I ordered my favorite Spring Mtn Roll.  I was disappointed when it arrived as the roll itself was smaller than all previous trips and it was not on the usual round brown plate (it's normal presentation).  Disappointing to say the least.  I guess I will have to only go at night when sushi chef "Joe" is there.  He always makes great sushi and will surprise you if you ask him to make you something special.

uId0F146uYeIQgnHgldn0A.text: It was amazing! The flavor is great. I highly recommend the James Bond roll, the Alaska roll, and the California rolls. Please be careful as some are spicy and raw, so if you have health conditions you should be careful. The food is great and service too. It definitely beats Osaka and Hiroba( other sushi places).

NYjm4PnmV_NBNpPln8VGKA.text: I really love I Love Sushi. Love to sit at the bar and just gaze at all that beautiful fish. My favorite is the Washington roll, but I've also tried others. Everything is good. I even broke my "raw only" sushi rule and tried their 4x4 on the recommendation of a friend. Wow, was it good!  Love the atmosphere, love watching the well trained chefs perform their magic. We're never disappointed.   Sushi isn't cheap, but I feel this place gives me my money's worth.

ROmYhrjvwX0i1Q40x7PRjg.text: This is my sister's favorite sushi place and I've been here a handful of times while visiting her. I wouldn't say they have the highest quality fish but their rolls are very tasty. And they have a large variety of them. All your favorites are on the menu plus quite a few that I think they made up. If you like trying maki with crazy combos then this place is for you. If you are more of a nigiri / sashimi sushi eater then I would probably go elsewhere.  PS they have a full bar and also make some pretty decent cocktails!

-tthDz2OQof0BsTFvHQ5jA.text: I have been going to this sushi place since I was in middle school.  Being young I was never into raw fish, until I ate here.  I fell in love with sushi here and this place will forever be one of my favorite sushi place to go to regularly.    I Love Sushi does not offer All you can eat because of the quality of their fish.  The Cherry Blossom and the Screaming Orgasm are my favorite rolls to get there.  The sashimi and nigiri is undoubtedly one of the freshest you can find in Vegas.  You will not be disappointed in coming here.

RF5xWYC1W-OqaO1FZVX1Jg.text: This place is amazing! Best sushi in town. On top of having the best sushi they are so kind and treat you with the up most respect while you are there. Sushi and costumer survive is on point.

r3_JSL7q36k1I9IRQOJktg.text: This place is always packed but sooo worth it.  Fish is always fresh and service is great.  I normally would choose ayce for sushi but this place is one of the few where it's worth paying for individual rolls.  Something new ... try "fresh wasabi" it's definitely way better than the normal wasabi everyone is familiar with.  Only disclaimer ... you'll never want to go back to the normal wasabi ... hahah.  If you love sushi ... why not try this place out.

POFlXIpvWueOIRVJtdRlng.text: I read some bad reviews about a rude waitress who could be easily spotted as heaviest one.  I am afraid that I met the same one so I got very bad experience at this restraunt.  I brought my whole family to spend the lunch time together.   As soon as we got there and waited to be seated, she showed no smile and unpatiently to serve us.  Also, she was very rude to my mom who held my 2 years old daughter.  It just seemed like we owed her a lot of money.    Although we were unhappy, we tried to understand her behavior  like she probably argued with her boss this morning or got a ticket on the way home.   No, we were wrong.  She was not unhappy because she smiled to other customers except us!  Is that because we are the only asian at that lunch time?  Cannot believe that she had discrimination on asian especially she is asian too!  I assumed that the restaurant should tell the asian customers like us "no service to you because you konw our food too much".  Yes their food sucks as we have tried asian food for decades and they are the worst one!   We really know too much:)

XX3GIvjlnc5EIBfzrZlx_Q.text: The three stars are for the food. The meals are well prepared and the rolls are terrific. One small fault is you're handed a card to choose which roles you want to order but there is really no description. You have to ask your waitress which tends to be tedious. Now for the bad. Like many of these Asian restaurants they seem in a hurry to Get you in and out as fast as possible. This one you can expect on occasion to get your main meal first then your appetizer or both togeather. The meals don't come out all at once but are on a when ready schedule. Therefore your companion could be finishing their meal when yours is on its way out. If you accept the erratic service then you'll like this place.

qlIhEaoyHiDzlI7TrkBHVA.text: The food is great, and the staff is very friendly. I recommend this place to all sushi lovers.

However,  this place is really nice inside,  the staff are wonderful,  and the food is delicious!  If you're out degree fence about coming here, you won't be disappointed!

It5hiQMVNREimp8_1hmHlw.text: Incredible sushi! Super fresh! Clean. Service was only okay. She was kinda rude and didn't seem like she could handle our order. Luckily the sushi was so good that we will go back but not because of the service.

0uQKLlAKDA0UkwbLpgyeEw.text: Definitely the best sushi place here in Vegas. I've tried so many places out here and the quality is second to none. Service is great! My new regular spot. So polite, positive and had great knowledge of the menu. He didn't let our glasses get empty and checked on us often. The best part was he heard me say I'm cold and came back with some complimentary green tea to sip on to keep me warm.

hy-OMM2PZCs3hpWYzXTlUQ.text: My favorite sushi spot! The prices aren't *too high* and the sushi is always delicious. I have come in a few times close to closing and the waitress serving us definitely needed some sleep but I don't expect a perky waitress at almost 11pm.

ibqPnwrBfyQq9agXDNIxIA.text: I have been here 3 times and have a great experience every time. The screaming orgasm and kiss of fire are my favorites without a doubt. Everything I've had is wonderful. The owner greets you at the door, and the chefs take great care of you when sitting at the sushi bar. Can't recommend highly enough!

XTbdQZmeqfBroP0iam-ztQ.text: I love this place!!! Great service great food!!! Authentic sushi... try the tuna tar it's the best! Great place for large parties !

0vjlP_cs7ZP0H3bopDrtJQ.text: First time here. Enjoyed the atmosphere and food. Good service!  One roll was a little too mushy but overall a delicious meal.

DInomOKmxwWlxnspFLsUEg.text: One of my favorites sushi restaurants in henderson. I love the vibe in here. They have a lot of authentic decorations around the bar and the booths are tucked away which is my favorite. The food is awesome of course, high quality and well crafted.

7N4cp3MQjaX1tjGvA1e1cw.text: My husband and I have been here a bunch of times, but we aren't regulars here. We went last night again after quite some time, and we both asked each other why we don't come here every time we are in the mood for sushi?!?!  It's not all you can eat, so the price point is a little higher. So if you're drunk and looking to eat tons and tons of food, I Love Sushi probably isn't your best bet. It's kind of nestled in the back of the shopping center with Walgreens and a Wendy's so it's not easily seen.  We always order the same roll, which I will post a picture of and it's probably the best roll I've ever had in my entire life. It has fried onions! And it's huge. If I went alone, i could only eat this roll.   The other rolls I've had were all very good also, but hands down the roll with the onions is a MUST!!  The sashimi cuts are huge. It's probably double to triple the size of what you would get at an all-you-can-eat restaurant.   Fast service, there's like 15 chefs behind the bar. The waitresses are all attentive, we had a few come up and check on us even though she wasn't our waitress. And I think the owner even came up and asked how everything was. Such a great restaurant. You MUST TRY!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Best roll I&#39;ve ever had!!!!

OwpYw-wKtj-6gEvrSHXTLg.text: Absolutely the best sushi in town! I've tried many places here in Vegas and in other states. There is no place that holds a candle to I LoVe Sushi. The service is great. The food comes out super fast. The freshness of the fish is second to none.

Akx8-95gMrjrsHiXbvz5WA.text: My absolute favorite non-AYCE sushi place.  Sitting at the sushi bar is always fun as the sushi chefs are very friendly and interactive.  They always start you off with a cold cucumber dish.  Yum!  As silly as this sounds, I had the best California roll I've ever had here!  I recently tried the Grand Canyon roll which was phenomenal.  A hidden gem for sure!  The ambiance is so comfortable.  You can sit at your own private table or out in the open.  The restaurant is always busy!  I'm always excited to try something new when I come here.  A must try if you are a sushi lover! :)

IGD_lva0QqUf_JINKhr4RA.text: We've been here several times . And just last the other night with a group of friends . And our two little ones. Under one years old .Service was excellent and the food is amazing !   Went again last night . This time our service was terrible . Our waitress was annoying and terrible made a comment saying she thought I gained weight from the last time she saw me !!!! Rude !!! Lady I'm 4 months pregnant!! Keep your thoughts to yourself and be professional. Last time we came out waitress made our dining experience wonderful . My 10 month old .. I order her a miso soup and ask for lots of extra tofu . As it is soft for her to eat and she loves it ! Last  night I asked the same thing and the waitress that was annoying said , I did put tofu ! When there was barely any !Uhhhh I won't be coming back because she's been our waitress everytime we go ! Mind you she not a very attractive lady herself . And shouldn't be commenting about a pregnant girls weight ! Over priced and not worth the bad service.

4s-ya9C3CvUSPL-dGWhKSQ.text: Excellent sushi but horrible service. I've been to this place over 20 times and at least half  the time the service was horrible. They need to train their people better.

vMPU0wpT0gm6yi2EnW91nA.text: I am so glad I was introduced to I love sushi! Their restaurant ambiance/decor and servers are very authentic . I recommend I love sushi for people looking for a high quality meal willing to shell out the extra bucks. This place will not satisfy you if you are looking for $20 all you can eat establishment- this is not it. Their a la carte sushi rolls have a huge variety to choose from. I only noticed on my second visit some of their sushi rolls have naughty names which made me giggle. My two favorite rolls are the candy cane roll with soft shell crab and the I love sushi special roll wth regular and spicy tuna in a garlic ponzu sauce. Even though this place can be packed I always get seated and served quickly and efficiently. So far my favorite sushi place in Vegas.

wBAMhi3_Fq44gH2ya_cOUA.text: Stopped by for lunch with my family around 2 pm on a Tuesday, and was quite impressed with the food and service here. May be on the pricier side for some but it's worth it.   Here's what we got: - Lunch Special [comes with miso soup, salad, gyoza, tomago (sweet egg), fried rice ball]. ($15.95) You pick 2 things you want off a list of things. We picked the following choices:    -beef Teriyaki + shrimp and vegetable tempura   -chicken Katsu + shrimp and vegetable tempura   - fish tempura + vegetable tempura]  Favorite part about the lunch special was the tempura, it was so light and crispy and delicious! Very used to having cold and soggy tempura- but that was not the case as it was fresh even at non peak lunch hour :). Beef teriyaki, chicken Katsu, and fish tempura were all good- can't really go wrong with any of these three!   - Spicy Tuna Roll ($6.50) - the spicy tuna just kind of melted in your mouth! Was really happy about this. Not too overly spicy either.  - Double D Roll ($14)- a special roll with tempura shrimp and imitation crab on the inside with a salmon avocado topping on the outside. Comes with a spicy dipping sauce! Really quite good, was impressed with the freshness of the salmon, a lot of flavor to this roll- I didn't even think it needed the sauce but was a nice have anyways.  - Kaki Udon - simple udon in a soy sauce based broth. Noodles were perfectly cooked.   They have a really impressive list of rolls to choose from.Would come back for sure due to the freshness of the food/fish and to try the sashimi next time!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Special sushi roll menu part 2
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Special sushi roll menu part 1
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Double d roll-tempura shrimp, crab, cucumber topped with salmon, masago, and avocado, chefs special sauce

OTKeJBUCz_xGs-v-owcSPw.text: I've been coming here on and off for about six years now. For the sushi lovers, if you're looking for a a wide variety of sauced up rolls, this is the place for you. With over a hundred rolls, they hit almost every combination possible. If I'm in the mood for a roll that might not be standard at other sushi restaurants, I'll stop here. There's also some nice bento box lunch specials if your not in sushi mode.  Definitely be prepared to spend a few extra dollars. Rolls range from just under $10 to up to $15. Two rolls does me just right. Since it's not an AYCE restaurant, I usually don't get any nigiri because it would be too costly. Burning Your Stomach and Something's Wrong 69 are two tried and True rolls for me. The menu gives good descriptions of every roll so take your time and look if you've never been there, there should be something for you.  Lunch does get busy, but dinner time turns into a mad house. Your best bet is to go mid afternoon. The servers can be short and communication can be an issue, but for the most part, they get the job done. Certain servers recognize us and take good care of us.  If you'd like a little more seclusion, the booths along the walls are sort of enclosed and may be a good place to sit if you're conducting business. You'll get an order of edamame and a cucumber salad to whet the palate when you first sit down. Even though the prices are elevated, I'll continue to frequent I Love Sushi because I think they're rolls are worth it and so do the customers that pack the house pretty much every night.

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Something Wrong 69
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Special sauce for Something Wrong 69

GW6UZKf2QMfhS9HX-jP1IA.text: When I'm at work and my wife messages me "I want a screaming orgasm" then I know it's time for some I Love Sushi.  I was in the mood for some sushi too and the Screaming Orgasm along with some Uni, Yellowtail, Unagi, Salmon and beer sounded like a perfect way to end the day of chaos and stress following what happened in Las Vegas on Sunday.  We came here and we were immediately seated and offered drinks.  We then followed it up with some great food and a great time.  It was the perfect way to not think about anything but food and beer for a hour or so.  This is definitely one of the best sushi spots in Vegas and I very much recommend it to anyone who hasn't tried it yet.

I AM taking away 1 star (it should be more) for the dirty names and insinuations.  I would never be able to bring my kids here and although it was so good I'm hoping to find a sushi place where I don't need to order "Sex On The Sushi" or "Fat Ass Special". Thank you

DmmHH5aIyGsXd6IhFwGtBQ.text: My husband and I are kind of obsessed with the AYCE deal at one particular sushi place in town so we kind of had to force ourselves to try something new. We decided on I Love Sushi thanks to the great reviews!  We went for lunch so it was pretty quiet and our food came out pretty quickly. They have a HUGE menu with lots of unique specialty rolls. We had one that was drenched in a garlic butter sauce which was absolutely horrible for us but tasted delicious.  We tried some plain nigiri and I was pleased by the quality and freshness of the fish- it was pretty fantastic. But the price was a bit high for everything we got and since I am a mega sushi pig, I want to eat a lot of sushi! Still, the interesting menu selection would be enough to bring me back for lunch or something in the future.

49MVad-MmlEeskWQb4PMHg.text: I really wanted to love this place. My boyfriend and I came here about a week ago because a family member had recommended it. I wouldn't say it was the best sushi I've ever had. We ordered a few rolls, a salad and octopus sashimi. I can't remember the crazy names of any of the rolls. (Not a fan of the names btw.) I ordered a steamed shrimp roll with avocado and eel sauce on top. He ordered a shrimp tempura, tuna roll of some sort with garlic sauce and another tuna and shrimp roll. The garlic sauce on his was very overpowering but the other two were tasty. We have other favorite sushi restaurants when visiting the Las Vegas area so we'll stick with them.
