0D-DOch5i9yH0Mphf0iB8Q.text: Alright! Off season is officially over. I'm all settled in Vegas. It's time to get back to some good ole fashioned reviewing. I've got a lot of places to review but what better place to start than "I Love Sushi" because anyone that knows me, knows that I really LOVE sushi more than anyone!  Cozily located in a strip mall in Henderson, I Love Sushi is one of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas, on or off the strip. The place is always bumping and the staff is always friendly. Although some of the roll names are less than desirable (example: Tastes Like Your Ex Girlfriend...) TMI and very SCARY DUDE! Not partaking in that one right off the bat, no offense! I'd use more examples but I am unable to find a copy of their heavily sexual connotated menu online. Poking fun at their menu's items is like fishing from a barrel.  I recommend starting off with the oyster shooters. I order mine minus the quail egg. For those that are into the whole Rocky raw egg thing, have at it! You might want to even ask for my discarded ones as I've certainly discarded enough of them, although I can't guarantee they'll hook that up. Their oyster shooters set the mood quite nicely for date night. Gotta love those aphrodisiacs! Yum yum!  I typically am a creature of habit when it comes to ordering sushi so I don't mean to bore anyone after this point. I love the Philly Roll + asparagus. Even better is their "spicy ponzu sauce" option which is not offered elsewhere at most other sushi bars.  All in all, this place is one of the good ones. It's about as unpretentious as it gets and the quality is as good if not better as that that can be found at many of the high end strip sushi bars, without the lofty price tags. My name is Bobbi Billard and I approve of this message. I'm on a mission to become the Duchess of this restaurant... Stay tuned.

-armGbs5O6mvd13NsPtiUQ.text: With sushi roll names like "Taste like My Ex", "Threesome", and "I Love Ass", this place is everything that Vegas is but is in the lovely neighboring city of Henderson. Yelp pro-tip, if you want to converse with your sushi chef and want real good food recommendations, I highly advise that you always take a seat at the sushi bar as opposed to a table if you can. We started off an assortment of nigiri as I tend to shy away from rolls as much as possible. Sake, Amaebi, Toro, Unagi, Uni, Ebi, Salmon Belly, etc. were all equally amazing. The Toro was like butter and according to my girlfriend, who rates sushi places based on how good their Uni was, was the best Uni that she has had since moving to Nevada. Because of the aforementioned names of rolls and the fact that they had like 60+ rolls/items on the menu, I had to try one. I ended up getting the "Kitchen Sink" and man was that a good choice. Literally a kitchen sink in terms of fishes in the roll and it tasted so bomb. Finally my girlfriend and I shared the baked lobster roll (no rice), which was literally all lobster and mushrooms and was also pleasantly surprisingly good as I have never had a lobster roll without rice before. All and all, it was a great experience and I will definitely come here again. Because, we were seated at the bar, I can't say too much about the service because our chef literally just hands us the food after we order. Yelp don't lie...this place is fire.

NT7Cf6GNPnjKIBsnyvgd7A.text: Service was FAST and polite! . We were in the mood for some late night sushi. Got here at 10:15, aye two rolls by 10:28. That's fast. So yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Japanese lasagna is cheap and really good.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Inside the cherry blossom
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Cherry blossom

zVToOFslONZLh7hr7am6Mg.text: Best sushi and price in town. Highly worth the trip if you're staying on the strip. Make reservations. Busy times are at 6 and 8 pm. Enjoy!

dWrLXyBjw1jo2_C0jOHSnQ.text: Korean owned sushi bar.  They always treat me well and recognized me on my second visit.  I had something that tasted a little fishy (it wasn't a popular item) and let the manager know.  He apologized and removed the charge from the bill.  Great service!

nlNjs6DFh_GP-AsDlE3aLA.text: I've eaten here many times over the past year and it is consistently delicious.  There's usually a 10-30 minute wait for dinner but no one seems to mind because the food is so good.  I recommend this place to anyone that asks for a good sushi place; even if they don't live in Henderson.

kyjWhN2zDCpU6E9IO927Aw.text: Stopped in for a quick couple rolls the other night with the wife. I'm slightly picky when it comes to sushi, only liking a few types of fish, but 2 out of the 3 things we ordered were pretty amazing. I don't use that word lightly either.  The Screaming Orgasm was awesome, the flavors and textures going on worked very well together, and the fish was super fresh and smooth.  The MC roll was also really good I would highly recommend it.   Also, another plus, two small (12oz) Sapporo's were only $7

kWuu4K8U-8JH8SP9d2IFQA.text: Going through town,  and stopped in.  Good food,  and there lettuce hand wrap is delicious

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

LZ0Bg8BVFeUkQ1am03m9jA.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas, hands down! The salmon nigiri is our favorite - the fish is so fresh and will literally melt in your mouth like butter. Bam Bam special is also delicious, along with the dancing eel roll. The owner is also very helpful and nice, he always recognizes us and says hello. I highly recommend!!

80GpPuqPnAH-FczqYACIhQ.text: Residents in the Anthem\Seven Hills area are SO lucky! This place is easily the best sushi in the desert especially for the price. Quality, Freshness, and Service are always top notch. It's so hard to go to an AYCE joint shortly after I Love Sushi, you notice a BIG difference right away.   I had frequented this place to the point of exhaustion back when I lived in Henderson. Now, living over 20 miles away, I crave it almost every month and MUST make the trip over. The variety of rolls makes it easy to find something that combines every kind of sushi you enjoy (i.e. Mistake Roll). The service is always the right mix of attentiveness and consideration. Most of all the prices are a value for the quality (but not on the lowest end of the spectrum).  My verdict is if you are looking for a great place to have sushi ESPECIALLY if you're lucky enough to be in the area, you must RUN not walk to I Love Sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Rock n Roll !!!!!
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Mistake roll!!! Yum

Qv_rEzYhVdnMGsUjDSf8BQ.text: I  love sushi,  xcelente  sushi, my favorite Japanese lasagna. Double D' Great Place!!! Great service.

PUVw_Yr89qcyx4eQF8ZImw.text: Great food! I really liked this place..... What I did not like was how difficult it was to order! There are about 1000 different rolls on their menu, many of which only vary by 1 ingredient so you really have to sit there and read what each one is (since the names help you figure out nothing in regards to what's actually inside). The names of the rolls are really tiresome and stupid... No I don't want an orgasm/penis/vulva roll. Can't sushi joints just name their rolls what they are?? It took about 15 minutes to just read everything and actually figure out what direction to go in terms of ordering. Sadly, the waitress we had spoke very little English so she was of very little help in figuring it out.   All that being said I ended up ordering a dinner special with a few different rolls on the side (no sexy orgasms or weird sauce stuff, just basic sushi rolls and nigiri - eel, salmon, tuna). The fish was very fresh, the tempura was perfect and the chicken katsu was really good!   Definitely my new favorite place for sushi in the Henderson area.

e29NfXzGsPwoWJoRxWFLyQ.text: We have been eating here for 5 years and though it is a little bit pricey for some things on the menu, you get what you pay for and what you pay for is the best Sushi and service in Nevada!  The staff is amazing and friendly- they know us by name and give my 5 year old hugs and high fives when we come in! I love the entire menu but if I had to eat one only one thing every day for the rest of my life it would be Salmon Lover no Rice! Best thing I have every eaten! (Close runner up is the scallop hand roll and salmon skin hand roll)  We look forward to our weekly visits and when we have actually ventured out to try other Sushi places we are always disappointed as nothing ever has come close in quality, service and atmosphere as I Love Sushi!

BuLKqO6q8QSSofUzQT6axA.text: I'm a sushi fanatic. My boyfriend and I are always trying new places. I've been here a few times and it's literally the best sushi I've ever had. The quality is great and they have a lot of rolls to chose from. The only downfall is that they don't have an all you can eat option so it gets pretty pricy. The rolls are defiantly bigger in size and the presentation looks great so it makes up for it. Try the I love sushi special and burn your stomach roll. I would suggest making a reservation too because it gets PACKED on the weekends.

40CJCynen9J8mOsCjEaWbw.text: Yummy! Loved the Salmon Lover & Screaming Orgasm :) Service was quick and it's totally worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon lover - healthy &amp; amazing :)

lb2YjSaBDhzTzjqCtBPIpg.text: NICE! The sushi portions are perfect! The staff is on point when their slammed. They have a steady flow of customers. NO mini Tapas crap here. Show me the UNI.... I approve this message JK KUHL

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

_539AiiRt4I4SH_CKZ6X4g.text: Great sushi.  I'm pretty picky about my sushi and this place is probably one of the best in Vegas.  I also find the owner to be rather amusing, although maybe his employees don't appreciate his heavy involvement so much.  :)  But he seems to genuinely want customers to have a good experience.  The food itself is amazing.  it's always busy, best to make a reservation.  But if not, we have never had to wait too long for a table.

e68bUoIHYwJThs8ziZ9pag.text: What is all the hype about this place. Agreed, it's packed with people. However, a sushi roll is just a roll. If your looking for True sashimi then this is not the place. Their bento and udon is..eh. Had much better many other places.   You really can't tell how fresh the fish is because it's covered with ponzu sauce or some kind of sauce. If you like that, go for it! If you are truly looking for traditional Japanese, not the place.  Service is good. Atmosphere is loud.

xYRnZZXEzEu5-PuF68j86g.text: My favorite sushi restaurant in the city. They don't do AYCE, but if you want great quality sushi this is the place to go. They have a huge specialty roll menu. My favorite items are the Bonsai Roll, Screaming Orgasm, I Love Sushi Roll, and Double Dragon Roll. They usually are pretty busy, but definitely worth the wait.

8GIFC0vPlCb9beoiJ4dDyQ.text: Really reasonably priced and the fish is fresh. I have not been to another sushi restaurant on the strip, in Henderson or Las Vegas that tops I Love Sushi!   Try ... Rock and Roll and have them add mango. I also opt for no mayo in sauce. Yellowtail and Jalapeno. Sean Special with soy paper, brown rice and no cream cheese.  ALWAYS a crowd pleaser! Everyone I take loves this place.  Frankie and Edwin are awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellowtail and Jalapeño

QdNPFdVzao9399tc5Hn6Zw.text: My favorite sushi in Las Vegas. Hilarious menu names, delicious food, great service!

J1s3C-3sy_ZPyPvRRULHuw.text: Best Sushi in Henderson. Great food. Good service. Clean. Worth the money. The chefs are funny too as is the menu.

1LIIPTNYslYVpw0-y9Y9sQ.text: I have been to I Love Sushi many times. I always try to go with someone who is more knowledgeable about ordering sushi than I am. This time I went with my adult daughter, who frequently eats sushi in LA, her home. When it came time to order, I prevailed on her to go with a "boat." We ordered the sushi boat for 2 with 3 of us eating. The meal started with miso soup and a small salad - both tasty. The portion of food in the boat was huge, more than enough food for 3, with a nice variety of sushi and sashimi. Everything tasted fresh. The service was attentive despite the restaurant being very crowded and all the tables full. I will be returning soon.

p0wMWZACQSqTMDepQEwlNQ.text: I come here al the time it is always fresh and delicious. It does get busy here so make sure you come early before it fills up on the weekends.

--BsRE_50iClkTVi_824Nw.text: Scale 1 - 5 Food: 4 1/2 Service: 4 Ambiance: 4  A must have is the Screaming "O" #51 and #15   The fish is fresh on the weekend and the menu has something for everyone.

XBV-4WcG3mKI1JbxGehhxw.text: The sushi was fresh, beautiful and delicious. So much food and it tasted amazing. #28 roll and poke salad are my fave. Service was fantastic.

9CGX4eFT-Aihzgea7cnGWw.text: I love Sushi!  The name of this place is exactly what I say mid-meal and post-meal every single time I eat here.   First things first, their entire sushi menu is the best in the world. No joke. The creativity in their rolls is uncanny, no other sushi place compares.   Second, their fish is fresh. Absolutely freshest i've had in Las Vegas.   Third, their uni shooter is heaven in a shot glass. The best mixture of uni, spice and citrus that tickle every inch of your palate.  Our go-to order is the "Screaming orgasm", Uni shooters, a few pieces of sashimi and a roll or two. We try to order a new roll every time we go. Definitely my favorite place to get sushi in Vegas, if not the US.

gyEW2ybDi_uxp9Py00lSLA.text: My favorite sushi spot in town.  No question. Hands down.  And that's after several years of living here and trying many other spots.  Try the Alaskan roll with cream cheese for a real treat!  My favorite roll anywhere!  So fresh and full of flavor with ingredients that taste a notch above the rest.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

h87Ev8xtHWj5cyG00tJnHg.text: I Love Sushi has been around forever!! they have great quality sushi; however, they are pricey and can get extremely crowded. their servers are always friendly and efficient. their 3 sum roll is to die for- I've never had a roll here I didn't like! the only downside is spending a small fortune for some sushi~ other than that, totally recommend.

1x4DLHBVviCaqMCwUVDN6A.text: I've always been a big fan of I Love Sushi, but I haven't been here in a while.  In the meantime, I've eaten sushi all over Vegas and discovered that I Love Sushi isn't all that it's cracked up to be.  The sushi is good.  I love their oyster shooters, but their 2000 different rolls all taste the same to me.  They rely WAY too much on sauce and often I want to yell at them that simple is good too!  A nice elegant simple roll can go a long way.  The service is always great.  Sometimes I wonder if the servers are really Japanese or they just fake a thick and heavy Japanese accent to go with their beautiful Japanese costumes and restaurant decor.  The one thing I really like about I Love Sushi is the ambiance.  It is always loud and rowdy in there, unlike many sushi restaurants.  You feel like you're somewhere "happenin", which I love when I'm eating out.  As far as the food goes, like I said, it's just ok.  If  you are the type of person who only eats sushi and sashimi, the place is great!  But if, like me, you like a roll or two, I'd check out other spots.

kB94djC7QAU85TPHhAMPaw.text: Nice lunch today. Great service, Imagine a cool Japanese Bar, calm music. I ordered the Flower Roll, Japanese lasagna, Sashimi salad and of course the famous Screaming Orgasm  Excellent! The minus one star was for a better mochi and the decor is kinda cheesy for the pricey meal. However fun great place to enjoy good sushi!

lAwJr3ES9Wpd3ApM9zaYlg.text: After locating another sushi restaurant in the area that has an "all you can eat" style menu with a set price, my husband and I stopped going here since we can eat somewhere cheaper. We haven't been back in several months now. Hope they change up the menu and accommodate the consumer a bit more.

BgJl1e-fQSi34tMZ5W_2-A.text: I use yelp all the time to find a good place. This is my first review because I was that disappointed! I'm not sure what everyone is ranting and raving about.   1st.- customer service: I called ahead of time and asked if I can get 1 sushi boat for my wife and I to share lady on the phone said yes and it was posted at 28 dollars or so. SHE DID NOT MENTION IT WAS 2 ORDER MINIMUM. The service was very fake not genuine at all.   2nd- taste of sushi: very average if not a little below average. We got the boat which is basically a ton of tasteless CA Rolls with a few other things.   For the price and quality I would go somewhere else. Maybe an all you can eat spot down the street.

9YY8ggXCYMuN-2LW8h7PLg.text: We came on a Saturday night for dinner, and by the time we were eating, it became very busy. -1 star for the service: it seemed like the servers were very overworked. Not once during our meal were we asked how things were. And good luck getting your water refilled during a rush. -1 star for the owner/manager screaming everywhere. At one point, bussers were clearing out an area of the bar and the owner yelled at them from across multiple tables to stop and clean a table instead....yelling right into my ear. I watched him yell across big distances multiple times, most of those times screaming right into customers' ears. While all customers are important, he was definitely focusing on getting all the parties waiting for tables seated and not at all focused on his customers already seated and trying to enjoy a meal.   The rolls themselves were very good, imo. But it seems like the majority of rolls offered are drenched in some kind of sauce, which makes it absolutely delicious. But as my friend pointed out, the quality of the fish could be bad and you would never know because all you taste is sauce.

idSWfNyo5c1YKDqxjeBVTg.text: Never fails! This is my FAVORITE sushi place in all Las Vegas, and I have been to MANY! The chefs are all very friendly and very fast!  My all time favorite rolls are Bonzai, Double D, Joe Special, Jackpot Special, and Kiss of Fire! I wish my stomach was big enough to have these all EVERY TIME! I absolutely love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

5Xugm7LSbSAWzgJqLk5o3g.text: Best place! I love the something wrong 7! So amazing... The warm towel welcome is certainly a nice touch! Great atmosphere...

2B_3h4PcqOEluZke3wM-Qg.text: Amazing and fast service!  Great atmosphere.  Definitely will be going back soon.  Prices we great, plus they were very accommodating with our young children.  They brought out their food first and fast.  Super nice staff.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi boat was awesome!!!

D8_aRqHeZ0SUPbLO5-dt5Q.text: I love sushi! And this place has really great sushi. The Gary special roll is delicious, and I always get the simple philidalphia roll. It's always yum!   I think the service here lacks a little bit. All my favorite waitresses always end up leaving and they tell me it's because of the management and everything's disorganized. I also always feel like I'm being rushed out. Especially during the dinner rush

db-rclkr5b6zyT18NnMzXw.text: Came for a late lunch on a Friday afternoon, around 1:30 and sat at the sushi bar.  The place wasn't busy at all, only four other parties seated in the whole restaurant.  There were three sushi chefs and four servers at the time.  Everything was prompt at first.  We received drinks quickly from the server and our first roll only took a few minutes.  The selection of sushi rolls was good, the food tasted good, but the service was flat awful after the first 15 minutes!   The only time the servers came by was to refill my drink (he had a large beer and a water, so his did not need refilling).  We were almost completely ignored otherwise.  One of our rolls was forgotten and our sushi chef disappeared (for about a half hour), and it was a good 15 minutes before we could get anyone's attention to find out about our roll, and service did not improve after their mistake was realized.    Furthermore, we wanted to order more drinks and dessert, but after waiting another 10 minutes for a server to come by, we just opted for the check instead.

LtaV7BjTP6mKftv0IeH3OA.text: I am very picky about my sushi. This is the first sushi place where I do not have to order a backup plate ( chicken dish or yakisoba or something). I love the kiss of fire or the Gary's special. Drink several bottles of nigori every time. Crunch roll and California roll are very good. Also the himachi is out of control. So soft and buttery. Will be back many more times. Best sushi I've had!!

depOXEgHtbIB7Hj3TPBm6g.text: Best sushi ever.  The spirit of the art of sushi abounds in not only the food here but the atmosphere as well. The attire of the servers is authentic. The atmosphere is authentic. A feat for the palate. A feat for the eyes.

7YgA96S1f8SEl2zhyeEDfQ.text: New owner, it's not a professional and the quality of the food it's become bad ,you will get a smaller portion of fish ( salads and sashimi ) and on top get an infection ( mouth blisters,  stomach problem )

x29FdJ3_m46mupqPJGL2DQ.text: A great local sushi spot found in southwest Henderson.  I Love Sushi has been open for more than a decade... and it's easy to understand why from the first bite.  Even with a line out the door and an extended wait to eat, the staff at ILS make each experience personal; they're attentive, but not pushy.  Plates are cleared almost immediately.  The fish is fresh and clean with consistent slices and clean presentation that's never mushy. Their menu is extensive, so there's always something new to try.  If you're in the area and have a hankerin' for sushi, I Love Sushi is the place to go.  Tips:  Order a side of chili oil with your food, and oranges when you're finished.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. After sushi oranges are a must!
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiger roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi bar

BD70yqUUSpzhgOuyTFf6VQ.text: Great food great experience! Ask for Alice she is wonderful! All staff are friendly and helpful....:)

bcYzDmbNrnoncTCr7REz9Q.text: I love sushi. We first visited about a yr ago we were looking for a new house came across this place for lunch. Every dish we had was delicious. Bought a house went back last week for lunch and had a fantastic meal again. This is our new hometown sushi place.

HJxAU8xdAhfoAaysXtDlaQ.text: They changed to iceberg lettuce on sashimi salad and it waters down the dish.  Also less fish and mostly lettuce.  Used to be a favorite but not anymore.  Quality and food texture has gone downhill.  They should've left recipe as it was and not cut corners to save money.  Service is also very very slow.   This restaurant was always on my list of " must haves" when visiting NV from out of state.  After last 2 disappointing experiences here, no longer a fan.  I do not recommended this restaurant if you want authentic food, quality service, and reasonable price.  Waste of time and money.

mbYKZKk_N6PgmjzcT2Oq_w.text: Dark romantic ambience so if you have an ugly date this is the perfect place to bring them lol just kidding!  Ben our server was awesome very attentive, and had great knowledge of the menu. By far this was the tastiest sushi we ever had. My taste buds literally exploded. The sushi was good, but as we kept eating the flavors of the sauces became overwhelming. Scallop shooters could be better not enough scallops to even out the amount of ponzu sauce I got a heartburn. For the kiss of fire sushi and burning one I was hoping for their spicy to be True spicy, not just a sour taste of too much hot sauce. Overall tho friendly staff. Prices are worth the portions they serve. Huge sushi selection on menu. I'm on vacay here, but if I'm ever in a need of a quick sushi fix I will be back to try other menu items

xWYyTZuBREQdjteRsY193A.text: Great sushi spots with a huge variety of rolls, with clever names to boot. Fast, friendly service, reasonable prices, worth a visit! 90% wood roll, mistake roll, pink sex on the beach roll (had mussels, lol),and rock and roll were our delicious choices, all REALLY yummy. If you are looking for great sushi, this spot will get the job done! Highly recommend it! Large dinning area, no outdoor seating, plenty of parking in lot. Nice drink menu too.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Rock n Roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. 90% wood roll :)
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Mistake roll ( left), Pink sex on the beach (right)

BRzniA29CBwPEUvNtY_Pmw.text: i absolutely love this place! i haven't been in awhile but trust me this place will not disappoint! they have a big selection of rolls, my favorite is the lisa lisa hand roll, SO GOOD! i also like the screaming orgasm, yum yum scallop, happy ending and the stuffed tomatoe. the staff is always super helpful and the service is quick!

uhxpB6GCkd85s_iVSoX16g.text: Celebrated my 7 year anniversary tonight at our favorite place ! Thank you to Ben for the great service !!

gpQaXy_Mz0uRzhWxFxpbww.text: Don't let the name throw you off.... this place is very good! The fish was extremely fresh and they have a lot of staff so everything came out quickly. Excellent first experience

YQ4KA2dEI9ObK00TbRH9Mw.text: Delicious!!! Great service beautiful restaurant. Highly recommend. Definitely coming back here!!!

Dqk8Y3yI54Z6Kvd8qJX0_A.text: Hotel front desk recommended. My husband and I really enjoyed the sushi and sashimi we had. We walked in at around 7pm on a Saturday night. We were greeted right away and sat almost immediately at the bar. Sushi chef greeted us right away and we were handed small cucumber salads and edamame. After reviewing the huge selection of rolls the chef took our order. It was lightning fast. Everything was very fresh tasting and the presentation was very nice as well. Staff was attentive and filled our waters several times without us asking. Great place for a super quick dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy and yummy!

dhfjmwzVX7bjO47f1r4aNQ.text: Wonderful service great fresh sushi!!! We went there for dinner Friday night. Sat on the sushi bar. Highly recommend!!!!!!!!

a8iCiyyUQHA2soJL-9OAzg.text: I am completely new to the world of sushi. I spent the first 34 years of my life avoiding it at all costs...and then...  The soy wrapper.  Game changer.  Wow.  So, once I found out about the amazing soy wrapper it changed everything for me. The seaweed wrapper is fishy to me, I didn't enjoy that. The soy wrapper is nothing, no taste, just keeps the rolls together. So now I'm able to try almost anything.   My favorite thing at I Love Sushi is the Tempura Roll. It comes with rice, avocado, cream cheese and then I substituted the eel for cooked shrimp. It's lightly battered with panko and flash fried then topped with eel sauce. It's so good. We usually get two of these because everyone always picks off my plate. My wife loves the Pho.  We always call and make a reservation. They host/hostesses always make me laugh because they make sure to remind me to be on time at least twice during the call. Reservations are key on the weekends because the waits can be relatively long.  Also, the service is always spot-on. Super friendly servers, very attentive, glass always full. They also check on you multiple times throughout the meal. Outstanding!

tMMAYi4sGZ8VoIWkCDCTlg.text: Decided to treat myself to a sushi dinner. Been hearing I Love Sushi is one of the best places in town. I was not disappointed. Came in to the sushi bar on a busy Friday night and the Custer service was great. Ordered the Screaming Orgasm and man did I need a good one  Been way too long. The chefs special sauce is a taste explosion, nice & spicy. I had the large order which was plenty for a light eater like me. I wanted another roll to use more of the sauce. Didn't even need to though as the last call roll was flavorful in a totally different sweet way. With melted mozzarella cheese, crab, mango and eel sauce. They don't have an all you can eat special, not a happy hour. I'll definitely be coming back as the quality is second to non. This place has been here 18 years and I've only now discovered it. What a town I live in to be so spoiled with good sushi places.

I6MyZiJjHWoJkiHT29hwvA.text: We came here for an early dinner on a Saturday and were seated right away. We chose to eat at the sushi bar since we were short on time. We ordered the Salmon lover (no rice), hamachi/unagi/ama ebi/sake nigiri, spicy tuna hand roll, and the Kiss of Fire roll.   All of the dishes that we got were pretty good, but none of them really stood out.  The Kiss of Fire had too much sauce for me, and that overpowered the taste of the fish. I'd come here if I happened to be in the area, but I wouldn't say that their fish quality was particularly exceptional. For the price that we paid, we could've gotten just as good sushi that was AYCE.   The sushi chefs and waitresses were great, and the service really made up for the food quality.

8zQLvOR7aCk06eYxOfiHMw.text: I love sushi is by far the best sushi I have had in Nevada. There is no better quality and service in town. If you are visiting, looking for a great date night, or even just trying to treat yourself this is the place to go too. The waitress we had was so nice and attentive to us with everything we wanted and also recommended the best sushi choices that makes us keep coming back. 5 stars all around!

Ty_ZI_TXI5pK_XHr2Y9xOw.text: Food was good.  Some dishes were hotter than just hot. Couldn't eat some spent $200 only ate 3 choices.   Order small then go from there!

4y2VjfMUE6WnxhVsDHRd6g.text: We've been coming here for a few years. Tonight the service was HORRIBLE! Our server took our order and we never seen her after that. Some guy brought our food to the table and that was the last of anything. We had to walk up to the front counter to pay our bill cause they never even brought that to us. We will NEVER come here again!!!! It's too bad we are forced to hit 1 star to post this review.

ETyNohRDhyQMLgeN2zLh3A.text: We love this place! Sometimes we are here weekly!  The owner is really nice and the staff are all nice despite how busy they all are.  The food is delicious. Some of our favs are niku udon, crunch roll, and dynamite roll!!!!!

OpXMz_7m_NFNAuYlkpiP2Q.text: I love sushi, but not so sure if I love it here.  There are many pros to this place, but here's why I thought it was just A-OK.  Walking in, you're greeted and waited by waitresses/servers dressed in kimonos (cute).  It was busy going to lunch on Saturday, but there was plenty of seating.    We decided to sit at the sushi bar.  I'm not exactly a fan of sitting at a low sushi bar where I have to look up to talk to the sushi chefs.  It's just awkward.    Tuna Karai, Candy Cane Roll, and the super white tuna nigiri (ono) are what we ordered.   The Tuna Karai:  $16.50 for a bowl.  You can go to Sumo Sushi and get a Tuna Karai for $14.00 and double the amount.  This was good, but not $16.50 good.    I love softshell crab, and I'm glad that I Love Sushi has a variety of sushi rolls that include softshell crab.  I decided to try the Candy Cane Roll.  There wasn't any sauce on it.  The flavor was just okay.  It had a weird after taste to it.  It was also a bit too salty too.  Just a weird flavor.    The super white tuna nigiri (ono) was probably my favorite.  They give you a generous amount of ono sushi.  Great with a piece of wasabi and soy sauce.    Maybe I'll come back and give this place another chance in the future, but for now, it was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Close up of the Candy Cane roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Super white tuna nigiri

N49ZETInwxFqL_4eGE_3QA.text: This place is has great environment and very friendly wait staff. All waitresses are dressed as geishas and are very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The rolls are a bit on the pricey side, but they do have a great variety and the fish is very fresh. The one down side is that they do not have ayce(all you can eat). With 14 bucks for a specialty roll it really adds up.

QX8gnaHHFYzdUSU70hMbHA.text: So there are a lot of good AYCE places that I like in Vegas and those are the places I usually go, because let's face it, I can put away a serious amount of sushi in one sitting.   Although I Love Sushi is not an AYCE restaurant, I like to go there sometimes with my wife because it is top-quality, and it's a waste of money to take her to AYCE because she doesn't even eat that much.   When we go to I Love Sushi, we always get a roll called The Kitchen Sink. It's a no rice roll and it is seriouly the bomb.   The other thing I like about this restaurant is the atmosphere. If Disney World did a sushi restaurant, it would probably look like this. All the servers are in traditional Japanese outfits and the decor is like you're in Japan. They also have real Japanese music playing in the background. I really like it.

LT4D37hRZdHZejaL9Oj_XQ.text: FOOD POISONING! I can't remember the last time I was throwing up so much and dealing with stomachaches and cold sweats. We ordered a few orders of sake nigiri and it smelled stale and not refrigerated. The service was great, but I'm in so much pain right now that I don't think I would go back again. Plenty of people recommended this place to me, but reading other reviews, it looks like I'm not the only one who got really sick. I would never recommend a restaurant where the chefs consistently get their guests sick.

i4J1mwSxp7Qn5hynU8xN6Q.text: *Rock N Roll-one of my all time favorite sushi rolls! Different types of fish sashimis rolled in soy paper and wrapped with a slice of cucumber. Soy paper was a substitution. I recommend this option because the soy paper is light in flavor, unlike the regular seaweed wrap which might take away from the freshness of the fish inside. This dish comes with five thinly sliced lemon slices. The lemon is for garnish but I definitely recommend eating it with your sushi. The acidity of the lemon paired up very nicely with the fish and leaves a refreshing palate craving for more. This dish only comes with 6 pieces! I wish I had ordered more. *Screaming Orgasm-comes in small and large options, sliced tuna atop of a huge bed of radish drowned in sauce. Tuna was drowning in the sauce; took away from the simplicity of the fish. This is a signature dish of the restaurant. Maybe I came on a bad day? Probably won't order the next time I come here. *Deep Fried Gyoza-I usually like my gyoza steamed then caramelized for some color and texture. But this one was too fried for my taste. Came with a side of gyoza dipping sauce. *Kiss of Fire-This dish was drenched in spicy sauce. I couldn't taste much of the contents within because the sauce was overpowering. Reminded us of a Mexican enchilada dish almost. If you do want to try this dish, ask for easy sauce. *Dancing Eel- We asked for easy sauce for this sushi roll since the Kiss of Fire roll was disappointing. The eel tasted fresh. Simple roll, nothing too special.   The decor and uniforms that the waitresses wore were very cultural. I loved every bit of it. The waitresses were super sweet and greeted everyone with a smile. They wear kimonos head to toe and have their hair in a traditional Japanese up-do. The service was excellent and they checked in with our table often to see if everything was okay and to refill our water cups.   I would definitely come back to visit again! I can't wait to try their other sushi rolls (they have plenty of variety which makes it very difficult to choose).

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Gyoza
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Rock N Roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiss of fire

5FJlqA4fvkIVWeWEYwtPTg.text: Best sushi place I've been to, hands down! I love coming here and the owner always remembers us. Last night we had dinner here and brought our 8-month-old along. The staff is very accommodating and came over to interact with our daughter. It's great food and reasonably priced. I always get the Boom Boom Nipple Special... the Bonzai Roll is also good and the Franky Special.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Boom Boom Nipple Special

TATXDsm2GqrkctIilkic6g.text: Wife and I have ate here multiple times. Never disappoints. It's moderately priced, however, it is the best sushi within the area. If you sit at the bar, try to get a seat by Simon. He's one of the sushi chefs (Itamae) and he makes the entire experience real fun.   Go-to rolls: Monkey Roll I love sushi Kitchen Sink Garlic butter special  It gets real busy during the weekends...make that reservation ahead of time.

WqUBXo6fa5tEwIzZ1Rp7WA.text: Gotta give this place 5 stars - fast attentive service, relaxing atmosphere and most of all quality sushi at a reasonable price.  I recommend the signature I Love Sushi roll if you like spicy excellence.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The I Love Sushi roll - spicy tuna lovers will enjoy

mBY8R4TouH6fWkhhJWH_oQ.text: Our friends Nicole B. and Steven S. begged us to try I Love Sushi, so after 6 years of avoiding it, I finally went.  Eric R. didn't think it would be a good deal since it is a la carte, and I heard it was all about pornographic-named rolls, so I wasn't expecting much.  Our friends made reservations, which we thought was weird for a local a la carte sushi joint, but lo and behold, there was a crazy wait at 7 and we skipped all of that.  The servers wore kimonos, and this place is really big for a sushi restaurant - less activity at the bar and more at tables around it.  Our server was very friendly and efficient, and we had a private-esque booth.  I got iced green tea.  Steven S. does NOT love sushi, so he ordered a dinner bento with chicken and beef.  He got brown rice for a $1 charge.  Nicole B. got udon and the cherry blossom, a non-rice "roll" which is really a massive amount of soft shell crab chopped up and wrapped in avocado slices.  Eric R. got the rainbow roll, ikura sushi, and had a few pieces of my nigiri order.  I went for it, and appreciated some interesting selections here.  I got hamachi, sake, saba, amaebi, uni, salmon skin temaki, and a quail egg shooter.  When I got the first pieces, salmon and yellowtail, I immediately noticed the same problem Goyemon has - HOT rice, COLD fish.  YUCK!!!!  The sushi rice was hot and not really sushi rice, which is upsetting because 1) sushi is about the rice and 2) the mixed temperatures make everything taste weird.  Not okay.  The fish quality was fine enough, though the yellowtail was splitting apart at each seam so to speak.  I liked the salmon better.  The mackerel was cured just fine and covered with my fave vegetable, green onions.  The uni was okay.  The salmon skin handroll was stuffed, and it was prepared with gobo, kaiware, cucumber, and avocado without sauce, which was very good.  The quail egg shooter had 3 quail egg yolks, masago, green onion, and ponzu which was different and tasty.  I got the amaebi last.  The sushi was good and the fried heads were enormous and covered in tempura batter.  They were on top of shredded daikon and served with ponzu.  I was very full after all of this, and I am glad I tried it finally.  However, there is no excuse for poor rice when sushi is about rice, so I do not see myself returning.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Amaebi
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon skin temaki
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Uni and ikura

BwrItmUHwRzQBVwTXphmJA.text: This was my favorite sushi place in town for over 5 years. Ever since the new owner took over, the quality and pace of the food has diminished. The environment used to be inviting and fun, but now it's tense and feels uncomfortable. The new owner hired new staff and it's not the same feeling. The old staff that is still there try to make the old customers happy. Yet, the new staff is slow and not consistent in their output of sushi.

TuA_K1LU2s7QJuQHkzdvjw.text: my taste buds had an amazing experience! i got 4 different items and they were all as good as i was expecting after ready the reviews! it was a busy night but the owner took 5 min to  get us situated. if you like flavor thats for sure the good spot!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

R1QXDzl1UXs4p-s6X7gAnA.text: Another favorite! Once you've had sushi here, you'll have trouble loving other places as much. Don't get me wrong, I do like other sushi restaurants, but this is our favorite. Even our friends & family from out of town, always want to go there when they visit. Try the Pepper Tuna. If you like pot stickers, get the spicy ponzu sauce to use as dip. The spicy edamame is great too! The service is good & prices are reasonable too. Enjoy!

4ht4Pq_Vvh7fQTRKIbP48w.text: In Vegas for Superbowl weekend, wanted to find the best sushi in town. I think I was successful, this is a very good sushi spot...the chefs were polite, service was fast and extremely courteous. The servers are lovely looking in traditional Japanese garments. The ambiance was done right as well. I ordered the Boom Boom nipple special and the Dragon roll. Both were delicious and I'm planning on going back for some of the other menu options before I leave Vegas. Highly recommend this spot to all who are looking for good food away from the stop.

-zseEi4lsT2qinJKdPK7uw.text: Best Sushi and Sashimi ever -- Was up here for a Triathlon in Boulder City and we drove all the way to this west side location to try it since it had such good ratings. Well worth the extra trip and will be back next time I am in Vegas for anything!

d9hIhklXaQ3T0eii2TYxjQ.text: They dont offer all you can eat sushi but this is by far the most delicious sushi ive had and spectacular fish!! Melts in my mouth every time, and the special thing about their fish, is that it doesnt have bad fishy smell u can encounter at other joints! One of my many date spots for sure! And the sushi bar is always fun and gets you involved!! I can suggest the ilovesushi special which is a tuna roll with this spicy sauce its fantastic!!

ZGQDK4j14GQYAWtuIkTRaQ.text: Very good, very fresh and very fast. Not too expensive and worth every penny.  The edamame appetizer and cucumber appetizers that were complimentary and I would order the cucumber appetizer even if it was expensive because it is dynamite. I had the flower roll which was delicious. The roll list is a little overwhelming at first but many awesome options. The sashimi was great. Well worth the trip.
