jZjB4bMS7FaJkR1XJs08Eg.text: Great lunch with my mom. Excellent service, excellent food, decent prices. Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

7H0BG9K-0wdaq56CHzniKw.text: By far the best sushi I have ever had, and I've eaten at the most expensive tables at TAO. I Love Sushi is always fresh, and perfectly prepared. I've been eating in and ordering take out from here for about five years and every single time the rolls taste the exact same each time ordered. Jackpot Special has become the favorite of every person I bring here: including people who have been eating sushi their entire lives (unlike me who only started as an adult). I've been loving the Japanese lasagne recently and so I get the jackpot special and that and it is HEAVEN. The employees treat you so well, and it's such a clean and pretty atmosphere. They accidentally burnt my Japanese lasagne last time and when I showed up they apologized and said they were remaking it and seconds later walked out with the new one..just an example of how they won't serve anything but the best.

BQfP7tYT9s8q3eiWIM--ew.text: Slow service and found a sharp piece of metal in my food. I actually chewed on it. Thank God I did not swallow it. When I brought it to the waitress's attention all she did was apologize and ask me if I want dessert. Then it took a whole hour before my sushi rolls came to the table. They didn't even put in my order. I will never return to this restaurant in fear that I could possibly ingest metal and worst case scenario die!

BbWpZwMmT3wtLodb93puvQ.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE!!! Two times, too many! We waited an hour after ordering 4 rolls and 2 box dinners an and a shooter. Our kids box dinners came out and no rolls, the waitress kept apologizing, but no resolution. We finally cut our losses and left, $60 bucks short without food for us.  We talked to the manager, just "sorry" "sorry". BTW- the table next to us sat down after us, ordered, eat and paid in this time. Whatever the situation, at the very least we shouldn't of had to ask for the manager and they should have taken care of part of the bill. The sushi there is good at best, but nothing to write home about or is worth putting up with such terrible service.

KwVueC2jwZZQmSvdTlJ_MA.text: Everyone is so friendly.  The food is great.  I think the owner is usually working there at night so the service is always excellent.

zGuydg1gQXFyT2vVILI03w.text: I Love...My Ass, Screaming Orgasms, Honey Rolls, and so much more.  The screaming orgasm is a gateway to serious sushi addictions. For the virgins out there, it's seared ahi tuna served on a bed of shredded radish and topped with a ponzu sauce. If you're burnt out on orgasms, try the spicy, crispy rice plate, under "fried rolls."   The spicy tuna and crab mixes are so good that I suggest you try them straight up in hand rolls, which are gigantor. If you're not afraid to swap saliva, buddy up on these. But do not cut them in half. I repeat, do not cut hand rolls in half. That would be like lobbing the head off of a Virgin Mary figurine.   For dessert, get the honey roll. Somehow this fried salmon roll tastes better than custard.  On top of all the sexy names and delicious sauces, the waitresses wear kimonos and repeat your order with humor, "So, you want I love my ass?" Yes, yes I do.

2dPKPAA3yTH_8i4Vg7G47Q.text: I luv this place, the Wait staff is very friendly, the sushi is fresh and the nigori saki is cold and served in chilled saki glasses.   Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Dynomite.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Cody Roll - crab wrapped in soy paper with rice on the outside

t9WLtSvbp6tlUMw7dBGb_Q.text: Love the Agadashi tofu, Spider Roll and the salmon sashimi!  The warm towels prior to dining is a nice touch!  This place is always packed on the weekends so be prepared to wait!  I'm definitey becoming a fan of this place!

Vv0f3VoHaNLPTOsSeDJJvA.text: I really can't say enough about this place.  The sushi chefs are awesome and they will make you anything you ask for.  The fish is always fresh and yummy.  I like going there because they remember us and know what we like.  Plus if you are undecided they will create some special just for you.  Fantastic service and great food.  Best sushi joint we have ever eaten at.

4D8A6s55-r3zLY34aJ_Jbg.text: Oh Thank God. Oh thank GOD that a sushi place in Vegas is not going to be a terrible, suburban washed sushi joint. I love sushi, I bow to you. I worship at your delicious menu and your fantastic service, and your overall Zagat awesomeness.   Sit at wooden tables and be served by wonderful ladies in kimonos equip with the shoes and all. They hand you a quick sushi list where you can check off any one of the nearly 100 sushi options they have. Don't get confused, the sushi is not listed in the folding menu, but on a stand at the end of the table. Names will make you giggle in front of your parents as you ask for "I love my ass" and "Tastes like my x-girlfriend". In fact, I sometimes have to stray from the awkward named ones because I'm almost always at sushi joints with my folks when back home. I resolved on Burning My Stomach ( which is probably sexual..somehow) and the Banzai Roll. The banzai roll is a delicious sweeter roll with teriyaki sauce wrapped in rice paper.   What really opened me up was the Burning My Stomach.  Really spicy crab meat dumped on more spicy crab and shrimp inside a roll surrounded by a thick layer of sashmi cut tuna. The flavor in this is insane. It's too big to eat in one bite, but maybe that's how you like it.   My mouth was burning so much afterward that water just made the temperature decrease from 200F to 199 F. Had to settle on a nice plum wine ice cream to give myself a break. It was perfectly sweet and tart just at the last minute that I had to eat the entire bowl, good thing I'm starting that "diet" next year.   I love sushi. I do. And now, I love you.

IFClnUpKbnYMgIYycT6l0w.text: Ordered sushi for lunch take out. Was expecting good sushi due to the reviews but it was just so-so. And the green onions which were garnish for our Joes Special roll were spoiled and smelled bad. Fish was not chilled so sushi did not taste fresh. Did not care for it.

TFbr8mNY9e5g0x1-XDyQGQ.text: Best sushi in the world!   My list: One Night Stand Happy Ending Sexy Time Ryan Special  Cant go wrong with these. Ive been going to this joint since the day it opened. Very rarely does it disappoint! Edwin is the best too! Its always busy for dinner time so come early or prepare to wait.

Ilxwy7d_xNGsdntN5TLsGg.text: No all you can eat here but they make up for that in delicious rolls! Probably one of the better quality near Silverado Ranch/ Seven Hills area  Been there twice one during dinner and another for lunch and even though they were packed the service was sitll great.

2zlRium-Isz7gTaSvydkpA.text: We had ordered a udon and the chicken was so dry we couldn't eat it. The sushi was ok, but not great. The owner was raising his voice to the nice woman that helped us when we asked for some sort of discount for the chicken udon, since we didn't and couldn't eat it. In the past they have been ok, but pushy to get us out. We were very disappointed. This will be our last time we eat here.

780rbOeIGayOJlpfFsggPw.text: I don't get this place. Servers and management don't speak English so if they make a mistake or screw up your food they still let you pay for it. Very average sushi with lots of creams to cover the flavor.

wIqQT3tiGz34kmTairu86A.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant. All the rolls are very well made and the salmon sushi is very generous. Always cut thick and not stringy with a bunch of connective tissue.   Weekends are easier to get a table then weekdays for some reason.  They have a full kitchen in case you go with someone who doesn't like sushi but I can't comment on the quality as I've never ordered off the regular menu.   As far as drinks goes if you're feeling adventurous, get a tall Kirin or Sapparro and mix it with Raspberry Wine. Makes for a nicely balanced drink that won't overpower the raw fish.

y1qtjWJ-0eaZZ_SNo4k3dg.text: An inexpensive gem in an otherwise expensive mine.   The menu is beyond intimidating, as their are nearly 100 plus rolls for you to choose from. I sat staring bleakly and relegated my dinner order to throwing darts, hoping that in the end my buyer's remorse wouldn't kick in. The plain spicy tuna was "so-so"; the Washington role was packed full of fresh, melt-in-your-mouth salmon and the Sun Devil role nearly made me change my underwear. Personally, one of the most delicious rolls I've had anywhere.  Service is very quick and non obtrusive. Seating was immediate on a Sunday evening and the restaurant was clean. The most obvious thing I noticed was the sheer volume of sushi chefs (nearly 10) pumping out quick, quality plates at a moment's notice. Overall, a pretty outstanding place. Price was decent (about $40 for 3 rolls) and there were no specials.

Ba54sDKYGwgfF03oAi_vjg.text: The sushi is great but order the ROLLEY RICE BOWL..... It will blow your mind.  The jackpot roll with cream cheese added is amazing as is most of the rolls but the ROLLEY rice bowl is a MUST. I have never seen a dish like this in any other sushi place.

LcXQdj6prdsKucMpU-sr9A.text: Awsome sushi, fresh and fast. I would go back over and over. The prices are high but thats to be expected from a place like this one. Enjoy!!

GewNo1S2lcjPsNpd2kXR0w.text: My first experience with I Love Sushi was just a few days ago and I CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK! My friend and I sat at the bar, and we were quickly taken care of. The sushi was amazing, the ambiance was so authentic, it's definitely a new favorite. Being new to the area I was searching and searching for a sushi place off the strip (I love RA sushi) and I've found it!

Je4j0cIEhQ70FwYyK085qQ.text: My most FAVE sushi place. Their rolls are on the pricey side and there's no all you can eat BUT their rolls are so worth it. Each roll I've had there has so many flavors and it always tastes fresh. They come in good size portions and not the small kind where you see in reg sushi spots.

wFfAi0XWLn_0z-DUr-_NKw.text: Hands down the best sushi I have ever had. The fish quality is amazing. For the price you pay, this is also great value. The o toro sashimi was phenomenal.

c1VzfXA-gjrfjV9uDqZMYA.text: This is not AyCE but truly and enjoyable reasonably priced meal. The service was exceptional. Nice decor. Large portions. Highly recommend

HQryaUOmjEdaXxsTv-quxQ.text: Yakitori is really good here, the miso is soso, and the rest looked good, but i don't like sushi..the staff is really nice and all in all a fun place.

ctgTuZ2-czsaDSCLCDFr6A.text: A fairly non-descript place located in a outdoor shopping area just outisde of Las Vegas but once you are inside, it's quite large and festive. Lots of sushi options as well as cooked options too. Service was very attentive and we had plenty of food.  When it came time for the bill, we were actually surprised at how reasonable the prices were overall.  Would certainly go back when we are in Vegas again.

2K8XSXH2FN_2IbD5KPq6vw.text: This is some of the best Japenese in Vegas. We try to make it there every time we get to town. It's out of the way but worth the drive.we always enjoy the spicy tuna roll. Everything is prepared to perfection.

3SAozVqkKrGUno6nqbUz4g.text: edwin is the best sushi chef this place is the best sushi place i've ever been too ..the screaming orgasm  is so yummy it's seared tuna with sum yummy sauce love this place ..  love the sushi chef EDWIN...

YgqY1yzfPYqDn34kylRIhg.text: i eat here a lot. favorite rolls: kiss of fire, sun devil, and something wrong. everything is good here though

k6qrf5fbHS3yFBFzZZVqww.text: Great food and great service! Try the "Kiss of Fire" and "The Crunch-Roll."

lKfrrUKyn9PTh4E8AXdXyQ.text: This is the Best  in Henderson.  My Mom does not like all kinds of sushi but she loves the Mexican Roll, and the  Spicy Salmon. Also has lots of cooked options  for thoes of you who do not like any type of sushi...It is in a small shopping mall but  is large inside.   Try it ....  Only problem with Sushi is no left overs for me.

8_6WCBa3aJc_c5vFyn6zSg.text: So many have said this is the best sushi!! Ok the ambience is great....food not so great.  Had 3 rolls and 3 orders of sushi between 2 of us.  None of the rolls we had had a wow factor...one tasted like fish bait and they all tasted fishy.  Fishy equals not fresh!  Still hands down the best is The Sushi in Henderson.....Learned my lesson....would not go to I Love Sushi again. Menu great, ambience great....food blech :(

evJs6CJeMwQ0twMKIhV8kA.text: I LOVE I Love Sushi!  Every role that I've ever had there was amazing and also their prices are great.  I would tell anyone to check out this place.

N5eGH2NBVewngWNL6PbdFw.text: my favorite sushi place in vegas! best time to go is early when they're not so busy and the atmosphere is a lot more laid back but going when it's busy is fun too when the sushi chefs are louder than the customers haha!

SWnbJoHizEWGPY-9fh_Y5w.text: Really good sushi, good service, nice atmosphere.  The sushi selection is enormous.

wFbEuIJFGZ69jnad7TVbOQ.text: Went there on Sun, June 20 with 5 adults, 2 young kids and a baby-not a long wait, 15 minutes, very busy place, probably because it turns out the sushi was excellent. I was a little wary of  place with a name like this, but a relative who lives in the area swore by it. I cannot remember what we had but we went through about 9 rolls (all very well made by about 8 sushi guys behind the counter), also had a couple of other things like a nice lobster dish with mushrooms. Kids had teriyaki chicken, wife had tempura and teriyaki chicken entree. We will definitely go back next time in the area-we loved it. Fast service, attentive staff, great food, great prices!

I-FsHr42fzOTPkN7x93JPA.text: Best sushi in Vegas! I have eaten at Shibuya (disappointing / over priced), Sushi Samba (ewww) and Social House (great restaurant but very, very mediocre sushi) but nothing comes close to I Love Sushi. My friend used to live in Henderson and when I left the strip to go visit her she would always rave about this awesome sushi restaurant in a random strip mall in the 'burbs. I was skeptical at first but she has worked in the restaurant industry for 10 years so I decided to check it out. Although this place isn't fancy I can truly say it is one of the best sushi restaurants I have eaten at. Truly a hidden gem! Everything is cheap despite the quality ingredients and innovative roles. The service is amazing and the ambiance is fun, lively and laid back. If you want a great meal and are ready to venture off the strip check out this local favorite. My amazing meal with three very hungry people was a whopping $62! Can't wait to go back next time I am in Vegas

QbcQtpcI3E_GKcidOnni0w.text: i'm really not too into i love sushi.  i agree with carly a.  i think this place appeals to vegas kids, because f the crazy sushi roll names.  i don't like how most of the items are deep fried.  i've had a few people tell me that they like i love sushi, because the fish is the freshest...to be honest, i can't tell.    really...even though the menu seems extensive, it seems like the rolls are all just a different combination of the same ingredients in each roll.

QNOpXogKAZAlz4y3dyHXOA.text: I used to love this place! It has totally gone downhill. Prices are OUT OF CONTROL! $18.00 for two avocado rolls! Plus the owner is extremely rude!  Don't waste your money!

m6loqA20UWDUgKlC9LIIhg.text: This is the best sushi place I have ever eaten at! The place is always busy, which is a good sign! The staff is attentive and super polite and the quality of the fish is top notch. It isn't as cheap of some other places around town and they do not offer AYCE, but that doesn't matter because everything else is so amazing! The garlic tuna, Double D roll, and Johnny's roll were my favorites. They also offer warm sake and filtered or un-filtered sake, something for all sake lovers! Also, I recommend making a reservation if you are coming with 4 or more people, especially on Friday or Saturday night!

lF2gfPOD7TMxHy2vUKpF5w.text: I hadn't eaten at I Love Sushi is quite a while, so I decided to try it again last night with 3 guests.  The environment is quite nice, even kimono-clad wait staff.  But, sorry to say, the food quality has really gone down hill.  And you do not want to eat sushi that is not excellent.  There is too much excellent competition in Henderson and Las Vegas to settle for mediocre.   I give it 3 stars only because of the attempt to create a nice Japanese environment, but I won't be going back anytime soon.

suzVXzKC9r9kyAi2nlW5tQ.text: Boom Boom took care of us again! Hands down...this is the spot for Sushi!!!  This place rules! Every person we tell to try it, loves it! The Uni tops it all!

-IAPUR3F__WT_NGp--4j5w.text: Excellent, fresh sushi with some good rolls. A little more expensive than it should be, and a bad location for how far away I am, but a great gem for those closer to this side of town!

b9pRujq5ubyYjtZfPR8NYA.text: You know, the sushi here isn't as great as everyone on here says it is. Subpar would  be an exaggeration. My wife got the crunchy roll and the rainbow roll. There wasn't much flavor in both and the fish wasn't very fresh. I myself got their lunch special with the fried pork and teriyaki chicken, and the chicken was a little on the burn side and the pork was dry.  All in all if you like bland food this place is for you but if you like food with lots of flavor I'd find another place to dine if I were you.

nlNItXhIapTYC4JkB-FKiw.text: LOVEEEE THIS PLACE! One of my favorites (if not my favorite) sushi spots in Vegas.  My boyfriend and I have been coming here pretty frequently the past year. And I always crave this place after like a week of not going.  The fish is extremely fresh and perfectly cut. Their oyster shooters are a great way to end the meal I would definitely recommend the Eddie special roll as well

X6ZWvjSW8MUbaNWrAUAolQ.text: Sushi was average, I was pretty excited after seeing the reviews, but it isn't anything special. The cheapest roll I got ended up being better than their more expensive rolls. The pot stickers were pretty good, but the sauce they came with...not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. 4x4 roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Mistake roll

HCmXv78AzlSdC9Gz2Qf_ZA.text: I have been all over the world at every type of sushi restaurant imaginable. Yes, the sushi here is good and surprisingly fresh considering we are here in the desert and not the port of Long Beach. But the sushi business has become very competitive around Henderson and you had better be fresh or you will out of business quickly. I have seen many local sushi restaurants have the sushi come right from the airport via courier to get the freshest fish for the day. I do not know if I love sushi gets their fish this way but each time I have been there it has been fresh.  I have had bad experiences with the staff and management. One time a waitress spilled liquid on my wife's new dress. You would think there would be a voluntary adjustment on the check but I had to argue with the manager to get a few bucks off the bill for dry cleaning IF the dress could be cleaned at all. Another time the fire alarm was going off the entire time we were eating. I understand it is not the fault of the staff but an apology and perhaps a free appetizer would have been nice when the experience literally resulted in a headache.

VwgmmKxfSvcCiC0VzETThw.text: Dynamite and Jackpot!!!!!! Sooooo good!  The food came soo quick and the servers are so nice! Love it here! Definitely coming back to try more food

UTnVAj5JKXZlNAaxBywuXQ.text: They know me by name I eat there so much! While my favorite thing on the menu is their caterpillar roll, I do sometimes experiment with new things. I haven't had anything bad.  Definitely the best sushi place I've eaten at in all of Las Vegas. Service is always great. If you order for pickup, I've generally found them to give you a time 5 to 10 minutes later than it actually takes before they have it ready.

dAFftZyHcCK9hNP8y5QMTw.text: With a name like this, I expected horrible food. However, my well-traveled sushi connoisseur buddy insisted on leaving the strip and driving off toward Henderson to the great little sushi dive. I call it a dive only due to the older, casual ambiance. The food and service were solid 5 star.  We overate ordering something like 12-14 rolls for 2 people. Additionally, we both had the sashimi salad. Many of the rools have too much mayonnaise or funky sauces. If you catch it upfront and request only brown rice, you can make this a healthy v hardy experience.  The sashimi salad is one of the most generous and best sashimi salads I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. I will definitely come back!

B8PWZK7kydY-z_8cj5DygA.text: Great sushi always fresh and tasting good. Staff is very nice and super helpful. The cook is very knowledgeable and always recommended stuff that I ended up liking. Prices are fair for the area. There are several sushi places in this part of town and this is the best palace I have tried. Super clean and hours and good.

DK94w8lDKstxQKDdfVceFA.text: Decent sushi with some unique rolls on the menu, somewhat expensive. We ordered the screaming orgasm, Mexican roll, lobster roll, kimchi roll, baked green mussels and fried gyoza. The food was good, nothing overly impressive. A lot of spicy dishes, felt a bit like a Korea/sushi fusion type of restaurant. The screaming orgasm was very spicy and its sauce wasn't as creamy as I usually like it. I really enjoyed the kimchi roll most. The mussels were a tad dry. The place itself was packed, we ended up waiting 30 minutes for a table and the loud noise from so many people crowded in such a small space made it difficult to relax and converse. The decorations created a nice atmosphere with a lot of red and black, paper screens and painted lanterns. Staff was friendly and our waitress was spectacular despite the crowd - great attitude, on top of our drinks, and kept track of what food we were still waiting on better than I could. Overall, a good experience and, although it won't be my go-to sushi place, I would go back again.

MqMSYoHMVrLKcrBU0vkiYA.text: Checked out this place because of the Yelp reviews and it was close to my office. Did not disappoint!! Great service, on point suggestions from our waitress and everyone that walked in the door was treated like family! My new fav spot, for sure!!

ZRzeZip-MNh7AuGvUsIdew.text: My love for I love sushi will grow each and every time I get the opportunity to go. Back in 2010 I went here for my friends birthday and tried sushi for the very first time, and I was in love. The chefs put so much love and craft into each roll, it's no wonder this place is one of the best to go to for sushi in Las Vegas. After trying many different rolls I tried the Crunch Roll and it has always stuck. It's actually what I compare other rolls to to decide how good it actually is. I've yet to find one in Reno that is as delicious as the Crunch Roll. I finally got to come back to I love sushi for the first time since 2012 when I moved and it felt like coming home. Nearly everything was the same, including quality of sushi and exceptional service. Ofcourse I got a Crunch Roll, and ofcourse it lived up to my expectations. I wish I love sushi had an all you can eat option, but I never expect that to happen.

Kt8hH3DhdkFwKkQdyXNpBQ.text: Favorite sushi spot in Vegas that I've been to so far. Highly recommend yakisoba and the deep fried Inari sushi! When we have the money this is one of my favorite places to go. The whole atmosphere is really cool as well. I've heard people say its kinda cheesy but I enjoy it.   But I wouldn't recommend going if you're right on funds as they are expensive.  Also make sure if you're a Vegetarian and asking for teriyaki they give you teriyaki and not eel sauce. One of the guys argued with my friend one time saying that they're the same thing because he didn't jut wanna walk to the kitchen and grab teriyaki for her or ask a waitress to or something.

nCWslzbFpqUkmpd4RGzHgw.text: Service is great, and you get pretty good quality. The menu is huge, so it will take customers a couple visits to find rolls that match their preference.

VP5TAh1XezAlc7_Ft9bmXA.text: We come here all the time. Great ambiance, friendly staff and the food is so fresh. Best sushi place in Henderson

spEzS7FTVy9Gz1E94f-v1w.text: Went here for my birthday dinner on a Saturday night with some friends.  I have heard things from friends here and there and I like to try new sushi spots, so I decided to give this a go from that as well as Yelp reviews.  -;)  No reservations and we were still able to get a party of 8 seated in about 10 minutes at 8 PM on a Saturday night, which was fantastic.  The older Asian man in the embroidered cowboy shirt and riding boots was nice and efficient.  We ordered after much debate (and apparently a menu-stealing waitress from what a friend said) and the food came pretty fast.  That might be relative to enjoying great company with friends, I'm not 100%.  Their Homare Strawberry Nigor (strawberry sake) is $16 a bottle - not bad as Island Sushi's is $20.  I drank most of it.  (Hey, it was my birthday dinner.)  I got two staples in my sushi ordering - crunch roll and dragon roll.  Both were good but not the best I've had.  The crunch on the crunch roll was not what I'm used to - it was fairly hard and not the normal light, panko batter that I've experienced at other places.  The dragon roll had a bit too much sauce, but the eel slices on top were generous.  My friend ordered a spicy roll with a jalapeno slice on top (can't remember the name) so we sushi-swapped and hers was great!  I had to eat one roll in two bites.  They are VERY generous with the fish cuts, which is great because they are also high-quality.  The tempura I tried from my friend's Love Boat was good but slightly reminded me of my crunch roll - that harder crunch instead of the light fluff of normal panko.  Service was very friendly and they brought out a complimentary tempura ice cream with a candle.  That was very tasty - the pound cake inside was soft, fluffy, and very melt-in-your mouth - but I was pretty full by that point so I only ate half.  Plus: LOTS of cooked choices for groups that enjoy Japanese food but not sushi. (Those crazies.)  Minus: No AYCE.  I came with an AYCE-friendly group, and since they are my normal sushi crew I probably won't be back for awhile.

6TkKRpw4r932zkiKHWcmmQ.text: This place was just a random pick because I was craving sushi. Thank goodness I took a chance on this place. My new favorite sushi spot!!! Service was super fast and the ambience was very traditional Japanese. I ordered the Dynamite Roll and my sister ordered the Jackpot Roll, and both were hands down, AMEEEEEEZING!!! I highly recommend this place and cannot wait to come back and try the Fat Ass Roll!

eYD3zeRbP3jVcs8lfsQusQ.text: My favorite sushi spot ever!!!! Like I've mentioned in other sushi reviews, I love when they have a huge sushi menu and this place has MANY different rolls to try, it's fun!! I Love Sushi has at least 90!!! My husband and I's favorite is the Jackpot Special and we get it every single time we have dinner there. My friend was right about this place, the food and fish is very fresh!! If you're thinking about trying this place out, don't think twice, just go - you won't be disappointed. Get a good buzz going too, try their cold Raspberry sake. Btw, the service is good too!! They get pretty busy and packed during dinner time but it's usually not that long of a wait and it's always worth it to me.. The waitresses are very nice and the chefs are fun!  Update (I've tried and graded these rolls/dishes to my liking): *Jackpot - A+ *Boom Boom Nipple - A+ *Franky Special - A+ *Screaming Orgasm - A+ *Monkey Roll - A+ *Kiss of Fire - A+ *Bam Bam - A *Tastes Like My Ex-GF - A *John Homes - A *Double D - A *Japanese Lasagna - A *I Love Sushi - A *Something Wrong #69 - B+ *90% Special - B+ *Sun Devil - B+ *Sean's Special - B *Crazy Horse - B *Happy Ending - B- *Burning Your Stomach - B- *Garlic Butter Special - B-

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Monkey Roll - salmon, cream cheese, avocado, and mango inside w/mango sauce and tempura crumbs on top. Yummy!!!

mB6B2_CMv00-9xvvOVOySg.text: I love this place. I love the udon noodle and jackpot special roll ... We usually come here with friends and family .

45JWTQ_uPd4dIGIkOsj3IA.text: While this place was certainly great, there's just something about it that keeps it from being 5 stars. The food is delicious, the fish is fresh, and the service is fast and friendly. But there just isn't anything about this place that makes it "a great deal" or "worth the high price." But the food, for the price, is just average. It's basically, exactly what you expect to get for the price you pay.  The options here are neverending. Seriously, the roll menu is HUGE. With so many different rolls, there's going to be something you like, no matter what your tastes are.  If you're a lover of fresh fish, definitely try the screaming orgasm, it is so yummy.   This place would be 5 stars if it was just slightly cheaper. While the fish is definitely good, I've also had a ton that's better quality for the same prices. And I guess that is I Love Sushi's fatal flaw: it has, ever so slightly, over-priced itself.  The prices are about average for a sushi place, but definitely not on the cheap side. If you're the kind of person who has sushi multiple times per week, you're better off finding a slightly less expensive place. For the occaisional sushi night, though, this place is perfect and you will leave happy.

JnK6FuYQFo5MSyfuHGKtNQ.text: I'm not a sushi fan but decided to give it another try. First time coming here by the way. Very friendly service. Restaurant was full but food was brought to our table in a timely manner. Food was great! I was getting food here and there and picking on everyone's plate in my table and it was good lol.

H9iJ8b5MYp6RJKauHVCmsQ.text: Had the burning your stomach roll and it was enjoyable.  Difficult to tell the quality of the sushi since there was so much sauce and mixed with other items but definitely tasty.

KsqOnMjUrLOBupxk4JDKig.text: This place has the best Sushi in town. There's usually a little bit of a wait on the weekends, but it's so worth it! My favorites: The Screaming Orgasm & the Japanese Lasagna!

JlBvRYHyQ98nvOoK5AgNYw.text: One of my favorite places to go for Sushi! Service is always great, food is always amazing! Some of the best Sushi in town!

yZKPcc_QyUx0tzeUoikkWw.text: Seriously the BEST sushi I have ever had - and the only sushi where I completely refuse to use Soy Sauce and Wasabi.  We always start with the Screaming Orgasm, then onto Tastes Like My Ex Girlfriend and finally Gary's special.  Sitting at the sushi bar is a fun experience, especially if you get the sushi chefs to do Saki Bombs complete with loud singing.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!

_fotCJL6CfCVfR4iA2LZqg.text: The BEST sushi spot in Vegas, without a doubt, and I have had aloooot of sushi just about everywhere in the 13 years I've lived here. The fish is always FRESH, the service is exceptional, the food is always flavorful and consistently satisfying, and I could go on and on because everything is just EXCELLENT!   I Highly recommend I Love Sushi to all of my friends, family, co-workers and even complete strangers. It's just that good.   Speaking of which, I'll probably head over there tomorrow. I'm due for a screaming orgasm, nabeyaki udon and a kiss of fire roll. Yum!

rZOcxVWg6ugd-ptYMjA_xA.text: One of the best sushi places in Vegas. Love the oyster shooter.

vQVJx7_8wFjPWTabBtGVnw.text: The food is fantastic and the staff is very friendly and accommodating! We dine almost once a week and have had good experiences!

Mhui90Xuqq8yJaBiXeT0MA.text: Like sushi? You better get down here and give this place a try.. The atmosphere is great. They have some of the best sushi at this place with the wildest names..  Every time I go here I like to try different rolls. I'll give just about anything a try once.. I like to order the what's your name and crunch roll. The xxx is also great.. My wife swears by there avacado roll since she doesn't like fish..  Every time I go here I have a great time except for my wallet, that's the only thing that hurts after this place...

7edKFnq43LlwKIW2KuL0xA.text: I've been coming here for over two years now and it's always consistent. You can find me here once a week usually Saturday nights. A couple of our favorites are Sexy Time, Double D, Frankie Special and Gary Special. Try it, you won't be disappointed!

2lv7j9hJmXuv6DDBgnU8pg.text: I love this place.  This is the best place around.  Good food and the service is outstanding.   Try the Kitchen Sink , it's awesome!

zCiKUvCg1S94r-vRzNuyzg.text: Hands down the best sushi in Henderson.  Quality sushi has been coming out of this place for years.   Always consistent.  Great, friendly service.   The manager is always super nice.  Best deals on sashimi in LV.

y0hqE9VjOGqVeMUBqqjx_Q.text: Absolute favorite place for sushi.  Visited 3 times and loved it every time.  No shortage of options, everyone will find something they like.  Best experience is at the bar where you can banter with the chefs.  Meat-less, rice-less, fried, raw, saucy, plain, all kinds of options and everything is good. Kiss of Fire, Bam Bam, Sushi Nachos, Screaming Orgasm, Who's Your Momma, and more and more.

YUyqjQRAeTsLpPxlekfv2A.text: Hands down my favorite sushi spot in town. The sashimi is fresh and the service is great. My only tip is that they tend to over sauce some of their rolls so it's a good idea to ask for the sauce on the side.

Qu-u1xGFZCq73uT_Yy7uUg.text: This is my favorite sushi place, period. Since first coming here 2 years ago, everywhere else I go for sushi is almost disappointing in comparison. The rolls are large and the fish is fresh. The waitresses wear kimonos which is super cute and are always friendly.   My personal favorite roll is the Kiss of Fire. The Japanese Lasagna is also a must try.

HhyNucecIgIHBDnEqF1DEw.text: Terrible. I'm surprised the reviews of this place are so good. The rolls tasted like mayonnaise. Straight up mayo. No rice, no fish, no nothing. I politely told the waitress and she could have cared less. Only come here if you want mayo with a side of rice. Gross.

9uI4TPaINNRGTXumWyt37g.text: Pretty dang good!  They have so many rolls with really funny names. Personally, the "I love my ass roll" is one of my favorites.

SVjFShjTR0DSxGf4RWzfOw.text: The two best rolls on planet earth: Somethings Wrong #69 & I Love My Ass.  I also really enjoyed the Screaming Orgasm =-)

2yCnBGDDR6I-dNDACciVdQ.text: My husband and I moved to Vegas 4 months ago from FL. We have been searching for sushi like this since we lived on the west coast of FL! We lived on the east coast of FL for 9 years and we had a sushi joint that we loved. They served a spicy crab roll, which is NOT a complicated roll but we have not been able to find a single sushi place that served this roll in 2 years. . .until we went to I Love Sushi last night! This place is our new go to sushi joint. We had the Jackpot Special, spicy crab roll and eel and tuna sushi. The red tuna filets were as fresh and yummy as you can get. The rolls were fantastic and the service was superb. I'm pretty sure that the sushi chefs have "I Dream of Genie" powers because as soon as we ordered, our rolls were on the table made exactly as we ordered them. The prices are in line with what we're used to paying and the menu has a good variety of choices. We'll definitely be back. . .and it's absolutely worth drive to Henderson from the Strip.

J_eY3mLqAd8tHZ8pZVXYEw.text: Hmm....what can I say?  I LOVE SUSHI, but not at this place....  The quality of the sushi was great here, but the prices were just TOO much for what you get. I ordered the Lisa Hand Roll, my friend ordered the "I Love My Ass" roll, and Theresa B. ordered the Orgasm one. All tasted great, but it really wasn't enough food for the three of us...our bill came to about $70....  We got 6 pieces of the Lisa Hand Roll, about 6 pieces for the I LOVE MY ASS roll, and a big mess of seared tuna in a mustard sauce...as well as a waitress recommended Korean Black Raspberry wine bottle ($15)...which really tasted like red wine, and didn't fave well with my friends...so we took it home...(shhh!!!)...  The ambiance was pretty nice. It reminded me of a place I went to in Santa Monica called Sushimon...  (Of course this place is Korean owned! I seriously only know one Sushi place that is owned by Japanese...or I think it is...?!)

aZzpEyUz9IyVeFQSLcMljQ.text: The fish really is incredibly fresh and consistently high-quality.  The price is also very reasonable.  Also the rolls are, over all, pretty traditional.   Overall, I like the place.  It's a good neighborhood joint.  It is a great place that will never let you down.

cR2mbGL6KcToOcQLJXUfug.text: Not bad sushi.  My husband and I went there about 7:30 on a Friday and got in within 5 minutes, even though the restaurant was quite busy.  We got the Vegas (I know a strange thing for locals to get!) boat for 2 and a caterpillar roll.  I thought it was a bit pricey ($47 for 2); however, the portions were generous.  The two layers of beef in the beef teriyaki made it worth.  Not bad.  More than generous for two!

8v9ionhpB_2ek6BQDmk8XA.text: I love I Love Sushi! Their prices are very reasonable and their service is outstanding. They are attentive without being pushy, and your glass never comes close to being empty. I had a dinner special with beef rib eye teriyaki and tonkatsu. The rib eye was perfectly cooked and tender, the tonkatsu was breaded and fried so it wasn't overly crisy, and the pork was juicy. The salad, miso soup, and gyoza that was included was excellent as well. The coolest thing about their dinner special was their tempura rice. I have never seen anything like it and i was pleasantly surprised when i bit into it. The rolls my GF ordered were tightly rolled and filled with delicious raw cuts of fish and the sashimi she ordered was nicely cut and very fresh.   It doesn't get any better that I Love Sushi for your sushi fix in vegas. The only thing that could possibly make this place better is an "all you can eat" option.

rig32VapA0o8IsQO9NEVOg.text: **********Edit 4/28/08  just came here again over the weekend and i had to bump it to 5 stars!  the service was great and our waitress was so attentive.  Though i though i had given up forever on sushi, i was wrong.  They have some pretty inventive rolls  like, "who's your mama?" "who's your pimp?" "whats your ex-wife?" funny names like that.  The chefs are all young, which doesnt mean anything, but i cant hep but wonder if they helped in the sushi naming. The bento box lunch specials are very reasonable, stating at $7.95.  comes with salad, miso, rice, a little pouch of something filled with sweet rice, sweet tofu (i think), and two pot stickers. anyways...probably the only sushi place ill return to when i come here again.   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  good sushi, tempura and teriyaki.  i would be more elaborate, but for sushi night my mom wanted to go here and i didnt...so at no fault of their own, i was in no good mood.  I ordered tempura which was average.  My brother ordered teriyaki chicken, which he enjoyed very much.  My mom got sushi, and then we all split a spider roll, which i found to be very tasty.  minus a star because the service was so so...had to wait for some time for our drinks to be refilled, though it was a busy night and somewhat loud...

dkyERQ074e_ktpBb0m3jsQ.text: Huge menu. Something for everyone. Lots of seating, but the seats along the walls are best. Host has great specs. Real busy so when the waitress finally comes order everything you will ever want. If you sit at the bar the sushi chef closest to the front is abrupt, engaging, and hilariously inappropriate. The chefs love to cat call fine honeys that walk in. Loud and cool. You'll hear people having sake-bombs. Not AYCE. Gourmet rolls can be greasy. I have too many favorite rolls to list. Parking usually is a pain. Bring your white friends. They will feel comfortable because their brethren are primary clientele. Lots of things to look at so if you have nothing to say to your food companion it will not be weird. Be ready to wait forever for your check.

SsE88S3nA4UdfKA5k5MIOw.text: This place is amazing.  Every year in August when I'm in LV for a weekend convention-like outing about 50 of us go there late afternoon and spend a couple of hours sharing their amazing rolls.  How they manage to handle such a large rowdy bunch, I have no idea, but we love it.    The rolls are unusual and very yummy, the sushi and sashimi is also good but it's the rolls that make this place unique.

UoUazHLsbvYVsojxOAl7yw.text: This is our favorite sushi place. Try the John Holmes Roll, the Who's Your Daddy Roll, and the I Love Sushi Roll and this will become your favorite as well.

XGJKrjVNs8_IgXDeN_227g.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas! I promise!

QbyLlnZqQfm26DBbcZFfRw.text: Henderson is such an interesting place - that being said if you're there and want Sushi, they won't disappoint.  Be aware if you bring young children here because a bunch of the rolls are named after sexual positions and experiences lol. Good place to spend a birthday for sure :)

U34yY2yJzT7GQbuW8mON9A.text: This review is long overdue! Sitting here wondering which is the best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas with the freshest fish. Hands down I have to say that I love Sushi takes the cake when it comes to quality and quantity. Although it is a bit pricey this place is definitely one of the best in town. They are definitely known for their outrageous names and service. I've come here many times for a causal dining experience, a girl's night out, and a group event. Each time I was never disappointed. If your are in Vegas and want to take a look at how the locals live....take a drive to I love Sushi.  The only bad thing I would have to say is I don't like the location, it's a bit far up South going towards Anthem. I'd prefer a centrally located place, but I guess that's just the way the cookie crumbles....

sP2sV3QhzkQe_VPE3SayFw.text: My favorite sushi restaurant ever. Really fresh fish, the yellowtail sashimi melts in your mouth. A very fun creative menu and the chefs are awesome.

eA-8Tk7pAW9nOLHm0w1sRg.text: I love... I Love Sushi!  We have been enjoying our neighborhood sushi bar for many years.  It is always packed - which is a tell-tale sign of how good the food is.  My favorites made special for me... Spicy Yellowtail with brown rice, a big dot of Sriracha and fresh jalapenos on each piece -yummm =)) I also love the Screaming Orgasm- no rice.  My kids have been eating yellowtail since they could eat solid food- thanks to I love sushi. I would highly recommend this sushi bar. Plus the owners and sushi chefs are really cool.

usGgnaqHJ1DGCRDo5FwSkQ.text: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME place!! I just can't say enough.   A buddy of mine who lives out here showed me one of two spots where the locals come for some incredible sushi without the outrageous price on the strip.   The interior is amazing.  I felt like I was transported back in time to a Japanese Tea House. I didn't realize how big it was.   I tried the Kiss of Fire (they warned me several times of how hot it was).  Incredible and very flavorful (Having a taste of the exotic and spicy), I didn't flinch.  My buddy had a couple rolls that I tried and I have to say it was damn good.  I can't say enough about this place.  Staff, Service, ambience.  Great place for a date.  Get out of the main casino strip and try the local spots if you can.  You'll save change and try some amazing rolls and Sashimi that's hard to beat.

Un4wtfMYRIfLpQUPyqzXog.text: I must say, this place is surprisingly good!  I definitely would go back!  I can always tell a decent sushi restaurant by their uni, and their uni was DELICIOUS and FRESH.  yum yum yum.  I also had their yellowtail sushi, salmon sushi, hamachi kama, shrimp lover roll, and a sex on the beach.  All of the above were DELISH.  The salmon was whatever, but the yellowtail was really good.  The sex on the beach roll was awesome as well.  They have a wide array of rolls that can suit anyone's cravings.  The service was good, the environment/ambience was good, and I had a really good time there.  Definitely worth trying out people!

u1jXObgT7gmy56W0ZIDmbA.text: I could eat at I love Sushi every day of the week.  Seriously.  Everything I've tried has been fresh and so delicious.  My faves are the Double D roll, yellowtail/scallion roll, and the grilled salmon collar.  The sashimi salad and tuna tataki salad are also really good (and huge!).  The place is in a random shopping center with a dry cleaners and a Taco Bell, but don't let that throw you off.  This is one really great sushi restaurant!

6lxvCBf5rWbDb52EV1Rh5Q.text: The Place: Clean, Casual The Service: Friendly  The Food: Good  This place has a good atmosphere, but I don't think it makes up for the quality of the sushi. Don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad by any means, but it's not Great / Memorable either.

YEedkHN2nsFZ-Ime5ekrjA.text: Favorite sushi place in the Vegas area.  Great rolls, quite a large list of them, the sushi is good, not great.  Place is filled with regulars, so you know the food is good.  Never have eaten off the menu, can't stay away from the sushi.  I love my ass roll, sexy time roll are both unique and very good.

6iKHe0CGqE9LkjxR1uFVJA.text: I have never been to a sushi restaurant I love more than this place.  It's hands down my favorite sushi restaurant so far.  The ambiance is good, the food is fantastic, the prices are fair, the service is great.  I always try something new when I go and have yet to be disappointed but I always get the sweet shrimp- they serve it with the head fried.  Not all places do that, in particular sushi buffets, which I'm not very fond of.

KGMNiuCl4Evza2lrMA5IBw.text: I came here for the first time with my girlfriend and overall we had a great experience. One of my favorite food is sushi and I have been to many sushi joints. What makes this place awesome is how friendly is the staff. As soon you sit down at the sushi bar all the sushi chef greet you like they know you even though they never seen you in their lives. The chef recommended the Kiss of Fire and it was the best sushi roll I ever ate. Its not AYCE and it's a bit pricey but the fun festive atmosphere makes this place worth coming back to!!

f-qoSyeE-ORLCw46fGKIag.text: Just a quick review: For solid sushi, this place is great. They don't participate in AYCE, like most local spots do--this is the place you want to go to for a fun, energetic environment and very good quality fish! The service has always been spot on and the dishes are great. Being that sushi can get very pricey, I typically order one of the Entree's and a couple rolls, to share. The Entree's are very reasonably priced and they bring you a lot of food. My favorite roll is the Joe's Special! A MUST!!!!

PfQyofBxWTAwG8QLEV03aw.text: A great choice for Sushi. The product moves. The help is great and the prices are fair. I love the "Threesome" or the "Super white fish" don't hesitate to eat here.

AP98fBB_Eb1bSOripG5WAA.text: I've been to many sushi restaurants around town and this has got to be the best one thus far. Great service, fresh fish, and a relaxing ambience. Always a returning customer!

kzED0pdCi6b168RJ5NkFqw.text: I have been here twice and I think it is great. I Love Sushi has a wide assortment of rolls and fish. The quality is good and the menu is creative. The truly great aspect of this restaurant is the attentive sushi bar staff and their relationship with customers. They are fast and like to chat with the patrons and suggest new things based on the types of sushi you like. We were sat at the sushi bar surrounded by regulars who knew the sushi chefs by name. A satisfying meal of only rolls, sashimi, and nigiri was about $50 for 2 people. I was expecting it to be more in the $65 range considering the quality of the meal. I Love Sushi is a solid value for sushi enthusiasts. merchantcircle.com/busin...

Xdi7sIdD7A1n4ursNlzc5A.text: The best sushi rolls in Henderson! Try the Taste Like My Ex-Girlfriend. Awesome!

tjxBswxVJM5rwOaD40ZbMA.text: Old staple in the hood, great atmosphere. always high energy and hard to not run into someone you know every time. All the guys @ the sushi bar are fun and personable. good sushi great variety.  Always finish with the oyster shooter.

Zn5kg2sm0ihCXviHKAVGsw.text: We love this place.  My husband and I take all of our out of town relatives here.  They have a huge selection of rolls, and sake, as well as bento boxes for people such as my husband who don't eat sushi.  My favorite is the Shawn Roll; so good!

P5ptlyiCZ-kKpV_3BW41zg.text: Hands down, no arguement, THE BEST SUSHI I HAVE EVER HAD! My husband and I went to Australia last year and went to a sushi restaurant thinking "ok, this has to be great, I mean we're in Australia!" Mmmm...yeah.....no. Didn't even come close to the amazing sushi at I Love Sushi. I have been all over town and tried other sushi places and I always come back to this place. Keep in mind, it can get really crazy and packed on Friday/Saturday nights so be ready for some lines and loudness. Some of my favorite sushi chefs have left recently but there are still some great guys there....Love ya Boom Boom! I highly recommend you give them a try.

KKzuTLD2Y9kcvr4MGuwwLA.text: I have been eating at I love sushi for years.  They have really fresh fish that makes the seafood experience overall... non threatening.  Pretty much everyone I've ever taken loves it.  It can get expensive if you're hungry (or in my case, typically thirsty!) but it is a great place to do sushi at.  And, their sushi menu is actually descriptive.  The sushi chefs are a blast and almost every time I go, the owner is diligently making sure the customers are getting stellar service.   Their cucumber salad in usually excellent and they have a full restaurant menu for your non sushi savvy pals.  My favorites are the baked green mussel, kiss of fire, and the sundevil.

RMNui8MxjRI307-bvvCFNA.text: Best Sushi in Vegas IMHO! Service is great sushi is even better. They have around 90 different sushi rolls you can order with outrageous names. If you are craving sushi and have not been this is difinitely worth a drive

ULJcArmY8qQrKJDIREVOcQ.text: I Love Sushi has a very nice layout with a bar in the middle of the restaurant surrounded by tables and booths. All the servers wear   kimonos which is a very nice touch.  The menu is overwhelming with so many choices. Luckily I was with someone who had already been here, so she made some recommendations. The first think to come out was the screaming orgasm. I have had quite a few screaming orgasms, but this one in my opinion was the best I had so far. Because of that we ordered a second "Pop". They offer 2 sizes, so the second one wasn't a big O.  We all order some sushi-mi, which was very fresh.  The roll we ordered was a 4x4 no rice from the deep fried section. This was very tasty and I will probably order it again.  The service was excellent and everyone was very friendly.

8TPAPDT8iqotV-YKAYxmzw.text: I do enjoy the more traditional sashimi and simple spicy tuna hand rolls - but there was something fun about reading the menu at I Love Sushi.  Makes ordering fun.  I loved that the waitresses wore traditional kimonos.  And the fancy rolls were delightful.

NUap0ZarfRzOK3X72E0ZLA.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas. Screaming Orgasm and kiss of fire...yummm!!! I won't eat sushi anywhere else

4xFTHnETK1QDkNPWvDC0ZQ.text: Being from LA where they have a lot of good sushi joints it tool a while for me to find something good in Vegas but here it is at last. I have been going to I Love Sushi for about a year now and never have i had a bad experience. Its always busy so you know the food is always fresh. My favorite roll is I Love My Ass and Spring Mt Roll. Another good item is the Screaming Orgasms and i usually ask them not to sear the tuna I think its a lot better that way.

NK3h52bGgQVhRBBDJNefGg.text: im gonna give a bump here because my lunch on Friday of assorted sashimi was decadent...  maybe it was a fresh order, or maybe its like this all the time?  who knows, but everything was delicious and of excellent quality...  for reference, just basic sashimi orders...  tuna, salmon, albacore, yellowtail, and white fish...  had a piece of a spider roll and it too was also very yummy...  maybe it was the Kirin Light, maybe it was just getting off the road after a 4 hour sojourn to Sin City from LA, but id recommend I Love Sushi to those looking for decent dead fish off the beaten path.

NufkN6vNZgWcSspzd2ridA.text: Delish ... amazing options. .. highly recommend the screaming orgasm! very authentic, waitress dressed in kimonos & hot towels delivered on arrival :)

evjB7qMlhqBUO2_1tlgqCQ.text: I totally dug the enterior but that is where it stopped. The rolls all pretty much were the same rolls on the menu,but named different things,looked the same when they came out and were WAY over priced. I live downtown Vegas and drove here because I was on a date, I think I would be much better off at an all you can eat sushi joint on Flamingo,rather than drive to Timbucktoo and pay out the butt for mediocre sushi. The sushi chefs however were very entertaining while chugging booze with the people at the sushi bar and making everyones sushi. That was a plus with the entertainment there.

yPpG0N3xQOset6HiYQcrgw.text: Been here on several occasions and it's probably the best sushi in Las Vegas/Henderson. Great place to bring friends or family. Lots of delicious courses too in addition to awesome special rolls. Friendly staff and always a great time. Yumyum!

KXjJX2RrHkWcdQlEeLNh_A.text: Great sushi outside of the strip!!!! My wife and and I LOVE SUSHI. We tired the Jackpot, and Last Call.  Amazing!!!!!  Will be going back.

xWPnnTqRv-Y67jnpVde3dg.text: I Love Sushi is one of those local spots that are as good as it gets. It is not the flashiest or most expensive and it doesn't have a famous chef. It's just quality, consistent, and delicious. I didn't think I was going to give a 5 to anywhere for a while but when I started to try and pick it apart I couldn't really say anything bad about it. They are fast with their service, but not too fast. The dishes are always delivered exactly the same. The food quality is always very high. The fish is very fish. Prices are reasonable.  If there was a 4.5 stars I would have considered that one just because of the decorations. It is nice, but based on the volume and quality of the place, it could use a little facelift to reflect the True quality of who it is. It's not bad, its clean, its just a little old and tired looking. But that would not distract from going.  If I want American style sushi, this is the spot. If I want more authentic Japanese sushi I always go to Miko's Izakaya. Two totally different styles. Both best in class.

Fr_Qf5JMEzC4C2JbKut5mg.text: Omg! I love sushi is fantastic.  Best  sushi place ever. I can't wait to go there next time. I have been going there for many years they are alway consistent whit quality and taste. My all time favorite there is crazy horse , Japanese lasagna

yhPetF2OVXHbcAUFWkAe_Q.text: What a surprise, driving into Vegas from LA and craving sushi we turned to Yelp and found this place.  Everything was really great, fresh and tasty sushi.  We will go again.  The building is in a strip mall near a residential neighborhood so dont expect great decor.

fVB3fq-ExRoJ_i8bPJZORg.text: This is one of my favorite places to get sushi in town. I have been going here for years and love that there is no "all you can eat" option - just a diverse menu full of high-quality fish. The chefs are trained well and present the dishes in a nice fashion. I love that they give you free edamame and cucumber salad when you sit at the bar. My favorite rolls are the Tempura Roll and Japanese Lasagna. I ordered the Boom Boom Nipple Special last night and it was pretty good, however I was not really into the fish mix tempura that went along with that. Other than that, I always have a superb experience dining here. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Boom boom nipple special!

TsczNFX-pdh4QEMRgKa9Jw.text: Talk about "under-rated"! This place was great! Probably going to come back tomorrow for breakfast! The Crunchy Roll was good. Didn't find the California Roll right away on the menu so just asked for it! Chef knew what I wanted and it was fabulous! I am such a traditionalist!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Authentic!

tOz2km0nCBbcy6lJwl0vTA.text: Great sushi at I Love Sushi. Love the atmosphere of the restaurant, great seating options weather alone or with a group. I'm shorting them one star because they're a little spendy ... I'd eat their more often if they'd shave a dollar off here and there. Either way, definitely recommend.

m7BzP6ja3iUQCC6NPhxg4A.text: First time I walked in to I Love Sushi was about four years ago and the sushi chefs yelled "James Dean, hi James Dean!" at me. Now, I've been called a lot of things in my life, mostly Macauley Culkin, but I have NEVER been called James Dean for the indisputable fact that I plain and simple don't look like the Rebel Without A Cause. However, after doing a few shooters and sake bombs with the chefs, I truly did feel like Dean and we joked and joked about it until I walked to my car and let someone else drive so I didn't actually end up like the late actor (faceplanted into the pavement.)  Joking aside, this sushi is the best in town. I've never been disappointed by a visit and every time I try something new and have a new favorite roll. Some of my favorite menu items include the Bonzai Roll and the Yellowtail Sashimi. The flavors of each are top notch and so fresh.   Lunch specials are very affordable and include a buttload of food. Stop reading this already and go find out why we all love I Love Sushi!

DUo92q871CetzaxM3b1aMw.text: Excellent, as always. We eschewed the sushi today, and explored the rest of the menu. David had the yakisoba, and i had the tonkatsu. Very, very good!

dtjuoCrnwueAO7S51bUvug.text: ILS is a great place to enjoy some sushi.  I went on a Friday night with six other people.  This was not a problem as reservations were made.  Good thing...this was a bumping place.  The parking slot was slammed and I was excited to people watch.  The people watching thing never happened as I discovered that there were many sushi options that were rice free (not sashimi) and thus my head was buried in plates of wonderful food.

Df1XXTqUTb6ypS5PX2TBDA.text: The sushi here is delicious, and the atmosphere is fun, as well. Not sure how I feel about waitresses wearing kimonos, though:)  I usually like to stick with nigiri (tuna, salmon) and basic rolls like spicy tuna and salmon skin. This place makes everything meld together so perfectly, I always try a new roll with a porn-inspired name when I'm here. (Tastes like my ex-girlfriend, anyone?)   Solid place.

A-MMTXSr0pEWwnhPdtJL5w.text: Delicious! My husband and I were recommended to I Love Sushi and went for our anniversary. The fish was fresh and all of the rolls were perfect! We will definitely be returning!!

HDd_6dQv5qOBby_P-VxkMQ.text: The location and exterior of this place don't seem promising (behind a gas station) but don't let that fool you. This place is quite a hidden gem. Great sushi and bento boxes. I'm particularly hooked on their fish tempura and beef teriyaki which are on their lunch special. Sushi chefs are always pleasant.

9Xr03CSuwZGxfmj2CmgSAg.text: This is hands down, my favorite sushi restaurant! My favorite items include the: Screaming Orgasm, Burning Your Stomach roll and the Jackpot roll, just to name a few. I've been going here for years. There's no all you can eat option, but the food is just so amazing!

slxW_ZKRfL4qB5cBNMeVTA.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant. I go here with my family probably once a month. So good! I recommend Tastes Like My Ex-girlfriend and Something Wrong # 69. Nummers.  The service is fast. Sometimes almost too fast. Hard to explain that one... I guess sometimes it's nice to have the rolls brought out more gradually.  I highly recommend this place.

SBzmAwdgeuUCjsK9kH7pBA.text: I usually don't venture down eastern because I live more west of Las Vegas, but I had some family staying at Homewood Suites down the road so we were searching for somewhere close to grab some dinner. They didn't know what they wanted and were just skimming through Yelp when we saw the reviews for this place. We got there just as they were opening and were greeted nicely and seated right away. The menu seemed like it had a lot of options and even for my aunt, who isn't a fan of seafood, she was able to find something for herself. We all seemed to try something we usually don't get just to see how we liked it and we were very pleasantly surprised at how delicious everything was. The staff was also very friendly and we loved how the ladies wore geisha outfits. We soon noticed that the place filled up quick so it must be a hit with others too! Thanks for the great service and even better food!

1Shw3QhMe7U65iHPDrYUyQ.text: Best sushi of my life go here ALL THE TIME! You know somewhere has good sushi when they don't have all you can eat! "Screaming O" with chefs special sauce is amazing ! Service is typical for a sushi place they all drop the food fast and refill you drinks often. Definetly go here ! Amazing amazing amazing

xHNMER-ozwnnFyZDlRJQww.text: If you don't want the usual "All you can eat" sushi then this is the place for you. The rolls are very flavorful and taste delicious.

cTb4ler5a5X_4Naq5szznQ.text: Love this place, owner is amazing, fish is over the top great! Strongly suggest trying!

oGaC5syLKZbLwWh6VbPCqQ.text: All of the rolls we had were amazing! Had the California Roll, Threesome, and Tiger Roll.  All were great! Especially because I like sushi but I don't want like shark fin eel in my sushi.  #whitegirlproblems.  Anyway, really enjoyed the place. Had great service, super fast, and such crazy names for the dishes :D

mVnT5cVgCLYP-5KtMWmD6Q.text: Love love this place! Screaming O is the best in town! And also the bom boms special roll! A must have. The game tonight was awesome! Thank you for letting us hang out after we paid our check to watch the overtime!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Screaming O!!!  Best in town

wHcbxGPWOKIgZqqsavSBQw.text: The food was amazing and the Sushi Chef's were great to interact with. Worth the trip off the strip for the food.

T3f3OkB_cJOZQU_uU6MUhw.text: I love ,I Love Sushi in the Henderson location ! I've been going there for years since I live nearby.The food is always fresh and consistent !! Always !! The price is right and not overly expensive! Love the wait staff and overall the ambiance of the  Japanese restaurant !Whenever I go there I feel like I'm back in Japan.The waitstaff are so very nice and efficient.I have no complaints whatsoever, the owner of this place should be very proud of  their employees! Five stars for this place!

BEd81yxTuU9LYQErkUAdcg.text: I'm a biiiiiig sushi lover and was really not so impressed. Sushi was pretty good I'd say, but not worth 16 bucks a roll.  All the sushi was overpriced and Overwhelmed by the sushi menu. I asked our waitress many questions and she couldn't answer half and the other half she was just look at me and walk away. Was impressed by the cucumber salad though!

wDL15tyk7ubt9K30ciFt3A.text: So many amazing choices here! The menu is huge! My favorite was the Kitchen Sink, but everything I tried was amazing. Super fresh and good prices too.  We sat at the sushi bar and all the sushi came out super quick. All the staff was very friendly, efficient and attentive.  I Love Sushi is officially on my list of "must eat at" places in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kitchen Sink roll. Get this. It&#39;s awesome. So much spicy deliciousness.

wUXPChfFxlBFvLvsZN1F9Q.text: Delicious! Speedy Friendly  Highly recommend this place   Alligator and Lobster rolls were fantastic

HPq-CfSAqJp3VWx_WSKBqw.text: My absolute favorite sushi spot in Vegas. So lucky that i live 5 minutes away from this restaurant. I frequent this spot so much that they know that i like to sit at the bar and they already know my order when i sit down. How's that for service. Lucky for them i am a creature of habit. I order the spicy edamame right off the bat. Soooo good, and spicy! A Screaming orgasm is a MUST! i can handle a small on my own or I'll order a large to split with my date. Joe is my favorite sushi guy when i get there at night. If i go too early I'll miss him, but the other guys are pretty attentive and friendly. I always see someone i know there so i know this place has to be pretty popular. Every once and a while i will make a friend there. To all you newbies, i guarantee this will be your new hot spot! But prepare to wait for a table if you show up during prime time which is usually around 7. This place is poppin ny then. Totally worth the wait though.

MMUb814W6QUV9KmvbZ-Xxg.text: You'll walk in to I Love Sushi feeling like you are in Tokyo. A lot of wonderful selections on their menu. We ordered several roll specials and everything was amazingly delish! The sushi is nice and fresh. Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas for sushi.

oU_zt-jtPPDkSis5Hcihsw.text: This place is amazing! By far my favorite sushi place in henderson/las Vegas! The owner James is awesome and very personable! Great environment and service! The screaming orgasm is AMAZING!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Scream Orgasm

tM1MaEd3spkOkRH3h1tk0g.text: Hands down best sushi in town! I'd recommend the Gary or DC roll are my favorites. Fresh and always excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

fo1lxIWEFUW57U9DoIjriQ.text: I can see why the locals like this place. The service is good and there is a wide variety of options - sushi and non-sushi. Just note its Americanized Japanese food - not Japanese Japanese, if you know what I mean. The winner of the night was the teriyaki halibut that was steamed. We were warned that it would take a while to cook and it was worth it. The sauce was on the sweet side, but the fish was surprisingly light and not overcooked. Scallop roll was the best, poke was passing and the shrimp tempura in the caterpillar roll was pretty greasy, and again had really sweet sauce. I have to admit I blushed a bit as I read the sushi menu while sitting across from my grandma. Screaming orgasm roll? Really? Good thing it was dark so she probably couldn't read the menu or see my red cheeks.

FgmYXGxzBQoiwe9cvF4fPg.text: Wow... I cannot even begin to describe how fresh and amazing this sushi is here at I Love Sushi! I've tried so many sushi restaurants here in vegas and this one has changed my view about sushi... The only negative thing I have to say is that it is expensive, cheapest roll was $9 and they don't have all you can eat... But since the service and sushi were outstanding, the bill doesn't even matter!  I'll definitely be back !

nROfM60DsowHoxtiwmVezQ.text: Amazing service! The tuna tataki salad is my fav but there is a huge variety of fancy rolls as well as more traditional fare. I have also had great take-out experiences from here as well (fast and carefully packaged).

__oH5Z1wuxDGNK4S-N8wtQ.text: What a great place to come have sushi when you're in the area. We drove from downtown Las Vegas just to come here.  Loved the I love sushi special, screaming orgasm, and the yellow tail.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

s4Ti8zAr-uKjJn5swcrwoQ.text: Very friendly staff, welcoming immediately. comfortable decor and reasonably priced. 4 of us celebrate in for a late lunch, 9 rolls plus appetizer came out to about 25$ each and I was stuffed to the gills. A great variety. will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Monkey Roll (left), XXX (right)

fYKDB-OswRNlctmfgf3i1A.text: Holy cow. I was recently given a Zagat Book and was taking a trip to Vegas so I figured why not check out a reasonable priced Zagat rated restaurant. This place has made me a believer of Zagat. First the service is incredible. They are attentive, fast (but not too fast), and overall professional. The decor was super cute with the waitresses wearing kimonos and authentic attire. But that's all fine and dandy. The food. The sushi. Holy cow. So good. We got...  Tastes like my ex girlfriend  Double d's Bam bam The kitchen sink Burn your stomach   The kitchen sink was my favorite but they were all incredible. We probably go to sushi twice a month and are always trying different places but this is hands down the best sushi I've ever had and for an incredible price as well!! Next time we are in Vegas we will definitely be going back!!

PSBMoKBFOwHDnEPpJ7Qb4g.text: Love the ambiance of this place . Ordered the crunch roll and the sashimi cocktail! Sooooo goood !!!

_aiDxtzN-2QCynMxUjW0Pg.text: Love their sushi, awesome,  Good service, we always eat at the sushi bar.  Unique and fun names to some of their signature rolls.

GeuJMl8mfNFygY4CYysWBg.text: I admit it I'm a sushi snob!  I do not enjoy just any old plain sushi roll.   First it must be fresh (this goes without saying),  and second I like a little creativity in my rolls.  Well this place delivers!  The menu is extensive and full of lots of unique choices.   Pretty much everything I have tried is delicious and awesome.  Having tried many sushi restaurants in town I Love Sushi is without a doubt my favorite. The place is always hopping and the service is pretty good.  Some of my recommended rolls to try are Shaun's Special and Ryan's Special.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ryan&#39;s Special

2IzPo8rE8iLgfawGMsBaXw.text: Where do you go for some off strip sushi to die for? "I Love Sushi" of course. I didnt know what to expect especially from a place called I Love Sushi, let alone it being located in a strip mall. Boy we're we surprised. This place was huge and had about 20 sushi chefs working behind the counter. The place was packed on a Tuesday night. I think the place seats about 200 easily. Wow. The food was awesome. AWESOME. The rolls were about $12-15 each but boy were they worth it. I guess one of the gimmicks of this place is the names of the rolls. Screaming Orgasm, Taste Like My Ex Girlfriend, Fat A$$ Special, and so forth. Regardless about the name, the flavor was top top notch. This is definitely one of my favorite places to eat at. Even though the names and description mention "special chef sauce", they are all different sauces that are highly recommended by the sushi chefs. I read somewhere there was a total of 81 chefs that are employed there. Here's a list of rolls we had:  (Check out the pictures I added to the I Love Sushi page. Warning: May cause a craving for some Sushi!)  Jackpot Roll - I dont remember the exact description but its a fried tempura roll with spicy mayo sauce. Spider Roll - Soft Shell Crab Screaming Orgasm - Seared Tuna in chef special sauce Fat Ass Roll - Tuna, salmon, yellowtail, white tuna, crab meat, avocado, deep fried panko, spicy mayo, hot sauce & eel sauce. I Love Sushi Special - Spicy tuna & cucumber topped with tuna & spicy special sauce Double D roll - Raw Salmon and tuna on a roll and then into the yummy sauce Dragon Roll - Lotsa lotsa Unagi. Baked Scallop Mushroom

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Dragon Roll - Lotsa lotsa Unagi
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Double D roll - Raw Salmon and tuna on a roll and then into the yummy sauce
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. I Love Sushi Special - Spicy tuna &amp; cucumber topped with tuna &amp; spicy special sauce

VPy713kFfAwbkNrrqvQVeg.text: I love yelp.  I wish people would be stingier with the stars.  Four stars means I have nothing bad to say even if I do.  This place is great.  They have apps that are different for a sushi joint, specialty rolls that stand out and atmosphere that is cool, lit well and not so typical in the Japanese storefront feel.  The owner will occasionally don the Elvis garb which slays me.  This is a very good restaurant, a great place to turn a newbie on and it has sex appeal.

-SAHWolIzj_9TyFOjz_mGw.text: It's good. Proportions and quality of food were regular. I enjoyed the decor and how the servers were dressed to represent the Japanese culture. Had the unagi bowl which came with a salad and the jackpot roll. After all the sushi I ate that day, every roll started to taste the same (I had ayce sushi at the Kaya restaurant earlier) so I can't rave about any of their rolls in particular because none of them stood out and that's not a bad thing...I just couldn't find anything that stood out exceptionally to give this place 5 stars. Anyways, try their garlic edamame.

I have to say I find it irritating when yelpers focus too much on a restaurant's service, ambience, etc, because I'm food-centric: bad service is frustrating, but all is soon forgotten if the food blows me away. I guess that's why the waitress' failure to give us 3 menus was so vexing -- the fish at  I Love Sushi is of an ok-quality, but nothing to get your panties in a bunch about.   "I also find it annoying rather than cute when Sushi places give their rolls wacky names, like Double Doggstyle Breakup Sex Roll. But not because of the restaurant's failed attempts to shock and amuse, but because I have no fucking idea what kind of fish and ingredients make up a DDBS Roll.
