Go somewhere else."  Why can't Japanese food be more...JAPANESE????

Bd9yUcpHDIuubLSapbjP0Q.text: I absolutely love this place! Been going here for a few years now and never been disappointed. Great sushi, great service, and nice atmosphere. Some of my favorites are the screaming orgasm, threesome special, burn in your stomach, and tastes like my ex girlfriend. These are some I can remember but they really do have a great selection.  Would definitely recommend sushi lovers to try this place.

PWGZDqa9HTwKQ2N8TpeD5Q.text: Got takeout here last night for the first time. The reception lady was very friendly and the good was great! We had noodles, edamame, rice, veggie tempura, and three rolls for under $50. Everything was great!

vtEOI0fRkAkrUnrBwmD0tQ.text: Very high quality ingredients with great service. The atmosphere is fun if you sit at the bar, intimate if you sit in a booth, or great for families or parties at a table. My husband and I love this place. They will custom make anything, also.  Sake bomb, anyone? :-)

4DVAlBEmTkvXOTPPB3-Y-A.text: Mmmmmmmmmmm.  I miss having a large variety of sushi restaurants and rolls.   My kindred spirit took us to her favorite sushi joint in LV and I must say, it's delish.  They had so many rolls I could barely finish reading the list before our waitress came by to take our order.  The fish was fresh, the sauces were creative, and the custom rolls were executed wonderfully.  You will need to try the Kiss of Fire roll which is a combination of spicy fishes drenched in some spicy sauce then topped with a dot of sriacha and a jalapeno.  So good...Most importantly, the prices are wonderful.

Hpt-HKH-hBeOa9oadFr8Lg.text: Love this place. May be a little far from the strip but one of the best sushi places I been. Gotta get the stuffed tomato roll btw

_JlTKgOh3RhbbzebljyJ1w.text: I drive 25 miles across town at least three times a week passing 100+ other sushi restaurants.  I love for the Screaming O, Something Wrong 69, Jackpot Special, and Grand Canyon rolls.  The wait is never long, and if it were, it would be worth it.

7779POADs6p9mBc_oniUZg.text: This is my first time eating here! Been to different japanese place and this is second to none... Their food is very good with good ambience... Even though, this place is way far from where I live... im still going to drive just to eat here because their food is worth it... the staff are wearing japanese clothes, they are friendly and approachable.... They are very knowledgeable with the menu...

tHMHBYkOpX2WtXsQbjrvLw.text: I LOVE SUSHI SAYS IT ALL!!! I currently live in DC, but used to reside in Las Vegas, and fell in love with I Love Sushi. Screaming Orgasm is to die for! and "I hate my ex boyfriend" (or it might be girlfriend) is great as well. I love all the creative sushi's and names they are given. This joint is always on my mind, and I miss it soo much! I wish there was a "happy-go-lucky" sushi spot in DC like I Love Sushi.

s92thBUCpc2OFFN1hRgn9w.text: It's a party in your mouth.   I LOVELOVELOVELOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!! This is the best sushi I've ever had in my life. Everything about I Love Sushi is amazing, the sushi, miso soup, the restaurant, the menu, the sexual/hilarious names they think up for the sushi rolls (Tastes Like My Ex-Girlfriend, Screaming Orgasm, I Love My Ass, etc..), the waitresses, the chefs, the bar, the booths, the tables, the service, the prices, everything! I dream about their sushi and plum saki everyday. The softness of the rice, the way they pack in the many versatile ingredients that go into each roll, how at first bite you just sit back and realize that you've been missing out on a big chunk of life in food world. Mmm.. I can still taste it in my mouth.  The restaurant is lit just right to be romantic and bright enough to see what you're eating, who you're talking to, and occasionally check out the hot chef with the Japanese flag as a bandana behind the sushi bar (i love you, super sexy chef). The service is phenomenal, everyone working there is Japanese, even the waitresses, and I had to keep from laughing when our graceful, polite waitress who looks like she's never said a cuss word in her life repeated our order to us, "2 Screaming Orgasms, One roll of Tastes Like My Ex Girlfriend, one Ricky Roll and one roll of I Love My Ass with plum saki". It still makes me laugh just thinking about it.  I once drove from L.A. to Henderson, Nevada just to eat here. My absolute favorite roll is the Ricky Roll. I give this restaurant a bajillion stars, this place will definitely get you some, and I'm gonna dream about their sashimi tonight.

LmQ7zCD9JBEKS7-yR65QfQ.text: Service is always consistently top notch. We have dined here consistently over the past 4 years and they always rock. Fast service, delicious flavors, and friendly staff.

sseSMuaEecRmc5rppkrLYg.text: Still the best Sushi in Vegas, or Henderson. Fresh Fish, Creative Rolls.. Great Sushi Chefs...

pYhYcU4-mv29y0Mo559i1g.text: I've been on a weird sushi kick and I've been craving it everyday.  I Love Sushi is located near my home.  So every night this week, I've called in my order... I wish they had a drive thru.  Anyhow, I normally don't eat rolls, but I couldn't resist looking at their extensive list of over 80 rolls.  So I gave it a try... Each night, I picked a different one and was not disappointed.  They have some crazy names and mix of a lot of types of fish.  One of my favorites was Eddie's special that had both spicy tuna and spicy scallops on top of a crunch roll.  It was soooo good.  I also tried their amaebi and uni... on Monday, the pieces were small but by Friday the pieces were bigger and meatier.    Thank you I Love Sushi for supporting my sushi addiction.

SMdlUUogcBSMxCESamp4cw.text: The best ingredients in any sushi Ive had, I Love Sushi stands in a class of its own. Definitely check it out

qugVbXybjvTbK4cBCR2zGw.text: Sushi was fresh.  Portion was acceptable.   Nice ambience.  I am extremely pleased with the service.  The server(s) kept checking back on us multiple times.  When I visit my friend in Las Vegas again, I would definitely come again.

rgnQwPVoQnCe4MWFNhuDZw.text: love this place... best little sushi restaurant in LV... prices are good, chefs are great. they give you edamame, and a cucumber appetizer free which is always a plus. i hate penny pinching restaurants!  despite that this place is korean owned and mostly korean chefs, I DONT DISCRIMINATE GOOD ASS SUSHI!!!! fun environment... my fav chef is edwin... he will make special rolls depending on your taste or preference.  when you get to the menu its a little overwhelming. there is like 100 rolls on their sushi menu!   first off... THE UNI IS FRESHHHHHHHH! yellow, fluffy and sweet.  my bf really likes the "i love my ass roll". it is super white tuna and spicy tuna,soft shell crab with a special brown sauce... i think it is sesame w/ a hint of mustard seed.  super good... i also get the rolley rice bowl with uni and scallop. this is a masago rice bowl mixed with scallop and topped off with some fresh uni. its like a very fancy chirashi bowl.  i also really like the kanpai roll. it is a yellowtail roll, w/ shrimp tempura, avocado and a ponzu sauce. its raw and yummy.  i love this place. i frequent here at least once a week. highly recommended to others!

4OkSNxn3flX-RvgGBHhNDg.text: Best sushi in town with great service. They have somethjng for everyone. I just had the fat ass roll. Amazing! And large to where I didn't need another roll! Their baked green mussels are fantastic. The service is also very good. The waitress filled our drinks like 3 times each. The prices are a little more expensive but ur paying for good clean sushi. Rolls can range from $7-$15

-yaU-fEvDvpulBb78nVQOw.text: Yuck! I ordered kiss of fire sushi roll 2 nights ago. I have had this before here and it was always good, this time they literally dumped so much sauce on it that it was almost impossible to pick up the sushi with the chop sticks and it ruined the taste of it for myself and my daughter. The waitress would not leave me alone about it when I sent it back saying "is it too spicy?" I told her @ least 5 times "no, it is absolutely soaked in sauce and it sort of turned my stomach" I told her I did not want anything in place of it. Again, she was so pushy so I finally said "okay just give me the same sushi roll with the sauce on the side!" My Gosh! Enough was enough I told her no so many times, please leave me alone! Anyway, when the sushi roll came back with no sauce on it I wish I would have thought to take a photo of it. We both took one bite of it and could not take anymore. The sushi was far from fresh. Pale in color and tasted like old rotten fish. Needless to say we left the entire roll - paid our bill and will never return to "I love sushi" again. There is a sushi restaurant on every corner and I recommend you pass go on this corner. Not only do they NOT listen to their customers but when their sushi is getting old they obviously dump tons of sauce on it to mask the decaying taste. Yuck! Just thinking about it turns my stomach.

3oHhDq5CamB6WXsyLeBxNA.text: Tried this sushi for the first time. It is not an all you can eat. We order the salad screaming orgasm and few rolls ( menu of rolls is huge ) and it was fresh and delicious. The ambiance of this restaurant is nice and spacious. Service was a little bit slow but it was at the same time of the CES convention and the restaurant was packed. I will be back for sure next time i am in Henderson

x52d0q8whHCq9H-JuLOfDA.text: The best sushi place in Henderson.  They do not have all you can eat but that is because they use fresh raw fish and they do not use imitation crab. For the sushi lover this place is a must try. This is a hidden gem in town.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The best oyster shooter.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Howard&#39;s roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Howard&#39;s roll

DwsIU2PcFtD-vp0L2CAkDQ.text: This is one of my favorite place to eat. Friendly employees, great service and food always so good.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

z933NyCqPk_c52mwzC_s_w.text: Still my favorite sushi spot!! I love that every time you walk in, the owner is front and center waiting to welcome you. Staff is always helping each other, very friendly and it's always a great dining experience. The sushi is always on point!! Never had a bad experience and we go 2-3 times a mo almost 2 years now. Any time we have guests in town, that's the go-to restaurant just because it's the best of the best!!

SyevV12vtkYFfeGYEB1fKA.text: Best sushi I've had in Vegas / Henderson area! If you go to Vegas take a trip to Henderson and try this spot! You won't regret it. And it's not a super expensive spot either! Which makes you eat more and try new rolls. Fun spot

lena26_mgqVOgW22ZXyJXA.text: Really love this place. Definitely on the pricey side but the flavors are really great. New owner is very nice.  Favorite dishes are definitely he screaming orgasm and the kiss of fire roll. Unfortunately they don't offer all you can eat:(

tr0wkYAQ6qKtvs2v419VXg.text: I've lived here now approximately 10 months in Henderson, Nevada , But prior to moving here, We have visited Henderson several times and have had the honor to stop in for dinner at the restaurant. This place is Awesome. The names for some of the dishes will make you laugh out loud no kidding. The service is great hands down. When friends or family come to visit and they have a taste for sushi, We take them to enjoy " I Love Sushi "  Mr. JP

KMOUo4D_6O1FZ0xmt9qwOw.text: Hands down best locals sushi n in town.  I have been coming here for years... screaming orgasm is worth the drive from Summerlin!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Boom!

W3CL-aeTE3dwZd0JZalglQ.text: I LOVE SUSHI.  I really do. This is one of my all time favorite places to go. It has been my main Sushi spot for years. I have had good sushi elsewhere but there is just something comforting about I love Sushi. The rolls taste the same each time so you always know what you are getting, and the quality of what you are getting.   It gets packed here, so arrive early, don't be surprised to wait, book a table to avoid this. If you do wait, it is worth it so get some Sake and relax.  Get the Japanese Lasagna! Don't ask questions, just order it and get back to me.   The Kiss of Fire roll is amazing, Jackpot special roll, Crazy Monkey (or something Monkey I can't recall exactly), and the crunch roll.  There are so many fantastic rolls from the baked, to the raw and everything in between.  I love sushi and always will!

9sie4ArczxPU_npzVcTUnA.text: I have lived here 10 years and have always been told how great this place is, so tonight I had a chance to try it out and it did not disappoint!  The shishito pepper appetizer is delicious. Fantastic quality sashimi. The rolls are outstanding. We will be back.  Very soon.

fcacWyXry4WShidfUq69hQ.text: It was packed when we walked in but they make sure you are seated in a timely manner. The sushi is good and fresh and the waiters are very nice. It's not ayce but after my wife and I ordered what we did and were full the price came out to almost the same it would if we did an ayce sushi place. Long story short good service and good sushi a must try.

VvG378eXzyJP9RKDXT3hqw.text: Great lunch specials! A huge assortment of rolls. The servers are quick and friendly. The agadashi tofu is very good. If you want something filling and fusion, try the Grand Canyon roll.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Fantastic lunch special
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy tuna roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Grand Canyon roll topped with cream sauce, shrimp and mushrooms

6E8AyPZLsUfcxPwTWqaaZA.text: I think we had a home run on this place are 1st day as an official Henderson resident. The food was fantastic the service was friendly and authentic. I think this will be a once a week kind of place for us. Highly recommended.

JgSKMRN-SKR8TTr2Og_g6A.text: I've been going here for years, and I  Sushi is my favorite!  I've lived in Vegas for decades and have been to plenty of other sushi restaurants in town.  The service has always been great, and I've never had a bad meal. My favorite rolls are Ryan's Roll and the Monkey Roll.  Yes, their prices are a bit high, but I feel it's worth it.  I was actually quite surprised by some of the negative reviews. But, I guess you can't please everybody all of the time.

DIlSkUSrHZYtCOPycsWaag.text: Food and price is good.  Only wish the servers English was a little better. She was very hard to understand but she was quick and efficient

EYozAEDe9tE5MgV7q4096w.text: Amazing sushi, soup, dumpling, atmosphere and service. Def will return and recommend to friends.

fEl0BQWMNA9UJzBEDAjVvg.text: Hands down my favorite sushi in Henderson, maybe even all of Vegas. Service is always pretty good and they have a lot of great sushi chefs who are very friendly when you sit at the bar. They do some really great no rice rolls such as the Johnny roll and Spring Mountain. Its not all you can eat so in my opinion there seafood quality is a little higher. Overall really great sushi spot. 4.5/5

N4q3-TXrAUnNHU2IsiknSA.text: Love this place!! The food is SUPERB!! Staff is friendly and it's always filled with familiar faces who go back to eat there on a regular basis!! I love restaurants that serve great food and feel like home!! I Love Sushi is that place!!

DpGRVkpHwHeWqcLNuaHAyw.text: Style over substance. Poor saki selection. Lots of crazy rolls with hip names.  It is a chore to get a nice nigiri off the menu. Meh.   Sloppy preparation. The rice just falls apart.   This place is popular so maybe it was good at one time. But it has jumped the shark if you ask me ;(

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sloppy preparation.  The rice just falls apart. Disappointing.

j_DjVCHiNGOTGRyucIV71g.text: Amazing!!  Upon arriving in Vegas, our family brought us here for the "best sushi ever".  Could this be True? We were soon to find out!  The restaurant was crowded, very lively, and luckily we had a reservation so we got right in.   Our cousin is pretty much a sushi snob, so he ordered all our entrees. We started out with saki to salute our dining adventure. First on the menu was the Screaming O (seared tuna with mayonnaise sauce on a bed of radish). It was pure delight!!  I highly recommend it! Next we had garlic albacore & garlic tuna. Both fantastic. Next up Kiss of Fire and Who's Your Daddy (both on the spicy side). They were definitely crowd pleasers. Last entree was The Grand Canyon Roll - a great finish to the meal.  Everything was very fresh, good temperature contrast and great presentation.   We discovered that they had Green Tea Tempura ice cream and we were full but just couldn't resist. We devoured it!!  We had a great experience and it stands up to the hype!! It's no joke!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Green Tea Tempura
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiss of Fire - spicy!!

7O8MNpBXkl5Whjly136HQw.text: The food is good and worth spending your money on. Has a good layout, plenty of comfortable seating, good vibe, people who work there are good.   Didn't give them that extra star because they can workout their spicier rolls better. They make them all large and pile on lots of stuff therefore the sushi falls apart and the spicy sauce theres so much of it, I feel like I'm drinking it. Meh.   But I've been here at least 15 times so its mostly always a good experience. Cant please us everybody all the time :-)  Also I saw a review before...some lady talking about quality of the sushi? Firstly...lol Second, the quality is just fine considering its just a regular local spot.   Anybody know a place around here with GREAT quality for this kind of price? Please let me know then! Id love to go there.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. This is the flower roll. Its delicious :-)

OghXqwc6t_YRPUXzdfPF6w.text: Huge chefs special menu. A lot of choices. I've had the jackpot, California, Johnny roll no rice, and James bond which is my go to.   Excellent flavors and nice staff. The location is a bit out of the way, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Johnny roll no rice
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. James bond
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

d2RamoUul5lDTc8lP48ZmQ.text: Went in with a friend and tried a bunch of things I never would have ordered and it was all good! Portions were fair, the quality and flavors were very good and we enjoyed! I just did not take pictures but the presentation was great as well!  We ordered the following rolls a flower roll (which is tuna, yellowtail, salmon with some tempura shrimp, massage and avocado in a spicy ponzu sauce. Great roll and the server said it was the #1 seller! Delicious! Then a Grand Canyon roll which is from the kitchen and warm with scallops, shrimp, mushrooms, masago and green onion over basically a California roll. Then two orders of negi Hama and 2 spicy scallops hand rolls in soy paper! Those were amazing as well. Super full of fish not all rice! Great job we will be back!

kyMVv8WNXelTHQXx6clBnQ.text: Normally a restaurant name like "I Love Sushi" should make a sushi lover run away screaming in terror. It's the sort of name you find on a place that has sketchy fish and a terrible menu.   Fortunately, we have Yelp to nudge us into giving a place like this a chance, and I'm so glad we did. The menu is huge. There are literally over a hundred rolls listed (in addition to the usual appetizers, sushi, nigiri, etc.). Quality was outstanding. Service was a bit awkward for us, but I think it's more because they have their own thing going on and we hadn't figured it out. Whatever, if the food is great we can overlook some other issues. We'll certainly be back.

AgcxkNFL6iulCIOVCqzVfQ.text: I'm pretty sure this is just a hip trendy spot to get sushi, but even though it's crowded and there's a lot of people in there laughing and having a good time probably drinking a bit too, the sushi quality is for sure a three out of five possibly lower. If you don't really care about the sushi quality and you're more into fancy roll, and maybe you don't really like fish that much then this is probably the place for you and that's OK. I'm just saying for a superficial love her and somebody that's going strictly for the quality and I really don't care what the restaurant looks like this was not the place for me. Also because they are so busy I think they're understaffed and it took probably 35 minutes just to get a glass of water-not super impressed to say the least. They did seat is quite fast though so that is a plus also they have these little private-ish areas to eat your sushi and I think that's pretty cool too.

AFC2CecwfLAtPl-AcroNTQ.text: This is my favorite local sushi place!  Ambiance: I love sushi is always buzzing with customers sitting both at the bar and in booths and in tables. The servers and managers learn who you are when you come often so you truly do feel at home. It's casual in decor and comfort.  Food: sometimes we ravage our food so quickly that we don't remember the names of what we ordered! We do remember enjoying a 80% something and a sex on the beach and a mistake something lol. There's raw and baked and cooked rolls for everyone to try! We love getting "easy rice" so there's not as much rice cramping our style tasting the fishy deliciousness! There's also great calamari! The drinks selection includes just enough house wine and beer and sake selection to get you through your meal.   I love Sushi makes Sushi to order that's quick and amazing and perfect to get your fix!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. 100% awesome

yLvtaWX7rXGOhBZ4QpoCGw.text: You are absolutely missing our on the best sushi in Henderson.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Philadelphia Crunch Roll and yummy sake

CDc66vh-cgQlTDVfo4GWCg.text: I have eaten at a lot of sushi spots here in Vegas and have to say this is one of my top two favorite spots in town! The staff is very friendly and very attentive to you while dinning. We love the lady's wearing the kimonos what a great look... Seating is very comfortable and after being seated they bring cucumbers marinated to your table on the house... The fish is fresh by taste and their menu is great, our favorite is the screaming O, yellow tail jalapeno, and garlic butter special. The sake list is great and priced to match.   Over all: Like I said one of my top two favorite spots in town, between the menu & fresh fish I believe this place sells itself. The price is moderate and when walking out they have my favorite old school candy (the root beer wrapped candy)   Thank you I Love sushi for always making date night good!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

b94XXc8ykerfGrAMj3KdnA.text: Great atmosphere and really good food.  My spicy tuna hand roll was packed full of meat. Dragon roll was great and tempura vegetables were delicious.  Locals live this place.  I'm glad I had the chance to eat here.

JhSPiD6FmX7YIJ3oV2Fejw.text: I strongly recommend. One of the best Japanese restaurant I've ever been. The food is really good. Price Is good too.

IIGuR3itxMQNotgP4DFALA.text: The Lunch Special is a great deal.  Edamame and cucumbers to start and then a Bento Box with several goodies and your choice of not one, but two, entrees.  I chose Vegetable Tempura and Vegetable Tempura.  What can I say?  I had a craving.  Next time, it'll be Vegetable Tempura and Salmon Teriyaki.  Only $9.95.  Great price!  Good food.  Excellent service.  Great prices.  Easy parking.  Clean restroom.  What else is there?

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch with a friend
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Bento Box Lunch Special of Vegetable Tempura times two
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Edamame, gratis

xu-VNrSpjOXnvZX3HI5fJA.text: What a joke this place is. Came in and there were no people waiting and not that many people in the dining room. It was earlier in the night and NOT busy. Told me it would only be 5 min and 20 min later I was still standing. Several other people came in after me and were all seated before. And when I asked the hostess about it, she couldn't have me more rude. I left without even trying this place and never will. There are hundreds of other sushi places in town who I am sure treat their customers with more respect. Never again.   Several other people have felt the need to comment on my review asking me to give this place another chance and it's just not going to happen. I went early enough in the evening so that it wouldn't be busy. It wasn't busy and I was literally the only person waiting and the girl at front was still a total b***h. Please don't try to defend this place to me. It's not going to work.

KabpJTv_IZtKiT7TI6Th1g.text: Have eaten here several times and have never been disappointed. Prices aren't bad at all but every roll fits on the range of "pretty good" up to "absolutely amazing". And I've had most if not every roll on the menu. Once came in with my toddler, and literally as soon as we went to sit down he vomited all over the place. The staff were amazing and very understanding, helping to clean up and make us feel better. All in all, a great place!

nnKWjX_G6LYvShgdPwE3BA.text: I've been going here for about 10 years & every single time the food is amazing, the service is amazing, everything is always perfect here.

4esSm7JO4MHnTJAyi_E28g.text: Wonderful sushi.  The place is immaculate, they seafood is fresh and well displayed.  the wait staff is personable, helpful and knowledgeable.  It was a wonderful dining experience.  Will go there often.

KK-6MBPK72j3RKjUYjwnmw.text: This place is great! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because they don't have AYCE. I came here for a friend's birthday and it was super busy because it happen to be on Valentine's Day. The waitresses try to be quick but it's almost kind of feels like they're rushing you, no big deal though I get it. But anyway, I pretty much enjoyed everything we ordered that day except for my Screaming O, I asked the waitress if they could slightly sear it a little more than normal. She brought it back basically cooked all the way so that was ruined. As for the sushi rolls the Kitchen Sink was probably one of my favs! Order it! You will not regret it!! My friend also ordered the Baked Lobster (no rice), that was amazing!! The Garlic Butter Special was mediocre and the Japanese Lasagna was pretty good. The other rolls my friends got, they said it was all delicious! I believe a few of the other rolls were the Johnny Roll (no rice), Johnny Special, and the Monkey Roll, there were plenty more but I can't recall the exact ones. I definitely want to come back and try other things on the menu and for that Kitchen Sink roll!

mAqq_K7N7lQZBsYAkDewYA.text: Checking out this place is very worth for a good meals with family or friends with reasonable price food & very good service. We got sit in very fast with the reservation. The food came out so fresh. They have big menu & don't forget to order the fresh wasabi for your sushi. One more plus is the waitresses are in kimono

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

tpPJISUzSm-YAzTMyvjmDg.text: Fresh toro/hamachi, wasabi was the best. Even the gari taste differently fresh. Best sushi bar in Henderson/Anthem NV.

4QQ0ss8GAPeiDmFKE4tu4g.text: If you love sushi... come here! I'm just kidding but really come here. Not the most exciting name for a sushi place, but boy do they have options. On their menu you can find over 100 different trypsin of rolls.  I love tempura so that is what I ordered and I was super impressed by the size of them.  This is more of a local restaurant, but their theming is that of a restaurant on the stripe. Great decorations and fast service.

r2sPWTgfg2J05GsdRW0RKw.text: IMHO This is the best sushi in town. Fresh. Creative. Worth the wait. My fav is the Joes Special. The Service is sometimes rushed. But to be expected when every table is turning every hour all dinner time long. I'm not a fan of the cramped waiting area. We learned to get there early. Before 6. Enjoy!

7tq1KkNWervkfz_gqGLblw.text: I have never been here when it hasn't been busy.  They have A LOT of fresh fish options, which my man really likes, while I like the cream cheesy kind of things....  THEY HAVE BOTH!  The seating isn't really that thought out, and can get crowded, uncomfortable and loud.... that's really the only bummer.

NqoNDYh3JPa4bRosth0V1Q.text: The first thing I noticed about this restaurant when we drove into the lot was how big the sign was and then how big the restaurant was.  It's a big place and I highly recommend it for big groups!  They even have big booth like sections for parties of 6.  FOOD: Kiss of Fire ($13): Spicy crab, tempura shrimp, cucumber, soft shell crab, albacore & jalapeno topped with extra spicy ponzu sauce.  I tasted more lemon than anything else in this roll.  Maybe it should've said "extra lemony ponzu sauce" on the menu instead.  I Love Sushi Special ($11.50): Spicy tuna & cucumber topped with tuna & spicy special sauce.  This was probably my favorite roll of the night! They were very generous with the tuna.  It's got a kick but it's bearable.  Crazy Horse Roll ($8): Smoked salmon, cream cheese, avocado, green onion & deep fried with eel sauce.  This is an excellent choice for those who don't like raw fish.  It's creamy and sweet!  Fat Ass Special ($13): Tuna, salmon, yellowtail, white tuna, crab meat, avocado, deep fried panko, spicy mayo, hot sauce & eel sauce.  My friends & I giggled when they repeated our order and when they brought it out: "Here is the fat ass".  HAHAHA!  This is a wide roll so you can't actually get all the fish in one bite.  Without dipping your roll in the surrounding sauce, it wouldn't be too spicy but if you drench it, you'll feel a good kick.  Green Tempura Ice Cream: They swirled the bottom of the bowl with chocolate syrup.  The tempura was more cake like than crispy but that's up to the restaurant's choice really.  The green tea ice cream was actually a little bland.  RECOMMENDED FOR: ROLL LOVERS!  Don't get all food critic-like on this place because this ain't the time.  Enjoy a long list of out-of-the-box rolls, crazy names & lots of sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiss of Fire Roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Crazy Horse Roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. I Love Sushi Special

sCT_DWcHRkXlFJ7ZIoAP9w.text: This is my go to Sushi / Japanese food. I have eaten there soooo many times and have no bad experiences. The selections are plentiful and delicious.  With the amount of people that eat there, the selection is always fresh.   Best Sushi in town! Something for everyone.

SjkWVJpjaPXXrhF2zMAemQ.text: Best Sushi in Henderson and Las Vegas! Less rice more fish which is always fresh. Have never been disappointed with service and quality.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. This roll is called screaming orgasm.

ODJkYrnMFgAXnqxCT1MqOw.text: I'm a recent transplant from California to Las Vegas.  I'm still trying to find the sushi place to replace my favorite in Lake Forest, CA.  I feel like once I find the rolls I like at I Love Sushi, this will be the place.. but I'm still searching.  I haven't settled on one I really like yet.  I am really not happy with the caliber of affordable sushi to be had in L.V.  (Of course the super pricey places on the strip like Nobu are amazing, but who can eat there once a week?) - All you can eat sushi is never as good a quality as regular a'la cart sushi. And every place I find here in L.V. is all you can eat!  It's something with the consistency of the rice and the quality of the fish.  I Love Sushi has quality fish.  Now if I can find one of their rolls that's similar to my favorite Jak Sal roll at my old Cali place I can finally settle down to a regular joint that I can visit weekly.

PCKtpDivSvjJgjR5-Sy6FQ.text: Well, I guess if a place is called "I Love Sushi" I should stick with strictly sushi.  BUT, I was drawn to the "Tuna Poki" option on the menu, and I love poke (note the spelling difference).  I've learned since then that Korean "poki" is slightly different from Hawaiian "poke".  That doesn't mean it was bad - it just wasn't my thing.  So I suppose this is my warning to poke lovers.  I also had some salmon-avocado sushi.  That was good.  Not the best salmon I've ever had, but pretty good.  I sat at the sushi bar and service was outstanding.  It better be; there's like 16 guys running around behind the bar cutting fish, so whatever you order, you get it pretty quick.  I did get accidentally charged for a Mexican roll that the people next to me had ordered, but the mistake was fixed very quickly once I pointed it out.  Always check your bill, kids!  Some raw fish and a bomber bottle of Asahi and I was very happy by the time I left.

7D2Shnxqr6jPQKMbhvHi4Q.text: My favorite Sushi Restaurant in Las Vegas.  It's a blast sharing great food with friends, and I Love Sushi knows how to help you have a great time, while preparing the best Sushi around.  Thank you I LOVE SUSHI!  you are the best.  Thank you.

z8LWlEeuMk_N6j6bnhgwlw.text: Really good sushi! Most of the sushi ranges from $4-$15. Their jackpot roll is really good and pretty much anything there with shrimp tempura is good. If you are dining on a weekend, call for reservations or come early. It gets very crowded. Best sushi I've had in the Vegas area and decently priced.

3b0qSMT28cwmByz-U-MVog.text: Ambiance is ok, tables are too close to each other with neighbors talking very loud. Food has moderate taste, either too salty (my Spicy Soft Shell Roll) or drenched in too much eel sauce making it too sweet (Spider Roll).

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Crunchy Roll (Left) &amp; Spider Roll (Right).
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna Hand Roll.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Soft Shell Roll.

5Nxxd-Bk4flyahRROmtFzA.text: We grew up in LV, but now live in LA. We don't get back much, but this place has become our reason for going more often. Honestly!  I Love Sushi, is by far the best sushi restaurant my wife and I have ever eaten at. Now, we are not easy to please either. We are both what our friends consider,sushi snobs. I have to admit that I hated the name of the restaurant, and almost didn't go because I thought it couldn't be good...that would have been a huge mistake.  I will tell you, we put this place through the test. We ordered several rolls, salmon sushi, and a variety of other items. We were stuffed when we left, and could not stop talking about how awesome it was.  The service is friendly, FAST, and all around fantastic!  In one word...GO!

o-jB8jdpiA1LYOcGPiQRqA.text: The sushi here is excellent and service was quick and friendly. If you are a sushi lover, this is the place to go! Highly recommend the monkey roll.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

7dW06MfogwyobC9QtCFHDg.text: After several tries my famly convinced me to try sushi so I did.  Six of us went to I LOVE SUSHI to celebrate my grandson's 20th birthday.  He's been a fan of sushi since he was 7 so who am I to argue?  LOL.    I'm hooked.  We ordered 10 different items and just layed them on the table smorgasbord style.  Wow.   The Japanese Lasagna is great but I would recommend sharing it cuz it's very rich as was the Orange Bowl, no rice - excellent! .  I particularly like the Mistake roll, D.C. Roll, Franky's special  and the Yum Yum Roll.  Everything was terrific but those were my favorites. Had something called Joe's Special and Johhnie's Special roll and like them as well.   I especially like the cucumber salad they served as we sat down.  My younger grandson doesn't eat sushi but ordered a plate of Pot Stickers and loved them.    I have nothing to compare this place to foodwise but I know that everything I tried was excellent and very well prepared.   Had to bring home a couple of containers of their pickled ginger and the wasabi is REALLY over the top good.   The service was great but I have to admit we got there early in the evening.   The ambience is Japanese right down to the kimoni type dress the waitresses were wearing.  Gave a nice touch to the whole ethnic scene.    My  highly experienced sushi loving friends are happy that I'll be joining them from now on and they recommend I Love Sushi also.   Gotta go with the flow on this one.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

Qy9CP5JEMs1R3oeowkUg4Q.text: Excellent service, food and atmosphere. We are here pretty often.  I love the udon, house salad, and pretty much everything. The oysters are excellent. I recommend this place to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. My favorite!! Nabeyaki udon

8M94IXcw85aT_07F9wB2Dw.text: Bam Bam roll and shishito peppers were perfect. Love this little spot when Im in Vegas. Great service too!

vbkyTxYu2D5WtyODna4dRw.text: Now my favorite sushi place of all time.  I loved the lobster roll.  Just a whole lobster tail stuffed with a california roll.  How could you go wrong?  They have this weird divider thing going on at the door though, which was kind of weird.  This place was busy as well, so maybe call ahead for a reservation.  Everything was super fresh.  The  more prepared rolls also had a great taste.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Baked lobster.  Get it!

OgiWssfwcbAkAKaKu7wbXg.text: We're having The Love Boat tonight. It looks amazing!! This place is SO good! Sushi and hot items have yet to disappoint. :) Yakisoba Beef is super!!  We REALLY enjoy I Love Sushi!  It'll be a weekly or biweekly place for us.  :)

yHA1S3dZXOyPdA70s9nZ_Q.text: This used to be one of my favorite sushi places ! Went here last night around 8:30pm.. and ordered yellow tail hamachi ... three pieces .. the first piece tasted just ok(not good) , the second piece tasted bad.. the fish had a rough / hard texture in the center and it didn't taste right.. didn't taste fresh, so I stopped eating it .. I woke up sick at 4am and have been sick all day so far :(  Also the atmosphere was very obnoxious last night.. there was a table of 6 people in their early 20s who kept ordering saki bombs which was amusing to watch at first but they quickly got wasted and started yelling and laughing during the entire visit .. my guest and I couldn't even hold a conversation cause they were screaming in our ears and we couldn't hear each other talk .. and they kept yelling the F word .. which doesn't offend me directly but I had my 5 year old son with us and looked around at other families with their kids too and no one seemed to be enjoying the loud obnoxious atmosphere .. the staff was very friendly .. as always .. they were doing shots with the loud table which was again amusing to watch.. if those kids could control themselves it prob wouldn't have been a problem but they were annoying AF .

-zl3AilHeIHtnN8XrbQO0Q.text: I was told about this lil gem by some friends from out of town. So if an out of towner leaves the strip to get food, it's gotta be good right? This is one of the few sushi places I've been to in Vegas that I can say is AWESOME! This place not only has fresh food, but the service is fast! I was first provided w/ a warm towel. Never been given this at ANY sushi place I've been to. That right there grabbed my attention. We arrived right when they opened so they were still getting ready. For waiting 5 minutes they brought out edmame. You can see that they want to make their customers happy.  They have quite the variety of rolls from baked to deep fried to regular rolls. If you're looking for something w/ some kick try the Kiss of Fire. The mountain blast is another good one to try. Most of the rolls do have some sauce that come on them. The price is typical, the service is great, & the food is awesome!

Frr__tHwKg4G9pS04cLm2w.text: Great rolls are Flower, Monkey, Gary Special, and Tastes Like my Ex Girlfriend are all awesome!! Oh and Threesome is tasty and cool cuz it has mozzarella cheese in it  wife lovessss

--tRsbzFW6BdhUiW9b8pkA.text: Went there for the first time with the wife and kid and we all loved it. The food was  delicious and service was quick and friendly. Our 7 year old daughter is a picky eater but she had no trouble scarfing down the shrimp and veggie tempura some pot stickers and even a few pieces of the lobster roll. We spent about the same as any other sushi restaurant so that was no surprise. Definitely going back....could be the new favorite, Sorry Sumo

PIGTmlQeAXcOhi1d0BDHMw.text: God, I have no idea why my relatives love this place.  The only thing I can think of is because they are from Utah and to them this is awesome japanese food.  Perhaps it was because we were in a big group which really shouldn't have an effect on anything but the service was piss poor.  So we ordered our food and gave the waitress the sushi ordering paper at the table.  Simple sushi...Inari, Tamago and California roll.  Easy right?  Should be out in 10-15 minutes!  That sushi came out when we were halfway done with dinner.  We ordered sake also, which we had to remind the waitress we ordered it because she forgot all about it.   So all in all...this palce goes down in my book worse than what I orginally rated it.

0lJZuUU09FkmWpc9ENAdiw.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. I love the menu. Come hungry!! The rolls are huge. You really get your moneys worth. It is the best in Nevada!!!

QmJgqTqyqVS_Zy3B_xxppQ.text: This place is the reason why I started liking sushi... I tried it out a couple months ago and now I go back AT LEAST once a week. My favorites are"I Love My Ass" and "Triple X." The staff is friendly and the manager is always around to make sure everyone is happy with their dining experience. Nowhere else satisfies my sushi cravings except I Love Sushi!

6hErfdkJq_EOaCQPi92I8w.text: Great selection of rolls, espcially with soft shell crab.  Cherry Blossom Roll is interesting.  Overall, I haven't been disappointed with this restaurant so far.  Sake Bomb!!

isPOVmL9rKbjKFJSAjH8qQ.text: This is the sushi place that I tell everyone about. It is "Americanized" sushi in an "authentic" environment." (if that makes any sense) There are lots of unique rolls of which I highly recommend the "cherry blossom" and the "screaming orgasm!" It is Korean owned but you will be greeted in Japanese. lol The TVs in contrast are always set to American sports. The waitresses are  adorable, dressed in kimonos, and are very helpful once you figure out how to communicate what you want. Good service, amazing food and reasonable prices consistently make "I love sushi" worth the 15 minute drive off the Las Vegas Strip.

mE6JfQ8HzrUYC_BxuoKkKA.text: Absolutely best sushi and service ever!...i love, I love sushi...favorite rolls are: jackpot roll, kiss of fire, and screaming orgasm....i just love this place! If u haven't been here yet, u've got to give it a try.

J5LytcAw2Uc1-_WgbjspHw.text: I love sushi is a great place to grab some sushi. Everything on the menu is really good. I try and have it once a month, because of how good their sushi is. My favorite roll is ryan's special. If you like spicy you should try the kiss of fire which is really good, but spicy. The spicy garlic edamame is really good and my favorite. Every roll I have tried at I Love Sushi has been really good. Everything on the menu has a unique name that I have not heard anywhere else. Their fish is always fresh and tastes great. For dessert their green tea tempura is really good and my favorite ice cream. Besides sushi they have other great choices of food.   They are always busy on weekends, but the wait is never too long. The owner is really nice and a good friend. Since me and my family always go here the owner knows us really well and sends us free sake most the time. The staff is really nice and efficient. They also have take out which is good, but you have to remember to put the sauces on the sushi as it is separate. The service is always great, even on busy days. The sushi never takes long to be served.   I would recommend I love Sushi to anyone who likes sushi. I'm a big sushi fan and I Love Sushi has to be my favorite place to get some sushi. Great place to have sushi and try for your first time. All their items on the menu are really good and I have not had something at I Love Sushi that I have not liked. Everyone I have taken to I Love Sushi for the first time has loved it and is now a regular customer there.

4vF8b3VXyTsns_jlsyMRUA.text: They don't have any sort of happy hour here, but they give you tons of food for the price.  Their lunch combos are great.. $8-9 for a two-item combo bento box.  I usually get it with Tempura, and Chicken Katsu.  It also comes with Miso, Salad, Egg, Rice, Beancurd Sushi.  I know I'm leaving something out, but I've never seen such a huge bento box.  The dinner combos go up a little bit in price (I think it's $13-14 dollars), but they give you about twice as much Tempura, as well as cucumber salad, regular salad, gyoza, some sort of Tempura fried rice ball.  Again, tons of food for the price.  Another good thing to order here are the teppanyaki plates for about $14.  My girlfriend usually gets the Ribeye one, and it's pretty much just tons of meat, zucchini and onions.  They're served with Ponzu, and another sauce to dip the meat/veggies in.  They also come with Miso, and salad.

YoGFYyrzL2j8UarCsN-aTA.text: this place is incredible. i love the towel they give you to wipe down your hands when you're first seated! Love the food (they have funny names for them). Fish is definitely fresh and customer service is EXCELLENT!!

yuPBXXUNAJRBBrXJ1Cf_IA.text: My girlfriend loves the sushi here and they have a large selection of other things for people with me that can't stand fish and sushi.  Place gets very busy and crowded at times so you may want to come early or at non peak times.

X6x3jnhrejDCu75mKRM2rA.text: I love it, she loves it, we love it. Everyone seems to love 'I love Sushi' (sorry Lucy).  A couple of years ago when gf san suggested this place I wasn't so sure. Eating sushi at a place called 'I love Sushi' in a shopping complex behind a gas station you say? Standby while I check my notes please. Sorry gf san, the answer is no. BUT I love sushi and I needed my fill so we tried it anyway. Since then this has become our go-to spot. We love the ambiance, we love the food and we love the kimono-wearing ladies cursing in Japanese (just kidding!).  The food's all good. While the sashimi isn't the best I've ever had, it's good enough. Their special rolls are delicious (not to mention creatively-named). The crunch roll and spicy tuna roll somehow always find their way into our order. The lunch specials are ok and I can honestly say I've had better bento box lunches. But if you're eating the bento here you're doing yourself a disservice. Have the real deal - the sushi and sashimi rolls. Finish off with the awesome green tea tempura icecream!

3VZDXkdwjpm0q8Y1S57N5g.text: I award this the absolute best sushi, and service in the state of NEVADA... no competition. nicely priced for the portions of food served. Very clean, only request is that open more locations. :)

rpPxAvSXxZlRyIX-fsfJFA.text: The sushi here is delicious, there are many different selections and they're all SO GOOD!! the only thing that sucks baaaad is the service.

2uUwkPtDEdEPNTZZy8M71g.text: This place has some ridiculous names for their sushi, but it's entertaining to talk about.  The waitresses are good looking.  The sushi's very good.  This place has really good miso soup, and the sushi tastes fresh.  They also have some very unique dishes.  I'm a big fan of this place.

QfVstMz37lxKmvDaPAeD-g.text: Amazing sushi that is well priced and sure to please! Best spicy tuna handroll I have ever had!!!!

ic6wlYaKqGOgxvfGq0kTNA.text: This Sushi restaurant is by far the BEST.  Their rolls are delish!  It's a clean restaurant with great ambiance!  I highly recommend this place.  I've been to many, many sushi restaurants.  This has been my favorite so far.  It doesn't matter if it's Korean owned.  In fact, I think the Korean owned sushi restaurants are better.  90% of sushi restaurants are Korean owned anyway.  Enjoy!

CVtByCD09D6T938U_KyHMQ.text: I LOVE SUSHI is right! this place rocks!!!  The BF and I always go here to eat. REALLY REALLY GOOD! not to mention, they sell the head bands..my bf rocked it one night at work..luv it!!

dB6Hf5n7O-1UuXXuhv1bIw.text: I Love Sushi is one of my favorite places to go when I am not wanting to do "all you can eat."  The menu offers a lot of choices.  My personal favorite is the "What's Your Name?" roll.  It's delish!  I took a friend who had never tried sushi before there, and she was hooked! The atmosphere is nice, the staff is friendly, and service is quick.  Some reviews have said to avoid it during peak hours, but I have been there for dinner several times, and I don't recall ever having to wait more than a couple minutes.

jBFrSS4iGR6xTRoeRY-yXw.text: I am a BIG sushi lover... and I LOVE I Love Sushi! Its one of the best sushi places ive ever been to. I recommend it to all my friends, and they always love it!

vgExr2FK824Ds3E7qjepqA.text: The past 2-3 times we have been to I Love Sushi, we feel as if it's gone downhill.  The service has been terrible.  The food & rolls were not as fresh as usual and just plain blah.  I am very disappointed...  Help, we need a new sushi home!

bOFaiarOdLDlxLKxSBZJtQ.text: 5 stars for the fact that it was reasonably priced for all you an eat sushi.   3 stars for the staffing who seemed uninterested and needed a calculator for 151 - 100  3 stars for decor ( the umbrellas from the ceiling, very cool )  Favorate roll: Crunchy Philly Roll

AlmXfpJwPviRkF7BPNbA4g.text: If you know the difference between a mexican cooking Italian food or an italian cooking mexican then you'll appreciate that Koreans really can't make authentic Japanese. To non-Japanese you may think this is good sushi but everything from the seaweed salad, green tea, and sushi are far from True, real Japanese in taste and texture. Basically to a Japanese person raised in Japan. This food is terrible. Like comparing Taco Bell to a real Taqueria. Don't be fooled find the real thing.

CZLkfZYyfatVYXq8k4REqQ.text: Best sushi spot in vegas, it's not all you can eat, but def worth the price per roll. Friendly and attentive wait staff, no complaints here, always fresh!

mVhlOl3mz-nnoMFE5njLZw.text: The service was soooo bad. I consider myself a good tipper (20% or more), but I barely left 10%. The waitress took our order for one roll and before I could order our next roll, she was already leaving. I had to stop her, and when I did she rolled her eyes at me. I have never experienced anything like it. Then, it took an hour and a half to get my full order of TWO rolls. It wasn't even busy.  The food wad just meciocre. After reading the reviews, I ordered the Screaming Orgasm and 69 dish (forgot the whole name) because they got such great reviews but they were a total disappointment. I have had a lot of sushi in my time, and some of the best I've had were at small litle places, so I'm pretty open-minded, but this was nothing to write home about. It was hard to gauge the freshness of the fish, seemed like it was thawed, but not really sure. Definitely not going back. Total waste.

92PN5OBXNkY0jiUtO8yLhw.text: Hands down my favorite sushi spot. You must try the screaming orgasm, the I love sushi special roll, and the Grand Canyon roll. There are many others that are just as fabulous. The menu is huge- you could order something different every time. Service is great. Prices reasonable. Since finding this place I don't go anywhere else for sushi.

5JQq5WWO6Ye_GtS-bsn4AQ.text: This is my go to sushi joint! No it's not ayce, but the quality is worth it and I never leave hungry or disappointed. I love the one night stand! Other good ones are the tastes let ex wife, kiss of fire (very spicy), something's wrong 69.... So many more. This place rocks!

JHE-SxgeQ4tcrX7Sk2UYOA.text: My friend took me here while I visited her.  I saw a lot of raves for this place but in my experience, I thought it was ok. The service wasn't great and the food was overpriced for what we were getting.  I think I got used to sushi-mon in vegas which has great quality sushi for a great price as well!!  Maybe I came on an off night!!!  Who knows, maybe I'll come back and try it again.

dl3WH6sCfmPquJ8lykMVrA.text: This place has it all.  Great food, great service, great prices and screaming orgasms.    I moved here from the Bay Area one year ago and I eat sushi at least once a week.  This place is definately my favorite.    EXCELLENT!!!!!

sUExvYQXTdQLMHT-5QL9Fg.text: Just had another magnificent dinner here.  We don't visit Las Vegas very often, but whenever we do, we always devote at least one dinner to this place.  Not only does it provide us a break from the chaos of the Strip, but the food here is fantastic! You will Definitely get far more value for your money here than on the Strip.  If you do come, you have to try the Ika Tempura!  We had 2 orders last night.  Crispy on the outside, and soft, but slightly firm (as it should be) on the inside!  Yum!   The staff is almost alarmingly attentive!  (unlike trying to get any kind of service in the Strip Casinos) It goes without saying, but I will anyway, that the Sashimi is top notch!  The pieces of fish, etc, are gratifying of sufficient size as to make them visible/identifiable to the naked eye...not always the case (these days) If you need a delicious break from the Strip, and your tastes turn toward sushi, you really should try this place.  I Love Sushi is (probably) a Franchise...this particular one is the BEST that we've found!

6yVtMnpqV6R88CSVyYdlRQ.text: Fantastic food, always has been always will be! I have come here since day 1 as a date spot and now many years later as a daddy daughter night out. Hope all you take the chance to experience this very friendly atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

W-B3Jk--nfj9iK8iIudq1A.text: So today I went into I Love Sushi with my family, we are regulars at the joint and always get the same Spicy tuna handrolls and garlic edamame. As usual the food was excellent but the reason for my 3 star was very poor customer service our waitress was very rude and seemed too lack common sense serving skills overall experience was okay I really think they should consider retraining she was a horrific employee

DA9E5_a9mSLrTRgMnJnCfg.text: I love I love sushi! I've tried sashimi salad everywhere and I really like this one, could be the dressing which is all homemade. I can't stand when salads come with bottled dressings, it's obvious to me, the taste is different. Anyway we really have only had sashimi salad and a couple rolls which were excellent. There are always lots of people here every time I've ever gone. The sushi chef "Boom Boom" was hilarious and super friendly and nice. He made us a special roll and it was amazing!

9LLMsHZ00I4RGPxlUlaFKg.text: By far the best,freshest Sushi in Las Vegas! Great atmosphere, and always a fun crowd. Even when it's busy there is never a wait.

_P0e9pTfPyE-sYpKj4MdxA.text: I really love the sushi here. It's a very modern, Americanized, sushi experience. However, the quality of fish is excellent so if you're in a more traditional sushi mood you will enjoy the toro, yellowtail, albacore, and salmon. But if you're ready to utilize all of your taste buds they have some of the most delicious and creative rolls in the city. "I love my ass" and "tastes like my ex girlfriend" are favorites of mine, but I would highly recommend starting with a spicy tuna hand roll. When I lived in Vegas I was a regular here, and when I come back to visit I try to make a point to hit this place at least once.

CIrLG0gLqBas_lgeHEWUfA.text: Best sushi place ever!! Very exotic and different sushi rolls. All their fish is fresh and I have never been disappointed. I get spicy tuna handroll w/ soy paper, Ryan's special , kiss of fire , cherry blossom. Trust me you won't go wrong with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Screaming orgasm
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy tuna handrolls with soy paper
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ryan&#39;s special! Amazing roll

HpLCqPHICO8XCK2XcqnG5g.text: We live in LA and go here with a group of 40 friends every year as a special outing. The staff is so accommodating and fun it's amazing, given how chaotic serving 40 people at once could be.  The sushi is always great and the names of the rolls are a lot of fun.  Everything I've tried has been top notch, and with 40 people along I figure I've tried about everything.

iATqy5xag2qCX68g2-xj_w.text: I eat here often and the food and service is always great.  My favorite rolls are the Jackpot and Ryan's Special.  I never have to wait to be seated even when it's real busy.

gR9-sUBPe8r5UWyb7uEbkQ.text: When a friend told me the name of the restaurant, I was a bit apprehensive...but the place was packed and we were seated quickly. Wow...the names of the rolls are fun and sex-themed. We shared some sashimi and a couple rolls and everything was great! I can't wait to go back! We had the Sex on The Beach roll, Lobster Roll, Tuna, Yellowtail and Albacore sashimi....everything was great!

iQtyzEBBZVfA3oU99bVQng.text: This place has some really good sushi, however it would be cool if it was all you can eat (I drove from summerlin bc of all the hype and I didn't even check if it was AYCE)....but it wasn't a big deal at all! Overall had a great time here and the staff is very friendly! Will definitely stop by here again!

szB5cnD-Slz23vHCpmsb4Q.text: This is our go to sushi restaurant.  Great sushi, fun rolls with fun names, and excellent service.  James, the owner, is hands on and runs the place very efficiently.  He makes sure tables are cleared quickly and service is smooth.  It gets busy often, but they turn tables quickly.  It also has a fun energy to it!

EnT9oo9DjacbyLdF4izPfA.text: This place looked more Chinese with the red color of choice lol.  The servers wear wrap around simplified shiny kimono and greet you the usual Irashaimase.  Their menu. They have a ton of rolls . Tons. It overwhelming and confusing since the the ingredients are all the same .  They should lessen the variety and stick to pictures menu so one can see how it looks like.  Their nigiri sushi are simple for a 4 dollar plus a plate.  But I can say their tuna that night was amazing . It just melted .

VrGdgSGLi-P9R0vshkOREA.text: I recently took our lunch group and the whole experience was great. Good service. Wonderful food and sushi. Each person had something different but all acclaimed the food was good. Decent prices also. We will go again.

6HOyYc76TxjdgNKw7OgY9g.text: We were visiting from out of town and decided to try this place because of the reviews.  The food was excellent and we felt it was a lot of food for the price - great quality, great value, fun atmosphere.  We'd come back anytime!

fKLbZqahEqUFjGu4JIRXdg.text: From start to finish everything about my experience here was average.  Greeted at the door by a host that may have been a robot. Service was nothing special. Sushi rolls were big but very plain to me. The Joe roll was dry, I ate one piece and left it. Prices were high for an off strip restaurant with no wow factor. We came here because they have great reviews, maybe we caught them on a bad night.

ZSHEQoqjYsFqoJ7ygts7KQ.text: Love their sushi! They have such a large selection so you can always try new rolls each time you visit. They do not have all you can eat but I think that's because of the high quality of all of their rolls. I love any of their spicy rolls, they taste so good! The service is also up to par. You never wait long for anything you have ordered and bring your check promptly at the end of the meal. This is one of my go to sushi places in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

inAY-bIjGgorZTCUtxGfpQ.text: This is one of my favorite sushi spots and it's right by my work which is amazing. The staff is so nice and sweet. The food I've never been disappointed it's always so fresh and good. I love the rainbow roll and all the salmon rolls just incredible. I always recommend this place to my clients and friends for a delicious sushi spot.

n-SbAx8etrvxfSMVa0GHlw.text: This place is awesome.  Food is unique and delicious. The service is awesome.    We will be back here soon.

iOltEX_DO9CIJgjAOQuG-Q.text: Authenticity: Korean-run  Food: We had (3) rolls. Alaska roll, rainbow roll and Joe's roll. Each roll had 8 pieces so it was pretty filling and tasty. This is not authentic, Tokyo-style sushi, but works when you are in the mood for crazy rolls. The fish tasted fresh and the place was busy which means good turnover. Crab is imitation - FYI.   Ambiance: a little kitschy, but that makes it fun. Huge sushi bar that wraps around the whole bar. We sat at a table.  Service: Fast and friendly.

ikbD1GAuI7CJy-AB7gW5nw.text: Love their sushi here.  So fresh and a variety of rolls with dynamic flavor that will explode in your mouth!  There are too many rolls to name on this post.  If you like green tea- theirs takes the prize in town.  It's a vibrant great scene with equally great service!  Can get a little crowded on weekends so take that to note, but they offer sushi bar seating and have a lot of tables available so the wait is minimal.

mkTTjPBiPI-4JWITM-0O8A.text: All I can say is, I Love Sushi ruined me from going anyplace else! I haven't found anything better. Kiss of Fire, Something 's Wrong # 15 & 69, and Pepper Tuna no rice all among my favorites. Service amazing as well.

mgs2tbkhHVHKyzIleESLuw.text: Our favorite sushi place!!! The rolls are creative and taste amazing every time. We love the atmosphere and friendly staff and quick service. We had our first date here and we come back every month to celebrate with sushi

0vAXH1QQMi0qtxJDQhaeQQ.text: So many sushi options to choose from. Definitely popular with locals (we came in on a Tuesday afternoon and I was surprised to see how busy it was). Decided on the boom boom nipple special and burning my stomach roll with the hubbs. Definitely good sushi but not the best. Too much sauce on the boom boom--and some orange sauce that was a little too tangy. Veggie and shrimp tempura was cooked just right--nice and crispy. Will be back :)

_fKqtCHaVPgfEIt3b7SSQA.text: I've been to I Love Sushi a couple times and am not disappointed.  I had been looking for a sushi place after moving to the Henderson area.  My favorite rolls are the caterpillar and kitchen sink - both with no rice.  I will be recommending this place to all my Henderson friends.

duDMd1dvWoMFFewpkR-CYA.text: Horrible experience  I am new to sushi and I was treated so bad   Any question I had a recommendation they would not give me and they gave me the cold shoulder most the time. literally had asked a couple next to me for a recommendation. I did not feel welcome nor did I feel like I should be there. This is not a place that I will ever return to     It seemed Like I was more of a nuisance than a customer. I could be in middle of chewing my food and my plate was taken away from me       I ordered multiple orders of salmon belly and decided to order a beer. At that point I was asked is that the only thing you're going to order a seven belly over and over? Who cares I asked questions about what sushi you have and I told Jose knew that you are obviously upset that I'm ordering the same thing which I know is safe. O   I will not recommend this place to anybody nor will I ever be back.   I work in the food industry, I serve people day in and day out. I've been doing it for over 20 years and the way that I was treated and the service I was given I don't recommend anybody.

KvvWWEWAU07SvAK9iX8kJQ.text: I must say I have been to many sushi restaurants in many different states.  My son and I are very picky about sushi.  We found "I LOVE SUSHI" a few months ago and I am not exaggerating when I say I am there 3 to 4 times a week. The owner Milton is the most friendly and inviting man and the staff, especially Alice are all so sweet, kind and friendly. And the food.  OH WOW. The food is amazing. Never disappointed. I am in Awe of this place. I cannot get enough. I bring all my friends. Sometimes I am embarrassed about how many times a week I am there however I am just going to be me and do it!  Thank you I LOVE SUSHI and yes, I will see you tomorrow!

ckKzxWiiNjfAVOobeEe5vw.text: My go to spot in Henderson for Sushi. I will not go anywhere else!  Food is always fresh with a great service. They have a huge selection and variety of rolls, so you will definitely find something you will like. Prices are slightly higher than average but it's worth it to me for fresh Sushi and nice size servings. I eat a lot of Sushi and this is one of my favorite spots :)

PacdzsOfqOLOx0EWu2Qrow.text: Def my #1 place for sushi. The atmosphere is great, the staff is awesome and the food is always on point.

4DsBBgqpkoixP0OcRUz64A.text: The best sushi in town. Atmosphere, service and sushi were all 5 stars. Our server was the best. Our drinks were always filled, food came out presented beautifully. Our friends from out of town were happy we went here. Even my friend from out of town said it was some of the best sushi he's had. Their appetizers are great too! The place was packed, but we were able to get seated within minutes.

PMgb04zlFVHTplIYXN6uWg.text: Something Wrong 69 and Screaming Orgasm...if you can get over saying the order you will not regret what you receive! The service is quick and the sushi and sashimi is top notch. This place is always pretty crowded for dinner but they usually can seat a small party within 10mins.  All sushi is served with a small cucumber salad and ginger and wasabi. The Something Wrong 69 sushi roll and Screaming Orgasm sashimi plate are both our go to entrees. Both of these are paired with an unbelievable sauce that they make that seriously will have you craving this place 24/7.   To go with our sushi we always get Light Kirin beer and a Sapporo. You can't go wrong with a little hot sake to go with your beers.

6_Psr8GUkauHyQdW5cOHvw.text: This is not just my favorite sushi spot in Henderson, it may be - that it is my favorite sushi spot of all time. This is the restaurant where I started eating sushi for breakfast. The next day I would come back for lunch or dinner. I would order extra to take home. I would eat the sushi next day when it was half as good, yet somehow still delicious.  Here's what to get if you're like me, a fan of spicy tuna:  Spicy Tuna Hand Roll - do not get the cut roll unless you're a baby who can't bite into mouthfulls of high quality raw fish.  Kitchen Sink Roll - the debate here is rice or no rice. My personal preference is no rice(you get more crab).  No Mistake Roll - good for people who only eat California rolls and looking to venture out to real sushi.  Sushi boats are great for special occasions!

BPncLNFFu01Xn5A5ICSHfQ.text: There was a evening event that I had participate in at I Love Sushi. Our reservations were for a Monday night at 5:30 P.M.  I Love Sushi is located in Henderson, near the end of Horizon Ridge Parkway. It was about 45 minute drive for me, located out in the NW location of Las Vegas.  Sushi is complicated for me at times. I decided to opt for a few different items from I Love Sushi with several members.  [1] Chicken Udon [1] Dinner - 2 meat - meal [1] Poke Bowl [1] Order of Tuna Sushi type  Complimentary, on the house, Edamame was brought to the table [2]. The service I felt was relatively rude. The waitress would just drop our entrees on the table, without saying a "Hi" or "who ordered this" or anything. We had to shuffle a few items around to the people whom ordered certain dishes. Even after our meals were served, we were not followed up for any re-fills on drinks [etc.] except for the bill.  The Chicken Udon was okay. I thought it had been sitting in the back for awhile as it tasted like the noodles were slightly cold and starting to congeal with the broth.   The dinner [2] meat was pretty good. The Chicken and Beef teriyaki was scrumptious, both not overcooked and packed a ton of flavor! One of my favorite dishes, was what seemed like their fried rice cake, covered in a teriyaki based sauce. It was really good. I would just come back to I Love Sushi for that dish again.  The Poke Bowl was okay. My boyfriend, whom ordered it, mentioned that the Tuna was really fresh, but the rest of the ingredients in the bowl was just fillers. He also liked the Tuna Sushi.  I don't think I'll be back to this restaurant any-time soon. The bill was relatively pricey for all [4] orders, approximately $80.00 and the customer service was really poor.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

kJwfHYTY-HrnsUaqTSoc7w.text: This has officially become my favorite sushi place in Vegas/Henderson area!! This place is not AYCE, but what you pay in price, makes up in quality! The fish tastes so fresh! They also don't skimp on their rolls! You definitely get a lot for what you pay for!  I ordered the kitchen sink with no rice and wow! IT WAS DELICOUS!!! I loved the topping of salmon, tuna and hamachi! I had never tried a roll with soy paper before and it was a pleasant surprise! The soy paper brought brought a slightly sweet flavor which paired great with the fish. It is a pretty filling roll!   I can't wait to go back and try more! Til next time I love sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

RBhDD8DkYuY42t2HPJkFpw.text: For not being a sushi lover, their huge menu makes this a great place for me to join friends who do. Raw rolls, cooked rolls, noodles, tempura... you name it. The menu here has great selections (with entertaining names) and the food is equally great! We made a group to go order and it was ready within 15 minutes on a Friday Saturday night. I was impressed with the quick time knowing this is a popular spot.  So much to try! will definitely be back here again!

Lgtj-uRuNCen33Xp_J3dcQ.text: Our go to Sushi Joint! and party place on the south side!

e-6DguN4JpjZdX8iuFdY2w.text: I tried I Love Sushi for the first time today and I'll definitely be back! It's kinda off the beaten path, but worth the trek. Service was attentive, food was tasty, and there's something for everyone.   It's a good size restaurant with a slightly upscale atmosphere, and servers are dressed in traditional Japanese attire- cute touch! The main menu is pretty big and they have a wide selection of specialty rolls. We tried the Johnny's Special, Sean's Special, Ryan's Special, and Flower Rolls. The special rolls were HUGE! They were all good, some may have been a bit over sauced, but the standout for me was the Flower. Wrapped in soy paper (not what I would usually pick myself), it was fresh with a little spice, and I felt it showcased the fish the most. Another unexpected stand out was their steamed edamame- so flavorful and perfectly cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

HPpuxwSZN5_KgZr1cDdOyg.text: As a sushi lover I am  We decided to try out I love sushi based on the reviews on yelp. Really glad we made that choice. The place is lovely, very Japanese like and the waitresses are adorable with their Japanese robe!  Such a nice touch that you don't see anywhere else. As for the food, it's delicious and fresh, lots of different things to choose from. One really positive thing? They'll make ANY roll riceless!!! That was too awesome to know they'd do that!  We loved our time there and definitely looking forward to going back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Riceless sushi
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Tuna tower

To7q9IhobqPUi0igX_yyyA.text: Very friendly and authentic people. Felt like I got a little taste of the Japanese culture. Food was delicious and a great deal. We went for lunch and they have these huge yummy bento boxes. We got the beef bento box and sweet potato tempura which was really yummy.   I really loved this place, if I lived on this side of town I'd be here all the time.

Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Bento box with beef teriyaki and veggie sweet potatoe tempura

7sJQgyrSJsxSt_uN5Xtgag.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas!! period. full stop.

G380ZlrEQP8LZsCZUnvvnA.text: I have no idea what happened to this place.  It's a sushi restaurant we all once loved yet there is no sushi related dishes for lunch special.  Definitely the worst service ever!!!  The waitress is rude, unfriendly and super pissy.  I have no idea what she is doing here.   No impressed with the food at all either.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

kTXTeZMXp1eqD3IX4EkqVw.text: I eat a lot of sushi. There's AYCE. There's conveyor belt sushi. There's even sushi burritos. But I have never had a sushi boat! Me and my friends, they took me to I Love Sushi. A name like that usually means terrible food, but man I was pleasantly surprised. When I walked in, the environment felt like a small street in Japan. The waiters and waitresses were dressed in Japanese attire. So at least the vibe was top notch. And plus based on how busy they were, you do have to make a reservation.  Now on to the food, we had the Sushi Boat for 3, the yellowtail sashimi was better than most. Although the tuna and salmon sashimi was on par with its competitors. As for the Philadelphia roll, that was actually good, I'm not a fan of it usually because the cream cheese can kill the whole sushi, but this one had the right ratio of cream cheese. The Alaska and Spicy tuna roll wasn't heavy you can taste the fresh seafood, it was like it was ready to go with the wasabi and soy sauce. The others I cannot comment because there was just too much food despite it saying it's for 3...otherwise this should be your first Sushi Boat experience!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Boat for 3 people! But we actually had 5, still couldn&#39;t finish.

lu9srRWWNo3aWqEaXSZ38g.text: This place was fantastic! Authentic Japanese feel throughout the restaurant. Service was very friendly. We got the Dragon and Rock n Roll sushi rolls. They were both very delicious and came out quickly. The eel & eel sauce on the Dragon roll was perfect & I would come back just for that. We also got tempura veggies which were great. I would definitely come again when visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Rock n Roll sushi roll

l1lDilPyIp6hUtr6CHhODg.text: Never complain at "I love Sushi"  I have been loyal customer of I Love Sushi for many years, spent about $1800 this year to date. I typically place a take-out order. The employees recognize my voice & order when I call-in. I have a couple of favorites that I always order. One of which is their Lisa Hand Roll; which is made of spicy tuna, crab, avocado and shrimp tempura. I ordered (6) today along with a couple of other rolls.  Full disclosure. several years back, I had an issue twice with the Lisa Hand Rolls not being very full, they were half the size with very little tuna or crab in them. So they have been showing the rolls to me when I pick-up. I can only tell if they look to be normal size, I can't see what is in them. I haven't had an issue for the past few years until yesterday, they looked great, nice size, however...I called to let them know the Lisa hand rolls needed to be re-made, they were all filler, hardly any tuna and the tuna that was in them was stringy brown (disgusting) not pink. They told me that I had to return them first before they would remake them. I took them back and was interrogated by (3) different people, treated like a criminal. After the (3) of them conversed for a few minutes, they said they would remake them. When they brought them out to me, I was given a message from the chef, that he will never remake anything for me again, I was stunned.  Well when they showed me the remakes, they looked like something I've never seen before. They were very small with the reddest tuna I've ever seen, no crab, no filler, no avocado, no shrimp tempura, they were actually awful looking. Then what appeared to be a manager told me not to come back, they will NOT serve me ever again. To say the least, I was stunned by the treatment I received.

6mRjuiSulO2O_v8V1dd5gw.text: I frequent I love Sushi at least twice a month. There's always a lively atmosphere here and a lot of that has to do with the owner and staff who go out of their way to accommodate loyal customers. The sushi is always on point here and there are more than 100 rolls to choose from. This is not AYCE, and I believe it is not Japanese owned, but I think it might be either the best or second best sushi in Henderson IMHO.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiss or Fire
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Fat Ass Special
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Udon Soup

S3k7fi11h_HDph8u7AKXkg.text: We decided to try this place out and are so glad we did! The ambience is great, from the music to the kimonos. Once we stepped foot inside we were greeted and than seated right away! Our server who was so sweet and patient came and got our drink orders and then kept checking on us while we combed through the many rolls available!! The HUGE BONUS for me here was that every roll could be made with out rice...EVERY ROLL!!!! The rolls are pricey and we paid about $87 for 4 rolls, tuna tartare and 3 hand rolls. It rolls were fresh and delicious, we had no problem paying for what we got! It's great to find a place that has delicious food and great service! This place lives up to its hype! Can't wait to go back!
