YjTGry2ZbVDbDTcvKl3KIg.text: My guy and I came here on a Monday night and were greeted by the staff at the restaurant. We were seated promptly in one of their booths. It was slower this evening due to Fourth of July being on Wednesday. We ordered the salmon, yellowtail, uni shooter, and a spicy tuna roll (I can't remember the name) wrapped in cucumber. The quality of the sushi was unbelievable.  Our server let us know ahead of time that we can ask for any roll wrapped in cucumber which I thought was pretty great considering I'm avoiding rice at the moment. Everything tasted fresh right out of the water and we were happily full but not overstuffed. We cannot wait to come back. From the service to the ambience this truly was a 5 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

XybeXj9Yi1KK-5vuhS_M4A.text: Not Impressed. We came here, first time due to good yelp reviews and I, personally was disappointed.  We were seated right away but the reception of the hostesses borderlined irritation.  We were waiting for two more people in our party so we sat at our table and delayed ordering until they've arrived.  We were asked multiple times if we were ready to order despite us repeatedly informing them that our party is on route.  We ordered the bento for lunch. It was good but by this time, I was already peed-off because of what we've experienced thus far.  I am not saying that I will not return to this place but it is definitely not on my top pick of Sushi places to take guests from out of state and out of the country when they visit.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Teriyaki and Fish teriyaki lunch special
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch. First time at this joint.

OToNZMYRB84_elV68ywXXA.text: This is always a great place for good quality sushi.  The lunch specials are a good value; comes with pickled sliced cucumber, edamame, choice of 2 main dishes, soup, salad, 2 pieces of vegetable gyoza, inari sushi, sweet egg and steamed rice.  The food is consistent and service is always good.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch special with Tonkatsu and Shrimp and vegetable tempura.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Lisa Lisa hand roll

nE6vBWKzvyxOgGWztS3AGw.text: Though I am usually an AYCE sushi kind of gal, it was my friend's birthday so she wanted to go here. I never been here before but have heard some positive things about it. Though everything is ala carte, they have a huge variety of rolls to choose from. It was almost overwhelming to choose a couple because everything looked so good. Their dinner specials they have on their menu is bang for your buck because you get to choose two or three items and it comes with gyoza, salad, etc. I also like that at the beginning of every meal they give every person a little plate of pickled cucumbers. Good service for a large party. This place is kind of far from me but if I am ever in the area I would come back.

ZXx2QiBNEHPAUs2ejhw48Q.text: I had the James Bond, Bonzai, and the Lobster rolls. They were all really good. I especially liked the Bonzai and Lobster rolls. Taste the different elements in the rolls and the food tasted really fresh as well. If you don't like my choices then you have 115 rolls to choose from to suit your palate. I like how they bring out edamame and cucumbers for you while you wait which were good as well. Staff were attentive with filling my drink on a regular basis. I really enjoyed this place. Sorry for no pics this time.... I was too hungry.

61Rs-InPTIUId4Ua1tI94Q.text: Food:  This place is a shadow of what it used to be. The udon noodle soup was warm, not even hot enough to cook the egg they dropped in. Mind you I don't want it boiling but is it too much to ask to have some steam rising from the bowl?  Service:  It's busy, I get it. Some mistakes disrupt a good time. Out of order delivery of food, asking for a fork multiple times--more than twice, and cold non-sushi food.  Cleanliness:  I felt like I walked into a gas station, the bathrooms wreaked of shit and urine. Clean that up please. Remember most of us are either getting ready to eat, eating, or just finished eating. Vomiting is not my favorite after dinner activity.  Will not return.

Ht4lGzqa6jU_NPHpyY_upA.text: Worth every 5* review. Friendly staff, Sake-bombs, great value.  Although they aren't on OpenTable we always work around that.  At every sushi place the most important things to me (in order) - Fresh fish - Excellent service - Cold mugs - Good happy hour / late night - Unique flavor combinations - On OpenTable so I don't have to wait for a table and so I can get my points - Chefs and staff who will pound 3-9 sake bombs with you.  I highly highly recommend I Love Sushi

O2uwK9T8XuGBSqtKdT74hQ.text: I never drove around Henderson before, but after looking for I Love Sushi, I realized it's a really nice residential area with TONS of eateries around! Definitely convenient if you're staying at South Point and don't feel like going on the strip or downtown.  I Love Sushi has a very Japanese-style interior which I liked since it makes it more authentic. They have literally HUNDREDS of different types of specialty rolls..not to mention unique (and sometimes embarrassing) names for them! No kidding, it was a little overwhelming to be quite honest, haha. We ended up ordering the Screaming Orgasm, I Love My Ass roll, and the Spider roll. I enjoyed all of them, but I think my favorite would have to be the I Love My Ass roll. Super savory and delicious! The Screaming Orgasm was definitely good, too - it's more like a salad though, just FYI. The rolls are a little pricey, but their portions are pretty generous IMO, so no complaints here! I left with a VERY happy belly :)  So yes, recommended and I would definitely not mind eating here again if I'm ever staying at South Point again.

ahdE_5PUmXq1YjPIs_uzOg.text: I love the atmosphere here - it's always rockin busy so you know the fish has to be fresh!. The sushi bar is huge and the booths are big and private. All the waitresses are friendly and very attentive. They wear stylish colorful Kimonos! It is absolutely family friendly - this is by far my favorite sushi place in all of Vegas / Henderson! People travel from all over town to eat here! They have very sexy & fun names for their sushi rolls! Coldest beers in town - large sapporro - fav!! My favorite rolls you have to order:  #1 Screaming Orgasm - Tuna with radishes that are cut like angel hair - good for low carb orders! #2 Kiss of Fire ( It's a little Spicy- if you prefer not spicy - just say no sauce- the little sliver of jalapeno on top is fresh so not very spicy) #3 Johnny Roll No Rice - Refreshing! #4 Sushi Nachos - Unlike anything you have ever had! Pure deliciousness! #5 Anthem roll - traditional Calif roll with spicy tuna on top. #6 Ryan's Special or Double D #7 Caterpillar Roll  This place is busy from open to close! Call ahead to get a reservation!

c3R6FO5zsaKCkiXZtYeAgg.text: Great food and an amazingly helpful owner who will walk you through all of the food options for both newbies and veteran sushi eaters alike.

yt2qdr6w9QZwKRPSAnMOcQ.text: This is probably my favorite sushi restaurant in the Las Vegas/ Henderson area. Their food is so good and very fresh. I have always had great service there. Their screaming orgasm is delicious. They also have rolls that are wrapped in cucumber instead of rice and I absolutely love those. Everything that I have tried is very good! I would recommend this to anyone who loves sushi!  The only con that I can think of is that they don't offer all you can eat. But besides that I love this place.

5kZC1BLMeEff4pCANq4Fug.text: The fish here is so fresh, service is fast! Tuna Poke is some of the best I've had! It's sooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic tuna and yellowtail sashimi...super thick cuts!! So good....
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Tuna poke and the Rock&#39;nRoll ordered with no rice...sauce for the roll is amazing too!

Tm4VIPIvrppd4WRbYjdncQ.text: The food here is impeccable and the ambiance is very nice. Halibut is always on point and the salmon skin hand roll is delish. These guys know how to do sushi right!

PtUGEZTlxWsV5ScDRtOHXg.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas, they really nailed it here.  Their American style sushi is prepared in front of you if you are sitting at the bar, which I recommend for a fun social experience. The staff is highly entertaining, serving double-duty as chef and social ring-leader they are somehow always successful at getting my group to participate in a round of saki bombs.   The chefs recommendations are always a good direction to go. Their service is fast but they don't rush you, allowing for a fun dinner experience whether you're out with a group or on a date.   The decor is cheesy and perfect. It can use an update, but if they do I fear the environment would change, so I do not recommend that they change a single thing.  If you are a sushi snob, this might not be the place for you, and we probably wouldn't want you hanging around us anyway. But if you are looking for yummy food and a consistently great time, I Love Sushi is your place.

93D1j_ezeiqom7eCZoJgVQ.text: Tried giving I Love Sushi another chance, and left less than impressed. Off to a bad start with the crumpled paper napkin with a couple of specs of blood on it, as if somebody has squeezed a pimple. Ugh ! Well, here's the beer with a nicely frozen mug. Next was the Tuna Tartar with Salmon (!) and avocado, which was easily the highlight of the event. Unfortunately, it was downhill from there. The tempura shrimp in our first two rolls was tough and chewy, as if it had been fried a while ago. The other rolls were rather bland and forgettable. Would have been 3 stars with a clean napkin.

FHJTFz_ydtdGKlDEppFP-A.text: I eat here ALOT and can't believe I am just now reviewing this place.  This is truly a great sushi spot.  Although it is not AYCE, I think for the quality of fish, it is perfectly priced.  I never leave here feeling like I overpaid.   Every roll is cut into huge pieces.  If you have a small mouth (like myself), it makes for some interesting eating trying to cram a whole piece into your mouth.  But it's also very filling!  I'ved tried the majority of the rolls at this place.  Here are a list of my favorites:  Kiss of Fire - Very spicy.  This is one of my favorite rolls I've had anywhere Franky Special - Just the right amount of spicy and sweet Burning my stomach - This thing is hot!! love it! Tastes Like My X-Girlfriend - Got to love the names of some of these rolls, but this is very good.  I can't say enough good things about this place.  I've been here on a Tuesday, Friday, Saturday and I've never had a problem getting a table, but it is always crowded.  The service, this means everyone from the door person to the chefs, is excellent!  I love the atmosphere here, too.  It's very lively and has kind of a bar feel which really adds to the experience.    I don't care if my Japanese food is prepared and served by Koreans.  Good food is good food!  One word of caution:  this place does go kind of heavy on the sauce, so if that is not your thing, you may not love this place as much as I do.

4VsX3qpVv98jDXiQEtoxbQ.text: As good as it gets.  Fresh sushi. Awesome service.  Awesome menu.  The sushi chefs are friendly. The owner is friendly. The wait staff is friendly.  Did I mention the food is awesome too?  This might be the best restaurant in Vegas period.

YGG80WR0zjZ384BTz5Eg4w.text: Amazing sushi. Probably the best me and my wife ever tried. Guys are great out there,especially Aron and Randy. Best sushi guys ever. Super friendly.  A+

ok64FUkXbyE-avtMiKTWcQ.text: Great quality fish.  I have been here about 10x and have always had a good experience.

_POw8TKm4emQRVE776Dv5Q.text: I always come here when I'm craving sushi, and anything less than the best just won't do.  Even though it's a drive for me now, it's still very worth it making the drive here because of the consistency, quality, and service. No complaints, other than they seem to have stopped offering the hot hand towels, and the place can get really loud and hectic during busy times! But service is almost always top notch with promptness at taking orders, refilling drinks, taking away plates, etc.   The Double D roll and garlic tuna nigri are some of the best I've had.  So much good options that it can be very easy to rack up a big bill. But it's worth it.

cDR-Jr48_9igP-lIY8cdzw.text: This place was delicious.  The dining room is pretty large and was packed.  My friend informed me that it was packed every time she has been there, but we were still seated immediately.  The waitresses are dressed and Gieshas which was really cool.  The food was amazing, and I highly recommend the Sushi Nachos.  They were delicious.  Will definitely be making it my regular spot.

6Eq_KztZPg-H4W6rKq_2yw.text: I've tried this place out once or twice more. Service was terrible, hardly friendly at all. The sushi is just not that good. I wish I loved this place but I can't stomach it. Extensive menu with crappy service and very mediocre food.

O0gUvmhW2sbb6JC_HcOJJQ.text: Some of the best sushi i have ever had - very fresh - i didn't buy so i don't know the pricing but I Love Sushi is my new favorite place!

9ynKE1N2i-GpR0jLqnDOIg.text: I have been to several sushi spots all around Vegas and around the country and this is my absolute favorite place to eat sushi. I like to do all you can eat but sadly this place doesn not offer AYCE  suchi so it can get pretty expensive. If you ever go I recommend you try the screaming orgasm... you wont regret it.

0eJRxRSAY3szM19QBNAqAw.text: One of my favorite sushi place! Great service and absolutely the best sushi place in Henderson!

PDmaa5e1K8MRiajYt8QQZw.text: Always consistent. Sashimi is cut for perfect mouth feel. The takeout presentation is plated well.

iRQfH8bmMNap6wydMAGwKQ.text: My favorite sushi place in Henderson and perhaps all of Vegas. The decor is aesthetically pleasing, the waitresses are lovely and remember your orders if you're a frequent customer, and the service overall is speedy and organized. And the sushi. Good lord, the sushi. The menu ranges from simple, elegant rolls to the more decadent style and they're all amazing. There are a lot of really creative flavor combinations that I haven't really experienced elsewhere. I've never had a bad roll here. The ingredients are always fresh and flavorful as well. Always a wonderful experience here. Don't miss out on the screaming orgasm, the one night stand roll, and the tempura ice cream. It's all lovely.

hA6K-j3UkvB5t4w8aYlALA.text: Finally.  After trying about half a dozen sushi joints in town, I think my wife and I found one we will go back to regularly.  I Love Sushi gained instant credibility because a.) it was actually crowded when we went there (on a Monday no less) and b.) they didn't have some incredibly priced ala carte menu to entice you into their "all you can eat" offering.  I think my wife and I would each get our rolls again (I Love Sushi roll, The Mistake roll, some roll that had the word "nipple" in it, and another one I forget the name of).  The highlight for me was the sashimi.  For $5 the portion was great.  Three very thick pieces of salmon and incredibly dark/fresh tuna.  The salmon was delicious and maybe the best salmon sashimi I've had, same for the tuna.  In the words Ahhhnold, "I'll be back."

DRZo_mraOpu_ZSxzC12VIA.text: Fantabulous!    I come from South Florida. I'm a native of Florida.   So we move to the desert, and I read the yelp reviews and it's only one mile from our house.  Wow!  The freshest and most original menu I've ever had.  I've been to Tokyo twice, and I have to say this is as good if not better.   I've just become a regular. Staff excellent.   Don't miss great sushi in the desert. Whoooooooo Aaahhhhhhh!

joCDK7kg-03uo4rZK5X0_A.text: If I could give this place more than five stars, I would. This is the best sushi I've ever had. My husband I and have to go here at least once a month. It gets busy around the dinner rush but they move tables really quickly. The sushi is always fresh and comes out really fast. Here are some suggestions: screaming orgasm, kiss of fire, mountain roll, Ryan's special, double d roll, threesome special... Everything is good. I've honestly never had a roll here that I don't like. The rolls are big so don't over order!   A definite must if you're in the Vegas/Henderson area!

NeZ6Jzw1BqR_etiO06Ai0Q.text: I want to say I've been here three times between the end of last year up to this past May. The good part is that every trip was great! I was really, really skeptical when my co-workers informed me of a "good" sushi joint in Anthem, so it took them a while to convince me to take a trip here. I'm definitely glad they did.   What's different from other sushi restaurants is probably the most important. I like that they have several, really delicious, no-rice sushi options. Very cool for those that want to watch their carb intake (diabetics!). Also, this is a non-AYCE sushi joint. Not everyone's cup of tea, but I think that attributes to the freshness and quality of fish.  My favorite no-rice dishes are the Spring Mountain Roll (spicy soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, avocado, radish sprout, eel, wrapped in rice paper, topped with spicy mayo and sriracha) and the Screaming Orgasm (tuna sashimi or seared, lots of julienned daikon, sauces galore, tobbiko, green onions). The Spring Mountain Roll is probably my overall favorite sushi roll. The last time I was there, the chefs gave us a bowl of tempura jalapeno. Not something I would ever order, but they were so good! And not terribly spicy either.   My only gripe was the terrible quality of the Ikura on my last visit. It was not good. But, to their defense, I hardly find really delicious Ikura or Uni in the valley. Other than that, it's just really busy during dinner. Service is usually pretty good, no complaints, but nothing amazing.  Overall, great place for a sushi fix!

ziHz1_zqB9Vl00jz0F0gUQ.text: It's Friday and my son was craving sushi, so I ordered ahead and picked up a Dragon Roll and Gary's Special.  The Dragon Roll is a California roll with eel and eel sauce on top.  I was cracking up because my son was eating the eel first, and then popping the rest in his mouth.  He loved it!  Gary's Special is a plethora of goodness, starting with spicy soft shell crab, spice tuna,  spicy crab, spicy scallop, and if that's not enough it's topped with yellowtail and salmon.  OMG.  My poor son, we were all digging in and trying this one.  Quick tip:  when you get it to-go, the sauce is served separately in a little plastic container (I love that!  Keeps thing from getting soggy).  Be sure to mix it up good, because I didn't and had too much oil, while my husband had the foresight to mix it up better and enjoyed a citrus note.  Although I Love Sushi is not an AYCE joint, it has some mighty fine sushi and a really nice variety of specialty rolls.  And, since it's right around the corner it's a favorite neighborhood place.  Enjoy!

jTCWq6XV7X5R4EhyHRmSXw.text: Absolutely delicious and fresh every single time we are here! There's no other Sushi restaurant in town that can be compare to I LOVE SUSHI, and we have tried many! Whenever we have guest visiting, we always try and take them here. We highly recommend this place!!! ENJOY!

vaJDj1JKTKt-j_7GA2kgVg.text: Absolutely love this place! One of my favorite sushi places in the Valley. I have not dined in yet, always get it to go, and it's always so good!! Bam bam roll is amazing!! Also love the screaming O!

JgmhF7Z3sQ2n11ddF3W1KA.text: We love this place. I have never had a bad experience. I've tried different rolls each time and haven't yet had one that I wasn't fond of. Fast, efficient service and presentation is a bonus.  Another BONUS: They give you hot towels to wipe your hands with at the start of your meal!   Extensive menu. Thumbs up.

y2TUpSSV2wmfowEc1Qkm3Q.text: I dig the name of the restaurant, because I myself L-O-V-E sushi literally.   The service is terrific here. Every time I come here, they always greet customers as you enter. Staff is friendly, fast, and efficient. And I've always sat at the sushi bar - I like to be up close and personal with the sushi chef and see what they're doing.   The sushi is great. They offer a variety of special roll's. However, I ordered screaming orgasm and wooow... the seared tuna was fresh with there tasty sauce, and not chewy.    To top it off, an order of Nigori sake makes it all worth while. It compliments the sushi and seared tuna all together.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Nigori sake
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. screaming orgasm
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

iGeiVrCXpVNUf9n2Kvc7vw.text: Typical selection of sushi without the Strip restaurant prices. Basic decor but with friendly and very attentive staff. It's a good choice for a casual no frills meal. Quiet atmosphere. I did not have a reservation and don't know if they take them but on a Late Wednesday afternoon I was able to get seated right away.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Dynamite  naked shrimp scallop mushroom topped with masago

6Nl9vKINUfdFD8iZNw6wFw.text: With names like stacys mom special and sex on the sushi how can you not love this place. The best thing on the menu was by far my ex wife :)   The entire atmosphere of this place was perfect for any group function. The folks that I went with were having a blast, between the Saki bombs and asahi super dry we were definitely causing a ruckus and no one seemed to mind. The sushi was fresh, so i had no concerns of internal battles with fish and seaweed.   I am definitely not a sushi person but i have to admit that being drug out to I Love Sushi and being forced to have a good time was by far one of the best decisions ever made for me. You gotta try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Im sure this is gonna suck in the A.M.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. saki bomb in the making
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado flower dish filled with fish (sorry i forget the real name)

NHm2i9sGJmyC8Ahjby3Kxg.text: I blame I Love Sushi for making me the sushi snob that I've become. I refuse to eat sushi anywhere else... my friends have tried to force other restaurants down my throat and each time I've been highly disappointed that I wasted my money on such sub par crap! I've pretty much had everything on their extensive sushi menu. Service is always fast and friendly....as a reg. customer I always feel like a celebrity when I dine there. Hands down the best sushi I've eaten, ever!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The kiss of fire will leave you wanting more
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The I love sushi special is the perfect spicy Ahi tuna roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The Jackpot is my all time favorite roll.

vpuTDr_TwzrHqA2_siqvdA.text: Love this place! Yumm! Everything was really good! A little pricey but great! We really enjoyed our dinner!

ArDBUOm4YmlYZxX3DyCG8Q.text: Cannot go wrong with this choice. The fish is very fresh and the rolls are exceptional. Try the yellowtail sushi, it's absolutely wonderful!

Mwq9OlrxLxmR4u4XwAUKGQ.text: Excellent!  The food was excellent.  Great service.  The portions were nice for the price.  My wife and I had sashimi while my father and boys had combo meals. The meals had very large portions.  Particularly with the tempura.  I highly recommend this place!

siR4SvHzbZrTTfyTpJHdAA.text: I finally was in Henderson. I have been trying to get to this place for a while and finally the day came and I have to say it was not disappointed.   Located in back of a strip mall off of eastern  ave. As soon as we walked in we were greeted. The waitresses are in kimonos which is kind of cool as for the decor it feels like you in Japan. Their booths are closed which is nice and intimate if you have a date. Service was great as well kept the refills coming and always asked if everything was ok.   As for the food the fish quality was really good fish melted in my mouth had the screaming orgasm, chef special roll both equally as good. I just wish they were closer to Summerlin.   Def will be back sooner than later!

TDgtzY9X4DLIpWtJz79VwQ.text: For sushi in Las Vegas and Henderson... this is the ONLY place.  Quail Egg shooters, Uni shooters, unlimited choice of cleverly designed and monikered sushi rolls to satisfy any palette, beautifully prepared, fresh sashimi selections... I could go on but that would waste your time.  You should just start driving and get there.  For those needing a more thorough review - here it is.  James (the owner) and his wonderful band of creative chefs and service staff are a one-in-a-million find.  In 9 years of going to this place 4 times a month, I have never had a less than welcoming and wonderful dining experience.  Lunch or dinner - it makes no difference - you are warmly received, served the best fish in town, and you are quickly absorbed into the electric atmosphere.  The chefs are top notch and have a lot of leeway in terms of creating your perfect dish, even if it's not on the menu.  And that is saying something since their printed menu and roll & specialty menu exceeds 150 items.  Amazing:-)    Their food quality is 5-star.  But what makes it fun is how cleverly written the sushi roll selection menu is - sometimes inappropriate, yes, but always hysterical.  Selections include - Screaming Orgasm (large or small),  Tastes Like My Ex-Girlfriend, I Love My Ass and, of course, the well received I Love My Fat Ass.  The hilarity and creativity of the menu is only exceeded by the fact that all are beautifully prepared and DELICIOUS!   The biggest rave for I Love Sushi is the SERVICE!  Without fail this is the best trained, best managed and smartest group of servers and support staff in town.  One visit, they remember you.  Second visit they remember your name.  Third visit, you are part of the family.  Think Cheers meets the sushi industry - it's a winner.  If you are hankering for a sushi fix, please do not hesitate to join the party at I Love Sushi.  You will not be disappointed!  Tell them Shannon and Lisa sent you!

oOVbko2nKt-K0d7-kykpOQ.text: Food is suspect but service is very good. Haven't been there for a while but went a couple times in the last month. The nigiri had a bad odor and the chef did not do a good job trimming the fish. Screaming O and jalapeno yellowtail sashimi were also cut poorly.  To top it all off the rice had a rock in it which resulted in a visit to the dentist to fix a filling!  I would choose many of the other local sushi restaurants long before this place.

DVDQW-B3xIr25X8aS89yyQ.text: BEST sushi in Vegas!!! Love sitting at the sushi bar, BoomBoom is amazing! The Ryan Special and the Gary special are so delicious! We are so picky about sushi since we moved from California and there are some of the best sushi restaurants there but this one is close! Must try!!

jNBDA898lsbHYSkb7XnAxQ.text: Excellent food cannot beat the price on the lunch special. White meat chicken was not on the menu but they made mine with chicken breast per my request. Great fast service too.

1j6TP-5vsGs5iMcvnb-vsg.text: Fresh sushi in Nevada? Yeah, its not just theory anymore. I visited "I Love Sushi" because of its stellar ratings (and I was lost). I used to seeing 4 star reviews for places, but the reviews on Yelp were a whole other matter. When everyone is raving about specific sushi chefs, -BY NAME - you have to know something is great.  I am so glad I tried this place. The little extra's are great. Hand towels, exceptional service. Even when you sit down, people all around you are talking to the chef by name. Crazy! I love it.   Each roll was exceptional. I actually ordered 2 more than I could eat because I loved it so much. I am a pretty picky person when it comes to sushi, but each roll was better than the last.   Hands down one of the best sushi places in Vegas. Check it out.

s3m6hXM2BNEL1ZwCHfyhWQ.text: Came here for the first time tonight and this place is awesome!! Everything was so good. The sushi was incredibly fresh and everything came out in a timely manner. I recommend the one night stand roll, definitely my new favorite roll! I love sushi came highly recommended and I'm so glad I finally tried it out! Already looking forward to coming back. Special thank you to our server, Hannah! Exceptional service!!

N3U3bnq6AccCXC8WD6ObSQ.text: The service is adiquit my family had enjoyed 3 rolls we had the spicy yellowtail sashimi 4/5 stars the sauce is amazing it really pops out in an amazingburst of flavor. We also enjoyed The Kiss Of Fire 3/5 stars it was good but it was quiet spicy and I'm not big on spice but it was quite good. Last but certainlynot least we had the Dancing EEL Roll I give it 4/5 stars it was exquisite it was a burst of flavor in so many ways the eel scause is great and I'm not a big fan of eel but it was sweet and had a amazing taste. I recommend this restaurant extremely for a family it was and amazing experience and can't wait to come agian I stand strong with my opinion.

-LWn0m5yV2gN3_WvQtNg4Q.text: Finally got a chance to eat here. It's across town, so you know how it is for us old folks to get around. I liked a lot of things about this place: The service was good, I was seated right away, and there was a large selection of sushi rolls. The only thing that I wasn't crazy about, was that there was no all-you-can-eat deals. If I wanted to fill my belly at this place, it probably would have cost me in excess of $100. Now, this is partly my fault, because I eat every meal as if I'm going to the chair, but there are lots of other sushi places which offer AYCE, and the quality is on par with this place. If this place offered AYCE, it would get 5 stars, hands down.

LpvgZxkDfz4d5H67qPlAoA.text: Soo yeah I think I'm in LOVE! Ummm yah hands down best sushi spot I've tried. And I will never go anywhere else!!! The rolls were so flavorful, there wasn't a lot of rice packed in them and there of plenty of fish. The poki salad was great! Our waitress was nice and friendly, I think her same was Lisa :-) I wish I could have tried other stuff on the menu but I was stuffed. Oh yesss for dessert get the mochi combo :-) anyway I will be back soon! LOVED IT!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummmm... Poki salad, Alaskan roll, rainbow roll and a spicy roll that had jalapeño on top :-)

yCfYYk_qA1oun_sAKYN0RQ.text: I love sushi, and this aptly named establishment delivers very good sushi. Armed with a varied menu of sexual innuendo sushi rolls, there is something for everyone.  I love sushi does not do all you can eat which makes it difficult to try different things on a budget but usually means better quality and attention.  Note - 3 stars means A-ok in my book.  To score higher, a restaurant needs to add the other things in that make restaurants appealing.  This is where this experience fell short but I enjoyed the food enough that I will return and hopefully update the review with additional accolades.  What fell short? 1) From the initial seating, we felt rushed. At least 3 times in the first 5 minutes, the sushi chef assigned to us (there must have been about 6 sushi chefs behind the sushi bar) asked us if we wanted to order. It was our first time in this restaurant and we were obviously going over the menu and I thought it less than friendly.  The bar was not overcrowded and there was no danger that other customers would be waiting without a seat.  Once we ordered the food came very quickly.however, when we wanted to make an additional order, we found all 6 chefs staring at a Nets game and not paying attention to the customers.  It literally took 5 minutes to get the chef's attention.  We ordered the sushi dynamite which tasted good however it said it came in a shell but it really comes in aluminum foil which gives it a very tinny taste and really lacks in presentation.  Finally, this is the most overpriced sushi restaurant not located on the strip.  if you order one of the special rolls, it costs nearly as much as an AYCE lunch.  The rolls we tried were good but there was nothing distinctive such as larger portions, better presentation, or fresher fish than a similar AYCE roll.  I do think this place has potential and on a busy night might actually be a fun place for the crowd and chefs.

3F6y7Czttil5Enr87G-kBA.text: Love the name, love the place. I have been here a few times over the years, I'd be there so much more if it wasn't on the other side of town.  I have never had a complaint. I always get their Edamame and Spider Roll, my favorites. This time we also got the Sexy Time Special Roll, which I really liked...nice amount of hot with great contrasting textures. And the Dragon roll, eel..yum! Staff is always great. Fun atmosphere and decor.

3_34iM-kfKZKvsM-q62y0Q.text: We tried tons of Japanese restaurants here then one day my sister introduced us here when my daughter and I crave for sushi now this place is always on top of our list whenever we crave for Japanese food! We love the menu they serve and we eat a lot whenever we get a chance to eat here. We always ask to be seated in the bar area for us to be seated right away. But it's always pack so expect to wait for a few minutes.

CYOZx7L1O2l4rZRZOOVjkw.text: What the ----! This place is CRAZY good. Seriously. I've had a lot of sushi around america, I live in New York City.. this place rocked my world. Not only was everything 5-star good, but they did it while closing for a party of 20. I was expecting some seriously bad sushi and they basically melted my face off. 5 star service, 5 star food.

XNbGzvk0CPE_-OIsAhDFUA.text: this place rocks. great prices great service. awesome food, not just the sushi either, the whole menu looks great. my favorites are the jackpot roll, shrimp bacon maki, and fresh wasabi, it costs a dollar more but is definatly worth it! and dont forget to save room for mochi, they serve it at the perfect temperature too!  I LOVE "I LOVE SUSHI" !

dnSeWQbSd2fqfKB1k8riZQ.text: So good.  So good.  Lots of vegetarian options, including a plain noodle udon with a vegetable broth, which I don't often find at sushi places.  I highly recommend both the inari and the tamago. A hidden gem far, far off the Strip.

NwQ5NPqvNhrq2V0s6QbZiA.text: I came here because of all the great reviews. We were seated quickly and service was quick but it's the food that matters. The only roll I like was the kitchen sink. Also had the orgasm, tastes like my ex girlfriend and a couple others that I don't remember the name but they all had too much sauce and it's a bit pricey for the amount you get. There seems to be plenty of other sushi restaurants in the area so I won't be stopping by again

Qvd73bnkCWArs4cEhfJDbg.text: If you like Americanized special rolls, this place is definitely for you!  They have a large selection for specialty rolls.  Their rolls are creative.  I have been to quite a few sushi restaurants all over the States but this place had some rolls that I have never seen before.  All the fish tasted fresh and delicious.    They are a little pricier but they have a good service and pretty waitresses.  They have  a large sushi counter and can get packed easily.  We got to the restaurant at 5:30 and the place was already more than half full.  I would love to go back and try some other rolls next time I am in Vegas.

MtwbDiyzM5wRdoZM1MWnwA.text: These guys are just amazing. Best sushi in Las Vegas in my opinion. Ambiance is great as well. They sure could spice it up w some good music and better outfits however. Not sure about socks and flip flops however. Looks not so comfortable but hey food this good i take it any day. Spicy hot edamame  is a good start. Good new creations on new food designs.
