Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Tempura and crazy horse
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Great sushi bar area

8uwA9WN4kAWbbtXmHEF6BQ.text: Amazing! Best sushi I have had in NV by far for the price. The fat ass special roll, candy cane roll and garlic tuna sushi were all soooo tasty. Great quality of fish. Also they served us completely frozen mugs with our beer and that made such a difference in the Kirin light. I would literally go back just to drink beer in glasses that cold. Great restaurant!

jJDi51jw-Bf_DpROpp8G6Q.text: Great service ,very nice ambience .wr orded the spy edaname is excellent so is the extreme orgasam and the iced tea is so delicious ,mist definitely we come back again

w0YTRHJ39XP8muG0mZT6Gw.text: This place has great sushi and I have been coming here for years. Unfortunately today when choosing what to eat, I realized that every price on the menu has been increased by $2. It's unfortunate that they've priced me out of returning because you can get AYCE anywhere else for less than the price of 2 rolls here.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. The burning your stomach roll. Absolutely the best roll I&#39;ve ever had at least 50 times.

PlhwRG-jJZ8iDpw-EtluqQ.text: Note that this place is NOT anywhere near the strip... but we happened to be out in the area for a soccer tournament and went here based on a recommendation from a friend.   My friend and I got 3 things to share. (My apologies, I do not remember the names.)  1. Pepper Tuna - By far the BEST pepper tuna I've ever had. Its super peppery, but sooo good. It comes with a really great sauce that you just want to drink. LOL  2. Salmon wrapped around avocado - No rice. -- I'm not usually a salmon fan, but this dish was really good. The salmon was fresh and melted in your mouth.   3. Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice - I've had this before at several other places... you cant really mess it up. The rice cake was nice and crispy and they top it with sriracha and a sliced jalapeno.   YUM.  I really enjoyed this place and would totally go back. We are out that way for our soccer tournament every April... so we will definitely be back.   GO HERE!

irbxw1VvTTmjot_XuAxMFQ.text: This place is in a store front of a strip mall but make NO mistake about it the sushi is extremely Tasty.  We ordered the sushi boat for two and we couldn't finish it.  The staff is very friendly and attentive. Definitely a stop ALL the time I am in Vegas

O_ikskP1yQqPfcrioSNnig.text: I grew up very close to this place and somehow never managed to stop by until a recent trip back to Vegas. After eating there I seriously regret not having taken advantage of this gem. Service was spectacular. They were polite and very fast. The food was equally great. I usually don't trust sushi from places far from the coast, but the fish was very fresh and flavorful. Huge variety of rolls, all moderately priced. The crunch roll and spicy salmon roll were very filling. I will definitely return here whenever I come back to town.

Qci4k6Bn28yflzkZv-8OQQ.text: This place was recommended by a friend who lives nearby. We decided to check it out and i am glad we did The sushi was spectacular. Many different sushi rollls to pick from We ordered alot of different items and they where all all GREAT! Highly recommend!!

jMmi6vrpOPWhD3krnVGWzw.text: Loved "I Love Sushi"!  I went with a friend and everything we ordered was delicious!  When we first sat down we were immediately greeted and give some cucumber salad which was so good I wanted a bigger bowl of it but didn't want to fill up on it. We orders 4 rolls ( I wish I could remember the names) but each one was very good!  The names of their sushi rolls are very inventive/funny. I highly recommend this place. If you don't leave stuffed that's on you. I know I was beyond full but couldn't stop because it was so good.

cT_5w08uQEMYHWvqmjcxpg.text: My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. The food is excellent and they are super fast in case you are ever in a rush.   Garlic Edamame to start is a must.  I personally love the Johnny Roll with no rice, the Candy Roll, and Hawaiian roll. The tuna nigiri is always fresh.

fN6aDayHTRMOFJ_l6MEHIA.text: By far the best sushi I've had in Vegas off the strip! The fish is very fresh, which is hard to find in the desert! Sashimi pieces are a very generous size. Mmmmmmmm! The rolls are also huge and have the freshest ingredients. The menu for them can be a little overwhelming! Every time my friends and I go to ILS we always forget what we ordered the last time.   The service is quick and friendly. I recommend sitting at the sushi bar. Those guys are fun and interact with their guests! Atmosphere is upbeat and fun. Seems like everyone goes on a date there. This place gets packed for dinner, especially on the weekends, so be prepared to wait for a table. It can be a little pricey if you're used to AYCE places, but the quality is definitely worth the money!

iAolp2uwkupBQQE40FvGjg.text: I have had sushi all over the world and this restaurant still serves as my sushi benchmark. There are some restaurants I can think of that may come close but I have yet to try a restaurant that serves better quality and better tasting sushi rolls. I recommend the garlic edamame as an appetizer and the Spring Mountain and Cherry Blossom Rolls.

yagoaLSFJrlGj8j1_3O9JA.text: First of all I am a sushi lover.  Second of all I moved to Vegas from New York where you can get the best fresh fish.  So I have tried a lot of places before I found " I love sushi". And let me tell you... this place is amazing.  it's very consistent. Fish is always fresh.  They have the best sauces ever.  The only thing is they are trying to kick you out as soon as you put last piece of food in a mouth.  But at the same time I understand the rush because they are always busy especially on weekends.  If you don't have a reservation you might wait for 30-40 minutes.  I strongly recommend to reserve your spot especially if you have more than 2 people and dinning on weekends.

NOpCJ0jLn0FNxgRVE-R2_w.text: When you're in Las Vegas, but away from the strip, this is definitely a great place to go for cheap, yet delicious sushi!  It's about a 10 minute drive from the strip, where the plazas are all similar and filled with fast food and restaurants of all sorts. But I plead that you go down the road just a bit further to find this gem tucked away inside one of the plazas.  Upon entering the restaurant I couldn't help but notice the decor and the great atmosphere it had. It wasn't that the waitresses wore kimonos, nor was it the fact that the sushi chef all wore read outfits with a hat. The place itself it dimly lit, but gives off a warm feeling. There are both booth seats in front of the sushi chefs, as well as tables and booths. The booths are comfy, intimate and private. Though it didn't feel "Japanese" the atmosphere made it feel like it was full of Japanese mannerisms. It's hard to describe, but a welcoming and friendly place to be. You almost forget how bright and hot it is outside.  The service was also great. The waitresses constantly came to our table to make sure everything was okay. It was fabulous. They were not intrusive, and not too passive. It was just the right amount of pleasantry that anyone would desire to have at a restaurant.  The food was also good for the price you pay. Note that Henderson (Las Vegas) is no where near a beach, so don't go expecting freshly flown in tuna from Japan. That being said, the lunch special is a great deal. You get to pick two main entrees (including tonkatsu, soba, vegetable tempura, etc.) which also comes with soup, salad, rice, gyoza, and sometimes inari and tomago, all for just $8 (unless you get beef tonkatsu or a fish entree, not including saba). The sushi rolls themselves are good and made on par with any other Japanese restaurant, but not many I see have the Double D roll! It's quite good I recommend it, no pun intended.  Prices for the sushi is average ($12-14 for a specialty roll), but the lunch special steals the deal! Be sure to go here, I don't think you will be disappointed!

jYeA3x6nHGenCi64ww4eWw.text: This was easily one of the best sushi places I've been to. I love how unique their menu is. You can't go wrong with anything you order. I will definitely be coming back when I'm in town. It's well worth leave the strip to eat here.

rygYWFoiU8-bW-DzypfJYQ.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas! Try the Happy End as a last special and you won't regret.

JnnV_Ux58R0vYfPsJ78qww.text: Wow!!! Still the best in town. Great food, great service,  great atmosphere. I absolutely think this is the best place for sushi in town.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

DtPlzupZQLmmS9UivdfhjQ.text: Meh. That sums up this place. Came here because I was in the area and I didn't have time to sift through reviews, so went with the 4.5 stars.   Presented with the extensive roll menu, then got a food menu. Had to then ask for a sushi menu. Tells you something about the clientele around here. Can't fault a restaurant for giving the customer what it wants.   I just had an assortment of sushi, was decent. Maybe a slight cut above what you could get at an AYCE place, but not great for the price. The salmon had a slight chemical aftertaste, not sure where it comes from. Sometimes get it at AYCE places too.  Decor is kinda tacky, feels pretty worn. They should definitely look to renovate within the next few years while they are still popular.

Kqs2su8ljkcZaBadL3FvDw.text: I love this restaurant, they are so quick! Always making sure if we need anything else, excellent customer service and the cooks made me feel very welcoming and the servers are amazingly polite. I recommend anybody to go and try out the food, I love this place. It's also very dark and feels comfortable to eat and they have big wide booths I love it!

e1704__EFNePnypHjXxLQA.text: Food, service, atmosphere: all fantastic!!   This gem of a sushi restaurant is in a small strip center. It's worth it tho, because once you step in, you're transported to what you would think would have to be an expensive restaurant. However, it's not.   The geisha-inspired waitress brings you hot towels and a palate-cleansing cucumber salad while you peruse the menu.  The sushi is plentiful and has ingenious names like 'Bam Bam' and ' Screaming Orgasm'. We had the Monkey Roll, the crunch roll, the Bam Bam, and some baked mussels. The hot tea is HOT, so be careful! The staff is attentive, the food comes out quickly, and the sushi is fresh off the boat!!   My kids are sushi sharks, and my 9 year old son doubles down on his spice, so this was definitely a place for us. Good stuff, and we will be back!

wn2A67fRvNWdjQF-PaRBgw.text: Ordered the Japanese burrito and the spicy tuna roll. Was not a fan of the spicy tuna only because it had green onions in it and I hate green onions. The tuna was very fresh tasting. Melted in my mouth!

PiQEyNM8p5hc-hWqw_rTSQ.text: Wow, tons of roll options! I also like that they have hand towels just like they do in Japan! We tried 3 things - we tried the #24 Hawaiian (Good), #27 I Love Sushi (Great) and #49 which was a Peppered Tuna Sashimi (I'd pass on this next time). I came back with my brother and sampled the Double D (Great!), Threesome (Great) and Kiss of Fire (Good). He also introduced me to their Special Sauce (a must get!) and Tempura (Vegetables) that we're great! They even have Mango Mochi ice cream balls!! They are great, I'll be back!

89VJkrEtBdkmtxqlOdrXWg.text: EXCELLENT and attentive services, food is fresh, the combo dinner was a bit salty to my taste

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

Ceu12SlHGIteeqQ66KmUzg.text: 3.5 stars  5 stars for Ambience: I really loved the ambience here. I don't know how they did it but I felt extremely comfortable and ready to eat as soon as I entered the door. I would definitely hire their interior designer if I ever opened a sushi joint. Furthermore, I like how everyone is in costume from the sushi chefs to the kimonos on the waitresses.   3 stars for Nigiri: Ordered yellowtail, salmon, and uni. It wasn't fresh as I expected. Is it because it was a Monday night?  2 stars for Dinner Bento box: It came with tofu steak, katsu, and other bento items. Weak dish, pobably not a good idea to order it again.  3 stars for Kake Udon: Noodles were perfectly cooked, broth had a nice mushroom/earthy undertone.  3.5 stars for agedashi tofu: Decent flavors and decent serving (enough for 3-4 people to share).   Conclusion: It seems that I should try famous rolls next time I return. I really like the interior design so much that I'd come here with my friends to grab a few drinks and appetizers in the near future.

xX16zAc93QBGcQ8IsgOCmw.text: I really enjoyed the sushi here. Came for a bachelor party, and there were 5 of us. We had so much to eat and drink, we could've used a nap afterwards. Easily some of the best sushi I've ever had. 100% worth the drive!

28La3V0v0sW7hfnZ_cP-Tw.text: This place was sold and has changed and am NEVER going back. It was by far the WORST service we've ever had.....and we are regulars who come from NW Las Vegas. We noticed the last time it was slower than normal, but we got our food. Today, we went with our 16 month as usual, and an hour later still no food. The place wasn't even busy! When we kept asking all they said was I'm sort it's coming. People who got there after us were either eating or already done. Then when I said we were leaving because my daughter needed to eat, they just started bring rolls out....not even her chicken teriyaki. Nothing was done or offered, aside an apology, so we said we were leaving. They didn't even try to stop us and make us pay. I'm in shock by this whole thing! I am so sad that the new owners are failing with what used to be one of, if not the best sushi places in town.

dP-QEZzl4P57pIwpdvfCQg.text: Initially we had chosen to eat at this place solely based on Yelp reviews. I mean a place must be REALLY good if it rates 4.5 stars out of 5 correct?! Boy was I wrong.   When we first entered this place, I thought it was a pretty cool ambience. We entered on a Saturday afternoon and it was not busy at all. Waitresses greeted you with cute kumonos (sp?) on and cool Japanese music was playing in the background.  The first thing I noticed is that there is no AYCE here?! What the heck is up with that? And to top it off, one specialty sushi roll is average about $16.00 PER ROLL! A spicy ahi Hand roll was $6.25 per roll? You have got to be kidding me. Better be sprinkled with gold or something!  So quickly, my boyfriend and I decide on a lunch entree instead. Mind you, my boyfriend and Just came from the gym and expo so we are starving! We order 3 entrees for 2 of us and while we are ordering the third entree the waitress says something along the lines of "oi! More food?" I thought it was rude and then hilarious!  I did not get the waitresses name but she was probably the heaviest one there (just so that you can spot her, and not experience her rudeness.) Anyway, she delivers our 2 entrees and once she places my plate down she says "no more entree for you okay?" I had to kind of piece it together that she meant it was after 3 so no lunch special. She does not say anything about our third entree after like 10 minutes of not delivering it. So I proceed on asking her where it could possibly be and she rudely cuts me off and says "it's on the way!!"  After we are finished eating and she is cleaning our table she sees that I could not finish the tempura (2 onion tempura) and proceeds to tell me that I can request no onion next time! I cut her off and explain that I was full!   Horrible experience and to top it off, I got diarrhea after eating there! I'd rather eat at Sushi mon! They have all you can eat and not rude whatsoever.

zXAZ2oMIU01WQYV5s_tIQA.text: (Brown rice sushi) I love I love sushi even though this place is packed on weekends!! It's worth the wait. I am trying to be health conscious when I can be so I love that they can make sushi with brown rice. I don't know any other sushi joint in Henderson or Vegas that can make sushi with brown rice. Their fish is always fresh tasting. The waitresses are nice. Sometimes I get a little rude attitude when it's super busy, but it's OK. If someone know other good places that can make brown rice, please let me know.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon skin salad
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

n9EKy_seOvZ9IyJkys8xbA.text: This is probably one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been to.  Great service, amazing food and the selection is outstanding. Great if you love sushi or even looking to expand your horizon.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. This place is amazing! Must come if you are a sushi/Japanese food person or looking to expand your horizon.  Small Screaming Orgasm

MX7d0km1Xnol9i_ddc6CCg.text: I Love Sushi has the best sushi I've had in Las Vegas. Great atmosphere and excellent food and service. I highly  recommend.

vrZZ0ZwQeka9uxknqPmD8Q.text: This has been my go to sushi place for a few years now. Never have had bad service or bad fish here, always consistent. A couple of my favorite rolls are the Double D (No idea what is in the sauce but it is awesome) and the crazy horse. I always get spicy tuna, yellowtail and usually a hand roll as well.   The decor Inside is great with a very Japanese feel and staff wearing kimonos. They also have a large sushi bar. They do not have AYCE which will steer some people away but Its worth it.

e2I-pdnj2rt6yN_DATPrag.text: Sushi was great quality and service felt top notch. The server was very attentive and followed up to ensure satisfaction. We tried 2 specialty sushi rolls - both delicious. It helped that sauce was presented on the side so you can choose how much. I would recommend and visit again!

uoP72pPzT9bYte2DM2Hyng.text: I've had a really hard time finding a good sushi spot in Vegas. Too be honest freaks me out a bit (we don't have an ocean lol) but I heard this place from a friend so I went to try it out. It was amazing! Really fresh fish and awesome rolls. There is an older man who is so cute he owns the place and he is there everyday. He seats you and checks on your through your meal. The staff wears kimonos and look very traditional, the place looks "crowded" at first but you warm up to its cozy vibe. I ordered albacore sushi and a baked lobster roll, so good. They are really good with food preferences and allergies too, I'm allergic to mushrooms and my roll had it in it so they made it without them. My sister had the mountain roll and it comes in a little pyramid and it has salmon and crab! This place is now my go to for sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Crunchy roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Niku udon noodle
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegetable tempura

-4GfHuXW2BHHcPQc5v_9VA.text: The name is deceiving because you would think only sushi.  But they have udon, sukiyaki, tonkatsu, tempura.... and it's delicious!  The service is excellent!  Would definitely go back!

KBd4VePKd1GiRfsTjnYQ_w.text: In my opinion, after many years on top, it's still the best affordable sushi place in town.  Thank you.

d4WsplHZ7bnX-ZBfrv577Q.text: Best sushi in town! The service was absolutely fantastic we will definitely be ditching our old sushi place.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

uqZ5cB-U056zxPZ6Kc9adA.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in town! We prefer to drive here despite having other sushi restaurants that are closer to us. Our favorites are the Jackpot, Kitchen Sink & baked lobster. They've recently changed owners, this owner is just as friendly as the previous and nothing seemed to change which is great. The servers are very friendly and our patient with our messy and loud infant. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is because they should have an AYCE option!

DY0QrXOPwdgJ9spDHkTX4w.text: My favorite sushi restaurant I have ever been too. The food is absolutely amazing and the staff treats you so well. We regularly come at least every other week if not every week and we always order the same things Nigiri sake . Spicy edamame . Pan fried gyoza. Nigiri . And then we always choose a roll. You can't go wrong!

bKE8fqUGo8uoK77K0pOY4Q.text: Went around 6pm on a Friday evening. We were seated right away and asked what we wanted to drink. The menu has a very large variety of sushi to choose from, so it took us awhile to decide. Once we decided took awhile for the waitress to come back and take our order. It was pretty packed inside and loud. The sushi was ok. I've had better. Place is overrated and I most likely won't be going back.

pDcB5bwPvF4fqY58ibY2uA.text: Very good and very fresh. There was 4 of us for dinner and the service was fantastic along with all the food. If you love sushi, then yes......go

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

4TwgDV6DgLif2V0LvqSdKA.text: What a gem tucked away in the corner of a strip mall in Henderson.  Great food, nice servers, good ambiance.   The delivery of fresh sushi is a bit slow but the wait is well worth it.     The I Love Sushi special is fantastic and I highly recommend it.  This sushi joint has become my new favorite and my "go-to" spot.  This place delivers quality fish and just go!

88UCYFL7A2V5qDmNzhml6g.text: This place is pretty cool inside.  It's pretty big but this place gets packed.  I never had to wait but I would call because it does get a lil kray kray.  They have nice private booths inside.  They welcome you by saying something in Japanese.  The sushi is fresh.   I had yellowtail and it was like butter.  The specialty rolls were ok but I am partial to regular sushi.  I came here last week for my first time and I have been back already.  The beer is 6 bucks for a large Kirin or Sapporo. This place was recommended to me by a local and now I recommend it to you.

mDIeFN96GvAmeespdUYeFA.text: I feel like I was tricked by my fellow Yelpers... Service was below average. We weren't greeted by the hostess or our waitress. The nicest employee was the busser. She actually noticed that one roll was left pretty much untouched and asked how it was. The shrimp tempura was cold and extremely dry. She didn't take it off our bill, but at least she apologized. Agedashi tofu was good, but none of the rolls we tried was impressive. If anything, they sucked.  Not a good experience.

wgBuusLmB62Uou2y2UhlvA.text: Sushis are fresh. Place is big enough to accomodate a lot of people. Bento boxes are not ideal, specially the terriyakis. Sauce is too sweet, and meat are small portion. The eel sauce is not perfect and not thick enough. But overall, if you're a sushi lover. This place would be decent enough.

UPbrFb-Nb1n8Mhu7IGNImA.text: We just moved here and discovered this place on yelp. I want to repay the favor and give it a good review based on our experience so others can give it a try and enjoy great sushi!!  Have been twice in the last two months. This will be our go to place for sushi! Excellent customer service. We ordered the last call, one night stand and one other I can't remember the name off the top of my head. Either way, give them a try. Won't be disappointed unless it's a fluke.

QwkiBQNxsNbFRFD84CLfVA.text: Did not live up to my expectations! Jackpot roll was highly recommended and supposedly their best roll, but it tasted like a basic roll. If u want real sushi, head down to SD:)

PGMqENvJjsJ1dpVaMKQuTg.text: Great sushi! One of my favorite places always busy!!! all my family goes there and love it! Great service, family friendly and very fresh fish!  U gotta love I love sushi!!!!!

_OnruKVJygYUXRAn2fIZsg.text: This is the sushi place my friend takes me to whenever I'm in Las Vegas for a visit. On each occassion I've sat at the bar and the service has always been excellent and the quality of the fish has always been very good. They are prompt in making the sushi and the wait staff immediately clears the plate once you've finished. There is almost a factory like quality to the service in terms of efficiency. Although I haven't personally experienced, but my friend tells me that this "efficiency" also makes this place a bit undesireable if you just want to sit at a table and have a leisurely dinner. If your table finishes their plates and are just hanging out, it's almost guranteed that they will be politely asked to allow the wait staff to clear the table for a following reservation.

lWzD_F8Sj1r8Y8Bdc4ByGQ.text: My Favorite Local Sushi Place on the East side. I Love Sushi is always on the tongue of my friends when we are craving some raw goodness. You can always get fresh sushi here, and they have a really extensive menu of fun rolls and dishes. I love the screaming orgasm, yes, this is what its called, I know.  Its yummy ahi tuna with a nice sauce over little cellophane noodles. The place is always pretty busy and I try to go at non peak hours...(read: super late lunch as I always do) so the service is quick.  This is not a super discount sushi place nor is it crazy expensive. I like this in the middle feeling.

53HRNPCm1YP2XpaD001IaQ.text: Love this place! Super fast and attentive service, especially when you're seated at the sushi bar. The specialty rolls are amazing and diverse and the names just crack me up. Definitely not for the conservative, I think they'd be offended by names like "tastes like my ex girlfriend" and "I love my ass". Creative rolls, fast service, good prices, really friendly staff. Its a place I would go to 3 times a week if my income allowed it! Someday I will have tried everything on the menu.

Thfs5a4kjG18hunHnX3xzA.text: Solid sushi restaurant. Large variety of rolls--at least 70 different types. Indeed, the screaming orgasm and kiss of fire are delicious! Kindly ask friendly sushi chef J.B. for extra hot sauce. Their flavors & friendliness will not disappoint. Without a doubt, I will be back.

9j4rK8bj80vYancyf35Zxg.text: I Love Sushi is OK.  Not bad, but really just ok.  I've had so many people tell me its so good and...eh.  I was totally underwhelmed when I went.  It's definitely a cute place, and their menu is huge.  But the menu items aren't that different from each other.  I found myself flipping the menu over a bunch to see what the difference between a couple rolls were.  I think it would be good if you are going with a large group and you're more concerned with having fun than eating awesome sushi.

Jw34darqh8VzEoIiulK02g.text: This place was awesome! The waitress was dressed in a kimono and the place had great ambiance. I felt like I was transported to Japan. We ordered California Roll and Spider Roll plus a Miso Soup for less than 20 bucks! I will be coming back here again soon!

IzN6JPdZ_f7xyjCC8y0SKQ.text: I have to say this is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. The food and the atmosphere is great. I recommend having the "Frankie Special", I have to get it every time I go. Second favorite would be "The Sundevil Roll". Delicious!

PhJ0IYZLmo-7XLLhFNmZow.text: Excellent service & fantastic sushi. This is one of the best sushi restaurants in the Las Vegas area

nQkBWM6uio0_7utfep6MHg.text: My husband and I have been to this place several times and we love "I Love Sushi"!    The food is always fresh, fast and great tasting...equally important is the stellar service we consistantly receive from the girls dressed in their traditional geisha garb.  I can't say enough great things about this place!!

600c1yAIUV1qpaLOD-Y99g.text: My new favorite sushi place! Loved everything about this place - especially their food and service! As soon as we were seated we were given warm towels to clean our hands with, which is a nice bonus you don't get at many sushi restaurants. Even though there were many customers at the restaurant and more kept coming in, I was surprised at how fast our food came out after we ordered. Hubby and I ordered the chicken teriyaki entree, and 2 rolls (Happy Ending and Alligator). Everything tasted so fresh and just right; the rolls are also a good portion.  I was also surprised at how spacious this restaurant was; from the outside it doesn't look very big, but this place can definitely accommodate large groups! Will definitely be coming back here :)

gBfCyx9xGf7E0bhy8CvCNQ.text: I came here for the first time about a week ago for lunch and liked it so much that I got carryout for dinner the same day!  The prices here are higher than I normally pay for nigiri sushi, but the pieces of fish are possibly half again the size that you get at Sushi Mon or Yummy Grill Sushi, so you get more for the money.  The ikura is GREAT- fresh and huge!  I tried their inari and liked that as well- not overly sweet , overly wet or overly dry, and the soy "pockets" have a nice texture- I'm picky about my inari and theirs is my favorite so far.     I had lunch there on a weekday around noon and the place filled up pretty rapidly. But service was slow before it filled up- I think the waitress forgot we were there or assumed we'd need more time to decide.    The names of their sushi are ridiculous- one even has the word "a$$" in it!  The names don't seem to correspond to the food at all (what do you put in a sushi roll called "Whose Your Pimp?" anyway?), and the silly names don't jibe with the formal decor and politeness of the waiters either.  I would have been embarrassed to ask one of those nice ladies for that "a$$" roll!  :-D  Is this place good for kids?  Well, the food's great.  Just hide that menu from them!

YElyCRuuhh8lUCAuHqe_Pg.text: ***Korean-owned*** (you wouldn't get mexican food made by chinese people would you?) I came here because my roommate used to live in Henderson and recommended it...The food wasn't bad, not the best sushi rolls I've ever had. I had the Screaming Orgasm, Tastes like my ex-girlfriend, and several other rolls which weren't as memorable. The shishito peppers were a total ripoff, i've had way better and fresher ones made at other Japanese restaurants.   The service was terrible. Our sushi-chef Ray (i think that was his name), was very accommodating, but the servers were all very impolite and sometimes rude. It took my girlfriend three times to get an order of the shishito peppers and when the waitress forgot she gave us a disgusted look. The waitress also knocked over our chopsticks onto the sushi bar on multiple occasions and didn't even bother giving us a new set, she just put them back on our plates.  Pricewise the place is decent. For the three of us (two guys, one girl), the check was approximately $70 including tip and we left decently stuffed. Would I come back? Probably not unless a friend suggested it.

uTLeAedJc65PvE33aRtg9A.text: Great Sushi and great staff! We go there and see my favorite sushi chef... i don't know his real name, but we call him "sexy buddah" and he is quite the character! Favorite roll is "almost 90% special"

mLmEX2HUkKBg3T_m9UmJ0A.text: Definitely tasty, but not worth 5 stars in my opinion. They have a LOT of sushi roll items (about 100+) but in my opinion, that's WAY too many. It always takes me forever to go through the menu and after awhile, all the rolls sound the same.   Service is good and the sushi chefs are nice, but the menu is a bit overwhelming.

I-XpIlEvZ41jSJAoZAHMBQ.text: OHHHH EMMMM GEEEE !!!!!!!!!!!!! ahahahahaha I LOVE, I LOVE SUSHI!  and so do my family from Hawaii that come to visit.  I love sushi is a MUST when they're here.    The sushi chef's are a crack -up- very lively and funny, and the servers are very friendly and adorable!  Ask for Eun-soo, she's the best =]  My favorites: * taste like my ex-girlfriend * grand canyon * bok-bun-ja

loBVoS49vpdZHlCAvHBw9g.text: Yep, I've done a boat load of sushi places all over the States. This place will continue to hold a slot in the top three, easily. I don't care if it's in the desert! The sushi is fresh. The portions are generous. The staff is friendly and attentive. On top of that, you'll eat some rolls that you've never seen or heard of before, that have names right on key with Sin City style. You can keep your Nobu and your Roku. If you LOVE sushi, then you'll get this place. It's in the back of a strip mall, so watch for the little sign with the heart just past the Walgreen's. They do a killing on the weekends, so call in to make a reservation! If you're staying in LV, it's worth the drive to Henderson. Trust me. There is no all-you-can eat here. It's not that kind of fresh dead fish place. You'll get plenty full off a couple of rolls a lil cucumber salad and complimentary edamame. Don't forget to try the cold sake or the Korean soju (careful! Kick your butt that stuff!) Kampai!

xS13fzp6BS436vkfNysdWA.text: I had heard mulitple extremely good comments about "I love sushi" and decided to give it try, even though i am not the biggest sushi fan.  The first thing I noticed when we sat down was the big menu with such great options... The screaming orgasm is absolutely to die for.  Price is good, service is ok.  Wouldn't say it's great, wouldn't say it's bad.  Overall, it's very enjoyable.

rsL98Zh89le8iC6mwHHsIw.text: First of all let me just say that I'm a huge foodie and I love to try new restaurants. I love sashimi and being from Hawaii I've had some of the freshest fish ever, well this place comes really close to it. I love all they're creative sushi rolls, sashimi is super fresh, and they have some good entrees as well. The owners is there almost every night he's very welcoming and they always give you great costumer service, by starting you off with a warm towel to wipe your hands to complimentary cucumber salad. I love this this place and I've been eating here for the past eight years, and it's never a disappointment.

daIBXuupXnjHRgnA1IQSLA.text: The best place in Henderson for sushi.  My parents live there and they've tried them all.  We always get a boat.  It's fresh, delicious and so much fun.  I LOVE SUSHI!

9HfixbRkdoFod_uGVwPtxA.text: The name will speak for itself. You have to try the Sashimi Salad... tastes absolutely yummy!  As for the sushi... they have a complete variety. Too many to list. If you love sushi... check-it out!

dPMFsK4mCIu-NvSP9Sq8_Q.text: I've been here several times over the past year and they never let me down.  This is some of the best sushi I've had and I've been told by locals that this is the best in town.  Service is excellent. They have a few TVs with the games on them.  The grilled shishito peppers make nice accompaniment.  Definitely some of the best tuna poke I've ever had (get it spicy!!).  Great job!!

sSu2PTjoowCr9GGcWk4qjw.text: I haven't been here in a while but, my last visit wasn't as pleasant as previous ones. The noise level and seating availability was a nightmare at night because it takes forever to be seated and once you are it's really hard to hold a conversation because of the noise. I was on a date and heard more of the conversations at other tables than my own.  After waiting half an hour to be seated, the waitress led us to a table and ran off. It took the waitress a while to bring just water and once she did she walked off. After we ordered and waited about 40 min, we asked three times about our food and they said it was coming but the food didn't come till about a full hour after we ordered. The food was messy and was not at a desirable temperature. It seemed like they had neglected our food. I liked the fish in previous years but, the fish when I went did not look fresh and I got sick later that night. I will probably not return because of the last visit.

iVh0kxDIi1YIyQjW1CwBTA.text: Used to be the best sushi place in town, but they got rid of our favorite sushi chef and now the place isn't the same.  I am sure the sushi is still really good as it was always fresh and prepared quickly.

f5mlALISReTKqnv3AUm8OQ.text: I really enjoy eating at this place their roles are very good, and fresh

teKu9Hv1qogLWob29WcrHA.text: everytime we visit family in vegas we have to eat at i love sushi because we love sushi! the variety of rolls offered here is amazing. so on our last trip back we were super disappointed with the quality and portions. the nigiri was sad. tiny pieces of not so fresh fish and ok sushi rice. one of our faves- the screaming orgasm (who doesn't love one) was a big miss as well. the tuna was drowning in the spicy sauce. i've been there in the past and loved the rolls (hence the three stars) but it was pretty awful this last time as far as sushi freshness and quality goes.

zY8cPdjeNXudqMO3B0dkfw.text: Don't walk,run for the best sushi and service anywhere. No matter when you go, the sushi is the freshest, it melts in your mouth. They often have special items not on the menu, so ask your chef what they have. They also have fresh wasabi root that is grated if you ask for it. Everyone is friendly, from the chef, to the servers and the owner. We are always greeted when we walk in the door. We have friends and family that have eaten sushi across the US and they agree this is the best.

1zZ-FlQj5Z-oa_AUSCIdCw.text: Good sushi, overwhelming menu, great atmosphere, great service! Fun every time. :)

lyUalm8HWtrCseHegA5RRw.text: This korean sushi bar is located a good distance from the strip and caters to locals, especially those who want to drink and have a great time.  Be sure to take care of your staff of chefs here (seriously, I think there were 8 of them) with beer and they'll reciprocate generously.  I really just come here to hang out and drink with a local LV friend of mine and not really to eat.  However, I've learned the sashimi is the better way to go here as they give you generous amounts of it and is pretty good.  I suggest the albacore tataki or the yellowtail.  Make friends and have a great time....but be sure to have a designated driver or take a taxi if you plan to drink heavy here as it's pretty far back to the strip.

w1Kxd26Vw-W8vUN6fvbRbQ.text: I came here from out of town when I visited my friend. This place is delicious! Even though Vegas is nowhere near large bodies of water, the fish seemed really fresh.  Their service was good and friendly, and I liked that my cup of tea never went empty. Prices were reasonable as well, especially given the quality. You can't beat the names of their rolls. The specialty rolls are HUGE. My friend and I were stuffed sharing two specialty rolls and a maki roll.  If you're in Las Vegas and in the mood for Japanese food, make your way to I Love Sushi if you can!

mxtAJgNikansSJiw8iO2IA.text: The food here is awesome, lots of variety and inventive rolls and salads. I love the screaming orgasm. It's been around for a while and it's definitely high up on the list of best sushi in Vegas. It's a pretty huge place with a large sushi bar, tables and private booths as well, not as cozy as I prefer, but it does have that rowdy vibe that some of my favourite California places have. The sushi chefs usually end up pretty smashed by the end of the night, which makes things fun.

SbuSvdTcH2sNUWUQ7SNLBg.text: This place is one of the best sushi places here in the Vegas area.  Each sushi roll and every bit of nigiri is prepared with care and made to look beautiful.  The prices are standard for sushi, and not too expensive, though of course not something you can get every day in good conscience.    The service is good.  I've eaten several times at different times in the day, and the waitresses are always polite and prompt.  They're a little subdued in early afternoon, but they're quite nice at dinner times.  The atmosphere varies, but not at all badly.  In the lunch times and early evenings, when there isn't as many people, they're a quiet, pretty restaurant that you'd take someone for a chat while you eat, whereas when you are at dinner, especially on a Friday or Saturday, they're full and very noisy.  Why noisy?  Because the sushi chefs are busy being fun and crazy and flirty (with women) and sometimes randomly offer free drinks and shots of things, and if not, then they're being bought drinks by the appreciative customers.  But the service is always good.  The quality of the fish has never let me down.  Even on Sunday nights, when most sushi places are at the other end of freshness, I Love Sushi seems to chug along as usual, and some of the dishes just can't be matched anywhere.    I always eat Dynamite at sushi places, and theirs was quite good, if not the best in the entire world.  I'd say it'd be great to order if you're there, but not worth a special trip.  Overall, I love coming here when I have extra cash on hand.  My only complaint is that it doesn't have an all-you-can-eat option, which I suppose would make the service level fall, the quality diminish, and the presentation falter.  But I eat a lot of sushi :/

RjxBdmOdm_j67Ufn-2Enng.text: This place is way to fun.  Whenever I'm in Vegas it's a must to go to I Love Sushi.  I recommend the I Love Sushi roll.  It's seriously the best. and also I recommend to sit at the sushi bar ONLY if your seated with BOOM.  He the craziest sushi chef probably ever. He even has a video on yourtube of how crazy he is.  The atmosphere is great, the sushi is great and the chefs are AWESOME.  Also ask if you can hit the gong.  That is always fun...

ys7qIpoSMx_tIfbeCKqcxA.text: Definitely my fave sushi restaurant in Henderson.  Ambiance is relaxed and friendly, service is efficient, price range is reasonable, sushi is delicious.

pCB4iB-xmH6vPUM_0ZeNiQ.text: We've been a few times now and enjoy the food very much.  Service can be a little slow as they are quite busy - but that happens.  Spicy Tuna - down the road has essentially the same menu and they're half as busy.  My feeling is the rolls are a cut above...and the service is better.

ZsXIdVvaVwG8syfPOfFpIg.text: I can't believe I'm the first to review this place... Silly name - Awesome sushi, gets crowded at dinner time... Lots of exotic rolls available, but they nail the basics.. Best I've found in Vegas...

DDMzklkIyJEVJKooVjJo4g.text: I have been here several times and the only bad thing I can say is it is very noisy. Love this place and plan to go back many more times.

WGW72yjnzU0tG8ElGnKcCg.text: Service is great when they're not busy and good when they're busy.  Nice atmosphere.  Good food.  Highly recommended.  Rarely a long wait unlike the "budget" sushi places.

a_lyvMpYNT1D9St98dNgVQ.text: This place was not as delicious as I remember it being. This time my friend and I sat away from the sushi bar, so it was not as entertaining--with the flying fish fillets and sake shots--as last time. We also sat by the door, which made the dining environment chillier than I'd like. Overall the food was good. I had the noodle soup and my friend ordered some elaborate sushi roll and dinner meal. Service was speedy and attentive.

rROiJZy6-7NT37bpZ8ORbQ.text: Came to Vegas for the week, had to try this place based on the yelp reviews and interesting looking menu.  Variety was overwhelming, tried just a couple items and was full In no time.  Would have loved to try more .  My suggestion would be half roll option or sampler plates.  If your looking for variety they have it. Atmosphere  at lunch was quiet and comfortable.

EuqXxXuSDjB5Vm2Qh2xA_g.text: I've been going to I Love Sushi for awhile, it's always been my favorite but today was a different story. We don't get to indulge on sushi often, it's a treat when we're able to afford to go eat sushi. Today my husband and I were excited to go to our spot to get some sushi, sadly it was the worst I've had in a long while.. my salmon was SUPER fishy and even my california roll was fishy, how does that even happen? My husband wasn't as displeased with his roll or his yellowtail, but it definitely wasn't on par with our previous visits. I don't know if it was an off day or if this place is going down hill. To be completely honest, we probably won't be back. They don't offer AYCE so everything is a bit pricey, in my opinion if you're not going to offer AYCE you need to make sure your fish is fresh. Can I also mention it was a Saturday? Wouldn't you expect the weekend the fish would be the most fresh because of how much traffic they get on a weekend? I won't be recommending I Love Sushi anymore :(

FDNzCQCZhCgtFm4LLL5DVg.text: Fabulous sushi, wonderful. The food was excellent, and the atmosphere was very authentic. I highly recommend this place.

pa9RM2pIse7ZlSXZTJUedw.text: The best sushi I have ever had in Las Vegas. For that reason when we purchased a house, we were glad to know we were moving closer to I Love Sushi. The owner is always in there, working so hard and really helps facilitate the movement and feeling of the place. There's not a big turn around with the sushi chefs or employees. Always a good sign. We have become regulars

Oa3BKmIrqoADaoO1F9nPng.text: So I checked this place out today at lunch.  It smelled fresh, clean and the place was busy. I'm looking for an AYCE place and this place doesn't offer it. Too bad. I'm on the hunt again!

AL8cZezf-d4w6auTuixFzg.text: This is my first yelp review!! I never felt the need to review a business before, but this time, I had to. I lost my Chanel wallet, which is worth around $1,300. I called I love Sushi to check if maybe I left it there. They told me that they had it, and returned it with everything in it! I cannot explained how happy I was. BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!. Thank you, I Love Sushi for being so awesome

PQae_PJuK-JsfQHCW3cb5w.text: Amazing. Fresh high grade fish.  One of the best Sushi places in town.  Highly recommend this place.  Higher grade sushi than most other joints in town.

MsroQUQiZrYLLBrw53maQA.text: I've had an amazing experience everytime I come here. The chefs are hilarious and the waitresses and bus boys are ON TOP of it! They're busy but it's controlled. My drink didn't go empty and my custom roll was delicious.

EBx0ksKFgEr3h2KXHZMenA.text: The best sushi by far not a bad roll in the house, only 10 min from  the strip..worth the trip, yummy

XXHgPGjcAZ2Nyn9RQqSSKg.text: This place is worth the 20min drive.  The sushi is delicious.  The names of the rolls are entertaining and the staff is nice.

OTamBFINgqr7Lx8zNvx6ow.text: Yellowtail, salmon handroll with avocado, salmon nigiri and rainbow roll, all excellent !

GNHXVxZGnc1bO6ivztUvgw.text: Fun atmosphere and lively. The design is a campy but flashy asian decor. Some may say its tacky, but I love the camp factor. The service is very attentive, but a bit rushed and comes off a little pushy. The food.... veggy tempura was mediocre, shrimp tempura as poor, the chicken teriyaki was ok, the beef teriyaki was bad, and the halibut tempura was poor. The sushi rolls just very average. We did not order any specialty rolls. The sashimi was good. Maybe we should have tried the specialty rolls... I was unimpressed.

rFym0cgYcywctAGNBqw5Hg.text: Super cool ambiance and the staff is always friendly! It's in an odd and deceiving strip mall location -  highly delicious! Wish they had an AYCE option tho- it's about the same price but just seems like a better value

Sgz1ucAOTBabNPMWbCcSNQ.text: Love this place!!! They burst my sushi cherry and I've been addicted ever since! The screaming orgasm is amazing and the green tea tempura ice cream is great!!!

saQtYjXdVL2Co_d5UtISoQ.text: Forget all the expensive sushi spots in town and go to I Love Sushi. Best sushi I have ever had in Vegas or anywhere else. The rolls are awesome and really unique...especially I Love My Ass, Dragon, Bam Bam...and the Screaming Orgasm rocks as well. They get very busy at the expected times but I've never had bad service here and I've eaten here at dozens of times. When I take people here from out of town the first thing they ask when they come back to visit is when we can go to I Love Sushi. Enough said.

oR1LLRwFJl6UpDw7StXrKw.text: This place is amazing. Fantastic service and food. We went about 7:30 on a Friday and told it would be about 15-20 minutes. It only took 10 min to get seated and they had 2 very large parties.  Our waitress was good, she had a great personality. Our food came out very quickly for how busy they were. My daughter (6 yrs old) liked it so much that she wants to go there for her birthday in couple months. No problem, we would happy to bring you here!  The downside, we have lived here almost a year and just discovered this place. ;) We will be back!! There is lots of stuff I can't wait to try.

uEPcexJdMC-2_U3uu5M5QQ.text: Johnny roll, Kiss of Fire, Sun devil, Garlic Butter Special, and Yellowtail nagiri are amazing! See Randy if you sit at the bar he is awesome.

HyrKoeQ_29SuyFKoGSo5nQ.text: Ate here for lunch over the weekend while visiting my parents. Cute abiance. Tons of different custom rolls. Great seaweed salad. Friendly waitstaff. My only complaint...I asked for water and the waitress brought me a glass of someone else's water that she refilled. She apologized profusely, and I don't feel sick, so that's good!  Located in strip mall kind of behind a Taco Bell. Would definitely visit again if in the area!

ER4V2ghSQU3eQ5PLJ1-mUA.text: Love this place! Even to-go orders are phenomenal! Love the huge dining room and variety of rolls! Every time I try a new sushi place, I end up comparing it to I Love Sushi and the latter always wins!

LYIHqF6QWqagvZf4hK50dg.text: Absolutely delish!!!!  If you go over the weekend be prepared a bit of a wait.  I am a huge sushi fan and this place rates top for me!!!

CR_c9owSsh_QIaotS2pgcQ.text: I just went today for my daughters birthday and we had a sushi boat for 2 soooo much food sooo delicious!! Great service!! Definitely well priced !! A must for anyone who loves sushi!!

ElbZ9VRi6AyYlOzEr_1K2Q.text: I stopped in after reading the reviews.  It was very crowded but easy to get in to.  Place was fun, and loud, but not too loud so you couldn't have a conversation.  Everyone just seemed to be having a great time.  One of the really nice things is they have plenty of staff to get your food out to you quickly and in and out in a timely manner.  I tried the screaming organism because of the reviews, it was really good and I loved the sauce.  I also tried the kiss of fire, but on the not so spicy side.  It was good as well.  This place was a nice find for a fun, quick sushi stop.

oFOlo6jqY4gjaWoOw_tp2A.text: This place is the bombbbbbb.   Two things struck me the most: The exceptional SERVICE! I loved how attentive my waiter was. Patient and not pushy. Nice and helpful, called attention to the chefs when he didn't know the answer to something (we were sitting at the bar) and overall fantastic. And of course the food was fab.   We ordered the Johnny's Roll ( see attached picture) which had soft shell crab and albacore. DELICIOUS. It was elegant and simple. Their selection of rolls is far and extensive and it's quite difficult to even pick but you really can't go wrong with anything that's in their $13 price point. Also, I feel like their deluxe rolls all have a variation of some soft shell crab in it ... Next time I would try Gary's Roll(soft shell crab with yellowtail and salmon!!) . But the albacore was incredibly good that night.   Hamachi collar and salmon collar (see attached picture). Delicious and big portions. Salmon collar seemed to have more food though but both were done well.   1 order each of tuna, salmon, yellowtail and albacore sashimi. (Attached picture) At $5 an order, I expected it to be a bigger cut. Sure it was good and fresh, but the pieces were puny and uneven.    Lastly we tried nabeyaki udon (not pictured :( ), a mix of tempura shrimp and veggies. I only had some broth and hands down, it was done very well. For the price however $11.95, I thought the portions were small.   Overall, very pleased with my servers at the bar, all male, who were all super attentive!! (I asked for one plate and he brought out a bunch for my entire family without asking) and continually checked up on us in a non pushy way.   Come here early though, this place gets crowded!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. MmmMm delicious soft shell crab with albacore.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Johnny&#39;s roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon collar YUM

PFCiKALAZMCfwLUVuAzLtw.text: As they say here, 'I love Sushi' and I live this place! Our waitress Bo was amazing and hilarious and on top of this the sushi is also amazing. Fresh fish, but note that if you get there late there is a chance that they will run out of things like the Fatty Salmon or Tuna Belly!   They have a large selection of rolls also if that's what you're looking for, but def come for the sushi and staff. This place is a solid 4, but I'll give the 5th star for the service cause she was A-Mazing!

inWpCZzpWc2Tf6zFp4Ze0A.text: Very tasty and reasonable. The rolls are quite large with some odd names. The staff is very attentive and pleasant. I highly recommend a visit.

VPVETPairdeAMkWJEZVlvg.text: WoW great place! Always fresh and the rolls are so filling! The ladies are dressed so beautiful and very nice! The sushi chefs are so fast with fun conversation every time we stop by. My son and I made it our favorite place to spend time together for weekend lunch!

kB-nMBJQauPgURKsNFXuFw.text: I love sushi is the best sushi in town as far as rolls and speciality items. I've been going here for years now and they have always been consistent. You do not come here for nigiri! This place is not all you can eat for a reason. Their sushi quality is always top notch and their rolls are what they are known for here. Some sushi roll recommendations of mine are the kitchen sink, screaming orgasm with salmon, one night stand, Sean special, Frankie's special, and jackpot. The hamachi Kama here is also amazing. This is not a place you go to for "quantity" if you're a huge AYCE fan and simply want nigiri then this isn't for you. If you want bomb ass sushi rolls and the best screaming o in town then come here.

eGAocol6kT9TUOMq_sRq_A.text: Tonight I was all about Sake bombs, Poki, and Asahi. I Love Sushi has it all ranging from the basic spicy tuna to custom rolls. It's been my favorite sushi restaurant since 2007 and has never gotten old.

ydr77HLDLeZ90eNYRluL5A.text: I've always heard of this place but never tried it. We came in during dinner time and they were packed. We were seated at the bar. Our sushi chef was friendly and nice.  We typically like to eat sashimi/nigiri. The selection of special fish are limited. Our go to is uni and it was nice and fresh here. We ordered the toro (fatty tuna) and it melted in your mouth. Other than that, everything else here was standard. The fish is fresh here because they stay busy. We also tried the oyster shooter and the uni shooter. I really didn't like it because it was salty, maybe it was the ponzu sauce? We had one roll, I think it was the Joe's roll? It was good.  I don't think this will be my go to place but I would come back.

vCW2mZX8zb2vEshv0DAScg.text: I'm not the biggest sushi eater in Las Vegas, but when I go, I do love, "I Love Sushi!"  Totally fun place with lots of energy.  The food is very fresh, and sushi chefs are entertaining!  Highly Recommend!

o9cOXZJAv7cBIE7lcpwBwA.text: Not the best sushi I've had but it's ok. ILS serves typical Vegas-Korean style junky rolls with quality ingredients, but are just covered in waaaay too much sauce.   Also, and maybe it's just me, but I'm so sick of all the dumb roll names. Really? Does every sushi joint need to serve "orgasm sauce?" One Yelper described this as "ingenious." Wrong "I" word--more like "idiotic." And there's like a million selections with just one ingredient varying in each. It took me a solid 15 minutes to order two rolls to go. Too much work.   I'd rather go somewhere else without the insane lists and just get a good freaking roll not drowning in a mayo-based bodily-fluid referenced sauce.

qjUHscaOVKMGXGfB0JoXog.text: My absolute favorite Sushi place!  I wish they had all you can eat because the specialty rolls get kind of expensive.  But everything is great, fresh, lots of choices, service is friendly and usually pretty fast! Love it here!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon Handrolls with Avacado
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon handrolls &amp; Roley rice bowl! Yum
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon and tuna handrolls and Rowly rice bowl

sL4-NOEXda4Yp3FpJQq-iQ.text: I love this place!!! The interior is great, the sushi is amazing, & the staff is awesome!  Sushi bar chefs are so attentive and nice  Sushi was super good! Haven't any sushi that wowed me in awhile and their sushi did!

ltEEgH8Fk0pCF5Zmc4_4VA.text: The Best Sushi in the entire valley. Very friendly and helpful I learned how to order sushi here.

44V1g0NvqmobumoYlk4BhA.text: I Love Sushi is on the extreme opposite end of town for me, but I was in the area last night and I thought it would be a good time to drop in and see what all the Yelping is about.  Right away I was very impressed with the atmosphere and the decor.  It is very fun and modern with Japanese paper lanterns hung about and nice artwork and booths.  I was immediately seated at the sushi bar.  The sushi chef recommended the Washington Roll for me and it was exactly what I was wanting with salmon on the outside of the roll and salmon on the inside of the roll.  The salmon is so incredibly fresh and tastes like butter.  A little splash of soy and wasabi...ahhhh.  I followed that with two pieces of Maguro Tuna.  It was a very nice meal.  It's a fun atmosphere and there was a lot of interesting people there.  If I am on that side of town again I will definitely drop in.  It was a lovely experience.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Maguro Tuna
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Maguro Tuna
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Washington Roll

P73W32kxwRBQ3fx87cIZfw.text: I live completely across town from I Love Sushi, but it is worth the drive. I stumbled upon this place through Yelp while I was in the area. Now I go out of my way to make it back whenever I can. It is completely al a carte, so be prepared to spend some money if you are very hungry.  It is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Screaming orgasm

JHfh3NiNLX_vyJmICreVAw.text: I haven't been here in YEARS! The last time I was here was probably five years ago! I remember the sushi being SO freakin' AMAZING.  My friend and I came here for dinner with Hunnie Bunnie. She ordered the Udon noodles like usual and some edamame. No complaints from her.  We had the garlic edamame: pretty damn good! It could have used more sauce but the flavor was good and the edamame was cooked well.  We had nigiri sweet shrimp: this was SO good. The shrimp was VERY sweet and BIG and the shrimp heads were HUGE. Good stuff!  The only one I didn't care for (I even spit it out in my napkin) was the Garlic Tuna Nigiri. I'm not sure if it was the flavor or just the fish itself - it was kind of rubbery, hard to chew. YUCK.  The rest of it was QUITE good though, salmon, tuna, white fish, albacore, scallop, unagi nigiri.  It definitely wasn't as amazing as it was the first time I had it but nonetheless it was still GOOD.  Oh yeah and we tried one roll: Tiger Roll. It was aiight. There are SO many rolls listed on the sheet of paper you check off and I didn't see any explanations of what was inside of them. I've had a Tiger Roll before so I wanted to try it here, however this one definitely had different ingredients then ones I've had before.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

tgn5I9loOWePnGCN9E5VpA.text: One of our favorite go to places for Sushi. Great assortment of specialty rolls. I was there a few nights ago  and they had blue fin tuna as a specialty fish for the evening. We have always had good service.

B5jlgwVimrVeQneMY8HLrQ.text: Don't know why this place has so many great reviews, Gyoza was terrible!!! Smelled terrible!!! We ordered three rolls that were very mushy and did not taste good.. We asked the chef to make us a roll based on what we liked and it was the worse roll of them all... Will never come back again.. Pushy staff and very rude when we said we did not like something.  If you want good Sushi go to Sen Of Japan off DI and Durango.

2FSpJmOyQiD0OTsV3h1X8A.text: One of, if not the, best sushi joint in Las Vegas. Night out with the wife? Check. Lunch with the boss? Check. Catching up with friends? Check.   Amazing rolls, always fresh. Service is always easy. In the Green Valley area it's a place you need to visit. Personal favorites include the Cherry Blossom and the Candy Cane. Cannot go wrong.

k6wG5b240IiJRPZh6Ema-A.text: Absolutely awesome sushi! Best in Las Vegas!   Wait staff not 100% great in customer service...sometimes language barrier.  Little pricey...no AYCE, but they know ppl will pay extra for their rolls cause they are that good!

2xo33pVxOR5yk9m-lM2a5Q.text: The best food I have ever eaten!!! We got the fat ass roll and the tastes like my ex girlfriend roll. Seriously, so good.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Tastes like my ex girlfriend roll. Really really good. This is take out
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Fat ass roll. Amazing

HGbKenIWRPDnGXyBNn1DNQ.text: First, it's a great atmosphere.  Don't be fooled by the plain exterior, the interior is nicely decorated in Japanese theme, and the waitresses and chefs are all in traditional Japanese attire.  I am a big chef's special guy when it comes to eating sushi, and I Love Sushi has a huge selection (100+) of excellent chef's special rolls and dishes.    Some of my favorite special rolls:  -Spring Mountain (my all-time favorite so far): spicy soft shell crab, spicy tuna, spicy crab, tempura shrimp, avocado, radish sprout wrapped in rice paper, special sauce (spicy mayo & eel). -Something Wrong #7: spicy soft shell crab in and out, cucumber & 5 different fish on top & chef's special sauce. -Monkey Roll: salmon, cream cheese, avocado, mango, tempura crumbs outside and mango sauce. -Jackpot Special -I Love Sushi Special  Each of their special rolls typically runs between $10 - $13 for 1 whole roll (8 pieces).  I find that getting 3 full rolls will typically fill me and one other person up.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Something Wrong #7: spicy soft shell crab in and out, cucumber &amp; 5 different fish on top &amp; chef&#39;s special sauce.

Fesmr5Owr1BPJtqSP9ewrg.text: The sushi was absolutely delicious.  My daughter treated me out to lunch and she spent $60 on three orders and one soda (a bit pricey), but it was good.  The reason it got three stars is that the sushi went right through us.  Not a good thing.  I would not eat here again only because the prices were pretty high.

l-2YyncwGfaPeMivybTelA.text: I LOVE SUSHI!  Just got back from my umpteenth dinner at I Love Sushi. It's one of my favorite places to eat here in Vegas, esp with a group so we can order lots of different sushi.  We try different things off their large sushi menu (it's almost overwhelming!) and always end up with a new favorite - I usually also order either a rainbow roll or spider roll because they are my favorites. They have something for everyone - basic sushi, spicy, mozzarella filled, baked, deep fried - so. much.sushi!!  The decor and costumes are cute, and sometimes the service is slow cause they are usually very busy - but we always have a great meal here and I think it's the best priced sushi in Vegas! The sushi is the only thing I've ordered here, I don't think I've ever been in a group where something has been ordered off the menu...

g0QHlO7zA7fUgyhbPpIx-w.text: Great change of pace from the countless AYCE places in town. You can definitely taste the difference in both quality and freshness of the fish.

YLCVfG0wL81dV85vRGi8Ag.text: This is by far my favorite sushi joint in town.  Holy yum just thinking about it makes me hungry.  First of all if you go to I love sushi and don't order the Lisa handroll you're crazy because it is cone shaped heaven, like I could probably just eat those for the rest of my life!! Anywhooo I also enjoy their Double D roll and screaming orgasm appetizer,  not to mention they have ridiculously fresh sashimi.  They do not have AYCE which is kind of a bummer but everythings very high quality so I get it (Sushi Mon had delicious AYCE)  It get super busy though so I would suggest making a reservation.  Also their waitresses have always been very sweet and attentive I don't think I've ever had a bad experience there.. happy eating!

UEVP1fSsCw5BZoZZjhbQ6w.text: These guys by far have the best service in town when it comes to sushi restaurants.  We love coming here because we know we will always be taken care of.  On top of that the food is great!

4uewfF9b6aGMrfK_SBoVrw.text: Love this place!!!  Talk about a HUGE sushi menu.  You can go multiple times without trying everything at this place.  I have only lived in Vegas now for a little over 2 months, but thus far I have yet to find another Sushi joint that I like better.  The only place this place is getting 4 stars and not 5 is because I think it is a bit pricy for what you get.  The service was also mediocre both times I have been here.  Besides that I don't think you can go wrong here.  Tip: The Poke Salad is amazing!  The screaming orgasm is also, well....orgasmic.

a1Yv4-Iv-l38lrdLn3Uahw.text: I loved this place. The atmosphere is amazing, I love how the staff wear authentic Japanese kimonos. The food was delicious and the prices are very reasonable. We will definitely be making this our go-to sushi spot in Henderson. Great service too. Thanks!

goHb6hTzHos6Q5W8o27S7w.text: Funky name and even funkier (and funny!) names for rolls. They don't offer AYCE but the rolls are comparably priced.  Like almost all great Vegas restaurants, the place is in a strip mall, tucked in a corner spot. Although unassuming, the restaurant itself is actually kinda big.  I didn't look too closely but I believe they have the sushi boats in the center bar.   The service was excellent. The food came out quick and when we ordered some lasagna roll, the waitress advised that it would take 10-15 minutes to bake and come out.     There is an extensive menu of sushi to choose from -- we had several rolls, including the Screaming Orgasm, XXX, Monkey Roll, and something with mango and creme cheese (two things I love).  All the rolls were delicious and the fish was very fresh.  Once again, I'm amazed about the quality of sushi in Vegas -- you know, being land locked and all. I was very satisfied with I Love Sushi, and will go again.

Ho9vMgZY6EMEzejNtSTjtw.text: From the first day I moved here I loved this sushi place. I'm a Cali kid- sushi is like a life necessity to me. I eat it at least 2x a week, at minimum, and I want only the good stuff. I love sushi does it for me. Their roles are great, services is on top of it (hot hand towel? don't mind if i do!), and the sushi chefs are friendly.

myA_zD4FUf5tK4nn5PGnbA.text: Still my favorite sushi in Las Vegas. There are dozens of sushi places within ten minutes of where I live, and this will always be my first choice. Recommend!

Buz3_krfpUJbByRxR29fgA.text: Service is hit or miss. During the latest incident our sushi took over an hour with barely any acknowledgment from the server.  45min into waiting she said "I know, long time" and left without another word. A guy who sat after us threatened to leave and he got his sushi before us. We did get a small complimentary bowl of edamame when our food finally arrived. I wish the staff was more proactive. Sit at the sushi bar!

0PBf8bWdLWRY2aKrpjcY7g.text: We ate here based on a recommendation. Bad choice. The staff was very rushing it was overcrowded. The food was not very good either. If you like sushi that is  completely American inspired and fried then drenched in a mayonnaise based sauce you might actually enjoy this place. Almost every sushi roll has mayo. They mostly do sushi rolls. There fish is not fresh either. We will not be eating here again. Very disappointed with this place.

Dk_wjqqGk-K8QiGHKoL_Lg.text: I know it's slightly odd to have a sweet flavor of sushi in your mouth, but you have to try the Monkey Roll! (it has cream cheese and mangoes). Pretty much everything on their menu is fresh and delicious. I've had great service there every single time i've gone and the servers are always ready to assist you.

rB3nZXs0X8DV7oONYENqGQ.text: This is a great neighborhood/chain place to find good sushi. Prepare to be amused!

7oar-Cxmkmz9dLWeM2W4lg.text: Excellent restaurant. Very consistent in quality of service and food. Service, in our opinion, is the best of all sushi places (off the Strip). Surprisingly, our favorite roll is Mistake roll (one of their cheapest), we love their oyster shooters too! The sashimi salad is terrible though (but it's more like an exception).

dPxkQevrrBwVfB38x0eWiw.text: Good to know locals. . . It was 5 of us. . .the resto seemed to pretty packed for dinner. The names of the sushi rolls were pretty appealing to Vegas. ..screaming orgasam, i love sex. . .the list goes on and on. . . The food was great! SUSHI is my fave food! WE had a bunch of different rolls. . . we even had 2 full rolls left over! We also ordered my fave. . .hamachi. . .yellowtail sashimi. . .the cut of the hamachi was HUGE and thick. . . Even though its a drive from the strip. . .it was worth it.

BZ_yd2Ms3dUuf8mBTJ613A.text: Their sushi choice is mediocre at best. The last time I was here, I was flipping through the menu several times because I was having difficulty with choosing anything that seemed remotely appetizing. I did choose the Threesome Special roll, though, which was actually pretty good. However, their sushi is too pricey considering the quality of food that they have. I wouldn't mind paying $13 for a roll that's not a special at a high-end sushi restaurant, but not at I Love Sushi. I will only come to I Love Sushi if friends want to meet up with me there, but other than that, there are better sushi places in Henderson.

zHaLqLjuELTjPDcbpbP3IQ.text: The name says it all!! I DO love sushi!  Great staff and I love to seeing the owner there! Favorite roll?? Well, there are many to choose from with cute names!! But my fav? The MC roll...

JK--DdsCeWFmbcn1Ob_Nog.text: Hands down best sushi I've had in a long time.  Started with an O face -can't explain what it is but it's delicious.  The head some amazing Hamachi Belly.  Then had a flower blossom roll (which just blew my mind)  I'm from San Francisco and we have great sushi -but this place is in the top 5 for me.    If you want off the strip for a little bit come here!!!

xvCwRug2LdeS4nU7TT0_MQ.text: Here's the thing, I literally grew up here. Like, this place is about a mile from my house, and a block from where I went to high school and we'd walk here after school and get takeout (we were spoiled ok?!). We knew the sushi chefs by name, and when we got a little older (not old enough), we'd sneak sake bombs before going out to the coolest party ever. The inappropriate names for the rolls were the funniest thing we'd ever seen- it was the bees knees and the best sushi I'd ever had.   Fast forward 10 years, and sadly times have changed. The quality of the fish seems to have gone downhill and the cold fresh rolls just don't taste as fresh and the hot crunchy rolls are drenched in indistinguishable sauces. I really hate to say this, but last time I was here a few weeks ago, two of us got sick from eating the same roll. It's still a fun place to meet friends and get some so-so food, but now when we want a quality sushi dinner (it's all relative), we'll head down to Spicy Tuna.

eFMFcjV0pWLVg35QoGEQ8A.text: It was ok , but I had better sushi  i just wish they had a revolving sushi place here in Las vegas very hard to find one out here .

3cRJtip22_IhJx6_YR4Qmw.text: The three stars are for the food. Quality great but priced high.   As for the experience it's crazy in there the manager or owner I believe does not let staff do their job he is all up their butts and loud about it. It's like a father yelling at his children.  The staff is great there I'm sure the make great tips but they appear scared and uptight on busy nights so don't expect them to interact with u.  Good expensive sushi but not a calm fun place.. Very loud. It may just be me but the owner is nice to customers but stands up in front and is over bearing I want to leave before I even get to enjoy his food.. I have given the place multiple visits and yeah it's never different. Not my cup of tea! Maybe lunch is different but I want be finding out!

yfoosZ3vBGYBqctQ-anVKg.text: So I have had a back and forth journey with this restaurant, and this has what has kept me from reviewing it.  I finally feel ready.  The first thing to know about this place is that there is no all you can eat and the rolls often are averaging around 13 dollars each (the ones I ordered normally around 14).  This automatically puts an expectation that they should be higher quality than an average sushi joint.  When you come inside the waitresses are dressed in traditional Japanese clothing and the restaurant is very sizeable, with lots of tables and booths, and a huge sushi bar.  Often there are many sushi chefs working behind it.  Despite its massive size, even on a busy night the service was relatively quick, and they work like a well oiled machine.  Now to the food, the first time I ever came here was about 4 years ago after being told I had to by multiple people.  I ordered a roll that involved mango and some other fun flavors, yet it was so bland and flavorless.  I refused to go back after that, and believed this place was over hyped.  I had a go to spot kaizen down the road so I had no need for them, however kaizen began to go down hill to the point that I gave up in them and jumped ship as a loyal customer.    I was desperate and in need of sushi that was close by so I thought ok I will give I love sushi one more shot.  I ended up really enjoying my rolls! Totally different experience, I thought maybe I had just ordered wrong last time. I had got the 90 percent roll, bam bam roll and spring mountain roll I believe.  These were packed with flavor, and I continued to have a similar experience the times I would drive up to get my sushi fix, until about 6 months ago.  I went alone just wanting grab one roll, and it was one I had enjoyed in the past.  It had ponzu sauce on it and shrimp tempura and many other yummy things.  However they weren't yummy, it tasted so much saltier than normal and the tempura was not crispy, it tasted liken it had been sitting out and the pack on the roll was sloppy. I was sad, and my craving not fullfilled with goodness.    I hoped it was a fluke so I went this past Saturday since monta was closed for renovations, and I was starving for something Japanese. I was greeted by insanity! It was a football night, and I guess this place becomes a sports bar when that happens, it was so loud I couldn't hear my boyfriend talk.  Whatever just give me good food that is all I want, we ordered the niku udon for the first time.  They have the medium thickness udon, not as thin as I prefer, but not thick like slugs.  It was some of the better niku in the valley,with a really full bodied broth, and the reason this review is not two stars.  I also ordered the 90 percent roll, a roll I thought I could trust, and another roll that had various forms of yellow tail and a "orange sauce".  The yellow tail roll was fine, not amazing though for its price tag.  The bam bam roll was aweful. The dip was saltier than it used to be, and the soft shell crab had become oddly tough.   So sadly unless I really want some niku, I am over this place.  Good sushi in a desert is so elusive, I will continue my search.

abGuusQaModm60Oe4c_pdw.text: I've tried several rolls from their special chefs menu and my favorites include the johny roll, James Bond and jackpot. The jackpot not as much anymore since it's a total project to fit each piece into my mouth. The johny is great if you like fresh, seafood and crunch - cucumber. The James Bond is basically the same but with rice. If you are kinda into sushi or on the fence you have to try I love sushi! If you really love sushi and can't get enough, you're doing a disservice to your life by not trying it.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Johny roll

51-ofxvsaIG7jpjAV2shyA.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas and that includes the strip and all the fancy places and this place is in a random strip mall in Henderson. We eat here almost weekly and always get the same 4 or 5 rolls and then one new one. Have had almost everything on the menu and the fish is always fresh and everything is great. Favorites include Screaming O, I Love My Ass and Bam Bam. Always busy so be prepared to wait on Friday, Saturday and Sunday but it always moves fast or you can sit at the sushi bar.

VqLrNZYigUBfUNQ4AzSg6w.text: We love sushi, so the name stuck out. After reading some reviews we decided to check it out.  Wow! Absolutely the best Sushi we've had. The service was fast and the decor on target. The location is off the Strip beaten path but this place was still packed.

eFLo9Ii9Jgj2_6PDo1zZvg.text: Love this place with my wife. Coming 2 times monthly. Monkey roll and Jackpot special is the best ones we like

0v4COMpXTfSsoV3GiPCLxQ.text: Great fresh sushi! TV screens for all you sport fans! Many varieties of sushi with different flavors, layers and textures with friendly and helpful staff.

eN-vM_eHt0F2rfHWqQubWw.text: Always a great place for sushi.  They don't have AYCE.  The lettuce wrap sushi is my favorite.  The bento is reasonable and a good amount.  The service is always good and the place is clean.

QXqL1E8tzFzSgLmVo5Dgsg.text: Solid Sushi Spot in Henderson one of my favorite sushi rolls called the Johnny roll which is crab and cucumber wrapped in cucumber which is amazing the other is the jackpot roll that has these little flakes that make it crunchy and super tasty very good I would highly suggest anybody trying it. Rainbow roll is very fresh very good all of their sushi rolls are incredibly fresh and really tasty. The only downside to this place is that it's a way off the beaten path so you Gotta really want to go to it!
