mkBeLHrs-oHAamk4ko9CXg.text: Love this place!! Fast service and always friendly.  High quality sushi with a lot if variety.  I got the love boat for 2people and it was a lot of good! Perfect for sharing.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Love boat was delicious!

IibKvswBdu8CG0qIS5a45A.text: Fantastic place. Great food. The quality of fish is very fresh. Great vibe too. The sushi chefs in center are very friendly and funny. There is always a line outside at certain times. I loved the followin sushi dishes: dynamite, pepper tuna no rice , spicy tuna , crazy horse , Japanese lasagna. I cant wait to go there again. Heard its been here for years.

uwSo13PqRJZpZ4Bgdxo-pQ.text: This place will take care of you whether you know what you want or whether you want to describe and have them make it. Very fresh and tasty. They greet you in the proper way as well. The food was awesome and the prices are completely reasonable.     Sitting at the sushi bar is the way to go.

ghIKi_aSF5rAC1dCzBmAFw.text: What can we say... I LOVE Sushi is our refuge at the  of the week! If we miss a week, we feel out of sorts! Why??? Because the service & food is top Notch! Best chefs & ladies in waiting!   Your constant companion,  ~deirdra

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Fuzzy Balls! Not on the menu... however, sooo yumm! Ask for Joe!

9Rc-UOvzy1CZYzH6mp-Ypg.text: This is our favorite sushi restaurant on this side of town. The menu is extensive but it's all good. Anything on the menu with yellowtail is my favorite. I've been for lunch only a couple of times and their specials are well-priced. Dinner can get pricey. Make sure to make reservations for dinner because it can get quite busy at night.

gzIC2tzuLXsH4P-fPoibPw.text: Unbelievable rolls! Amazing service! And clean space! Love love love!  Try the green mussels they are so delicious. My husband and I are huge sushi lovers and have been to about every sushi spot in the city. This place is on the top of our list.

9NY27KMJq5TPytnQ0uRqdg.text: This place is so delicious. Their sushi is always so fresh and the service is amazing. All the servers are so friendly. This is my favorite sushi place out here so far :) will be coming back a lot.

8L89q1lB_kbLx_10v2NX_A.text: Wife and I have tried many sushi places and I Love Sushi is the best.  Our Favorites are The "I love sushi" roll, the "Grand canyon" roll, and the "screaming orgasm".  Note: the sauce on the i love sushi roll and the screaming orgasm is very similar.  The grand canyon roll is california rolls topped with cooked shrimp, scallops, mushrooms, green onion and an amazing sauce.  I have been happy with everything i have ordered and we have tried most of the menu (minus the baked rolls).

ResWKto2BcpzWSxDUuO1Rg.text: Favorite sushi spot in Vegas. I live 20-25 mins away and it's always worth the drive for great service and great food. Their screaming orgasm is the best and the freshest Tuna in town! Love this place.

WhZSEML9atiMqXUfvd4rTw.text: This is my favorite sushi place in town. Super fresh. Big rolls. Not a ton of rice.. they don't skimp on the fish. The service is always good and quick. No all you can eat option here, you do have to buy by the roll. But, the rolls are huge! You will spend less than at an all you can eat place because the portions are decent.

xcos2TJ99w30Wkla18yE9w.text: Passed by Vegas this weekend and came to I love sushi, it sure didn't disappoint! I appreciate the Japanese aesthetic and welcoming environment. Although the prices are on the higher side it is worth it. The restaurant is spacious and I enjoy being able to see the cooks making the sushi. I do recommend this restaurant for anyone who is in search of a good time and good food! This place is very cute for a first date or just out for a group hangout with friends. The costumer service was dive and everyone was very welcoming. The place looked very clean which is always a plus. I love the fact that the menu has many funny names for the plates such as "I love my ass" and so on. Which I enjoyed when I was ordering it infront of my family. All around I had a great time being in this restaurant and trying many plates at once was pretty amazing .I am a pretty heavy eater and this sushi definitely filled me up. Coming back to this restaurant would probably be very hard for me to achieve since it's so far but I would definitely head over if an around Las Vegas once more. The cool part of this place is that the is that when I went the place wasn't very packed and we were able to get our food pretty quickly. This place created a new memory for me, my cousin, and my sister where we all took the time to hangout at Vegas and come here and eat some sushi. I enjoyed being able to sit down and have a meal with my family. This restaurant felt very calming and relaxing and was a perfect environment to just relax with family. I loved that the restaurant's color was a dark wood color. While sitting in the far left side of the restaurant I was able to see the kitchen where the sushi chefs made sushi and also the restaurants restroom. We were there for along of 2 hours just chatting about life and my comfort zone protect. Which we all made a joke about it. We were all recording each other making "yummy" sounds just for the video and laughed for hours. I would love to come back to relive those moments I had my family in Las Vegas.

E6pa_FYTbKfEMPzfYF7r3A.text: Hands down one of the best sushi joints I've ever been too. If you're not familiar with the menu, it will surprise you. You'll order one thing, expecting it to be a roll, and then bam, you're hit with some wild sushi masterpiece that blows you away. I've eaten a lot of sushi, coming from California, and this restaurant is hands down one of the best I've ever been too. Sit at the bar

ducdJdlbyL86WcPvPy7Oqw.text: Authentic atmosphere, great service, sashimi and poke was great.  Coming back soon with friends

eke-E9TyHLAXdzVVhxLoPg.text: Great ambiance!  Everyone said hello as the hostess seated us. The waitresses were in kimonos and our waitress was patient and explained everything in detail. We ordered bento boxes and we both enjoyed all of the selections and lunch for 2 was surprisingly less than I expected!  Good food with nice atmosphere and great service with the surprisingly less cost means we are coming back!

Guqc-HMlWxSvN-g5aOXE-Q.text: My daughter and I went here for a quick bite before she returned to LA. Welcoming and cozy atmosphere. A Choice of table, booth or right up by the sushi makers.Our waiter was knowledgeable and pleasant. I a couple of pieces of garlic fish sushi and a delicious small salad. It was good. My daughter ordered a roll and also like it. Only didn't have gluten or dairy free options.

R-MJeAkAArzcZplB_op3Xw.text: I ordered to go. while waiting for my order, they had me wait on their couch. I was surprised how busy they were. The waitresses wore kimonos (so cute), the waiters just regular black pants and white shirt. The restaurant was well decorated, booths on the side and tables in middle. I ordered some lobster rolls (i think it was little " heavy ") and the Monkey roll (salmon, avocado, cream cheese, sesame seeds) it was very good forgot to mention the special sauce they put on the side so my sushi is not soggy. I enjoyed my monkey roll with some ginger! yum yum waitresses outfit are really entertaining. Since i was waiting for 20mns, I was looking at the staff running around, none of them had a smile on their face ...  The 2 girls at the entrance were a little "rude", when I came in I asked for the menu so i could order to go  and if they had any suggestion for some rolls with cream cheese and avocado. they looked at me and whispered something in front of my face, that was very rude... Ladies when you do, please be discrete... i went there yesterday night 01/06/18

UvnOjllECXvwoijMxEkljw.text: I can't say enough about this place. Get the expensive stuff and enjoy. Uni, toro, YT belly, fresh hokaido scallop nigiri. And get a roll or two if that's your thing. I love the Sean special, dc special and a couple more. I get take out at least 3 times per month. But go there and enjoy the atmosphere. I would if I had the time. AYCE places can suck it. Quality over quantity for sure.

Nk0Jkl71VfR5BllnLCcv0A.text: Absolutely delicious. I'm allergic to fish and shellfish but love Japanese food. This was definitely the place to go!  I took my 5 year old son here to try sushi for the first time. The staff was friendly and gave great recommendations for him. Soy paper wrapping is better than seaweed for kids. He loves the California rolls ( no mayo) and enjoyed the atmosphere.   I decided to get veggie tempura and habachi chicken ! It was perfection! The price was right and the service was great! It was an over all enjoyable experience! I'd go back again and again!!!!

-C3XJBjEVPgp30VhQIKnAA.text: I came here for a friends birthday. First off, they don't have all you can eat. My friend picked it though because supposedly the quality is better... I have to say I don't agree. It's hard to want to pay for nigiri (where quality fish really shines) it you're not at all you can eat, and quite frankly I've had just as good of quality sushi other places in town that do offer ayce. Furthermore, the price doesn't really compensate for the lack of ayce option like other non-ayce places do. And to top of off, our service was terrible. Save your money and go somewhere else. Food was still good though.

8zsEMUGhbeXPlOT6sO-2sQ.text: Yum yum yum .  OMG I could eat here every night. My favorite spot in town to visit. Always packed, always great food and service. Not once have I had a bad experience .

3BjjGqEzzddt_RiStuZfvw.text: Monkey roll is too die for. The mango on top gives it an unforgettable taste. Great service and nice setting every time.

IYkPOFjvDzLtaiyG_rW4xQ.text: The best Sushi place hands down in Vegas! May be the best overall Sushi Place anywhere in the country. Hard to beat this place.  This place is packed day in and day out - no matter the time or day. That speaks volumes of how much the locals love it.  The owner - James - is consistently in there every night making sure the place runs smooth and efficiently. Such a nice and friendly guy. He always takes care of my girlfriend and I whenever we eat here (we eat here a lot btw).   The Staff and Waitresses here are awesome and always on top of it with a smile on their face.  The sushi chefs are the best you can find!   Let's get down to why we come here - for the food!  The Sushi here is top of the line. The fish is of the highest quality and always fresh. Not to mention - the portions here are huge for a great price! The sashimi cuts are huge! The rolls are huge! They will even substitute for Brown Rice (which I always do)  The dinner menu items are really good if trying to do something other than sashimi or sushi rolls.   The rolls here are my favorite! The variety and selection of rolls is crazy - there are over 100 rolls! The rolls are huge! And not because they are full of rice like most sushi places - but because they are stacked with fish! These rolls will not disappoint.  A few of my favorites are: The James Special The Ryan's Special One Night Stand Kitchen Sink Something wrong 69 Spring Mountain Double D Screaming Orgasm Flower roll Stacy's Mom Las Vegas Roll I Love My Ass Lisa Hand Roll Bonzai Roll Monkey Roll  I have a lot of favorites - when I come here with my girlfriend, there is so much to choose from we usually end up ordering more than we can handle. Oh well :)

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. We eat a lot here....just the two of us :)
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Roll not on the menu by Randy. Tempura shrimp, spicy crab, tuna on top with fried Onions. So good! Please add to menu!
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Chicken - so good!

iLPT8Yjy2EYetY1u0Rxpqw.text: My favorite sushi place in the Henderson area! The food is always bomb and the fish is always fresh. The service is not the fastest, but always friendly. The name is a bit corny but I highly recommend I Love Sushi!

awBtKIAXYEktJYi2pWhlCA.text: Eric- sushi chef gave me the most delicious screaming organism :)  He made sure I was happy with the service , my meal and my visit.  Its nice to get individual attention when you sit at the sushi bar alone. Its not so lonely after all. I frequent often and this place is just a hit!

o4x1XsnPOuHGJIRlCDOs_A.text: My favorite Sushi spot in Vegas. Great food and good service. My good friend lives around the corner and suggested it, he knows what to order. The screaming orgasm is highly suggested. It's a heaping pile of tuna on top of some sort of shaved radish with a secret sauce so good you'll want to drink it. You get a little house cucumber salad with some sort of fish and dressing, very good. They have a huge menu and that can be a little overwhelming, the waitress gave a few suggestions and she didn't let us down.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. House cucumber salad
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. I don&#39;t remember the name, I think &#34;Johnny special&#34;
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiss of fire

X-58WLm-BNHu6Cfw4spI_Q.text: I  I love Sushi!  To be treated with such great service and great food, an all encompassing grand experience is divine and delightful.  Thank you for such a beautiful experience for my daughters 18th Birthday.

xhMU4CTrw7bG_QfTm4z9_Q.text: Rude staff on the phone couldn't look at the menu, but when I got there the menu was right next to the phone???  Rice is not prepared correctly, low quality fish  Was empty when I was there, I guess everyone already knows how shot it is  Pepper tuna tastes weird and off putting maybe I just don't like cilantro but seared tuna usually tastes good to me this tasted bad...

4vmSaxmJB93r2qHn7EQ5DA.text: Rainbow, Rock n Roll, Anthem, Bonsai, Sexy Time roll, Lisa roll, Salmon Lover, sashimi rolls with & without rice to name a few of my favorites!  I love the sashimi salads that are full of fresh fish & filling!    I am a regular at I Love Sushi & have ordered these rolls above numerous times.  The lady next to me ordered the MC Roll & it looked amazing so will definitely try that next time!  It had tempura halibut & she said it was her absolute fav!    Always friendly staff greets you, quickly to seats you & takes your drink order like clockwork.  I always sit at the sushi bar & order a sparkling water, which only comes in large, sake or wine. Whether you are on a time limit or not, they are always consistent, I have even been in & out of there in 20 minutes!    Lately, I've been to a couple sushi restaurants that never say 'arigato'.  I don't want that to go away ever that's part of the experience.  I love the whole wonderful sushi experience, even the small stuff.  Kanpai  8.10.16 Love these people that work here even more & tried the MC Roll as recommended earlier... AWESOME!  I wish I could give them more stars.   Thank you I Love Sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Recommended by lady next to me, whoa!!  MC Roll tempura halibut, cucumber, topped w/ spicy tuna, brown rice, sauce on the side &amp; no masago.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Orgasm in your mouth?  That&#39;s probably why they call this a Sexy Time Roll it&#39;s like candy w/ a jalapeño dabbed w/ Sriracha!
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. One of the best ways I love eating Salmon is w/ avocado!  The Salmon Lover is just perfect!

iJghH0YPnPEN13vnRx5O4w.text: Best sushi I've ever had!!! I live in California, here for summer vacation and this place is so so impressive. Really good atmosphere and nice staff. I would definitely recommend it to a friend and come back if I'm ever in Henderson again.

VpFAO-XnGsedvaXXPTgcbw.text: The Kitchen Sink Roll is Amazing! The prices are good, the rolls are veryyy large so priced accordingly. Always great.

nv0vH01PqPGEEjscSjB5Jw.text: This is the sushi im looking for im really glad that i made the right choice to eat here the sushi was so delicious and fresh also i really love the place if you guys sushi lover i recommend this sushi restaurant.

ugWiE66tjWsVGWVu-czC7Q.text: Amazing sushi! By far The best I have had. The peppered tuna with no rice is amazing. The garlic tuna is also delicious. Lastly, the Lisa roll (cut roll)  is mmmm. Definitely recommend this place.

7VsPdP1eAKpi7rG-y5wnZg.text: I tried different rolls, they were good. The food is Fresh and very tasty. I wasn't expecting this in Vegas...  Pretty busy place but staff is polite. Good place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

6FCbdS1LhC8lkxj-49QjVA.text: Wanted to get the sushi boat. It's $65. They will not substitute a cut spicy tuna roll for a spicy tuna hand roll (which is less in price than the cut roll). We will spend much less ordering a la cart and will leave slightly unsatisfied.

cO2i_MRTPOogTocuRHv4Ag.text: I love this place!  I took a friend there for his birthday  and they were awesome  and the food is always good, professional staff, timely service, always checking back if anything is needed!  It was so cool they brought my friend out cake and ice cream with a candle and we sang happy birthday!  He loved it!  A must go, it's a superb place to eat!

uODV593aPifjU4WilT8EYQ.text: I mean come on. Best sushi in Vegas. Period  Traditional. It's not. It's a mind blowing culinary experience. So many creative creations. And the names are so funny.   100% of the time we visit Vegas we come here. We take the ride to Henderson and enjoy ourselves at I Love Sushi. Funny thing is I heard of this place 10 yrs ago watching Poker on TV and the pro players were talking about it. So happy I love poker. But happier I love Sushi  They literally have ~100 different rolls. All I can say is read them all and focus on the type of fish you love and just try it.   I highly recommend I Love Sushi to anyone who goes to Vegas

kWIiPoB1OI4uYNGlVn-zKg.text: I love sushi because this place is good,  name says it all!   Every Roll has a unique explosion of flavors that complement the fish each roll showcases.  Presentation is appetizing and the size is generous. The fish is fresh and rice is flavorful!    One of my favorite features in their rolls is the little crunchiness from the soft shell crab and/or shrimp tempura inside the roll.  My favorite rolls: Gary Special and Stuffed Tomato.  Lately I've been enjoying the Nabeyaki Udon soup served in a cast iron pot which is so nice during the cold days!   Been a regular customer for almost a decade!

ZY6l0YArZhzmTd8gfOIxrA.text: This place is by far one of the best sushi places in all of Las Vegas! The waitresses are all really nice and are able to help with almost anything. The owner is a nice guy and gets to know his clients very well. Only thing about him is that we always get the vibe that he tries to rush everyone out.  Anyways! Onto the sushi. It's amazing and great quality. Some must try items: Lisa Handroll (my all time favorite!!!), something wrong #15, and Tuna Karai. They are all amazing. So amazing that I just stuffed my face and forgot to take pictures until everything was gone except part of the something wrong haha.  Pricing is reasonable, but can get pricey depending on what you get. Go check them out. P.s. there's no all you can eat, if that's what you're looking for.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Something Wrong #15

Go3RZYueJvBu4mVrUnF5jw.text: Family favorite, even though we are mostly eating vegan now.   Favorites:  Screaming orgasm  Flower roll  Kitchen sink  Put your hands up   Dinner is better than lunch and quality can be hit and miss (compared to 10 years ago when it was always a hit) but still the best spot in town.

Y9AKm_v_9JG8LWjlpogj4A.text: A must! Try Kitchen sink and Gary's special rolls. People are very nice and super professional.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Don&#39;t miss out.

RTj__8q-vSG_FXksrgbuOA.text: Being that this is Las Vegas, I wasn't expecting a whole lot from the sushi restaurant. But I love sushi turned out to be a great find. The atmosphere was traditional Japanese, the service was excellent, and the sushi was very fresh. Each dish was prepared with great care and presented beautifully. The only Reason I didn't give this five stars is because they were a little heavy-handed on the sauce which covered up from the freshness of the sushi itself.

q1q_34K23ThZJuScprSFMQ.text: Service was impeccable. There  are a lot of options for sushi rolls but most of them are pretty similar. The sushi itself was a bit overdone for me (as in too complicated which I think masks the quality, or lack thereof, of the fish). Mochi was yummy!  Overall sushi was just ok, better if you like a ton of stuff piled on and tempura shrimp in them.

HcM91N5w8OYGsRIm0fSllA.text: Hand rolls here are to die for! Very nice atmosphere and very pleasant staff. Very high quality fish and ingredients used.

-35_iplfXpwFGOdjQ1iqPg.text: I walked in and requested a table of seven. I was seated immediately and my table was quickly prepared with waters, edamame, and cucumber salad before the rest of my party could arrive! Awesome service, and even better sushi!! Would recommend 100%

_9K-1wI5qDMwp_n6Lh8l3Q.text: Best sushi around! Always happy with the quality of the food. I have had sushi from NY to LA and this place holds its own in comparison to any of the best I've had. Very happy to have found an awesome sushi place so close to home!

HoBACr5Y_y62EOEqyvXFbA.text: Best sushi in town. Been coming for years and it never disappoints.  Service is almost always great and food is amazing.  Get the kiss of fire(spicy), jackpot special, and Ryan.

6-Ao4RHRIN2O6d3H3kneYA.text: This has got to be one of the top places in the country for sushi (not just in Henderson, NV)! I have been here several times.   We were a group of 5 and we ordered it up! We had Burning My Stomach, Boom Boom Nipple Special, Kitchen Sink, Spicy Tuna Roll, and Deep Fried Cheesecake.  I'm know I'm missing some things. We shared everything.   That Deep Fried Cheesecake is everything! It tasted like a delicious funnel cake, lol.  And there's something to eat for everyone. Even if you are not a "sushi" person.   By the way, you can tell they get creative with naming their meals, lol. The names will make you laugh and think "I can't believe they named it that!"  Service is fantastic! The staff is so active, quick, and friendly. This is a great place for family and/or friends to have a great time.   Prices: I would say it's moderate ($$).  They make everything at time of order. Groups are always coming through here because they can easily share the food and share the bill. ;-)  If it was too expensive, I would think most locals wouldn't be coming  on a nightly busy.   Location: it's located in a shopping plaza near Sunridge Heights.  I love sushi! What move can I say, but just go and check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Kitchen sink! Delicious.

f_MfpesB5IaTWd93-VissA.text: 3.5 stars. Recommended by a co-worker. Not AYCE. Food overall a bit salty and slightly borderline on sauce overkill.  We tried two of their nigiri - halibut  and garlic tuna nigiri at around $4.25 each for two pieces. Fresh fish, but too much ponzu.  We ordered two cut rolls. The spicy tuna roll was quite spicy but delicious. So was the eel roll.   Tried the lunch special. You can choose two entrees and it comes with salad, miso soup, inari, tamago, chicken gyoza and steamed rice. We ordered the chicken katsu (cut into six pieces and breaded just right) and salmon teriyaki ($1 extra).  We also ordered three specialty rolls: screaming orgasm, something gone wrong #7, and taste like my x-girlfriend. The screaming orgasm had no sushi rice at all but was very good. Halfway through though, the sauce became too much, especially if you eat the shredded radish under the fish---it sucked up all the sauce. The taste like my x-girlfriend was delicious but also too much sauce. The best was something gone wrong #7. So so good. It also comes in a dipping sauce, but is perfectly yummy without it.  Add in two hot green teas and I was $81 lighter after our meal. I'd come back again, but request less sauce. Ample parking in the plaza lot.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. the lunch special: chicken katsu, salmon teriyaki, salad, miso soup, inari, tamago, chicken gyoza and steamed rice
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. something gone wrong #7
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. halibut  and garlic tuna nigiri, screaming orgasm

VYH810oYvhgebJRAkQoX_g.text: Yum - order off the menu rather than from the train. They have a killer poke bowl if you choose rice instead of noodles and it is so fresh and tasty that I lay awake at night craving it!

lSiDfxJ9464U7aGbtqw2ww.text: We go often - they have good quality product and large portions! Last nite we had the BEST server eva! Her name is Lisa! Be sure to sit in her section.

4uUSMu7O80T3vyz9cbn67g.text: We live in Sun Anthem and I Love Sushi is our favorite sushi restaurant not because they are close to us but because of the quality of food they serve 7 days a week.  We have tried several other sushi restaurants in the area but we find that I Love Sushi seafood freshness, quality, service and pricing is unbeatable. We normally have all the sashimi selections but definitely try the " kitchen sink" without rice and request a little spicy Enjoy!!

yp2QsnDIUaZWXrhv_OYLXA.text: Screw best sushi in Vegas. I'm calling it, right now..BEST sushi in the world. Sorry Jiro, you have your dreams AND three Michelin stars, I Love Sushi gets the "best sushi in the world" title. I've had sushi from the west coast to the east coast. I've had it in four different countries (Japan wasn't one of them) and I Love Sushi is the best.  I'm not even going to go into the simple stuff, like perfectly cooked edamame, or the gyoza that can be ordered steamed or fried, the cool ambiance or the super friendly staff. You can get all of that at any sushi/Japanese restaurant.  I'm going to talk about their raw fish. Clean, fresh, seasoned to perfection, beautifully sliced, raw fish. Each piece of fish sets on top of a well proportioned pillow of rice. One bite and your sushi world will be destroyed. Every other sushi joint will fail to live up to I Love Sushi. Sure, you'll try other joints, mix things up a bit, but the whole time you'll be thinking "man I wish I was at I Love Sushi".  Don't take it from me though. Go there and order a "screaming orgasm". It's tuna, ever-so-lightly seared, swimming in a pool of their in-house made ponzu sauce on a bed of shaved daikon. If that's not enough try the "something wrong 69" roll. I: shrimp tempura soft shell crab. O: more soft shell crab and five different types of raw fish. PLUS it's served with a side of their DELISH ponzu.  And to the people giving low stars based on chicken teriyaki, or that the screaming orgasm doesn't come with rice...animals don't deserve to die to be eaten by you. Just saying.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Something Wrong 69
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Large Screaming Orgasm
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic tuna

3Pxi6VrdYrNxPsKMEynAkA.text: Sad to say that I will never return to my old favorite sushi spot. A friend and I decided to come here for dinner after debating between a few other restaurants in the area. I thought that I Love Sushi would be a sure bet because I have dined here and ordered take-out numerous times before and enjoyed it.   Tonight was different. The older woman was our server and she provided us with the worst customer service I've received in a long time. From the moment we sat down, she was very quick and cold with us. No smile, not welcoming in the least bit. She took my order with so much attitude and a sense of annoyance in her voice.  My friend and I ordered Tempura Yakisoba and Teriyaki Shrimp. The food itself was just okay. The Yakisoba was on the sweeter side and the Shrimp was very rubbery.   As I was clearly still working on my food, the woman decides to approach us and just give us the check. No "Are you all set?" "Do you have room for dessert?" NOTHING. She basically just sat the check on our table. Which also confused me because there was a couple right next to us who had been dining longer than us and she never once approached them with their check. It felt as if she was specifically trying to rush us out.   I have no idea what her issue is or why her customer service skills are so awful, but they have lost a loyal customer. I will no longer be returning or suggesting this place to friends and family.

a5HORWcC44512-kaqgUbjw.text: Actually we are fan of sashimi and sushi . So we came to i love sushi and expect to get really fresh fish and unique sushi . But over all on the menu most are sushi roll .so we try a hand roll , sashimi . Which is ok . And unagi don came with good portion but eel little too sweet and have some bone which is you have to careful litle bit while you eat . And yellow tail collar was very disappointment because the fish was old and taste not impression . ( made me got diarrhea later that night ) . For the service for out table i guess the waiter not really attentive . After he took an order he came back a couple time to asked again that what we order . We took not too long to finish our dinner before we leave we have one lady to seem like she attention but just right before we get a check .

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi roll
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Not fresh yellowtail collar
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Unagi don

4vffLSvw_HzWjHel6QVJOw.text: I have never had a bad dining experience here and I have been coming here for years. Do not come famished. You may be waiting a while to get a table especially on weekends but certainly worth the wait. Cherry blossom and Spring Mountain rolls are my favorite.

hc7iqsDeJcPKW94Joii3_Q.text: This is hands down THE best sushi joint in Henderson.   I've been going here for years & started just on the dinner menu. The chicken teriyaki, tempura, and dinner combinations are all excellent and well-worth the price (you get a LOT of food with your entrees). Recently, I started a personal challenge to try ALL 100+ chef specials on the sushi menu  (I'm in the mid-60s right now) and I haven't been disappointed yet.  Some must trys are: Sushi Nachos, the Grand Canyon roll, Something Wrong #69, and-of course-the Screaming Orgasm.  Be sure to ask for Lisa's section, too.  She'll make an already amazing experience perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Orange Bowl, half eaten...

CKwMMZcDlbXZfix2R4LKIA.text: I used to love this place. I went with my wife sat down started reading the menu, got up walked out. The staff asked me why I was leaving and I said the menu is offensive. Items like the John Holmes Roll, Threesome, Tastes like my ex girlfriend and others (many). I just had to say when. The acceptable level of disgust has reached the point where public places accept this as standard. Not me not anymore.

nfK9Ujbe_H0dgcaVzxpXOw.text: My first time here and it was amazing!! The fish was fresh and the presentation was outstanding!  Our servers were very attentive and informative for our decisions.  Very unique sushi combos and the flavors are crave worthy!  A return visit for sure!

3D5YZzp3Nl2i1yd0SCJmOQ.text: The sushi here is really delicious. The fish is fresh and of good quality. They have a large selection of sushi rolls to choose from, most of them are creative and have a nice twist. They also have funny/ interesting names  I had the Crazy horse, and the monkey roll. So delicious. I love Philadelphia rolls so I picked these two because they had salmon and cream cheese. The monkey roll had so much flavor, beautifully presented. Basically a Philadelphia roll but with a twist as it has mango and "red crunch" on top with a sauce, I don't remember what it was though. The crazy horse was more simple but equally satisfying. It was tempura but it was a nice thin line not super thick like other places, and with that you get the full flavor of the inside (the salmon, cream cheese, ect)    My bf had the last call which had mozzarella and crab. It was surprisingly good considering cheese isn't traditional included in sushi, but it was different and delicious   The lobster roll was too plain for my taste but it was well made  Overall this place is awesome. The sushi is creative and of great quality, the sushi chefs are very friendly and are more than happy to recommend what sushi to get and are knowledgeable about what they're doing.  The decor is ok, nothing exceptional. The service is also whatevers, the waitress accidentally poked me in the face with my chopsticks while taking my plates away and only said a whispered sorry, but didn't really care.   Wish I had taken pics of the food but it was that good that I gobbled it up and forgot.

kPtrJp28w6wZeMeZKTQrAQ.text: Love this place! It has a wide variety of options which will surely satisfy any kind of sushi you're craving. They were easily able to bring us separate checks for our rolls as well, which has been an issue at so many other restaurants.  Our server noticed some gifts on the table for a birthday we were celebrating and she brought out some ice cream for us all free of charge without us even asking which I was really impressed by. She really went above and beyond. We also stuck around for a couple of hours after we finished our meal because I hadn't seen my friends in a while and we were catching up. Granted it wasn't really a busy night, our server didn't try to shoo us away or make us feel bad for lingering. Overall, great food and great customer service!

siYbxgxtIjqXoOKP85TAqg.text: Best sushi I've had out here in NV to date.

GyDaOwCIS2F6RKepzc9gqw.text: Nice surprise. Invited by a friend. Best FRESHEST most tasty sushi I've had in a long time.  EVERYTHING I ate felt perfect in taste, temperature and texture. Loved the crisp fresh salads and how very clean and neat the place was.

fGx-fXEwBc12vw1VowueIA.text: Eat here regularly because of the quality and service. Even on crowded Friday nights you get seated ina reasonable time. High quality sushi and the 'boats' are an amazing value, you will never leave hungry or wanting more.

WDm4nNW8oE-Vs7e2EnMTnw.text: This has to be one of the best sushi places you can possibly eat at. The sushi is fresh and delicious.

U7jrfJxN53EkkP3976r5Iw.text: My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas! My friends and I go here once a week - sometimes twice! Always sit at the sushi bar! The staff is fast, attentive, welcoming, and love to interact with the customers!   Food - They have 116 rolls on their menu, so you are bound to find something you like. They have rolls without rice if you are trying to be healthy, and deep friend rolls of you are feeling crazy. My favorites are the salmon lovers, the boom boom nipple special, and the fat ass special. The fish is always fresh, and I have never had a bad experience.   Sake - We have never done official sake bombs, only the shots. They have 5 different flavors, and they are strong!   Definitely worth the stop! BEST SUSHI IN VEGAS!!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Nacho!

qpI81cYi1UrvkgnVRUE2jw.text: Fantastic service, and wonderful food! What more could we ask for? Loved the shrimp hibachi, and kimchi roll. They went out of their way to give us a magnifying glass to read the small menu too!!

jSwWXEZ8suEY3bH9vILxLw.text: My family's go to sushi place. Cherry blossom is a guarantee must have. Everyone is always super nice and this place never disappoints.

jmZBw1xOQ7g3ejT5rGjRTg.text: I was a little hesitant about I Love Sushi when I saw the place but much to my surprise, it was some of the best and freshest sushi I have eaten in a long time.  It was nice to get off "The Strip" and find good sushi at a great price!

3f6f1nPikVEQtE-5_VfF_Q.text: This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas. It's more expensive but I don't even care, its just sooo good!!!  The Quail egg shooters are amazing, comes with 3 eggs in 1 shooter!  The sweet shrimp sashimi comes with 3 pieces and this deep fried shrimp thing that was delicious! The almost 90% special is great too!! I also love the cucumber salad and the garlic pepper edamame.  Today they had Toro, Yumm!!

v9Hg2ZNcVWNOjt-Cz2K7Ig.text: Absolutely delicious!!  I eat here at least once a week sometime twice!!    Favorite Rolls: Japanese Lasagna & Threesome Special & LOVE the house salad  Husband's Spicy Favorite's: Sun Devil, XXX, Burn your Stomach  Kids Love the California Rolls  For desert we had the tempura ice cream and the tempura cheesecake.  Neither were delicious enough that I would order them again.  The service is ALWAYS great.

WcH-0Jc7RvsuQH3nj7rwhA.text: I absolutely love that even when they are busy, I can still get a table and the sushi is always amazing.  I especially love their spicy tuna roll.

zN3Xv4q2hhAHys2blhnOSQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while. When it was sushi date night with my boyfriend, I suggested this place other than my normal place. The sushi we ordered was so good! I loved each roll we tried. I loved the atmosphere and the service was awesome. I am definitely coming back as soon as possible.

BmxjGvBF4kdOsPOXzQLkyg.text: There is some good sushi out there -- not much, but some. This one is GREAT -- the best in Las Vegas. If you want to kick things up a notch, ask for the Spicy Ponzu instead of using regular soy sauce. The sushi always tastes fresh and their rolls are very creative. Service is always quick. One of my favorite go-to places.

LpstfgHxPSot0-Uk5D8T9g.text: Good atmosphere  Great place to introduce sushi to a hesitant consumer

cvU9iItPBxL4GwOFIn1iuA.text: Name is cheesy but food is good.  I'm a fan of all-you-can-eat, but my sister and friends convinced me to give this place a try.  We were greeted by a kimono-clad hostess/server, which was a nice touch and sat in a wooden, semi-enclosed booth.  There is an extensive list of sushi rolls with extraordinary names!  Very non-traditional, but still yummy.  I ordered the bento box with teriyaki salmon and some kind of mackerel.  It came with a little bowl of rice and a tempura rice ball, which was unique and of course miso soup and salad.  Also ordered a pepper tuna plate, which I shared with my hubby.  It was slices of pepper tuna in a yummy ponzu-like sauce.  Delicious.  Fish was fresh and service was good.  This place is way on the other side of the world, but I would definitely go again if my sister was so inclined! :)

QVaCOSXaF9czvSj75AE4mw.text: I love I love sushi.  I've taken out-of-town guests there 3 or 4 times, and all have left with little japanese food babies and big smiles.  You can miss it easily, as it's tucked into the back of a strip mall...with one tiny little sign to let you know where to turn.  But if you miss it, keep circling until you find it...it's worth it.  Consistently fresh sushi, and reasonable prices.  Great, dark wood decor, with serving staff in full traditional dress.  I always feel like I'm on a little fantastic voyage away from Vegas when I step in here.  Service isn't as great as some others in the valley, but the price is right, so I can cope with a little less butt-kissing.  One of my top sushi picks in the city.  Enjoy!

MQ6pEv7jWUQ_29auYIwoEw.text: I Love Sushi is our go to restaurant for sushi. I have never had anything from there that wasn't great. The monkey roll is unique and very tasty. The service is good and no matter how busy they are, we always get right in. But most of the time, they are pretty busy. If you want to best sushi in Henderson, check this place out.

F_aLZA3OUrivpozVVFefZA.text: After living and working in Japan my wife and I enjoy  "I love Sushi" I have had several items for both lunch and dinner. Yesterday I had the veggie yakisoba and my wife had the spicey tuna roll plus the noodle soup.

UzXMe0x2ykraGlVD3c-1vA.text: I will definitely venture out here again when we visit Las Vegas! Everything was delicious and the place was packed but we didn't have to wait long. The sashimi salad has an amazing dressing. Their rolls maybe a little too much sauce on it but other than that a super yum sushi experience!!

kLjtssWHWLj33jxlr12Ulg.text: Great Food. Great Management. Great price. Owner James was very accomodating and nice. He came over to introduce himself and provides many complimentary items. Thanks! Better than any buffet Sushi.

ppSqCR_-9lth7HbxEnfLmA.text: A great place to eat rolls. They proved me wrong that 'sushi' isn't always about nigiri and sashimi. Atmosphere is great, the rolls hardly have any rice, and tons of fresh fish....mmm.. I LOVE, I LOVE SUSHI!! The bill may be pricey because its not all you can eat, BUT nonetheless its worth every grain of rice!!! Trust me, I've only been doing ayce at sushi houses for the past six years only because I didn't believe in getting full off of rolls. But I LOVE SUSHI can create some badass dishes!!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Look at the marbleization
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

fT9uVyCeE2ayfQF8aVkAOg.text: I have been all over this lovely town of Las Vegas in search of a sushi place I can call home, and after nearly 5 years off and on, I have finally found it. I Love Sushi was AMAZING!!! From the two sided menu with endless amounts of creative goodness, to the hilarious names of the items (ex. Screaming Orgasm, The Threesome, etc.), to the timely and polite service from both the waitresses and sushi chef's, this place is great.  Enough seating that even when its busy, it shouldnt be too long of a way and the food comes out nearly as fast and fresh as when you order it.  Pricing is GREAT!  GO TO I LOVE SUSHI ASAP!!!

4zf4VgK5ewt8Cdti7coKGw.text: Ambiance was great, service was stellar and the food was divine! I brought my 4 year old along without any trouble, but it would be great for a bubbly happening date spot too. I can't wait to head back and try the scallop shooters. We tried the chili garlic edamame to start and I'm so glad we did! I'm so glad I finally got to try this sushi spot. I'll definitely be back!

_nLaJEOqsHpdAEnoiDvTJA.text: Sumi is the most awesome person!!!!! Very attentive, professional, and her recommendations were spot on. The burn in the stomach roll was the best sushi roll ever!!!  Excellent quality sushi and very reasonable prices. We are visiting from so cal and would drive back just for Sumi and sushi

Sv2icHXduRenVrCdiM6m0Q.text: The sushi here was amazing! Probably the best sushi I've had. The owner, James is extremely hospitable and friendly. 5 star experience!

kATs0jPsxR6PmXGntXE2Yw.text: Hands down my favorite sushi spot in town. Great services, great food, great atmosphere. Everyone I take to ILS falls in love with the place, as I did when I walked in for the first time last year. I'll drive as far as I need to have sushi @ILS

DJ2fIvhJQV3tSp8I83qMGw.text: Best Sushi Place in Las Vegas! My favorite rolls are the I love Sushi Roll, Tiger Roll and the Kitchen Sink with tuna! Always a great time! Best place in the house is dining at the Sushi Bar. My Fiance does not eat sushi, but always orders the spicy chicken with shrimp added! So Good!!!!!!!!

zJ7TLLTthCmQwL_3xIWqmA.text: I don't know if it's the best sushi I've had since we moved in Vegas almost 8 years ago, but it's up there certainly.  This is a large restaurant with several ways to dine.  You can sit at the sushi bar, there are numerous tables throughout the restaurant, and there are booths that offer a more private experience.  Service was decent, but we had to wait a long time for our check.  This was annoying as it was lunch time on a weekday, we clearly weren't looking for a 2 hour lunch.  The rolls and sashimi were good.  The famous screaming orgasm wasn't as good as I was expecting, given its reputation.  The yellowtail and salmon sashimi were excellent.  Buttery pieces of fish that had excellent flavor.  Good quality and prepared properly.  Decent beer selection.  We will definitely be back.

AH2uJ4KiQL2hbAbC8kVcRA.text: The seafood is fresh, the rolls are works of art, the servers are fast and friendly, the chefs are mesmerizing to watch, and they are always accommodating.  Service: The place is full nearly every single time I walk in, but they still manage to greet our party and get us seated as quickly as they can. We are offered pickled ginger, wasabi, edamame, and a cucumber salad within seconds. Drink orders are taken and delivered equally quickly. Our drinks are always full, our dishes are taken away as they are emptied leaving room for more dishes to arrive, and we are accommodated with special requests (my daughter loves vegetable rolls with only certain items and they are very nice about putting it together for her). We were even treated kindly when we had a shellfish allergy at the table; they made sushi and a roll on a separate area and were careful about serving it separately. Hot, damp towels are brought at the end of the meal, which is nice.  Meal: Orders are taken as often as you like (you can order piece by piece or all at once, they don't mind either way). Food is brought out fast, fresh, and beautifully presented. The chefs are so much fun to watch that I always try to either sit at the bar or seat myself facing them. I have literally NEVER had a piece of sushi, a roll, or any other dish that I didn't thoroughly enjoy. I always finish up with an oyster shooter because it's like a cherry on the sundae. *It's hard to say some of the names of the rolls to the server with a straight face, but I try anyway*  Price: Very reasonable for the quality of food offered. I gave it a $$$ simply because our party always orders drinks and a slew of fancy rolls. You do NOT have to spend that much to have a great experience.  Overall: I Love Sushi is on my shortlist of all time favorites. I spent my last 2 birthdays there and many a date night and family out night in between. I will be back!

P8xAdpCmJ99f6YqZNkWU2A.text: I have to say that " I Love Sushi " is definitely one of the best that I have tried in this town to date.  Food was Very good, service was also Very good.  I will go back and I am going back next week!

aAYIMMr4n6YSV6Ci26HhPA.text: I never even really cared that much for sushi until my partner made me come here one night. The rest is history. This place is great. They typically get people in and out of there fairly quickly, so there is hardly any wait time. The house sake is awesome; it has a great kick to it. They have over 150 special sushi selections.

mwuCKmeCqF7K4wGGAce4gA.text: The reviews for this place have to be fake. The place is dirty, service was slow and very polite or attentive almost as if you owe them something for going there. Additionally the rolls are sloppy, too much rice and sauces. There are much better places in Vegas to go then this place!

FWB6Y4EabeAtGLbbfmzncw.text: I travel a lot and everywhere I go I make it a point to find a sushi spot with the sole purpose of finding the perfect sushi. So far I have not been able to find anything that tops my hometown regular sushi spot. Until now! I Love Sushi is that place. Aside from the authentic atmosphere which includes Kimono clad servers and no less than a dozen blade wielding sushi chefs behind the bar, I Love Sushi offers literally the best sushi I have ever experienced. Packed with flavor and texture, their rolls are second to none. Even the simplest spicy tuna roll is comparable to others' master chefs rolls. If you are in the area (even in Vegas) I highly recommend the trip to I Love Sushi. You will not be sorry.

CgxDKphvoIt91--DRJH49A.text: There were so many options here it was almost overwhelming!  I finally decided on the dancing eel roll which had eel, tempura shrimp, tuna and avocado and a spicy tuna roll. I also tried a piece of the kiss of fire (VERY spicy) and a roll that had mango on top which I can't remember the name of. All in all, they were all very tasty. The prices were right and the service was great. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Dancing eel roll

zCxL6xGz3lNkRIV8AbNf6Q.text: Great sushi. We were recommended I love Sushi by chance. Met a couple at Egg Works (another great restaurant for breakfast). They told us about I Love Sushi and we tried it later that night.  Really fresh fish , which is as anyone knows is hard to come across in the desert. Service was quick and very attentive. Drinks never went empty and sushi chef couldn't wait to fix us something else.  Try it out if you are in the area. It's a bit pricey but worth the $$.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

RNiPkPqNdVlMceAOUtIqYw.text: This place was super busy and yet we got seated right away. I'm not going to lie I'm not a sushi person, but all of my family is so ya... They loved loved loved their sushi everyone that got a roll was so happy.  I got the Chicken Yakisoba it was soooooo good! I was very happy with my dish.   Our waitress was so cute, nice and very attentive. I loved the atmosphere of this place. The family absolutely found their favorite sushi place!

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken  Yakisoba

jltneagk0t2yfp2cyizEOw.text: When in Henderson/Vegas, this sushi joint is hands down the best there is.  Some of the names can't be written or repeated here (when you see the menu, you will understand) but I had two different ones that were killer.    Tip:  Ask for the Natto Hand Roll.  It's not on menu but you know you have a authentic Japanese Sushi Bar when they have Natto.  Cash and Credit Cards accepted.

rhARwN4Tprc4iqrjP4CHKQ.text: I have to say, I'm surprised by all the great reviews for this place. I will say, the service and the atmosphere are lovely, and very well done. The food itself is not great, and I found the quality of the fish to be poor. We ordered the Poke, the Screaming Orgasm, and an Eel Role. The Poke and  Screaming orgasm were inedible due to the poor quality of the fish. The roll was deep fried, and decent, however we decided not to risk anymore bad fish and move on with our evening. Still looking for a great sushi place in the area.

MB2YW_5OJ04DtQHU67rvWw.text: There are many sushi restaurants in town that are pretty good, but it's rare to find one with excellent food and great ambience.  All the waitresses are dressed in kimonos and the inside is decorated in a way that makes you feel like your in Asia. The food is even better than the ambience.  A couple menu items I would recommend off the bat is the oyster shooter and the toro.  It may be pricey but it's definitely worth the money.

egZ6VP3OfAutsAiB7THzDQ.text: I love I Love Sushi. My favorite sushi place. Kitchen Sink, Tuna Tartar, Screaming Orgasm, Spicy Salmon Roll, and age dashi tofu are my favorites. Get fresh wasabi.

8IffnakntiPKwtOp-CnTbQ.text: This is my favorite sushi place in the valley. The freshness, quality, variety and service are unsurpassed. I've lived in Las Vegas for over 12 years and I keep coming back to I Love Sushi for the best Sushi experience. The focus is the on quality of food, not showmanship. It's in a small anonymous strip mall but it's worth coming to even if you live in the Northwest corner of the valley. You won't be disappointed.

rcRg5_0R1GGbDx-JZ0PCig.text: I love sushi is hands down the best sushi spot in Vegas!!! The place is always packed so be prepared for that!!! The service is fast though so you never have to wait long!!! The food is fresh. They have a variety of options. A few of my favorites...Cherry Blossom, Joes Special and the Screaming Orgasm. Consistency is the key here!!! Food is always AMAZING!!!

HP7YhA0we2i0evoIzDgadQ.text: Got food poisoning from eel the other night was told by management that 4 other people got sick and was offered a gift card will never go there again

TIqf4QKGNkCGxgz_1iLQEA.text: The service here is on point. I was checked on pretty often, but not so often that it was obnoxious. Maybe because I was a pretty girl, sitting by herself at the sushi bar (forever alone).. haha I kid.   I decided to treat myself to some sushi after a nice evening walk by MacDonald Highlands. I was supposed to eat whatever I wanted as my cheat meal for a really restrictive high protein, essentially no carbs, diet. I ended up ordering seared tuna that was served with half an avocado and marinated red onions... essentially not what I was supposed to do. But man, it was really good. A++ would order again.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Seared tuna with avocado is not considered a cheat meal

vU2se325rtgeW6MtWGLe3Q.text: Love it. It's fishy in all the right ways  I'm a little biased here because I met my now fiancee here. But personally I have eaten at many sushi places and this one is definitely one of the better ones. The fish tasted fresh, I never had to ask for water refills and the atmosphere was pleasant.

19HaecNVm9fbn3nW_lSqnA.text: Just tried this place for sushi last night. Had the Candy roll, jackpot roll, and crunch roll and all were yummy.  Loved the ambience with kimonos and Japanese music. We will be back again soon!

n_UPCPk6XJdKxHXexcVI_w.text: By far one of the best sushi restaurants that I've been to. I don't care that the rolls are ultra-Americanized with crispy this and fried that. What it boils down to is Grade A raw fish and this place delivers! This place is consistent and since it opened has been serving some of the best sushi and sashimi in town. Added bonus that it's right down the street from my house.    The place went through some beautiful renovations in the last two years and is now even bigger. Bolder and more attractive colors. Some of my favorites: Flower roll, Ryan's roll, Spicy Yellowtail Sashimi with spicy ponzu sauce, Yellowtail comma, and the lunch bento box specials are solid as well.

hhHldROkTQeZo7PE5yPhPA.text: This place is AMAZING. One of my favorites, if not my very favorite, sushi place in Vegas.  The atmosphere is awesome, with a cordial staff dressed in cute, themed clothes. The prices are reasonable, for sushi. There are many unique options, and every item comes perfectly prepared, often with an interesting design. And EVERYTHING is delicious.  Highly recommended!

KLj7c5q7CD7zOIS6M6UbAQ.text: Food was okay. The salmon was fresh. I got the Grand Canyon roll and wasn't a fan of that. I would probably come back.

lkAeoRIbdhK5xF0UOQyjQA.text: If you are ever in Vegas and you are hungry for sushi.  Drive to Henderson. And go here.  The rolls are awesome.  We made reservations. Thank goodness.  It was packed, and for good reason.  I love the names of the rolls. Screaming Orgasm, Washington DC, One Night Stand, and so many more.  Every sauce they use, so delish.  Cant wait to come back to Vegas and go here.

tgdyKNboZeuZ1PnvamddUA.text: Yikes?  What happened to authentic Japanese Sushi?  If you like the litany of sexy body parts and earthly dragon named sushi that are extreme variations of traditional sushi, then this is the place for you.  I prefer more traditional and authentic sushi and so it is hard really to taste the flavors of the sushi in a restaurant like this because the sauces and fried stuff and mixture is kinda overpowering.  But hey, I like to have ketchup on my steak once in a while, and so, I have come here several times and will come again as it ain't bad, but it really isn't real Japanese food, it is blended to the American taste.....

LB1WZ8xookVj9vFOAjoTww.text: Love Love this place!!! So wish they had the AYCE.  The food is always fresh and amazing.  Lasagna roll is the best.  Jackpot special and the grand canyon roll very good also.

_OmCvpjenOsmAI9xz49Ypg.text: What can i say...i am a believer...i had heard about this sushi joint but i don't think any of the accounts i heard did it justice.  I am a True fan of authentic Japanse food and sushi but the chefs here put a twist to all your favorites...its like your fantasy sushi and roll combinations coming True.  I had the Triple X roll ,Mistake roll ,Kimchii roll, and Orgasm roll and i put them down in order of preference. The Triple X is most definitely the best roll i have had since i was put on God's green earth.  I don't think the pictures i took came out right, but then again my saliva glands and my mouth was on a trip so i cant blame my hands for wanting to drop the phone and get back to feasting.  Had a few Sake bombs and yet the bill wasn't ridiculous at all. I know its not on the Vegas strip but i highly recommend you take the detour.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

hnWHUYC1ji4BoolWM9d1aA.text: A paradise away from the overcrowded touristy places on the strip. If the names of the custom rolls (pages of them) doesn't amaze you, the taste will. Plus the chefs at the sushi bar are a riot.  The prices here are fantastic enough that my friend and I stuffed our faces (we're both big guys) and the tab didn't even make a dent in our wallet. Quick service, delicious creations, and clean eating area. Lots of eye candy too :)

R7RJpoJfDZPSlON8E11L6A.text: Great rolls, great, attentive service, fast turnaround time for food, even when it's busy! Overall amazing experience and meal here.

VWa1rrbymEUm0xd2wOTIxw.text: The food is delicious but the service is horrible. If the food wasn't good, this would be a 1-star review. I recommend going for delicious sushi but don't expect the waitress to be on her toes. We had to get up to find her to say that we were ready for the bill. And that was after waiting for a long time.

jQh_SyQu6iXx9VGEKWv2ew.text: This place did not live up to the hype I heard from multiple people and yelp reviews. The atmosphere is nothing special and the sushi was ok. I had spicy tuna and the screaming orgasm and even though the screaming orgasm was what one would think is a "specialty roll" it was honestly just average. Maybe I should've ordered different items but I did not love it.

KPoqDjBlNzIemphbmdIHZg.text: I had lunch here with family (not my kids) and the food and service were great. Don't let your kids read the name of the rolls as they are R-rated but very entertaining.  I would definitely come back!!

uMgbCGo0tvgZ_sRzOMYYMg.text: If you are from Cali don't eat at those high price Sushi places on the strip or hotels. This is the place to go and of course you'll need a car to get here.   My girlfriend and I always go to I love Sushi because of the quality of the food and prices. For what you paid to eat Sushi at a fancy hotel you can feed about four people at I love Sushi. The service is friendly and they welcome everyone in their restaurant.  The girls are dress in their kimonos - pretty cool.   Please try I love Sushi if you're ever in Las Vegas and have a car. Trust me you'll be happy that you saved some money and had some good sushi.

2h6F3tpPBOBfKXiSoBpsJw.text: Excellent sushi!!!  The wait staff and ambience are great as well. The Vegas special (#54) is great. Can't go wrong with some tall Sapporos either.

knotNn2oQjaAa84TEAQoDg.text: Bomb af! Food came in fast which is always a plus and was magically delicious. Finished all of it and my stomach went from 0 to 100 real quick. The waitress was on top of her shiet! Always checked on us and always came through with that we needed. I almost wanted to call her "bae". In addition to that the atmosphere of the place made me feel asian af, and I love that. Definitely coming back!

0SGPhUTJ3_b2ioU0ToL9xQ.text: We had the special garlic shrimp dish. It was amazing. The sushi was very fresh and delicious and the service was great ...very attentive. We have a new favorite sushi place to go now!

HIjPWleugwZnJySlxlHZEw.text: I LOVE Sushi is a fun place to go. It's very busy, so I assume with the amount of people dining here, the fish is fresh. We ordered several different items, loved them all. I will go back again!

X4ddQbi2KvReUeZvgdD2Qg.text: It's pretty good.  Really liked the sushi boat.  Very busy place and staffs are friendly.  We'll definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Boat $57.90 for two.  Pretty good size.
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Soft shell crab - a little greasy
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Vegetable tempura - after we ate a shrimp and two vege

Owk09kjIFEJLooerRnvWlQ.text: The honest truth about I Love Sushi is that it isnt amazing, but it is a solid, never-fail option. Ive eaten here dozens of times because I know its easy to get to, is a huge restaurant (so its pretty easy to get a table), has a huge selection, and I know everyone can find something they will like.  The fish is always fresh, but never mindblowing. The servers are always somewhere between rushed and friendly, but never rude. The portions are large, the prices are on the mid-high end and the presentations are always interesting. Because it is so popular there is sometimes a wait, especially on weekend evenings, but it has never been too long. Sometimes the front counter people can get a bit snippy, but overall this is a very safe bet where I have never had any issues and have always come out satisfied.

zBfT59bNa_2yxPJ-c-Y5DQ.text: Probably my favorite sushi restaurant in the area.  So many good rolls to choose from with excellent quality fish being served there at reasonable prices.  And you gotta love a place with such crazy names for rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of I Love Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

S58OWMZ6q-WrKbIiYtY22A.text: This sushi place is amazing!   After living here two years we've thought about trying other sushi places, but we are always scared we won't find a place as good as this one!  John Holmes roll= amazing, Monkey Roll- hell yes, Ryan Special- yep it's delicious.  Everything they serve there is delicious and the restaurant is always clean and the staff is friendly.  Hardly ever a wait for a table and every trip has always been amazing. Basically I wish I had sushi right now as I write this review......
